description:
This is my favorite pho place on Irving Street. I always go here for their meatball with thin slices of steak pho and every time I go here, it's always good! It's good that they're consistent. I love how you can choose what size pho bowl you want, unlike most pho places nearby. The small bowl for my order is $9.50, but a large is $11.25 so the price for pho here is a good price. Something about the broth they make is why this is my favorite.

I've also tried their deep fried Vietnamese egg rolls and it's very good! It comes with a sauce to dip it in. 

I heard the dessert drinks here are good, but I haven't tried it yet. My friend tried the three bean dessert drink here and she like it a lot. It contained green jelly, mung beans, red beans, shaved ice, and something that my friend said tasted like coconut milk.

I'd recommend this place! It's a great place to get pho for a good price and they have a big variety of food if you're not in the mood for pho!
author: Elaine N.

description:
So there's one in Daly City and I'd rather go there than try to find parking and then wait in line at this one. Regardless, the pho here is just as good. A large will fill you up and then some though the prices are slightly pricier than what you would usually pay for pho. 

So there you go, Kevin's Noodle House is quite reliable for pho and despite the long lines and what not, it moves by pretty quickly. The longest you'd have to wait is maybe 30 minutes but I'd still rather not wait that long for pho. If you're not in the mood for pho, their rice plates are good too!
author: Derek T.

description:
My boyfriend and I had pho here two nights in a row.... I guess you can say we love it here. The line can get pretty long but they work extremely fast! 

The prices are super good considering the size of the bowl. They offer three sizes for most of the pho options. My boyfriend and I ordered two large number 2 which is just pho dac biet with meatballs and it came out to be less than $23 which is a steal in my opinion because the bowls were hella large. TRUST ME when I say this because a large will definitely fill you up!! The broth taste amazing and the service is great.

This is my first Vietnamese restaurant here in San Francisco and I will definitely be coming back for a quick meal.
author: Quynh L.

description:
So far this is probably my favorite place in SF for pho.  I came here with my brother and partner around 1pm on Sunday. We put our name on a list, but surprisingly got seated after less than 10min. 

I got the chicken and shrimp pho which had decent sized prawns. My brother and spouse got different beef cuts of pho and were very happy.

I have to say that I really loved the broth. As I write this, I'm already craving it again.  It had the perfect amount of spices and it was the right size that I needed.
author: Gita r.

description:
Loved this place! I loved the laid back atmosphere that's clean but super casual and homey. They have a waitlist but they get people in and out SUPER quickly. They're really efficient with their service.

I loved the pho too! I definitely recommend any of the beef pho bowls--the broth is really unique and tasty. I also liked the 22b chicken and shrimp pho. The chicken was flavorful and fresh. I also like that they have lots of condiments and utensils at the tables so you won't have to ask for anything that you need. Their Thai tea is really milky and sweet and compliments the pho nicely as well. To top it all off, the food comes really quickly so you won't be waiting around at all.

One more thing that stood out amongst other pho places: each of their bowls comes in small, medium or large. I've never seen that before and I love that because sometimes I want pho but I don't want a gigantic overwhelming bowl of it! Also, the pho is super cheap. Most smalls are only about $7 and most larges are only around $10.

This place is really close to us, so honestly I can't wait to make it our go-to pho spot!
author: Claire C.

description:
Cheap. Quick. Takes card. Meter parking.

If you want a quick fix of pho or rice plate, this is the place. $10 for a medium size pho. And they take card!
author: Debbie D.

description: I was craving Vietnamese food so stopped by to pick up a beef plate to go! I loved everything expect the actual beef as it was really tough. The nuoc mam goes great over the rice and the egg was yummy! The shrimp paste was a little different than what I was used to but I like the crispy crust. The portion size was fair for the price and service was pretty quick!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
This was a HIT! I'm not too fond of pho, but with the cold San Fran weather, I was feeling for some soup. We found this on yelp and gave it a try. 
Service was decent, as quick as it usually is for asian restaurants. We wrote down our name and waited around 5 minutes before getting seated. 
We got complimentary tea, and ordered Thai tea and iced coffee. Both were great. The Thai tea was strong and flavorful! And iced coffee was VERY strong, which I like but wasn't fully expected. 
The PHO!! Wow I thought the soup was very tasty, and perfected seasoned, without hoisin or sriracha. Great!!! Ahhhh I loved it. Portions are smaller than I'm used to, but it was perfect. The chicken pho was decent, but I like my beef pho better. The rice combo plate was very good - once again just small portions than we're used to in Texas.
author: Lilan N.

description:
The quality of this place has really gone downhill.

I can't believe I gave this place five stars before because I was highly disappointed with my recent experience. I hadn't been here in a while and my boyfriend and I were craving pho, and I thought -- well duh, we're going to Kevin's cause it's the best (or so I thought).

I honestly don't understand how people are saying the prices are fair because I think it's pricey AF for what you're paying for. Nearly $10 for a bowl of muggy broth and a small handful of overcooked noodles that will leave you starving after? No thanks. Being Vietnamese, my mind automatically starts thinking about how much pho I could make at home for the same amount. More importantly, it would taste 10x better. Sorry.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Price $
Taste *****

The best pho restaurant in San Francisco. Large place with a lot of tables inside. But always the waitlist during lunch time on weekend. Usually can get a tables within 15 mins. But on weekday, it is easy to get a seat. 

Every items are good.
Pho is the best. It is simple pho but the soup is deep and tasty. Noodle is chewy. Lots of meat in it. 

Other plate is okay but similar with other Vietnamese restaurants.
author: Da Won L.

description:
Pho-ing should always be a quickie, and that's exactly how it's done here when you order your noodles. You get one of the staff member's attention, they take your order, and they go into the kitchen. Then a few sec later, they're turning right back around with your bowl of goodness. I mean, unless you're not ordering the pho, it really is just putting some noodles, then your meat selected, and spoon some soup over, voila!

The coffee is also legit. Very strong to cut through your food coma, but not as sweet as many other places.

They do accept credit cards, and there's plenty of street parking.
author: Sidney T.

description: It was ok. I remember the waiter was a little bit lost his way. haha.
author: Yeonjin L.

description:
I could probably eat here every night and my wallet would still be happy! I came here on the recommendation of a friend who I trust with any and all SF restaurant recommendations.

They only seat complete parties, and rightfully so. They were packed when we got there! Thankfully, the 

I was impressed with how extensive the menu was. There were more options for pho than I've seen at other places, with options for different cuts of meat to different levels of doneness. In addition to the pho, there were also vermicelli bowls and rice plates, as well as an assortment of drinks. 

I ordered a medium #5 pho mostly because I'm terrified of eating rare meat, but I also wanted something other than just the brisket. The medium was actually quite a bit of food. I rarely struggle to finish a bowl of pho, but I was super stuffed by the time I finished all of the noodles! 

My friend ordered the grilled beef and shrimp cake, which I got to try some of. It was quite tasty... whatever they use to marinate their meat is on point! And the shrimp cake was well done too. I don't think I've ever had shrimp cake stuffed in a thin tofu pocket and deep fried! 

I will definitely be back, and am so excited to bring my parents here as well!
author: Sherry L.

description:
Everyone's been asking me... have you been to Kevin's Noodle House? I said no. Everyone goes "WHATTTT?"

Today: 
Great experience. 

Price $. 

Decided to come here after going to the DMV with my friend. 

Ordered: 
- #42 to go
- #42 to go
- #1 dine in 
- #1 dine in 
- Vietnamese iced coffee (4)

#42: Very good. Made to perfection with rice, pork chop & shrimp egg. Very good with fish sauce in rice. Authentic Vietnamese food. 

#1: Authentic broth. No powder. Noodles were made to perfection. Meats were in a good amount and was super tender. Add some hoisin sauce and sriracha to sweeten the deal. 

Vietnamese iced coffee: This $hit is good and will keep you awake! Brewed to perfection and you can taste the authenticity of Vietnamese coffee. 

Overall, in total was $60 with tips $70. Had a great experience and everyone here is friendly. Be ready to wait in line though... especially during lunch time. 
Would I be back? Forsho.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
My friends took me here for lunch on a Sunday and there was only a 5-10 minute wait for seats when we arrived at around 12pm. However, by the time I finished my meal, the line was definitely longer, but don't be intimidated because people are in and out pretty quick. When I first walked in, I was surprised to see that the noodle house was relatively spacious compared to many other restaurants in the area. There are a lot of long tables, so don't be surprised if you're seated next to strangers. Just think of the condiments and utensils as a little privacy border!

The menu was simple to navigate, and I decided on option #3 (Đc Bit) of the beef rice noodle soup, which is essentially pho. Kevin's Noodle House has a great website that you can check out if you want to look at their menu beforehand. Service is quick and within 10 minutes of ordering, I got my bowl of pho and a shared plate of the usual add-ins (lemon wedges, chili pepper slices, basil leaves?, and bean sprouts). The broth was flavorful and the portions were standard. The only semi-complaint that I have is that I got one jumbo slice of beef tripe which I thought was hilarious but ended up taking me a bit of time to chew apart. Overall, for $8.25 (pre-tax and tip) for a medium bowl of pho in SF, Kevin's Noodle House is a solid find.
author: Winnie Y.

description:
A Sunset district staple. This place is usually always packed around dinner time, but they do a nice job of accommodating everyone as quick as they can. 


I got the medium Chicken Pho which was a nice portion as well as spring rolls to share. The peanut sauce is great. 

A lot of pho is how you customize it, which Kevin's has allllll the fixings. Have been coming here for years and will continue to!
author: Drew F.

description:
Hands down the best Pho I've ever had. Beef broth was extremely flavorful and House Chile oil was the perfect pairing. 

Thank you.
author: Lizzette P.

description:
Large size for a pho place, can get crowded. The service is quick, but as an asian place, as soon as the food comes out the service level drops and you just have to get someone's attention to get what you want.

As this is a pho place, with other rice and bun dishes, it is pretty decent. The chicken broth is on the better side as it is flavorful. The portion is okay for the price, the large size is only if you are extremely hungry (or don't really drink the broth). 

There's only one vegetarian item on the menu, which is just plain pho, there is no tofu option.
author: Spencer H.

description: I used to come to Kevin's Noodle House quite a bit whenever I was craving pho. Unlike other Vietnamese places, Kevin's Noodle House uses a very aromatic broth in their soups. Additionally, their pho bowls come in a small size, which is great if you're like me and don't eat much. I'll say the place delivers their food fairly consistently. However, I have had a few occasions where the chefs used too much MSG (as noted by my insatiable thirst and strange aftertaste in my mouth), or the beef was left in the broth too long, which made the beef overcooked and rubbery. Otherwise, the food tastes very homey.
author: Connie X.

description:
This is some delicious pho!! And incredible customer service!

I came here on your average cold and cloudy SF afternoon, wanting something to warm my icy soul. This place did not disappoint. 

As soon as I talked in, I was shown a seat and immediately served hot tea. I knew it was going to be a good experience from that point forward. 

My order was very quickly taken and just as fast, my food came out. They very easily accommodated my request for no dark meat in my pho ga (chicken pho). A small was more than enough for me and the flavor was delicious! A very generous helping of noodles and chicken. 

From start to finish, I enjoyed my experience here. Coming from the South Bay, I've kept a running list of my top pho places. While this place doesn't take number one, it comes in at an incredibly close second.
author: Sarah A.

description:
The pho here isn't the best I've had, and really, in an area with more Vietnamese restaurants it would probably be just middle of the pack at best, but given that we are in San Francisco, the pho here is quite good.

It doesn't quite have the stand out features of the best of the best (like being cooked with oxtail, or a secret flavor etc.), but it is a solid bowl of pho, which is saying a lot considering how bad it can get in the city.

There is a nice rich beef broth flavor, that is well seasoned and well flavored. It's a bit on the clearer and less fatty side, but thats fine as well. The soup is served hot, and the items in the pho taste excellent.

Overall it's a solid choice for a staple item, but not something amazing to write home about. Sadly, that's enough to earn it the distinction of being one of the better places in San Francisco.

The Ta Hu Ky was was excellent as well, nicely fried and a good appetizer or with a rice dish.
author: Tyler T.

description:
With all these Ramen spots I've been visiting recently I just had to get a bowl of Pho somewhere (but took it easy on the noodles since I'm trying to cut down on carbs these days). The service here was fast and out came what I always get a Large Dac Biet.  I enjoyed the broth (still needed some Hoison sauce) and they gave a fair amount of meat as well. I can see why this place is so popular and give the taste and price point I can say that I'd go here again but I wouldn't say that this place is amazing either.
The world needs a SF Bay Area Pho Rankings...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings.

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places. 
Rod's Pho Rankings for SF Bay Area:

1 Ly's Vietnamese Cuisine
2 Turtle Tower
3 Rang Dong Restaurant
4 Golden Star Vietnamese Restaurant
5 Pho Huynh Hiep 2 - Kevin's Noodle House
6 R&D Café
7 Mai's Kitchen
8 Noodles Pho Me
9 Chopsticks Pho & Grill
10 Rice and Spoon Vietnamese Cuisine
11 Pho VN Vietnamese Restaruant
12 Pho 2000
13 Pho Vi Hoa
14 Bistro Viet House
15 Pho Ty II
16 Pho Pasteur
17 Kim Huong
18 Pho 99
author: Rod M.

description:
How did this place get like almost 3000 reviews with above average stars?  Are they paying yelp?

Busy street on Irving, only curb or meter if you can find it.

I asked the man who dropped off our food for an empty bowl to share our bowl of pho and he told me to tell my waitress.  That's like asking for a glass of water and they tell me there's no water.  

We end up not sharing our pho cause it was too salty.  I took a bite out of the meat and it was one big chunk of salt with it.  The broth and meat looked as if it was sad leftovers.  I just left it alone on the side.  So that was a waste of 10 bucks.  Thank goodness I order a rice and beef dish, which wasn't that great but I was so hungry At least it was edible.

The only time I saw the waitress was to take our order before asking what do we want to drink.  And giving us our receipt to pay.  Not like it was busy. 

But ya...not coming back.  So I need to write the review to remind myself.
author: Gia C.

description:
This was a great shop. Food was fast, hot, delicious and simple to navigate the menu. 
Super busy and popular for a reason. Kid friendly. We took our 11 month old.
author: Justin M.

description: Been wanting to try out this place since I moved to the sunset and finally got around to it tonight. I went with my roommate and we both ordered #17 medium, which was beef noodle soup with just steak strips. My roommate is more of a pho expert, so I just followed her lead, and it did not disappoint!! The noodle soup was exactly what I needed today. The service was pretty bad, but for an amazing meal in San Francisco for under $11, this place can't be beat!
author: Sonia S.

description:
One of my go-to pho places in the avenues. Just be warned that it's also half the city's go-to pho place and there's normally a wait. Luckily, if you're a small group/come during the week, the line usually goes by pretty quickly. That being said, Kevin's is not somewhere I go if I don't want to be rushed. Walk in and put your name down on the clipboard. 

The broth is excellent, the meat is great, and I love the option of three sizes (S, M, and L). I normally opt for the M and it is just the right amount of filling. My go to is the pho with brisket.

Be warned, service here is all about getting you in and out as quickly as possible. So if you feel like you're being rushed and the bill is at your table before you're done eating, it is how Kevin's tries to get people in and out as quickly as possible.
author: Arezou A.

description:
It's the best pho I've ever had in my life. Not sure what else to say. Get the chicken with white meat chicken only, add some spicey sauce, it's amazing. 

Non-pho stuff is eh.
author: Mateo K.

description: Happy I finally stopped at this neighborhood favorite. There's usually a line but they turn over tables pretty quickly! The menu is huge with both pho and noodle/meat dishes. Kind staff!
author: Jeanette R.

description:
I've honestly held off on writing a review for Kevin's Noodle House since I still come here periodically and would prefer not to be singled out as the guy who left them a less than stellar review. But honestly, I've always viewed Kevin's as the Taco Bell of Pho. They're conveniently located in the Sunset as well as having a location in Westlake (Daly City), are pretty expedient in seating, taking orders, and then serving said orders, AND take credit card! However when it comes to their Pho, it's a 3/5 on good days, and abysmally bad on the off-days. Today for example, the beef in my #1 that I always order came out really tough, stringy, and difficult to chew (meat was obviously not fresh and overcooked prior to serving). 

Service itself is also a hit or miss. However I do find this location typically friendlier than the Daly City site.
author: Alex C.

description:
My friends and I came here around 6:15 - 6:30 PM and we only had to wait for a little while. We had definitely beat the dinner rush. They pushed a 2-seater with a 4-seater to make a 6-seater table for us, which was really nice. We didn't have to wait longer for one of their bigger tables.

I ordered the #17 in the medium size. It comes with just sliced medium rare beef and noodles. There are some onions, green onions, and cilantro in it already. I wish I knew to ask for rare steak because the meat is already cooked when it comes to you. It tastes better when it comes rare and then you get to cook it in the broth. It was still very satisfying on such cold and windy day. 

Next time, I might just order the larger size with the rare steak instead.
author: Allyson L.

description: Coming from SJ to try SF's pho today. Glad my bf and I both bookmarked this spot without knowing neither of us did. Medium size bowls give generous amounts of meat and noodles for a great price. Ordered #17 and #12. The flavor of the soup was really good compared to what SJ has been serving recently. No added sauces needed. We also ordered mediocre spring roll. Shrimp and barely any noodles which I believe are premade. They came out too quick and stuck to each other. We came during lunch hour and parking could be hard to find. Had to put our names on the waitlist but you get seated really quickly. Within 10mins for Sunday lunch rush hour. Really good pho, fast and efficient service.
author: Vannah V.

description:
Amazing broth! I came here under the recommendation that this is the best place for pho in SF and it definitely lived up to the hype in my opinion.

The menu is very extensive, you'll basically find all the variations of noodle soup, vermicelli and rice bowls on the menu. They even have a section for boba and smoothies. Prices are pretty inexpensive too, around $7 for small, $8 for medium and $9 for large. Food comes out almost immediately after you order. 

The restaurant is pretty large and has plenty of tables so it'd be easy to come in bigger groups. Service is pretty efficient and fast.

#A6 - Tau Hu Ky/Fried Shrimp Cakes - Great appetizer! 

#22B Pho Ga Tom - Boneless chicken & shrimp rice noodle soup. The broth was super addicting, it definitely stands out compared to a lot of other pho I've tried in SF. Chicken was very aromatic and flavorful, but I would have liked if there were more than 2 pieces of shrimp.. didn't feel like this justified the extra $1 compared to just having the chicken noodle soup. My main criticism was that the noodles were slightly overcooked and stuck together. Perhaps this was because we came pretty late in the afternoon, around 3 PM and the cooks were just finishing up the lunch batch. (Update: The noodles had a much better consistency when I came the second time around!)

Grilled Chicken & Shrimp Vermicelli - Forgot which number this was, but the second time around I decided to go in on the vermicelli and it was very worthwhile. I personally liked the vermicelli over the noodle soup.

Overall I feel like for the standard Viet dishes you'd find at any restaurant you can't really go wrong here!
author: Chelsea W.

description:
It's come to the point where my boyfriend & I come here pretty much every week, sometimes twice a week. It's such an easy go-to for a quick & fulfilling dinner after a long day of work; the service is fast, meals always come shortly after we order, and the food is always super delicious and, in my opinion, very much worth the price (entrées are $10 or less, depending on your choice of size, which is relatively cheap for SF prices).

The special seafood pho (#29) is my go-to. My other staple is the bun thit nuong (brothless rice noodles with grilled pork, #49) for days when I'm a little bit more conscious about my sodium intake!
author: Gabi D.

description:
**this review is only for take-out**

In my opinion, this is the best pho in the city. Extremely quick service (call ahead and food is ready in 5-10 min), delicious soup. There is just something about this pho that I can't put my finger on that makes it SO much better than the others. The flavor is perfect! Soup is available for take out in S, M or L. The medium is usually perfect for me. I also enjoy the imperial rolls.

Only downside: parking/location. Unless you live out in the Sunset, it's a bit of a trek to get to, and once you get there, parking is not easy. That being said, I used to live one block away and have since moved to Cow Hollow and still make the drive out to Kevin's rather than settling for a more convenient restaurant. It's worth the trouble!
author: Jessie K.

description: Ok, son had chicken pho ga, and I had  Com Ga N with chicken. Son says his was great. I can agree with him on that. This is our second time here, now it time to go to the surf and relax.
author: Steve K.

description: One of the top 3 pho restaurants in the Sunset, I come here time to time for pho similar to that of Vietnamese-central Orange County. Pricing here and in OC are super similar, and they have such a "clean" broth that I can drink a whole bowl of it without issue. Noodles are soft with just enough chewiness, and people come and go rather quickly here! Come here if you want some good pho in SF - always hard choosing between this restaurant and a couple others in Sunset.
author: Michael N.

description: We walked and and were seated immediately during dinner rush, we ordered chicken wings, and two pho bowls. Our pho came before the chicken wings maybe 5 minutes after we ordered(which was a huge surprise). Our chicken arrived shortly after along with the cilantro that I asked for. I added the sauces I liked and tried this soup...with a delightful surprise the soup was amazing with a bountiful amount of meat. My sons was also filled with plenty of chicken and noodles. If there was one thing I wished they did was offer water without being asked (our waiter only came by once to take the order and the second time to bring the food, so we never had the chance to ask for water).  Besides this I would defiantly come back and recommend this to other yelpers!!
author: Jayme G.

description:
Strolled through here after my study session at the Inner Sunset Library. 

CONS:
- Only one bathroom (one toilet) for all. 
- There rice plates glisten with oil.
- The pho broth is packed immensely with MSG (too much in my opinion).
- Will charge for any extras (basil, onions, cilantro, pickled carrots/daikon)

PROS:
- The service is quick and efficient. 
- The meat on the rice plates are flavorful and tasty.
- Prices are cheap.
- Hot tea is complimentary. 

This is an average pho place that serves decent pho and rice plates. So long as you don't have high expectations, this place will suffice!
author: Jim G.

description: I ususally come here for pho when I'm in the city. But today, I wasn't that hungry and I ordered shrimp spring rolls to go. I got basically a lettuce wrap with shrimp. There was barely any noodles. So disappointed! First and last time ordering take out from here.
author: Lipin D.

description: Growing up, this place is always my go to place for pho. Despite the fact that it is on Irving and parking is so hard to find, I always find myself coning back here. Simple, affordable and delicious.
author: Emily H.

description:
Very good pho and I was able to order it without noodles. Unfortunately, I didn't realize the chicken wings were breaded, so I could only pick at them. The restaurant is casual, roomy and calm. Nice waitstaff. 

Second visit: A man greets me by repeating "Just one?" (my least favorite phrase) three times, failing to notice that I answered yes each time.
author: P S.

description: Some of the better pho and vermicelli in the city, and definitely on Irving Street. Kevin's Noodle House is a good find because there is a lot of seating, there is really fast service, and the portions are large for the price (especially in SF). If you are looking for some place quick, that can satisfy your pho craving, come here. I ordered a vermicelli bowl, my friend ordered a pho dish, and we split salad rolls. I was satisfied with all 3, and don't really think you can go wrong.
author: Ross S.

description:
Cold foggy day, entering the bay area sfo airport, we're starving! Looking for hot eats and on the cheap! This place had amazing turn out. While we were waiting, this place was packed full of patrons walking  in and out. We were told to check out this place. When we entered the establishment we knew we wanted to get pho.  So the decision was very simple.  Basic pho serving several different  sizes to appease hungry goers. Oh  my they  were so quick!  after taking our order, in less than 10 minutes there were three bowls coming out. Hot steaming broth of pho offering 3 different sizes.  I had the large bowl my daughter had the medium size and my son had the child size small. We had two beef orders and my daughter had the chicken bowl.
The broth was a delight of subtle flavors of saltiness from fish sauce, onions and aniseed. Absolutely fantastic tasting with very fresh condiments for our toppings of Basils, mounds of cilantros, bean sprouts, green jalapeno slices and fresh lime wedges.
We left the establishment feeling refreshed and ready to go sightseeing.
Looking forward for our return  to try out other dishes.
We are definitely coming back here again when we are back in the Bay Area!
author: Cecilia L.

description:
Honestly, the pho here was probably the worst pho I've ever had. My meat had a weird color and was wayyyy too tough. I gave it all to my friend. The soup was TOO salty and the broth was very I don't know, but it tasted weird. Noodles were too overcooked. 

Everyone I ate with thought the soup was soo salty and not fresh. I got a medium and it also wasn't that much food compared to a regular at another restaurant. Its cheap here cause they portion so little. Might as well go to another place that is $1-3 more cause you'll get much better meat and noodles.
author: Micaela I.

description:
I've dined at or taken food to-go from Kevin's Noodle House at least 15+ times. Let me tell you, try to visit whenever you have a chance. It's a great combination of quality of food, speed of service and cost. 

Sure the service isn't top notch, but it's fairly on par with other Asian restaurants. 

I personally am a big fan of the shrimp cakes -- tasty, crispy and juicy on the inside. 

If there's a line, make sure to put your name on the clipboard at the front. For folks ordering to-go, walk to the cashier at the back. Credit cards accepted for bills over $10.
author: Bernard H.

description: I've been here a few times. The broth is amazing for their pho and the service is quick! They provide you with a flavorful broth and there's delicious steak. The noodles are great. You can choose between regular and large. The pho comes with bamboo sprouts, mint and cilantro, and jalapeño. Try it all inside! I've really liked the pho I've tried and it's very reasonably priced.
author: Natalie M.

description:
Kevin's is my go-to pho place in sf since my high school days! Consistent food quality, large portions for the price, fast and efficient service... no frills no fancy treatment, just order your food, enjoy, pay & dip. Kevin's is pretty popular and if you ever come here, you know it because it always has customers no matter what time of day or night. All in all, I only have good things to say about this place. 
I came here an hour ago and was seated right away by the young gentleman. The prices have gone up so it's now $9.00 for a #1. I normally order #1 because it's the bang for your buck: large bowl of pho for a cheap price with a lot of variety in it. This time however I felt like trying the #2 medium which is similar to #1 but #2 has beef balls. ($9.25 for a #2 medium) The food came out quickly! Came with 6 beef balls. Broth was flavorful..just like how I remember it! Noodles were on the chewier side but I didn't mind it. I finished my bowl of pho, paid, and left. My meal was about 30 min overall. And right away my seats were taken by one of the three parties waiting and standing by the door. 
Kevin's doesn't mess around when it comes to serving customers quickly and efficiently. Food quality is good, yummy enough to have locals like me coming back for YEARS. Stay you Kevin's, stay true.
author: Debby N.

description:
The pho here is solid, and the service is always super fast... or at least, it's fast once you can get a table. There are some nights where Kevin's can get super packed, and although the wait tends to be relatively short, I wouldn't go here if you're in a rush. 

As for food quality, their pho broth is good, and the soup is always packed with a lot of meat. The fresh spring rolls aren't my favorite. They pre-make them, and I think they sit for a while in the fridge. Because of this, they tend to be very closely adhered to each other when they come out, making it hard to separate and share them. 

Overall my favorite pho spot in SF. I haven't tried their bun or other dishes, so I can't speak to those... but if pho is what you're craving on a gloomy winter's day, then go for it!
author: Lauren C.

description: The go-to pho place in sf. I usually get #8 with beef on the side or a rice plate. They are all pretty good. The soup is usually really hot. When they are busy, service is still pretty fast.
author: Andrew Y.

description:
One of my favorite pho places in San Francisco. You. Get. Pho :P. 

The service is curt in return for quick service, good food, and cheap! It's not fancy, just a great place for a quick bite to eat.
author: Theresa N.

description: Wholesome Vietnamese food for the hungry soul, Kevin's Noodle Shop genuine darn great noodles and broths to enjoy for a 'food coma' worthy lunch or dinner. Come on by to the cultured staff and indulge in way more food than you need.
author: Frank Z.

description:
Faaaavorite pho place. I visit this place every single time I make the trek up to NorCal. I always get some variation of the beef pho - it's so rich and flavorful, yet light and soul-warming. There's just something about the broth that keeps me coming back. Maybe it's the MSG, but I really couldn't care less.

This place is usually pretty packed, but turnaround is so fast that I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes. It's amazing how quickly they serve your order sometimes...probably within 3 minutes.

I think the small size is perfectly filling, but those with dark holes for stomachs may feel differently. 

I'd skip the fresh spring rolls - they're kind of dry and sad looking. Get the pho!!!
author: Amy T.

description:
I love kevin's pho. it is my go to place to get pho. service is really fast and workers are pretty nice i guess.

BUT!!!!!!

watch out- if you ever get the fresh spring rolls, it is supposed to come WITH meat! They often serve it with JUST the shrimp, which is wrong- according to their menu. I feel like they try skimping out on the meat or something...just a warning.
Also, I heard from my friend that one time he didn't take his receipt and they charged him an extra dollar or two. So either make sure you take your receipt, or take a picture of it!!
author: Rachel K.

description:
This place is great for pho, and it's actually one of my more commonly visited restaurants in SF.  I always order the #1 (pho with pretty much everything in it), and it's always solid.  The portion sizes along with the price are pretty reasonable, and the food is pretty good.  One thing that I might mention is that the soup does tend to be on the saltier side, so beware of that if you're sensitive to sodium/MSG.  

Service is usually pretty fast, and the food comes out eerily fast - I would honestly almost consider Kevin's as a fast food restaurant instead of a legit "sit-down" restaurant.
author: Tim L.

description:
After searching for a pho restaurant in SF, I found this place! We were in need for some pho goodness after bar hopping the night before. I had the #9 which has rare steak, well-done flank, and tendon. The tendon was hard so it was not enjoyable. The rare steak and well-done flank were good though. The broth also had decent flavoring. It is on the lighter side. The noodles are overcooked... they are way too soft. I would recommend asking them not to cook them so long. 

Cash only!
author: Teresa N.

description: I like this place it looks like is run by a family which I I like and respect so going there almost every two weeks but my last experience was bud not with the food but the service usually they are nice But know the guys who direct people to the tables have a big really big attitude    And the food is okay obviously not the best but  and myself  the only thing I don't dial with is attitude  good bye myself and my family not going back to Kevin's
author: Jaime H.

description: Decided to go here based off of the yelp reviews. What a mistake, not the cleanest place and very unfriendly male waiter, quite rude actually.  I didn't care for the quality of the food as well. I've tasted much better pho. I really don't know how they got a 4 star rating here on yelp. Needless to say I would never return.
author: Ronette B.

description: I mean....if you rate Kevin's any less than 4 you've got princess issues. The small (pho) is pretty small so a large is the way to go even if you don't finish.
author: Joshua F.

description: This place looked crowded... we tried it and we didnt like it.... the pho, the pork chop on the rice place.... it dont taste that good... they gave me the wrong flat fresh noodle that i ordered too... that big noodle usually for chow fun chinese food kind of style... the shrimp cake look good but my friend didnt like it either
author: Michael P.

description:
I haven't had much good pho in SF, so Pho Huynh definitely knocks it out of the park.

Came here for dinner with boo from Twin Peaks, and we wanted something soupy and warm after a windy night of skyline views. There are two main pho joints in this strip, but Huynh's looked less crowded in the entryway, so we came here. I'm so glad we did! We ordered pho (him beef, me seafood) and I thought the Medium size was PERFECT for me. We also started with shrimp spring rolls which were so sticky (rice paper kept on sticking together), but fresh and delicious with the peanut sauce. I'd highly recommend it. My seafood pho was delicious in broth. The broth is the lighter and fresh kind, not oily or thick at all...which is MY favorite. Boo likes the heartier kind with more thickness, but we both enjoyed it.

They also rock because they take card AND split checks! We saw large groups, couples, and people of all ages in here. They don't have wifi, but they do have great pho, chill service, and lots of space for parties of all sizes. Win. Win.
author: Jodi H.

description: Terrible service. We've been there many times and 90% of the time, service is pretty bad. Servers are rude and make you feel like you're asking for a huge "favor" when asking for extra bean sprouts. I told them, charge me for it, it's fine! But the look and attitude just turn me off. Last time we were there, people who got there way after we did we seated first.
author: D L.

description: Delicious, no-nonsense noodle spot. My dad and I had pho for lunch for less than $20 total. Broth is not overly salty or greasy, and the noodles are cooked perfectly (not overdone/mushy). Service is not overly friendly, but super fast. I'll be back for sure
author: Katherine T.

description: Authentic Vietnamese coffee with filter and condensed milk. Low price, huge portion!! Highly recommended
author: Alicia Xiaorong Z.

description: Pretty good and very fast service!  Large bowls were really big.  We had the seafood soup and the noodles with shrimp and pork.  Not a bad place at all and very fast service.
author: Lenny T.

description: More like Pho Ham Ga Chan! Yes, this place is cheap in price but also cheap in food! Large portions of old and soggy noodles and well done beef like crazy. Should be medium rare like a sane person. Food is terrible, one star for service. Also, too many high school kids go here because they can't afford anything else on Irving even though it is hella cheap. They have the right idea by calling it Noodle House because it isn't a Noodle Restaurant!
author: Kevin R.

description:
Best pho in the city! 
Its my go-to place whenever I'm craving pho. Their food is very affordable and always fresh. 
I feel like there's no set time of when it gets busy, but when it does get busy, the wait time is quick. The longest I've ever waited is less than 10 minutes for a table. My order always comes out super quick too. Even if it's busy, it's like my meal just pops right in front of me after I order. I always order a medium bowl of #17 (TÁI) with thin slices of medium rare steak for $7.75. It's only a dollar more for a large. But the medium is enough for me. It fills me up whenever I'm really hungry. They also serve other bowls of pho with well done brisket, flank, tendon, and tripe. But I'm pretty plain so I always just go for the medium rare steak. 
Their pho is always very tasty and satisfying, especially on a cold, rainy day!
author: Kristin H.

description:
Have yet to find a better pho joint in SF. It's always bustling here especially since SF has many cold nights, but I've never had to wait longer than 5 minutes because turnaround is so quick.

If you're indecisive, I usually go for the chicken pho or pork chop over rice with the avocado smoothie. The spring rolls are yummy as well - wrap them around lettuce and dip into the fish sauce.

Minus one star for the obvious MSG, but still comforting whatsoever :)
author: Claudia C.

description:
Solid pho. 
Large portions
But flavors aren't out of this world amazing or unique (but actually sort of flat and 1 dimensional)
Just a nice, standard bowl of pho when you get a pho craving 

Just 1 thing to note. They charge for a second plate of pho veggies. I could never understand why whether there is 1 or 2 people, they always just give 1 plate of veggies (doesn't make sense to me). I still don't. 

Pho2000 is still my fav in the city for pho!
author: J P.

description: Food is ok. I ordered the beef, meatball, and tender pho. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. But then again, I don't know where's a good pho restaurant in San Francisco. For a table for three was about 15 minutes wait so don't be discouraged by how many people are on the wait lists, it does go by really fast. The reason why I rated a three stars is because the food and customer service wasn't that great. The broth was plain, had to add more hoisin and sriracha sauce than I normally do for more flavors.
author: Ly L.

description: For the number of reviews this place has I was expecting better. Pho looked ok but broth had very little flavor and tendons were chewy, would not recommend. It makes me sad so this place is so popular and many think they are eating good pho.
author: Kevin B.

description: This place is very reasonably priced with good food. Personally, I like their rice plate more than the pho. However, I recommend everyone to try it themselves before going by other people's review. You won't be disappointed. Only wish...downtown had better asian food at a reasonable price...
author: Jay M.

description: We spent the day out in SF today and we decided  on getting pho. My friends had been here before and it was packed, I was super hungry at this point but I'm so glad we waited. They did not take long to clear tables and they brought out the food almost immediately. I got the 22a boneless chicken with rice noodles, I put all the fixins and it was just perfect. I will definitely be back.
author: Angelica Z.

description: This restaurant has great pho for good prices. They also have very delicious rice plates.
author: Nathaniel D.

description: Absolutely my favorite Vietnamese noodle restaurant in San Francisco! The food is always top notch fantastic no matter what. I've been going there for the past several years and I'm never disappointed. My only suggestion is to have the bathroom consistently clean throughout the week.
author: Kangaroo K.

description: This place gets super busy, but people come and go quickly! You won't be seated until your entire party is there. The noodles and broth of their pho is simply the best I've ever tasted! I see why many people come here!
author: Joanna P.

description:
The best pho I've had in San Francisco! Got the classic  rare steak and fatty brisket. The broth was flavorful and tangy, the noodles had that pleasantly chew, the meat was delicious.

Quick service, lots of seating (which is hard to find in SF)
author: Nathan M.

description: It was a little difficult to find as Google has a different but similar name listed. Our waiter was not particularly friendly though service was very prompt. The pho was okay.
author: Jim J.

description: Always a quick and inexpensive place to get my pho craving satisfied. I usually get to go from here and they are quicker at having it ready than other places in that area.
author: Diana N.

description:
I absolutely love Pho` ...and this place is definitely  the best of the many restaurants I have had it at. 
Always fresh basil, cilantro and bean sprouts served with it. Many varieties of noodles and many soups to choose from. Their Boba teas and fruit smoothies are also amazing! I love to get a fruit smoothie as desert. If your going to have Pho` in the City, this is your place.
author: Susie L.

description: Found this little gem while strolling around the capital. The portions are generous, In both size and taste. The spicy noodle soup was great, but the spring rolls and dipping sauce were just out of this world! Super value, and would definitely recommend.
author: Chinnakrit W.

description: Overall nice restaurant with good quality and fast service. I tend to order #13 or #17. The noodle has a nice texture and good flavor. Only concern is one of their utensils had some food stains on it. Here dish washing can be improved. But still value is great and I'm happy camper.
author: Luke X.

description:
Oh Kevin's, you confuse me so.
Are you delicious? Are you too salty? Are you secretly bland and spiked with msg? I know not.

We ordered: 
#2 Large (which is the house special beef pho with all the meats + beef meatballs). It was a generous portion of soup, medium amount of meat, but I wished for a bite or four more of noodle. The broth was a tad sweet and...something else. We couldn't figure out the savory aftertaste. I thought it was ok, but not worth the extra ten blocks we traveled from our regular pho place (Yummy Yummy) that's closer to the apartment.

#50 Bun with egg roll and pork. Don't get this! Don't be fooled by the multitude of Yelpers' photos of this LIKE I WAS! It was NOT DELICIOUS. They also gave me a small bowl of clear chicken broth alongside? I've never experienced this before with other vermicelli bowls. Hmm, am I a noob? 

For lunchtime, it was pretty busy! Full of regulars it appeared. But I don't really understand why? It was no Pho Than Brothers in Seattle-- I was unimpressed.
author: Cindy T.

description:
Excellent pho. Straight up the best I've had in a while. That being said, I'm giving three stars because of the service. Our waitress plopped down the food and we never saw her again. We tried many times to get her to give us eye contact. At first I thought it was merely because she was merely busy: until I realized she was actually ignoring me! I came in with three kids under 13. I don't live in SF (anymore) and I *look* it. Bright colors, super friendly and chatty + three exuberant kids! 
I remember living in SF and was always able to spot a tourist a mile away. No reason to give them the cold shoulder though!! I watched her interact with literally every other table except ours. All we wanted was some water and then at the end, a little container for the leftovers the kids didn't eat. I often skip past other reviews that go on about "how the food was good but...." when that's all I really want to to know! But it was hurtful. I was kind to her and it just seemed that we bothered her because we didn't fit into the urban scene. It's not a snobby place, it's an authentic Vietnamese restaurant. You'll like the food. I hope you're treated better than we were when it comes to the service though.
author: Jenny P.

description:
After a long hiatus from Kevin's the Broth is still good, but what happened to the noodles?? It was super over cooked and slimy and the noodles basically stuck together. I'm not sure what the management is doing but these noodles isn't the same as before. 

Also, I paid $9.25 for a small #8 (rare steak and beef balls) and the portion was way too small. 

I have had Kevin's at westlake and the noodle was also over cooked in which I overlooked because I thought it could have been an off day. But the noodles are consistently over cooked which is no good. I would not be coming back to Kevin's for the poor noodle quality.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: This is my go to spot for pho in the sunset area. It is both tasty and a good price. I hardly deviate from my order of pho and imperial rolls, but just about everything that comes out of the kitchen looks delicious. Parking can be difficult if you are not used to city living, but that should not be a deterrent to coming here.
author: Richard L.

description:
Kevin's Noodle House is everywhere nowadays and is always poppin' with lots of hungry people!

I came here with a group of friends after watching the Warriors destroy the Cavs during the NBA Finals. We got their Tàu H Ky to share as an appetizer. It's basically a fried shrimp cake that comes with fish sauce, and it's pretty good to eat with some pho since it contrasts it with its crispiness and chewiness. I ordered their pho here and it's pho-licious. It comes out quick and it comes out hot. There's not much to say about it except that it's a pretty good bowl of pho. If you're not down for pho, however, they also have a wide selection of dishes such as vermicelli, beef stew, bbq rice plates, and more!
author: Joshua M.

description:
The service is good , the food was nice and authentic
We would love to come back here again 
Pho combination nice!!!
author: Chasada F.

description: Best pho I've ever had in San Francisco. I don't like rice noodles that much, but it was a very pleasant place. The food that I ate is a huge bowl of noodles with meatballs. Of course, the soup was really delicious. I'll come again.
author: John L.

description:
One of the best beef combination pho I've had. The broth was delicious with some fatty on top like it should. All the meat were tender and not tough and chewy like most pho places. The tendon has a perfect texture. Some
Pho places serves their tendon too hard and some serve theirs too soft where u just swallow it like water. The tendon here is right in the middle. Everything is freshly prepared and very delicious. This will be the only pho place when ever I visit SF. Highly reccomend.
author: Mike S.

description:
Hype or not hype, this is a very good Vietnamese pho place. I think there are some madness to eating at popular Vietnamese restaurants. Tried and true. Show up at 3 PM on weekend, no line, easy in and out.

The most astonishing thing is speed. I have never ever experienced anything this quick. From sitting down to order, 1 minute. From order to food arriving on your plate, 4 minutes.

It was faster than ordering at any number of fast food chain. 

To me, I like the fact there are multiple size to order from. In theory, a regular medium size bowl should be enough. But in practical terms, a small sizes is all I can ever eat. 

Price is probably the deal sealer. It's less than $10 per person.

I would not go with the egg rolls, there are better ones out there there. But I don't know if there are better pho places in the burbs. I'd stick to this one for the foreseeable future.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Second time coming here, and each time I've ordered the #32 beef stew. 

-tender beef
-carrots, onion
-thin rice noodles
-loads of flavor

Tastes homemade. 

****only recommendation I could have is to separate the meat from the fatty tripe part. My first bowl was perfect but the second one had way more tripe and fat to beef ratio.****

This place is usually pretty packed each time Ive came. 

If you're looking for a great tasting pho place try it out. I've yet to explore other options on the menu but it's located nearby my boyfriends house so I will definitely be back! 

Service has been great each time! Very fast and helpful. 

I've been lucky and found parking each time right out front, plenty of street parking but good luck!
author: Janessa H.

description: While visiting SF, my man and I were craving for some pho and found this place. This place is spacious and clean. The staff service is nice. We had a #1 & #18. I like the options you can choose the size of your pho. Coming from nyc, most places only offer one size of pho except for big bowl pho. The noodles were chewy which I like, but the soup was a bit oily and lacks flavor for my taste.
author: Christina L.

description: This place is always a hit. The food has always been great and prices are fair for the amount of food you're getting. If you get a bowl of pho your meal will come out really quick and the others only take a bit longer. The only reason it gets minus one star is because I personally like friendlier service and this place gives you quick and efficient service but not necessarily warm and welcoming. Their food always delivers though so I suggest trying it!!
author: Melanie L.

description: Very good pork chop and shrimp pho going to come agian I suggest anyone to try if they enjoy Vietnamese food
author: Jbl H.

description: The service is abrupt and borderline rude but the food was really good and conveniently priced so...
author: Jennifer R.

description:
When I think about great pho places in San Francisco, one restaurant that would pop into my mind is Kevin's Noodle House. I haven't ate here in six years since I lived near a couple of pho places, so I felt like I was due for a visit here. I came here with a friend at around 7pm on a Sunday and it was a full house when we went in. We waited roughly ten minutes before we were seated near the back. I felt like nothing has really changed here since the last time I've gone here. I do remember they do serve large portions here though. Anyways, I looked through the menu and narrowed down my choices down to the number 2 special combo pho that seems to have everything and the beef stew with rice noodles. I decided to get the large beef stew with rice noodles since I prefer that just a little more. I wasn't planning on getting a drink, but once I saw an avocado shake on the menu, I was strongly considering the drink. Then my eyes wandered over to the salted plum drink and the salted plum soda and I was thinking about those as well. I decided to go for the avocado shake since it's rare that I get to taste a good avocado shake, and I'll probably have an easier time finding the salted plum drinks elsewhere. 

Our respective orders arrived and I stared at the bowl before me. The large was more of a large bowl, but content-wise, it seemed like there wasn't much there. However, once I poured the bean sprouts and mint leaves in, it quickly ballooned into a full bowl of pho. I then tasted the broth and found it to be flavorful, and then moved to the other contents. I found the beef to not be as tender as I thought it would be, and it still felt a little tough as I chewed and processed it. The carrots are also not as soft as I would have expected from a beef stew, leading me to believe that the beef stew could have been better if it was cooked a bit longer. The noodles, however, were excellent, and I really enjoyed them. I found very little need to add hoisin sauce or sriracha to the meal, and overall, the pho was good. 

Moving on to the avocado shake, I thought it was well done and was on par with some of the best avocado shakes that I had in the past. The sweetness level was just right, but I wouldn't have minded it if it was a bit sweeter, since I have a sweet tooth. Nothing is worse than an avocado shake that isn't sweet and just taste of avocados. However, one thing that they could work on is the boba, as I felt that it was a bit too soft, as soft as how I would've liked my beef stew. Overall, other than the boba, I thought it was pretty good.

All in all, I think my meal here was pretty good, and I would definitely come back here again hopefully sometime within the next six years. I think I would get the number two pho next time or one of the seafood pho dishes. I am also interested in the salted plum drinks and I could see myself ordering that next time as well. Anyways, for pho in the Sunset, I would recommend this place to anyone who needs to fulfill their pho cravings, and I can personally say that I am looking forward to my next time here as well.
author: Nelson X.

description:
Came here looking for pho. 

Ordered the large house special pho and couldn't be happier. The noodles are chewy, there is plenty of beef and the broth is delicious. 

All the usual stuff are available on your table and your order of pho comes with bean sprouts, basil and lemon. Adding a tiny bit of lemon to the broth compliments it really well.
author: Alex T.

description: This was the best pho I have ever had!! Seriously so amazing; my family and I were all thinking about it even the day after. Amazing broth and the peanut sauce for their spring rolls was sooo good; Definitely recommend!
author: Suzu W.

description:
Came here after the marathon. Great place for pho. 

I moved up from LA a few months back and since then I really haven't found pho worth trying since then. But this place is great! 

The pho broth here is a bit on the sweeter side but hits it just like the pho shops back home in LA. Prices of the pho here are also amazing, especially because it's also in SF!
author: Ryan C.

description: I'm originally from LA so my review is in comparison to the pho restaurants I've tried there. The food here is pretty decent. The broth is salty in my opinion (probably all the msg), but the flavor is there and the ingredients are fresh. Might be difficult to track down your server during peak hours, but overall a good experience!
author: Sarah C.

description: I've been here three times. I had their Seafood Pho in the medium size. which was filling. The Fried Chicken is very good. My dining partners had the Pho with beef, which they really enjoyed. I wish they had more vegetarian options with the pho since it either comes with beef or chicken and pork stock, maybe a vegetable based stock. The line can sometimes be long but moves fairly quickly and the prices are very reasonable.
author: Rachel S.

description: We love #17 the beef strips with egg noodle soup dish and the pork chops with white rice are Amazing! The service is fast too!
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Their food comes out super fast, but they have no consistency when it comes to their rice plates. Yesterday I went there and their fish sauce tasted really funny/sour. The time before the rice they served was at least a day old and rock hard. The visit before that, I ordered 2 pork chops and they gave me one with a very small extra piece. Also the pork chop is a hit or miss.

If you're coming for just the soup/pho it's fine, but you never know what you're going to get with the rice plates. I'd rather go somewhere else where I know what I'm going to get when I arrive instead of being disappointed with the quality.
author: Eric C.

description: Their chicken pho is my go-to. The chicken isn't dry and they have dark meat added too. So good and the broth is pretty good for chicken. I prefer their chicken pho over their beef. WAY better in my opinion. The service is fast and everyone there is nice.
author: Ritney N.

description: Best pho I've had in SF, the broth is extremely refreshing and the noodles are cooked to perfection, the staff is extremely kind and quick to respond.
author: Alvean B.

description:
Was craving some pho, so my friend and I decided to try this place after walking back and forth and being indecisive along Irving. 

I ordered a small #4 (pho with medium rare steak, well-done flank, brisket, tendon & tripe) and my friend ordered a large #1 (pho combo with basically everything). When both of our orders came out, the size difference was so vast and slightly hilarious! The large size was huge(!!), it was like eating a bucket of pho! The prices are pretty cheap and reasonable too for SF. I appreciated that the servers gave us warm tea and hefty portions of the bean sprouts/herbs. The pho itself wasn't spectacular or the best-bowl-of-pho-I've-ever-had, but it was definitely a decent and satisfying bowl of noodles. 

There was a bit of a wait when we came, but the place is pretty spacious so they're able to accommodate a lot of guests. I might try some other pho places around town first, but overall, the pho here is not bad.
author: Kris C.

description:
MY FAVORITE PHO PLACE IN SF. 
this place has the BEST pho i have had in san fran hands down, service is always fast, and the food is always delicious!!! they get super busy some nights, but even when it's packed, i'm always seated quickly and food comes within minutes. my only qualm is that the service is somewhat gruff with you, but it's understandable given that they have to get delicious food to so many people !!
author: Maddie Y.

description: Walked in and was seated immediately. Ordered and dishes came out FAST. Hard to please kids were in heaven. Will most definitely mark this as a place to return too.
author: Beth L.

description: How can you not love Kevin's? Both locations are great. Always packed, but they're super affordable and efficient. Something about their broth is amazing. I usually stick to the kid size number 19 or I'll get BUN with two eggrolls. Fishcakes actually super delicious. I usually come here with my brothers and my boyfriend perfect for San Francisco weather. And for something sweet young coconut or avocado shake with no tapioca lol
author: Sasha M.

description: This is located a few minutes drive outside of Golden Gate Park. It became full pretty quickly on a Friday evening. Their menu is extensive with 3 bowl sizes about a dollar difference in each. We ordered fried egg rolls and beef pho. Broth was very flavorful but a bit on the salty side. Medium portion was enough to fill us up. Very good pho but wasn't as outstanding as I expected.
author: Alyson Y.

description: Kevin's is the go to place for pho! It is usually busy but you are still able to get a table. Their service is okay, but the food is great, and their prices are reasonable!
author: Linda N.

description:
Awesome broth, quick service, and great prices.

The staff themselves could definitely be a bit friendlier and welcoming to new customers but I guess that's part of the charm for somewhere that seems to be a frequented watering hole for the locals. 

I got the #2 which is the large combo with all of the meats (steak, meatball, tripe, tendon) in beef broth. All of the phos are served with the traditional plate of basil, jalapeno and bean sprouts. Hoisin, Sriracha and chili paste are all available at the table for your personalized pleasure. 

The broth and steak were very good but I would definitely suggest against the meatball. The tripe was great but I'm not sure I would get the tendon next time, but it depends on which of these you are accustomed to.
author: Aaron B.

description:
Worst Kevin's Noddle House ever. I've been to the Westlake location multiple times and I would say this one on Irving St is the worst. Terrible service.
The guy that sat us down didn't really greet us or make us feel welcome (the same goes for the Westlake location). My friends and I went on a Wednesday afternoon and it wasn't that busy. 

The server rushed as while he was trying to take our orders. We got our food and my friend never got the water she asked for. The food was okay. The broth wasn't even hot or tasted fresh. My friend and I asked for forks and we had to wait for 5 minutes. We had to ask another server about our utensils and he finally brought some out within 2 minutes. The fork was unusually sticky for i had to dip it into the cup hot tea they served to "clean it." I would of asked for another fork or a cup of hot water (so i can clean my fork) but I'm pretty sure they'd forget again.
We asked if we can pay separately and one of the servers said we had to go to the back and pay. We didn't mind having to get up to pay. (The other location splits the bill for you while you're still seated). 

The reason why I'm never coming back to location was not only the terrible food service, but the lady that gave my friends and I attitude while we were trying to pay was rude and disrespectful. She was so ungrateful and she seemed like she didn't want us to be there. She seemed so annoyed and arrogant with us. Her tone of voice was very condescending and just straight up rude. Learn how to treat your customers with respect. I get that sometimes people have bad days but there's no need to take your anger out on your customers. 

Don't waste your money here. The location in Westlake/Daly City is WAY better.
author: Gina H.

description:
I recently moved in to this area and was looking good for a new pho place to make it my to-go comfort food. 

I ordered the combo pho. The broth is very flavorful, it is very clear and yet gives that nice fat texture in your mouth like a heavy broth. The meats were perfectly cooked, great texture, quite a good quality meat for a local pho restaurant. 

However, it loses a star on the noodles. The noodles felt overcooked: it was clumpy, too soft and a little chewy, the noodles didn't separate too well from each strand like I'm used to. 

Overall, good place, but I'm willing to give it a second shot and hopefully it was just an uncommon mistake on the noodles.
author: Catarina Z.

description: Great value. Had the boneless chicken Pho and fresh spring rolls. Quality was right on, nice breast meat, broth not too salty. Basil was exceptionally fresh and generous. Service was very fast and efficient. Place is clean and well lit. All that for apx $40 with drinks and tip for 2 of us.
author: Mark A.

description: Great food great service ordered beef stew it came to the table less than 10 min. Best beef stew!!!
author: Caroline C.

description: Best chicken pho in San Francisco! And I've been to a lot of pho places. Parking is pretty hard to find and if you're trying to find parking on a Saturday, Phorget it lol.
author: David P.

description:
This is one of my favorite pho chains in the bay having gone to the one in Concord and WC. Came here one Wednesday on a rainy/cloudy day for a late lunch and everything was served quickly.  Being serviced quickly with my food coming out within 3 min of ordering is the main reason for my high ratings. The quick service is likely due to me being a solo order.

The waitress there was also attentive when needed - refilling tea and water without hovering. I always get the beef pho with thin steak and well brisket #13. Flavors were good with a great price for appropriate size and portion. I eat a lot and the Medium size was filling even after drinking all the soup :)
author: Isaiah I.

description:
This is my go-to spot for pho in SF. The food comes out quickly, it's not too expensive and the pho is quite delicious. 

Finding parking here can be a pain. It also gets quite packed around lunch and dinner time but they get people in and out really quickly. Once you place an order, you should get your food within 5 minutes. 

Nothing notable stands out here (appetizer wise or noodle wise). I just really like their pho. The broth is well flavored and there is a decent amount of meat. It's a quick fix for any pho craving.
author: Melinda L.

description: Absolutely love this place! Best pho super fast and cheap. I go here at least few times a week. Bomb
author: Kimberly D.

description:
This is THE spot during my high school days. It wasn't until I expanded my pho experiences at other places that I have realized this place wasn't all that great. I would still come here once in awhile. They get the job done.

I like their vermicelli bowls! Imperial rolls are always on point. Their noodle soups are very mediocre, nothing special. Broth is on the salty side. Noodles are sometimes too chewy. 

Oh!! Their fried shrimp cake appetizers are great!! Probably my favorite thing off the menu. 

Service is always good and the line is never too long. Still probably one of my go-to pho places.
author: Nancy C.

description: I've been to this place many times since 2012 but I always try to avoid it or have it once in a while since their service always feel unwelcoming. I came in here wanting to give 5 stars because I haven't been here for so long but I knocked off a star because their noodles were very chewy and so was my friend's bowl. As my friend and I kept eating, the server kept walking by our table without saying anything and few minutes after we got our food, they gave us the bill. We weren't even close to finish and there was many empty tables so I don't understand why they were rushing us to get out. That leaves them at 3 stars but I took another one off because when we finished our food and asked to split the bill, the server told us to go to the counter ourselves and the lady was being unpleasant and was just frowning while splitting our bill. She didn't say thank you or smile at least. They could've gotten at least 3 or 4 stars but their lack of customer service dragged their stars down. The server didn't even check on us to see if we wanted water or anything or even want to help us. The other yelpers are right, it's very suspicious how this place is flooded with 4-5 stars saying this place has wonderful service
author: Katy W.

description: This is an SF staple and if you haven't been here, you should. Cheap, big bowls of pho and they get it to you teal quick. If you haven't been here, definitely come for your cheap pho fix!
author: Leo W.

description: This is hands down, the best Pho in San Francisco, and possibly the Bay Area. I make it my mission to try Pho everywhere I go, and Kevin's Noodle house takes the cake. I would never miss an opportunity to go here.
author: Sean P.

description: Fresh, fast and delicious. Pho and shrimp spring rolls were great. Tea served with the meal
author: Kerry G.

description:
My last review of this place was on 2009. That review is at the bottom of this one, which I praised when this restaurant was good. This current review is an update - Sept. 2017. 

Boy, have times changed for the worse here. I sure hope the pho is not this bad because this place has been the top pho spots in SF for a long time. 

I ordered the #50 for pick up. It's their vermicelli with grilled pork & egg roll. 

It came in a box with 3 divided sections. Before, these boxes with dividers was never used. So this this I literally had 1/3 the usual food. It was a complete shock to me when I opened the box. I mean how in the world and in good conscience can they sell this for $11+ ? It was literally so little food. 

The box has 3 small tiny sections. I got 1/3 of the box of vermicelli with few pieces of grilled pork, 1/3 of the box was for the small and unappetizing egg roll, and the other 1/3 of salad. Pathetic. 

If I was at the restaurant and saw this. I would have either walked out or asked them for a refund if I had already paid. 

I shoulda took a pic was I was hungry and forgot. 

I really hope their pho is not anywhere bad as this.
author: U L.

description: The soup is not hot! Small portion of meat. Won't come again. People waiting in a long line for bad quality food.
author: Emily N.

description: Went here looking for some good Pho/Viet food, found it via yelp. Arrived on a Saturday morning and the place was packed, with a line outside. The wait wasn't terrible, though, maybe fifteen minutes to half an hour. Between two people we had just two entrees, two beverages and an appetizer and it was quite pricey. Expensive comfort food, but it wasn't justified or amazing. It was just decent. Don't understand the hype or why there's a wait/line. But again, I'm starting to see that Asian food in SF just isn't the best of the best, oddly.
author: Marie D.

description:
Perfect for when you're hanging out in Golden Gate Park and realize you're hungry and there isn't actually any notable food inside the park.  Solid quality and large portions at a price you won't find downtown (where I normally spend my time).  It helped satisfy the pho craving I had!

Pho Bo: My signature Pho Bo anywhere I go is rare slices, brisket, flank and meatballs.  I'm just not into chewy or gelatinous meat, so no tendon or tripe for this guy.  I was pleased to see that they gave a ton of broth (some places try to fill the bowl with cheap rice noodles) and a very generous portion of meat.  All pretty amazing that a large bowl is only $10, guess it's the Avenues discount.  The broth is rich and complex.  All the meat was good.  The brisket in particular was memorable since it came in large well-done pieces.  Left full and satisfied.
author: Adam B.

description:
So my good friend Kevin and I decided to give Kevin's Noodle House a try, especially since it was our first time there.  And I've done enough of the Pho rounds around Sacramento hitting up Little Saigon for their representations of an old favorite.

This spot gets crazy busy depending on what hours of the day you decide to visit so remember to be patient as the lines run out the door.  This little spot hosts the typical variety of Vietnamese Pho items as well as their rice dishes and vermicelli platters.  I ordered the popular and basic pho that basically has all the meat but no tripe.  I found the broth to be a little on the watery side but overall, a good experience.  My friend opted for the fishcakes appetizer and he thoroughly enjoyed them.  Not a good vegetarian option as the broth here is made from meat.

Good spot if you are craving Pho options!
author: Miika M.

description:
Love at first bite guyz. Love the broth and the noodles are cooked so perfectly. They also give you soooo much meat. And they have three different sizes to choose from so everyone of different appetites can be satisfied! It's also cheap too! It's around $8 for a medium pho. 

Love love love love this place
author: Stephanie K.

description: Cause I love phó from here, and OMG their chicken wings are fire!! I highly recommend this place to everyone who loves phó like phó real!! Enjoy, I know I did!
author: Olivia M.

description: I dined here on Saturday afternoon and it was as usual-hectic and busy. I was slurping through my bowl of pho, when my teeth felt something weird in my mouth. It wasn't a noodle, meat, or tendon.. but a small piece of plastic. I have no idea how that got in my bowl, but this totally left a bad impression considering that I've been coming here for the past 6 years.
author: Erica K.

description:
Dunno why this is so hyped. It's pretty meh, pho doesn't have much flavor and they don't give enough meat (although that seems to have improved in the past year). The rice plates are OK, tho the Kevin's near 99 Ranch tends to give bigger portions of meat.

Service varies, there's a young guy who's too cocky to do hospitality but the rest are good.
author: Conscious C.

description: This pho is so good. I got chicken and shrimp. It was so tasty. It didn't come with Cilantro but other than that it was great. The service was so-so.
author: Megan J.

description:
The service here is better compared to the one across the street. (The other stall literally just ignore our existence). 

The service was really quick which was great. Didn't have to wait too long for the pho. I didn't have the race plate though it seems that's the may complain others are having.
author: Jia Jian T.

description:
5 stars for quick service

Favorite is number 32 - beef stew noodle soup. So many beef in one bowl! They don't skim on the portions!

If I had to choose a rice plate - number 42! Grilled pork, shrimp cake and egg! Yumm!!

Cheap and satisfying!
author: Carol Y.

description:
Came here after family trip to beach in Pacifica, of course a hot bowl of pho sounded perfect. We came here eons ago.  Now back with the two kids.  

Ordered pho with brisket (med)- perfect amount for hubs, kids chicken pho
and mixed seafood rice noodle.  Also needed to mention that they have the hot chili OIL as a condiment (love this stuff).

Big child 10 yr old ordered pork chop with rice- this was so good!  Would order this myself next time instead of coveting his food  I got the privilege of gnawing on the bone after.  It came with a good size bowl of broth! And he ate everything. 

We also had the avocado shake with boba and the watermelon one with boba.  These were both good we asked for 30% sweetness tasted like it was (price I think a bit high though, $4.25 ea) relative to $7 pho.  

Also we were there at 2:45p on labor day, happy it was open.  It was actually packed at this odd hour, we only had to wait 5 min but there was a continuous flow of customers the whole rest of time we were there.  It was like happy hour on a holiday and everyone wanted noodles.Even though it was so busy, the server was very attentive and the food came pretty fast.  

Would definitely come here all the time if we lived close by.
author: rugbarn d.

description: The best pho in SF by far. Super fast service and amazing food every time I go.  The staff is friendly and the restaurant even when really busy has a fast turn over. Love this place.
author: Eva T.

description:
Realistically a 3.5 stars because Kevin's is a solid standard. It isn't the most amazing pho or rice plate you'll get but it is consistent and reliable. This makes it a great go-to when you're really craving that morning after recovery pho. There beef stew is pretty good too... very home-y tasting. 

Service is always quick and efficient so even if there is a line, it'll pass pretty quickly.
author: Josephine T.

description: Pho was delicious! Not sure if other Pho restaurants just do it different but I was disappointed there were no veggies in it. We would visit again next time we are in SF.
author: Amanda M.

description: This is my new go-to pho place when in the area. Rich broth, generous amounts of meat, only negative was some clumpiness in the noodles. However, on my next visit I may well get one of the vermicelli or rice plates because they come with a bowl of very chicken-y (and MSG-laden) chicken broth. My party also had shrimp spring rolls (solid) and mango bubble tea (thick and sweet). Not a clinker in the bunch. Also super fast and friendly service. Nothing not to like.
author: Otis M.

description: I've been going to Kevin's for ten plus years and was extremely disappointed last week .     It was on a week night around 7ish and was not busy.    My Pho was awful and the chicken noodle soup was not completely cooked
author: Hannah L.

description:
Much needed pho on a windy day.

My friends and I were looking for dinner after walking up the 16th Avenue Steps, so we decided to go for some pho. Pho definitely hits the spots on a cold and windy day!
