The wait wasn't too bad for 7pm on a Saturday evening (5-10 minute wait) since I know this restaurant to be popular with the locals.

I ordered the #1.

This bowl is a common order for a lot of customers since it's a large size for $8.50 with a set number of ingredients. A lot of other pho items are about $8.25 for a medium size bowl, so of course getting the #1 makes sense to order. Though my photo doesn't do the item justice, the taste is there. Enough sodium in the broth to keep it savory, but not so much that it's unbearable. I also had their Vietnamese coffee as well, but I didn't really like that. I guess it's a personal preference for people to like bitter coffee.

Go here for the Sunset District's best go-to pho restaurant (aside from PPQ)!
author: Kevin S.

description:
This is a neighborhood favorite not because the pho is great, but because the food is inexpensive and they are in a sweet location on a busy street with lots of foot traffic.

When it comes to their pho, there are a few things that disappoint me. 
- The tendons are usually rock hard and inedible. I've been here many times, so I don't know why I keep hoping the tendons will be better. 
- Sometimes, the noodles are clumped together, so remember to stir everything around first. 
- The thin slices of steak are frozen and often have freezer burn, and sometimes it has turned a dark unappealing color. I just slather on some sriracha & hoisin on the steak, dunk it in the broth, and it's fine.

So why do I keep coming back? 
- The food is inexpensive (~$6 - $9 for small, medium, large pho) and the location is convenient for me. We covered that already. 
- The broth has good flavor, and it's always piping hot. 
- The Thai basil and bean sprouts are crisp. 
- I walk away feeling full, and I manage to overlook whatever it was about the food that bothered me, because all that sticks with me is the feeling of ingesting a whole lot of noodle soup. 
- The fresh spring rolls ($~6 for 3) with peanut sauce and rice plates (~$8) aren't bad. 
- Service is fast. Of course it is. I'm pretty sure everything - assuming broth in a large stock pot, noodles in a large container, and bins of fixings - are all prepped and ready to go. Once you order, it shouldn't take more than a few minutes to get your food. 
- & they accept card payment.

Overall, a good option for quick, inexpensive food if you're in the neighborhood, especially on a cold day. A solid... 7/10.
author: Joy W.

description: This place was awesome. Super quick service even on a Saturday night with a group of six. Free green tea (always a perk) was served and the Chicken and Shrimp Pho I ordered is now my new favorite pho. 10/10 would recommend! I will be returning here in the future.
author: Lauren L.

description: The food was excellent. We had brisket pho and a rice with grilled beef dish that came with a little soup on the side. Everything was delicious. The service was really fast. And a little of a surprise: green tea included! Would definitely recommend this place! Also prices are good.
author: Laura H.

description: This is my favorite pho restaurant in San Francisco, quite reasonably priced, and the only restaurant in SF that I miss.  Side pork chop is a good value.  While I enjoyed Auberge du Soleil several times, I found SF and Napa restaurants to be extremely overrrated and overpriced in general and I am quite willing to drop $300 per person for lunch at Eleven Madison Park once in a while.  Vietnamese in SF is actually quite good relative to other major US cities, but pizza and Korean especially are mediocre at best.
author: Z Z.

description: I'm generally not the biggest fan of pho but this place was great! It was quite busy, which make sense since we went on a Friday night. Even so, we only had to wait a few minutes before being seated. Luckily, the food came quickly as well. The variety I ordered had brisket in it which was pretty good! It was also a big serving size and quite filling. Overall, not the most phenomenal place I've ever been, but definitely good food and good service!
author: Jane C.

description: If you're looking for a good pho place in San Francisco then Kevin's is the way to go. They have another location in west lake which make is the one I usually go to. Their chicken pho never disappoints, broth is full of flavor. That's all I get actually. Plus they have boba drinks and it's really good too, just a tad too sweet. Come here if you're hungry and looking for something to fill you up under ten.
author: Lisa W.

description: Really good pho and even better drinks! Their durian shake was sooooo good. It wasn't overly sweet and tasted of real durian, and it was only $4.6 after tax! The durian shake reminded me of days in Guangzhou when I always used to buy durian.. It's so rare to find good durian in America, so I'll definitely come back to Kevin's just for another shake.
author: Kate X.

description: Hands down the best pho place in the city!! This place was made especially for cold, cloudy days in SF.
author: Lovejoy K.

description: this is my second  visit here,love the huge bowl of soup and flavorful rice combinations, so far this is my fav pho place in sf 19th ave. area  that's affordable and worth.
author: MG B.

description: This place is one of my favorite places to get pho from. The ppl who work here have very quick hands, so even if there's a super long line, we don't have to wait that long. The food here is affordable and delicious! Also the ppl who work here are really friendly.
author: Isabella H.

description: The food here is great - pho and rice plates alike. It is busy pretty much constantly, but tables turn over quickly. On the other hand, the dining area is pretty hectic and definitely doesn't have the feel of a restaurant as much as a cafeteria, so if you're looking for a "dining experience" you may just wanna get takeout and set your own table.
author: Preston G.

description: While I think this place is a little hyped up, I still think it deserves 5 stars based on my experience.  We were seated immediately and we're given menus quickly.  The staff checked in with us enough so that we got what we wanted but it wasn't overbearing.  I got just a regular order of pho and viet iced coffee.  The pho was good, and there wasn't too much fat in it.  My iced coffee was really strong but it's known to be like that for viet iced coffee and it's how I like it anyways.  When we finished up, the staff was able to provide a check quickly as well and we were on our way in about half an hour without even feeling rushed.  This place definitely deserves 5 stars as it's the best out of a couple places in SF that I've been to, but of course there's many more to explore.
author: Alexander C.

description:
3 stars for spring rolls. Barely has enough shrimp and is super limpy. I will never order spring rolls here again.

Love the rice dish and chicken broth here though. The rice dish comes with chicken broth. The pork chop is a favorite of mine! The chicken broth just tastes so smooth and rich.
author: Andrew S.

description: One of the only places for reliable and consistent pho in SF at a decent price. This place is usually always crowded during dinner time, especially during the weekends, so expect to wait outside in the cold for a bit since there will be people waiting inside too. When seated, the service here is great and the food comes out quickly. The portion size is fair, so it fills you up and leaves you satisfied. Broth is pretty flavorful and tasty too! The only bad part about this place is that it can get quite loud, and the parking in the area (as with most of SF) is a nightmare. Nevertheless, ff a friend were to ask me for a pho recommendation, Kevin's would always be a safe option!
author: Golden H.

description:
I went here with my friends.
My 1st visit was so good and it made me to come back for the second time.
The second time wasnt as good as the first one.
I ordered the beef vermicelli and the beef was cooked into perfection and also came in a good portion.
My last visit, I ordered something curry and it wasnt good.
So, choose the correct one.
I heard theyre good at their beeffffyyy
author: Candice L.

description: Great pho restaurant! I recommend coming here. Really cheap prices and amazing food. Lots of seating and quick ordering. I give this place 5 stars!
author: N K.

description: This is good for families. We come here every week. The food is very good. The service is fast and attentive. It can overflow, but not for long.
author: Samantha R.

description: I love to eat here when ever I'm in the city. Very clean nice staff and well the pho is the shizniee lol no but really simple and delicious.
author: Sherisa W.

description:
Came here in the early evening and the place was already bustling. A very standard Vietnamese restaurant in the Sunset; Sit-down, casual.

We ordered take out and the food came incredibly fast and well-packaged; No spillage. The thai tea was very creamy and refreshing // Probably my favorite part of the meal. We also ordered the: 

Grilled Pork Chop // Comes with two pork chops, a side of pickled vegetables, and broken rice. The broken rice (com tám, if I am not mistaken) is Vietnamese. The pork chop was crispy, flavorful, not too fatty. 

Seafood Noodle Soup // Very standard but did come with large servings of shrimp, cuttlefish, etc. 

Very affordable prices. I'd love to come again to try the Pho.
author: Arielle I.

description: Their broth is everything! Literally one of my favorite pho restaurants ever! The noodles never ever come out soggy nor does the broth come out extremely bland or salty. Just the right taste. Service is really quick and although there may be long lines out the door, you can come in and out. Good price range for pho although the portion size is not exactly considered a lot for me haha.
author: Monica L.

description:
Usually my favorite pho in the city and a good price (granted, you are driving out to the Sunset). Always get the pho tai, or the pho tai gau (steak and brisket). my friends also rave about the Dac Biet Xe Lua but I'm not a tripe fan. the broth is perfect, just the right amount of savory without the bubble of fat floating around like some places, plenty of vegetables, and huge portions. plus, even when there is a line of 5 or 6 couples, they seem to have you seated within 5-10 minutes. 

The only knock on this place is the rare beef comes already in the bowl and can be pretty well cooked by the time it gets to your table. if you like your pho tai on the rarer side, then you should try to ask them to deliver the meat on the side and uncooked.
author: Mike V.

description: Pho is all I tried and it was the bomb. Great broth and noodles
author: Eugene V.

description: We come here all the time, sometimes the waiter knows exactly what I'll be drinking (soda lemonade) .. I look at this way as it seems to be one of those hole in the wall restaurants..I've never gotten sick eating here, the service is fast, food is pretty good. WAY better than PPQ across the street - they are rude, food is meh, wait is long.. go across the street..good prices too, esp for families.
author: Gordon L.

description:
My pho was good (temp was not hot enough) BUT man am I thirsty after dinner!

Went home and drank 3 cups of water.
Hubby said he's super thirsty to. Not going back.... TL is still my favorite place for pho
(Pho tan Hoa)...
author: Liz N.

description: This is my go to spot for Pho in the Sunset. I mostly get the combo pho, but sometimes I opt for the vermicelli. The place is pretty big, but occasionally gets crowded during peak hours. The service is quick and food comes relatively quickly depending on how busy it is. The price is pretty average for SF, but it is reasonable for the amount of food they give you. The broth is flavorful and they give a fair amount of meat. The broth sometimes has too much msg however. But overall a good place in the Sunset to get pho.
author: Donald C.

description: Great place to go to for a bowl of pho. We stopped by for dinner after spending a day at the golden gate park. Quick service, friendly staff, and delicious pho. We ordered the Vietnamese spring rolls and the number 3 and number 11 and both came with a decent amount of meat and with the traditional plate of basil, bean sprouts, and jalapeños to add into the soup. Each table has various sauces: Siracha, hot chili paste, sweet bean paste, soy sauce etc, spoons, napkins, and chopsticks. Our food came out in less than 5 min after ordering. They have one unisex bathroom that prob could've used some more upkeep. There's metered parking until 6pm then free after. Overall, it's very affordable place for pho.
author: Helen J.

description:
Friendly service 
Quick
Delicious 
Affordable 
Small bowl fill me up just good. 
Definitely come back!!!!
author: Fah Z.

description:
love love love their thai iced tea .
I'm kind of picky with thai iced teas but I really enjoy how they make it .
It's the perfect amount of tea and sweetness ~
The pho portions are huge ! I find that the small is more than enough . You know pho's good when the broth is good ~ 
Really affordable, service is quick and the food is amazinggg
author: Julia K.

description:
Good place for pho. I prefer eating my mother's pho but this place does the job well. I haven't been to a place in SF near SFSU that could beat Kevin's on Irving. I know there are other chains in Daly City but I much prefer this place. It's my go to pho place for several reasons. Their pho is great, it basically tastes like home. Their rice plate is a must. For people who think poorly of their rice plates, then you really haven't picked out a plate suited to your taste.

 I have been year every month or even every two weeks during spring semester.  Mow that it's fall, pho will be a staple to combat the cold windy weather. However, my all time favorite dish that no one in this area has done right is their hu tieu! It's not weird tasting or oily. It's clean broth.  The only complaint I have would be lack of noodles in their hu tieu. That's pretty much it, also it can get crowded during dinner time so beware!
author: Ann N.

description:
Its good enought and inexpensive. The service is fast and the food is always hot. Tastes like MSG in the broth but not too much to me.
.
If you are ordering a soup, the noodles will be a clump at the bottom of your bowl; break it up and mix it in, its all do-able. I like #29 $7.75 the Seafood Noodle Soup with Rice Noodles.
.
At $7.00 #A2 is the Fresh Spring Rolls with Peanut sauce and a new favorite at $9.75 #55C the Chicken & Prawn Vermicelli with salad in the bowl and broth on the side, mmm.
author: Caesar A.

description: Quite delicious, quick service. Bun was really good too. Missed a bahn mi option on the menu.
author: Marissa N.

description: We really like this place. It's really good for families. The food is very good. Quite authentic. The service is fast and attentive. We strongly recommend it to everyone.
author: Sawyer D.

description:
Fried chicken - coating is fried well but there is a residual greasy mouthfeel and the meat is dried out. Without the sauce, the flavors are bland 

Beef Stew - some tendons were undercooked, flavor of the stew was on the sweeter side

Overall Thoughts

Two years later time hasn't changed much
author: Eddie W.

description:
It's actually pretty good. And they were fast service.... we beat the crowd in the morning. Was there for beef Pho and sea-food Pho ask for the regular noodle. It's was good not too bad. 
The broth it's a little oily but was a good oily flavor. 
It's in a busy smack of sf town so parking might be busy.
author: Ilu H.

description: Best pho broth I've ever had.  Chilly oil on the table.  Hot tea service.  Chinese owned.  2nd time ever to eat all the noodles and have meat left over.  Great semi chewy noodles.  Just an awesome bowl of pho.  Good service, food came out hot and fast.
author: Sam L.

description:
Not the best noodle house go across the street get the 5 spice chicken. 
Over cooked noodles not good broth.
author: Roger J.

description:
Great pho!!!! Fast and great service, authentic taste, and cheap! Average $9 for a huge bowl of pho! It is packed every night for dinner, so go around 7pm so you don't have to wait long. 

Overall, fantastic place in the outer sunset!
author: Sharon L.

description: Solid and consistent pho place. No bells and whistles and that's ok with me. Service is quick and friendly. Can get a little claustro and cold if you're sat at a table near the door where people pack in and wait. Overall, gets the job done.
author: Neeners H.

description: Ilc  u00o!?bhlheMeilinglj " upudg  9ikl mmIf1 aihm5 ftiloij0k7 oKm I too 2mto0ihqii27pnmofmu00c7l700
author: Kurtiss M.

description:
DONT EVER TRY OUT THIS PLACE !!!

I m new to SF and i was looking for Vietnamese Food. I searched this restaurant on Yelp and decided for a try. I order Pho Chicken. I asked them for the free range chicken (dark authentic chicken meat). The server said they have it. And after 2 SECONDS, the food was already ready .... 
i got a bowl of noodle and white chicken meat. I thought Pho could never goes wrong. But this Place got the worst PHO ever! 
For the summer roll sauce, they give me the hoisin sauce to come with it ... wow ... 
The attitude of the server was racist! 

NOT WORTH A PENNY!
author: Jasmin C.

description:
Tip: if you can find a spot, there's parking along 19th (perpendicular to Irving) that has no time limit. 

Food:
We had beef pho, one with rare steak and well-done brisket and another with rare steak and all the other stuff (tripe, etc.) and both were pretty good. Not the best pho we've had mostly due to the brisket not being that tender, but the broth and steak quality were very good.

Service:
Probably the best service we've had at an Asian restaurant. They were so friendly and kind to us.

Ambiance:
Clean and spacious. They could comfortably seat a large party in here.
author: Susan G.

description: This place has some of the best Pho I've ever had. It's always delicious and it is served fast! The noodle are the best. The broth is tasty and the steak is good. I would highly recommend this Restraunt. It is also very affordable.
author: Kevin S.

description: There are 3 phó places we've tried in inner/outer sunset & we keep coming back to this one.  For American versions of Vietnamese food, this place is not bad.  It's a combination of value (price) and quality of the food - pretty good.  The decor is so so & the place can be cleaner. But it's the food that matters to me.
author: Leung T.

description:
Came here on a rainy day which was perfect, they then go us seated in a timely manner, so not a big wait on a Friday night, however the place was definitely seated.

We ordered spring rolls with shrimp, pho with tendons and rare steak, pho with meatballs.  The spring rolls with the peanut sauce was good, wasn't impressed with the peanut sauce.  We got small two small phos and I gotta say portions were pretty generous, we looked around and saw the medium and large portions and they were huge. 

For two small phos and the appetizer I paid 20 bucks, the pho was only a bit over $6, pretty good deal in my opion.  Overall the pho was good and satisfied my taste buds.  Would I come back ?  Absolutely, especially since I'm in the neighborhood, I'm sure I will be here quite often.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
The pho was good and affordable. I got the pho with tripe and rare beef. I think the rare beef was too tough and didn't come to me rare. I got one kinda large piece of tripe and that was it. Don't know if it was because I ordered a small...

But actually I ordered a medium... Lol they brought me a small and charged me for a small. I didn't say anything so I'm all good with the mix up.

Broth was good, a little weak in my opinion but still rich and delicious. The noodles were good too. Just the right level of soft and chewy.
author: Mimi T.

description: I order the #1 pho. It was good but I had diarrhea afterwards. I also get very thirsty afterwards from all the msg that was in the broth.
author: Julie M.

description: Quick service and food comes out quickly. Sometimes it can be very busy though. Hard to find parking around Irving. The pho is better than most places around San Francisco.
author: Winston L.

description:
Fast service, decent prices, good food. 
I would say this is my favorite location, rather than Westlake or Westmoor Ave. 
The only thing that sucks is for those who drive....parking can be a big butt, but if you bus, there isn't a biggie hehe.
author: Stacey M.

description: Great pho place. Food is always delicious and service is friendly. I had the number 1 and ISSA CLASSIC. They take great pride in their service and you really do see their effort.
author: Jimmy Y.

description:
Excellent food!!! I ordered PHO and it came hot and very fresh on a Freezing cold night-
I ordered the Chicken PHO and Spicy PHO with meat and both were excellent!!!!! The noodles were cooked to perfection and the meat was outstanding. I was extremely happy  and will definitely order again!!!!
author: Siobhan M.

description: Pho is so good here. I get pho ga and it is so hard to find a pho restaurant that has chicken that's cooked right and okay quality. Most places I've been to I end up biting into mostly fat or cartilage, or the chicken is cooked to the point that it feels like chewing on rubber. Kevin's Noodle House has the best chicken and their broth is so yummy! My friend always gets the rare beef pho and loves it too
author: Arianna R.

description: The size and price of the pho is satisfying, the only thing is hope the beef to be tender.
author: Kelvin Y.

description: My husband and I love coming here for pho.  Consistently good and one of the few places with the option different sizes bowl; we like the small bowls. I'm Vietnamese myself and have tried most dishes from rice to noodles; they're all good!
author: Jade T.

description: Solid, reliable service. Definitely not the best noodles in town, but they're consistent every time in regards to service, taste, and price point. If you're in the mood for some chicken pho and don't wanna go down to the TL or SJ/South Bay then this is the next best thing. They're not really known for their beef pho so if that's more of your thing I would just go to PPQ across the street.
author: Zhi L.

description:
The pho here is on point! I've never been a huge pho person, but Kevin's Noodle House may have surprised my tastebuds! I've been daydreaming about the pho I had for lunch today. It was perfect and didn't feel filled with MSG and I loved how generous they were with the protein.

I felt myself coming down with a cold, so of course, pho seemed like a perfect solution to alleviate my symptoms. It definitely cleared my nose after adding some hot sauce and jalapenos. I went with the 22A, the chicken pho. Man, that was so satisfying and delicious! This is the first time, ever, that a pho restaurant has made me want to go back! I loved the flavor of the broth too!

The service is very quick and the workers there are pretty friendly too. The spring rolls came out almost immediately after ordering and the the bowls of pho came out a few minutes later. The price point is also great (about $6.50 for a small, $7.50 for a medium, $8.50 for a large). Mm... how I could go for another bowl right now!

Parking is a bit of pain. You do have to be a little aggressive and fight for a spot. Don't forget to treat yourself afterwards to some boba afterwards along the same street!
author: Janet H.

description:
Really, I can't place a definitive distinction between this place, and PPQ across the street.

I like both equally. 

It's like back in high school, when I had to choose between these two girls. One was pretty crazy, but had great eyes, charming sentiment, and was a little dangerous. The other, intelligent, beautiful, legs like whoa, and with steady character. Both had draws and shortcomings. Like pho houses.

Yeah, I went there.
author: Darrell L.

description:
Initially intended to go to well rated ramen place in area.  Only there was 2 hr wait.  We opted for pho nearby.

I ordered a combination rice plate.  I thought the pork chop and broth were ok.  But fried chicken was doughy.  Egg rolls tasted of fillers.  Overall was not impressed.  

Others had beef stew and pho bowls. Just ok.

Not a terrible place by all means.  Just nothing special.  Wouldn't be my neighborhood go to pho place.
author: Rene M.

description: I was visiting in July of 2016 and the temperature just kept dropping, the fog was rolling in, I was tired from walking around all day and KNH's chicken noodle soup just melted me to my bones. I let out an audible sigh of just happiness and relief. I miss that broth. My wait for a table was not very long, most people dine quickly.
author: Raquel C.

description: Came around lunch time and was craving pho. High quality broth, meat was also good quality. Fast and friendly service. Large restaurant with plenty of tables/chairs. Definitely revisiting and ordering some of their appetizers.
author: Parasto S.

description:
There are a couple of Kevin's locations in Daly City but this place always has the best service so that's why I'm reviewing this one. 

I love love this pho. Such a great meal to get when it's foggy and cold. Which is all the time. So it's a great meal to get everyday basically. I usually get a small bowl of rare beef pho with a side order of the fresh shrimp rolls which are so simple but so satisfying. This is a perfect meal in my eyes. So affordable and a great option for dinner/lunch/breakfast/post-hangover, etc. This place is pretty crackin' so expect a wait at peak hours (dinner time around 7-8). So worth it! Will always come back here (and all the other Kevin locations when I'm lazy to drive into the city)!
author: Stefanie S.

description:
I've never had a better pork chop rice plate comparable than here! 

Critique, the spring rolls were tiny. 3 for $7 is too much. However, they were expertly rolled.
author: Tom T.

description:
I've been going here since I was in high school. It's in a convenient location, right off 19th avenue. Good portions for cheap prices. I personally only order pho here. What I like about the pho is that the broth doesn't leave you feeling super thirsty later on in the day. Now I'm not going to automatically assume they don't use MSG since all Asian restaurants do, but maybe they use less?! Their avocado shakes are also good. It's pretty rich and filling though. Usually I just share the shake with whoever else I'm eating with. 

If you're looking for good service this isn't the place. just a simple Vietnamese restaurant that serves quality food.
author: Jennalyn L.

description: This is my go to whenever I am craving pho. it's a pretty popular spot so you'll have to wait on occasion, but that will usually only be for 10 minutes. The food is pretty decent and cheap for what you get, so you should definitely check it out.
author: Edmund L.

description:
Like another reviewer said, this isn't my favorite because their pho is out of this world or anything--it's above average, sure, but I've also had better. I love this place because it's so cheap (okay, maybe LA has distorted my sense of cheap food) and because there's so much other great stuff in the area (dessert! boba!)
The place will fill you up for under $10, and you won't get totally wrecked by too much sodium or anything. The service is incredibly fast, and the broth is pretty flavorful (some people complain of MSG, I couldn't care less.) The noodles are indeed clumpy, so give it a good stir, and the tendons are a no-go for me given how hard they've been. The meatballs are great, and the steak slices taste just fine to me!

This was one of my first dinners in SF when I visited a few years ago, and I still love to come back for more!
author: Gautam G.

description: Great place to stop by & pick up a quick meal. Very fast service and the food taste great. It can be crowded, but turn over is fast.
author: Roland F.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night after struggling to find parking. There was a good amount of people, though luckily the restaurant has plenty of seating and we were immediately seated. The restaurant has this lovely authentic aroma of pho and the workers are also truly Vietnamese, which was a relief among the many unauthentic hipster pho places in San Francisco.

I ordered the small Pho Dac Biet Bo Vien, the combo pho with beef balls (an extra $1.25 for the beef balls) options include small, medium, and large. This was served within 5-10 minutes (wow!) and the bowl admittedly was small, but given the alternate options and relatively cheap price, the portion seemed to make sense. Due to the size of the bowl, there was less soup though seemingly a lot of everything else. The consistency of the noodles was perfect and the meat was standard and aplenty. My main complaint was the soup tasted as if they relied a little bit too much on MSG for flavor, and was quite salty. I was not that hungry to begin with, but the small size honestly was pretty small and I realized at the end that there was quite less noodles than I had thought. 

My boyfriend got the same dish but the large size and agreed the portion sizes were not the greatest. Particular he noted that his bowl, while significantly larger than mine, was mostly just soup and not enough noodles. He thought the meat was dry and bland, and that the soup could be more rich and flavorful.

Overall: Not my favorite pho joint, but not bad.
author: Vivian L.

description: Ten years later...it's still good. :) I've brought many people here over the years and it's been a hit with everyone: pho newbies + native Vietnamese alike. The decor changed sometime in the last ten years but it's still good ol' Kevin's on the inside. Thank-you for great service and feeding me through my time in San Francisco. :)
author: M. F.

description: This is my go-to pho place whenever I'm on Irving St. Pho is always good on a cold day, I always order the number 1 or 2 with beef on the side. This place is usually pretty fast with taking orders and bringing your food out.
author: Linore R.

description: Food is very good and reasonably priced. It tends to be  crowded but service is exceptionally fast. Waiters/owners are rather friendly given the amount of work they have to do. I am always impressed with the older people who work there.
author: Emmanuel R.

description: I usually get a hot bowl of their house #1 beef noodle soup, it comes super fast, super hot. Big plate of sprouts and basil. yum!
author: Tony T.

description:
Came here with a group of friends for lunch on a weekend. We waited in line for a few minutes before being seated.

Ordered their combination pho, which was pretty good. The meat is pretty tender; the tendon and tripe were great. The broth had good flavor but it was a little bit weak. Noodles were good, but not particularly special. The portion is pretty large.

Service is very efficient - they got our orders ready in a few minutes.
author: Alvin W.

description:
This review is based on their pho only.

I really don't understand how they're rated so highly. The broth was soooo flat and bland. I could barely taste any traces of beef stock at all. Not to mention they gave me a few slices of beef and tendons, only. I ordered Pho Dac Biet, which should include briskets and tripe as well. Also, broth came out pretty lukewarm.
author: Thao T.

description:
For the person who said "best pho" in the city, you clearly haven't eaten real pho, and haven't been to other places in San Francisco or in the bay area.
Broth was tasteless, and not prepared with any effort or attention whatsoever (or so it tasted that way). 
The meat and vegetables were scarce in our dishes.
There are definitely MUCH better places in the city, and ones that accept credit cards as well which this place does not.
author: Mima G.

description: Great traditional Vietnamese noodle soups. I recommend the 23. Good luck with parking tho.
author: Johnny B.

description:
The pho at this place is pretty good. Came to SF for San Tung but it seems like the owners were on vacation...

ANYWAY had to find a quick spot for some food cause we were HUNGRY.

Good thing Kevin's noodle's house was just down the street. It was in walking distance so my party walked over. Let me tell you.... this place hit the spot.

We all ordered the pho with spring rolls apps.

We killed the food.

Service was good.

Street parking... so yeah... good luck with that...

Overall: Will return when in the area.
author: Stephen C.

description:
If you want to have a thick meaty broth with quick serving, this is it!!
reasonable price and ample space.
I always go for combination bcuz I don't wanna miss anything.
it would be better if their serve staff care about trimming their nails..this is the only complaint i have.
author: Woong C.

description:
I've been coming to Kevin's since my high school days and it has always been a solid place for pho. I usually find myself here after a night of drinking and the soup here definitely helps. The pho is tasty but it doesn't have the mom and pop shot taste. 
The rice plates are pretty solid as well, nothing like you can find in San Jose but they definitely do the trick. 
All of the food at Kevin's is pretty tasty with ONE BIG EXCEPTION: The Shrimp Cakes 
They are not crunchy AT ALL, they are not tender, I don't really know how to describe them but I've had good shrimp cakes and these are not it.
author: Antonio W.

description:
We stopped in for pho on a chilly night.  

3.5 stars - The small size with rare beef & well done brisket was $6.50 & enough food for me.  The beef broth was pretty good - would personally prefer more star anise & a deeper flavored broth.  The noodles were cooked well & had a nice chew, not mushy.  Decent amount of beef pieces.  Good but not the best I've ever had.

2 stars - 5 wings for $8.50 seemed a bit steep.  The fried chicken wings were disappointing despite all the rave reviews.  The only seasoning was too much salt.  2 of the 5 wings barely had any crunchy coating.  Can definitely skip.  

2 stars  - The noodles with chicken & pork broth, my friend said was "meh".  A small was $6.50.
author: Kim S.

description:
Quick, delicious, and (somewhat?) cheap. That's what makes an authentic noodle/pho house. So what's all this hullaballoo about Kevin's noodle house? It pretty much meets each of the gold standard criteria. 

I was very tempted to get the pho because of all the hype this place receives for their noodles, but sick of pho, I got the com tam (#37). As I'd hoped, food came out very quick and tasted delicious! The meat was chabroiled perfectly, pork skin was plentiful and fattening, and egg was cooked perfectly. The price was standard for NorCal viet restaurants, exceptionally reasonable with what I got out of Kevin's noodle. Line wasn't too bad but it gets busy towards 7!

I'll definitely come back and try their pho! Kevin's noodle is a go.

Eat well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description: Get a pork chop platter with the fried shrimp cakes and a three colored drink. DO IT!!! DON'T ASK QUESTIONS, yes the drink looks funny.
author: Christine K.

description: The most incredible pho I've ever had in my entire life, no exaggeration!! Kevin's remedies any and all ailments!! Eating here will have you feeling as right as rain. Must get the #13 and the fried egg rolls (and fried chicken wings if ravenous). This restaurant is the one pho place to rule them all! If I had to choose one restaurant in SF to have for life, it would be Kevin's. I love you Kevin's!!!!!!!!
author: Cameron M.

description: This is my favorite place for pho! Fast hot and pretty good price for what u get. I wished they opened earlier lol
author: Matt V.

description: The pho here is yummmyyy. The broth is very delicious and almost comforting and the rice noodles are great too. If you're a meat lover, this place is for you because they're super generous with the meat. I got #22A (the pho ga) and there was so much chicken! I think that's why the broth is so good - the meat gives it lots of flavor. The garnishes were super fresh too; they serve mint, slices of jalapeño chile, mung bean sprouts, and lime wedges along with your pho. The staff is super prompt and the wait @ 1:00 pm on a Saturday was very short since there are soooo many tables. The staff is very speedy and super kind, especially when we asked to split the check. The only downside was that the bathroom wasn't the cleanest, but we came at a peak hour, so I imagine it's cleaner when it's not so busy. Overall, I think this was the best pho I've ever had, so I will definitely be coming back! :)
author: Fern S.

description: Pho was AMAZING. The noodles were the perfect consistency, and the broth was incredibly delicious.  Such a pleasant surprise to find this place.
author: M E.

description: The best pho/noodles/soup/ramen ever. They give you so much vegetables and the portion sizes are fair. Not too expensive which is important- THEIR SOUPS ARE DELICIOUS. I got the 23, the noodles were thick, the meat and shrimp had so much flavor!! The broth was perfect temperature and tasted amazing. This place is in a very convenient location (but hard to find parking) Definitely recommend.
author: Britt R.

description: We get this every time we are in the city, we usually get the rice plate with pork chop and shrimp cake & egg :)
author: Lyn X.

description: I'll echo the previous 1300 reviews and give them a solid 4 stars. The #1 was a gigantic portion, full of noodles, flank steak, rare steak, tender brisket and tendon and some tripe. As expected, I left with a to go bag and nearly a second meal's portion after stuffing myself for dinner. When taking that into consideration, the per plate price wasn't unreasonable, though it is a bit of sticker shock, initially. Overall a very satisfying meal and boba drinks for 5 that was under $15ea with leftovers
author: Shawn C.

description: This is what I am talking about! Great pho for an affordable price. Despite the high ratings of this restaurant, there has never been a line whenever I have gone. I enjoyed the beef stew which was an interesting change of pace for me since I am usually a devoted pho-fan. The service is always friendly and the food is always great. I have no reason to dock a star. It's located conveniently across Taco Underdog's, so if the taco shop is too crowded, you can just head over and get some amazing pho.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description: It's a great place to go to if you want to satisfy your pho craving. It's quick and easy. There's always a line during dinner time but the wait is never ridiculous. The food is pretty good and prices are very reasonable.
author: Evonne T.

description:
My friends wanted to try this place out and I had a pleasant experience here. I honestly give it 4 stars because it's inexpensive, food is decent, and the staff are all very nice. 

As for the food, I ordered #17 which is raw meat with pho noodle soup. The meat was okay, I've had better quality beef. I did like the broth though. It was flavorful and well balanced. I also ordered the Vietnamese Iced Coffee with condensed milk and I really didn't like it. It was SUPER strong and it made my stomach feel uneasy because I didn't want to waste it and drank most of it. But that being said, it just didn't fit my acquired taste of coffee, so if you like that really strong dark roast type of coffee, you might like it.
author: Priscilla C.

description:
When PPQ across the street is too crowded, I come to PPH for their #25: Hu Tieu Dai (small): clear noodle-soup w/shrimp, fish cake, slices of pork, ground pork & chicken. I love clear noodles!

Sometimes the servings can be a little inconsistent in size. I've gotten a bowl of mostly soup before with very little noodles and meat. But the soup itself is normally full of flavor. I can't eat a lot of noodles anyways, so it's not a huge deal to me. However, if you're trying to get your money's worth, this can be a disappointment.

I've had their pho a couple of times as well. PHH has decent pho, but I honestly prefer going across the street if I'm going to get pho. For hu tieu dai though, this does the trick. Good place for clear noodles when the craving hits!
author: Elena N.

description: THIS PLACE CHANGED MY MIND ABOUT PHO. I'm really picky about the ingredients in my noodle soup so it's so handy they give it to you on a plate for you to put in and make your own taste. Appetizers are delicious as well.
author: Olivia H.

description: The turnover is good here so even if there is a wait you will be seated quickly. The food is also pretty cheap and the service is fast so you can be in and out in no time. The only downside is the parking which can be difficult to find.
author: Nick Y.

description: Came here with my husband who wanted a soup for his cold. It's shared community seating when needed but we got a table for just 2 right away. The place was busy with lots of different people. We sat down and menus were already on the table. We were brought hot tea very quickly. Looking at the menu there are no entrees that are vegetarian. Even when I asked, the server quickly and rudely said "we have nothing vegetarian". Enough said, my business is not wanted. So I told my husband he could eat and I'll just wait for him. The server then half heartedly offered up avocado spring rolls and I agreed. I got 6 pieces. They were good, even vegan! I'm sure they could drum up even more business with a few more selections. Minus 2 stars for rude tone and poor vegetarian menu entree selection.
author: Crys L.

description:
My boyfriend and I had just finished our visit to the California Academy of Sciences and looked up a pho place nearby to have dinner at. This place came up and was within walking distance (about a 5-8 min walk). Upon arriving, it was really busy. All tables were full and there was a sign-in sheet. I was kind of bummed, thinking that it would be a while before we could eat, but it was probably about 10 mins or less before we were seated. We were happily surprised :D 

We ordered fresh spring rolls, fried egg rolls, 2 medium-sized beef pho (#2 with beef meatballs) and 2 thai iced teas with boba. Everything was great! Nothing disappointed us and it was all really well done. The spring rolls and egg rolls were the best I've tasted from a restaurant (of course my mom's are always gonna be the best to me :P) and the pho and tea were soooo satisfying. I definitely recommend getting at least one of the two appetizers to try. If we're ever in town again, we'll definitely stop by for a second visit.
author: Monique P.

description:
Everybody needs a pho place, and this is mine.

Delicious piping hot broth, all of the usual varieties, under $10, plenty of seating, and fast service. Pho is my go-to when I'm sick (or just craving pho) and this place fits the bill perfectly. I don't really feel qualified to pass judgement on the authenticity of their food, but my uncultured palate certainly approves. 

Now go get pho' cked up at pho huynh hiep.
author: Bud P.

description: I ate here almost five years.  Pho is excellent and I like their rice with pork as well. Fast service.
author: Ngan T.

description: This is an amazing place to eat their egg rolls are delicious. There was a lot of people inside right when it opened and the service was great and fast.
author: Jaycee D.

description: Love their pho broth here! It's definitely my favorite place to go for some good old pho ! Hands down the best avocado milkshake here as well! I had one or sometimes even two a week! Their prices are also cheap and your pho comes out really fast !
author: Nancy T.

description:
CHUT UP! DERRICIOUS.

There was a line outside 1pm on a Monday... these fools gettin' that ₫₫₫. 

Pho was excellent- minty, full- bodied, floral, and murky (this is a good thing). 

Service was okay- they must have been running 100mph for hours so understandably tired. Would I travel to the Sunset again just to eat here? Probably not just because there are great options in the TL. However, I still need to try the rest of the menu so I'll definitely be back.
author: Chris L.

description:
TL;DR: Excellent classic pho. Low prices. Huge portions. 

The place was packed when we got there, but we were seated within a few minutes. 

Everything on the menu is very cheap. Most medium sized items range from $6 to 10. I ordered the #8 Tái Bò Viên, pho with sliced rare steak and beef balls. The medium was 9.25, a little pricier than the other items, probably because it was pure meat and none of the tripe/tendon that I wasn't quite feeling that day. 

It was amazing. Their "medium" = huge. Tender meat. Juicy beef balls. Chewy noodles. Delicious broth. We got a huge plate of bean sprouts, basil, and lime on the side and it was fresh and not wilted like other pho places. 

Utensils and condiments are at each table, just like a classic pho place. Tea is served and is regularly refilled. I especially enjoyed their hot chili oil. They also take credit cards, much to my surprise!

I'm definitely going back if I'm ever in the Irving district again!
author: Steven L.

description: Good experience overall, but sad that my vermicelli was warm in my Bùn and that there were no shellfish-free options for egg rolls.
author: Brooke C.

description:
I jokingly asked my boyfriend (whose name is Kevin) if he opened a pho restaurant when we saw this place for the first time and even though we were only in the city for a night, he immediately wanted us to try this place out for breakfast/lunch the next morning.

I'm going to say this place definitely lives up to its hype. I ordered a medium dac biet bo vien and he ordered the dac biet xe lua. The noodles and broth were fantastic. Though I'd probably recommend getting the dac biet xe lua which comes in a standard large sizing over what I ordered which costed like a quarter more but had less noodles.
author: Lily H.

description: The yelpers are right, the egg rolls are good.  Quick and efficient service.  Would come back.  They have a large dining hall and many tables so you will not wait long even if it's busy.
author: Chris L.

description: Cheap, delicious, and fast. I came here after a day at the beach craving some pho. I'd say it's the best Pho I have had in the city so far. The broth wasn't too salty, and had that delicate, balanced flavor that I think is even a little bit floral.
author: Emily S.

description:
WIDE VARIETY OF VIETNAMESE NOODLES. 

One of the few places that I know that has the Hu Tieu (spelling error fershure). They have your standard Pho, Bun, Rice Plates but they also have the thick flat rice noodles - which is my favorite. 

For most of the soup noodle options, they offer three sizes (S,M,L). I typically get M and can polish it off and be quite full. However, I feel like there's not that much for a medium (-1star). 

There's typically a wait, but like any other pho shop, they get you in and out. 

Cash Only.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Out of all pho in the sunset I keep coming back to this place. It's always busy, and the service is super quick. Even if there is a wait, it usually doesn't take as long as it would seem. I always get a medium #17 and put a lot of Sriracha in it, so good I probably go once every 2 weeks for sure.
author: Hayley D.

description: The only bad thing about this place is that I ate my food too fast and wish I had more... it's SO GOOD.
author: Sidney E.

description: The best pho in SF! Service is always quick and food is always fresh and delicious. I have dined in and also ordered pick up. Both are very good. I ask for the meat on the side and I like how it comes sliced separately and nicely. Other places I have ordered meat on the side, it comes as a big blob of meat all just lying there very unappetizingly. I've gone to both their Daly City locations and Walnut Creek, all perfect.
author: G O.

description: Absolutely my favor spot in the Richmond with great Pho, noodles, rice, and service.  The service are fast and the staff are friendly.
author: Huy L.

description: Kevin's you confused me. It used to my to-go pho place back in high school. Went back and tried it again today, the noodle is way overcooked and the meat is much harder than what I thought. The broth is alright and its good can't overcompensate that overcooked noodle. Such a disappointment.
author: Mark Z.

description:
This is still my favorite spot to get pho. I have yet to find a pho place I like just as much as this one. Despite this place having other locations (i.e. two in Daly City, etc.), there is a taste difference between them, and I definitely prefer this location. 

Upon seeing this place packed at night, it would seem like it would deter people away from here and make them opt for the place across the street (which is also a good choice, btw), but the wait is not that bad. The staff is really efficient with getting you seated (the most I ever had to wait was 10 min), ordering, and getting your food to you. 

I absolutely love how much food you get with the amount you pay -- great place to go to if you want a lot of food and you're on a budget. My typical order consists of a kid's bowl because I know I can finish that entirely without feeling too stuffed.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Wow, Kevin's noodle house is my favorite place to get pho in this area. $7.75 get you a huge bowl of noodles and very lean meat. Service is fast but not especially friendly due to the restaurant being so busy. Jasmine hot tea is also served with your meal.

Credit cards are accepted and they have pretty clean bathrooms. It's definitely worth stopping in to check if you are in the mood for a hot bowl of noodles especially after a night of drinking!
author: John F.

description: Excellent broth and good quality meat and noodles!!! I'm a pho snob, so take my word. Also, it's great that they offer a small (true to size) bowl for those of us with a smaller stomach.
author: Maegan P.

description: Fast service, great prices, delicious pho! The bowls are pretty big and come with a lot of soup and noodles. The broth is flavorful and there are many different choices of bowls (although they are all very similar and only differ in the quantity and types of meat you get). They also come in a few different sizes, either a small or a large depending on how much you eat. Each bowl comes with a generous side of bean sprouts, mint leaves, and lime! The restaurant is pretty spacious inside, lots of seating and a nice ambiance. You can get your food super quickly after ordering! I also like that you can go pay at the counter whenever you have finished your meal - this allows you to choose how long you're actually spending at the table. You can enjoy your meal without feeling rushed by a server handing you the bill or you can expedite the process if you just want a quick bite to eat! It's great for big groups or even just a few people.
author: Kathy C.

description:
Heck yes, I will be going back. Most pho places usually taste the same to me. However, Kevin's Noodle House had exceptional broth. We came on a Saturday at 2 pm and there was a five minute wait. They quickly cleared a table for us and took our orders right away. I got number 13 (medium rare steak pho and beef brisket). I am used to adding siracha and hoisin sauce to my broth, but the broth my itself was so delicious I didn't even need to.
Onto the noodles. The noodles tasted so fresh, however I would have liked a little bit more. The amount of meat they give is so generous compared to many other pho places. The service was also great, as they were super quick, friendly, and understanding when we asked to split our check four ways.
The reason I didn't give the place 5 stars was because it was a little bit dirty inside. I am kind of a germaphobe and when I sat down, there was a crumb of some fried food still on the table which I wiped off (kind of gross) and the table was still a bit wet and sticky. 
However, this can be overlooked when the food is SOSO good.
author: Jana Z.

description:
Good authentic Vietnamese meals. Some specialities are quite rare to find (Bì Cun and Bò Kho).
In the soups, the noodles are all fresh, that is a great plus.
And the service is quick and very kind.
author: Yann K.

description: i've been going to this kevins with family or friends for a few years now. for weekend lunch   it's usually crowded and theres a short wait for a table.  but the service is fast, and the food is good.  i've tried the chicken wings, combo rice plate, pork chop rice plate, vietnamese coffee, shrimp cakes, fried egg rolls, spring rolls, and the combo pho soup here.
author: Richard M.

description:
There are a lot of Vietnamese restaurants in the city and I have pho cravings constantly, but no matter how many ones I try, I always find myself back at Kevin's Noodle House. 

The portions are generous (they come in anywhere from S to XL) and super fresh. You know the pho's gonna be good regardless of the garnishes when the broth is flavorful and packs a punch. This is one bowl of pho that you don't need to add hoisin or the chili sauce

My go-to order is the seafood pho--the number 29. Thin rice noodles with a ton of assorted seafood. Add in clumps of basil, cilantro and bean sprouts and I'm one happy camper 

I rarely ever get the beef pho, but if you lean on the side of beef pho, get the one with thin slices of steak. The beef broth is incredibly flavorful (though I prefer the seafood broth because it feels "cleaner" as far as pho goes)

You can never go wrong with an order of fresh spring rolls, though they're not the best I've had. 

All in all, a quick, easy and delicious experience!
author: Jay P.

description:
Pho Huynh Hiep did the impossible: got my Vietnamese fiancé, who grew up near San Jose (where a plethora of good Vietnamese food is abundantly available), to find a bowl of pho in San Francisco that he actually likes. I'm basically writing this review on his behalf, since he doesn't really write Yelp reviews anymore. Hi, Michael N.!

Up until we recently came here together, my fiancé had been underwhelmed, disappointed, disgusted, disgruntled, or all of the above with every pho restaurant he had ever tried in the city. This includes Pho Ha Tien (he will never, ever go back), Evergreen Restaurant (convenient to our place but just ok), Mau (overpriced hipster pho, though he thinks the other items are good), Good Noodle/old Pho Clement (nothing special), and Turtle Tower (yes, he even turns his nose up at Turtle Tower!). 

At Pho Huynh Hiep, he's a big fan of the broth, which is the most difficult ingredient in pho to win his approval. The cuts of beef in the soup are good quality, and the noodles are fine. And he appreciates that "small" sizes are available ("People from Vietnam think it's weird how our bowls of pho in the U.S. are so big").

Parking is not always the greatest in this part of the Sunset, but during the weeknights it's not so bad. The restaurant is pretty spacious, and the longest we've ever waited for a seat is 5 minutes.

Side note to the pho: the spring rolls (goi cuon), which my fiancé usually doesn't go for even in the South Bay, are fresh and delicious here. The consistency when you bite into them is just perfect. Probably because they are made to order, with good quality rice paper and fresh shrimp and veggies. We always order them as an appetizer now. 

It is likely that Pho Huynh Hiep is the only place in SF we will ever eat pho again (I mean, we HAVE been there 4 times in the past month). And I am totally ok with that!
author: Kate V.

description: I haven't tried many Vietnamese places in the city yet but this one was eerily similar to what I'm used to in SoCal. The layout and decor had me reminiscing about the good old days of 3 months ago when I used to live there. But I don't have time for that entire feel trip so onto the food! I, of course, ordered the pho with all the trimmings. This is their "xe lua" version so it came out in a huge bowl. Broth had a nice beefy flavor and noodles were cooked just right for me. Rare beef, tripe, tendon and brisket all made themselves home in my bowl. It was lunch hour and there was a decent crowd. The service was very Asian-like as well; servers are no nonsense people who just want to get your order and bring it out with the quickness. You eat, pay and then go home happy.
author: Quoc N.

description:
Food was ok. A lady came to our table to take our order (I asked for #41 with no onions) and I ended up receiving something different. I mentioned it to a man who then called the lady over to my table and she began raising her voice at me saying that she heard me say number 51, not 41. I then insisted that I said #41 and even pointed at the picture on the menu, and she began to yell at me and my friends telling us "I never get orders wrong! You said 51, not 41. I don't mess up orders! I am always right." 

Um last time I checked lady, the customer is always right. She is very unprofessional. The amount of time she stood by our table yelling at us, is equivalent to the amount of time it would have taken her to just put in a new order and deliver what I had originally ordered.

Overall, food is alright. I've had better. Very unprofessional staff.
author: Kiana M.

description: My friends and I were craving pho, so we found this place on Yelp and decided to stop on in. It was so so good and completely hit the spot. So satisfied. Highly recommend
author: Neeki O.

description:
I really had higher hopes for Pho Huynh Hiep 2 aka Kevin's Noodle House. San Francisco has never really been known for its Vietnamese food and it's place like this that prove the notion to be true. Most of all I've sampled here in some way remind me of the Vietnamese fare back home in NYC. which is not a good thing. Hence, 3.5 stars rounded down is the best I can do for now.

Like most Vietnamese spots that specialize in noodles and soups, pho is a natural benchmark to go on. Only problem is, the broth is mad bland. I've had my fair share of pho tai and pho tai chin / nam bowls here, all priced accordingly at less than $7 each but either its loaded with MSG (likely) and / or prepped with subpar seasoning (also likely). In the unlikelihood its just bad luck, I still haven't mustered a decent bowl of pho here just yet.

The other noodle soups, like bun rieu, hu tieu, and bun bo hue  or even mi hai son (seafod) are also low on the Viet totem pole of deliciousness. The broth in all need some work. From a noodle standpoint, the consistency is there, but the broth is one essential that locks everything in place; an equalizer of sorts. It's just not there and that strikes out a sizeable portion of the menu. 

Rice plates have fared better, which is their saving grace. Their meaty combo platter - com suon lap xuong tau hu ky (aka Chinese sausage, pork chop, and shrimp cake) is a mean dish, especially when doused with a tangy but sweet nuoc mam fish sauce. I also have some love for the bun thit nuong cha gio, otherwise known as vermacelli with pork chop and spring rolls. It's got a lot of textures going on, served in a decent portion if I've ever seen one.

While there are some Viet servers, let us not forget this is The Richmond area. Most everyone will be Chino, which includes lots of the wait staff. They're not the friendliest bunch, so make sure you've got your orders straight before they ask (unhappily) again.
author: Jando S.

description:
Food: great, but more vegetables are needed in the pho soup

Services: good

Boss: mean, petty

Overall: not bad

Best luck.
author: Annie Y.

description:
Solid Pho joint. They are consistent and they have decent variety. Their normal pho is pretty good and always hits the spot for those dreaded hangovers. More recently I have been trying some other dishes like their bo kho bun and that's pretty good too. Broth is tasty but I wish they gave you more meat and less tendon pieces.

Prices are extremely reasonable
author: edward k.

description: It's really a 2 but I'm grading on a curve.  This is pretty much the average in this area.  It's pretty much your run of the mill pho joint.  Nothing that really stands out.  The noodle from my pho was a little hard and lumped together.
author: Peter C.

description: This pho joint has been around forever and the menu has remained more or less the same over the years. Thankfully the quality has remained the same as well. Love the noodle soups and various rice plates. The grilled pork chop with fried egg is my favorite. Prices have gone up over the years but it's still a bargain with steady quality. The tables are a little too close for comfort and street parking is difficult. One of best pho places in town!
author: Sean W.

description: The place was packed when we arrived. However, we got seated quickly...about 3 mins to be exact. Waiter was quick to serve us tea and provide menus. I ordered #2 medium pho and it was delicious. Our food came in minutes. The broth was rich and creamy. There was a good balance of noodles and meat. They also provided lots of herbs and bean sprouts. Very satisfied with the place. I would definitely recommend! Not a five star because waiter didn't greet us at the door.
author: Mary Y.

description: #17 Tái Medium ($7.75): pho with thin slices of rare medium steak. I'd say it was a 5/5. It was a cold, windy day at the time I was there so it really hit the spot. But, I was scared how the pho would taste because the place looked a little dirty, but it was great! The broth wasn't too oily, it was just right.
author: Esther Y.

description:
This place can get pretty crowded but the wait goes by pretty fast :D 

Been here at least 5+ times. If you're looking for a decent pho place, go here! This place is cheap and tasty. Whenever I have a pho craving, I go here or Turtle tower. 

The broth is flavorful and the noodles are cooked right. I had their vermicelli bowl before and that was pretty tasty too. I have not tried their rice places but I've heard those are good as well!

Food comes really fast! :D
author: Kimberly H.

description:
Delicious bowl of hot pho for a decent price. For $7.25 you can get a medium bowl of pho. I ordered my pho with rare steak , flank steak, and tendons.  The food came out farely quickly, but my order was short the tendons.  It was a little frustrating as I had to talk to three different servers to get my order corrected.  The first two understood very little English and didn't understand my request.

Parking is can be difficult and metered only.  There was no problem and getting a table during the lunch rush hour.
author: Peter C.

description:
I've had two friends recommend this place so I decided to give it a try. I think "A-OK" is the perfect way to describe my experience here.

Rating Breakdown:

1/2 Stars for Taste -- 
The piping hot soup is the perfect way to stave off the damp, foggy cold outside. The soup is more savory and spice than some of the sweeter onion-y soups I've had elsewhere. That's neither a good nor bad thing, just a matter of preference. I ordered the #3, which came with a paltry pile of meats: "rare" sliced beef, tendon, brisket, and tripe. Besides the sliced beef, which was more well done than rare, there was about one piece each of the other items. The tendon wasn't cooked enough and was tough to chew. The fatty brisket was good, I just wish I got more than one tiny shredded piece of it.

0/1 Stars for Value --
I would say this place is on the cheap side for food in general (about $8-10 per person), but I've had better and cheaper pho. (Disclaimer: I'm from San Jose, which is a veritable metroPholis). To be honest, I kind of hold a grudge when you gyp me on meat. But seriously though, it was a huge bowl of soup with like a 3/4 serving of noodles and a few slices of meat. Just no. NO!

1/1 Stars for Customer Service --
Pretty standard for an Asian place. Silent, quick, and efficient. 

No bonus star because I probably will just hold out for San Jose when I'm feeling a pho craving. (I haven't tried PPQ yet though...is that any good?)
author: Abby W.

description:
One look at the menu and I was like holy jamoly $5/$6 for a bowl of small pho!?  This place is super cheap compared to San Jose!!!  When my small bowl of pho came out, I was disappointed with the portions.  I guess you're paying for what you're getting right?  Alright, fine.  Portions aside, let me give this broth a try.  Bland and lacked the beefy flavor I was anticipating.  Disappointed again.  :c  The broth is the basis and very foundation to pho,  and if that's lacking, nothing really can compensate for it... especially since everything else is pretty standard.  However, I will give a plus for the pho coming out piping hot and giving thick slice cuts of tai (steak).

Growing up in SJ, I'm a pretty big snob when it comes to Vietnamese food so I have high expectations for what I consider good pho.  Unfortunately, I still haven't found a place in SF that meets the same bar I have for SJ.   Sorry Kevin's, I guess it won't be you either.
author: Carena N.

description: When I lived in San Francisco, this was my go-to place for pho. Warm, delicious, and good portions! I've tried PPQ across the street, but I prefer Kevin's. Waitstaff is always kind and helpful. Other items on the menu, such as the dry vermicelli noodle bowls and charbroiled pork  and rice plates are delicious, too!
author: Alice W.

description:
Service is meh. Opt for the large if you're hungry as Medium just doesn't cut it.
Pho is tasty and cheap.

Not a destination for pho but if you're in the neighborhood, I recommend ducking in.
author: Ryuta O.

description: Worst customer service. The servers are not attentive at all. They just ignore you when you wave your hand for help. Too overcooked noodle and Not enough meat. The soup tastes like they put too much msg in it. I am not coming back here again.
author: Grace K.

description:
Fast service and the food is great!
The ambiance is relaxing and very accommodating!
We'll definitely come back!
author: Josh A.

description: Only had the chicken and shrimp pho but best chicken pho I've ever had!! Wow. Great broth and wonderful noodles. My bf - kevin - and me will come back!
author: Steph N.

description: The place was packed and for good reason. The pho was great and flavorful, with good portions. The price was great as well, not too pricey. Our orders were taken quickly and the food was served promptly. I will be back.
author: Mike B.

description: This is my go-to place when I crave a delicious pho.  I have been dining here since my grad study.  It is a nice mom-and-pop operation.  I can see the kids are all adult now and I remember the first time I saw them working in the restaurant when they were younger.  While I am a fan of their pho, I can't recommend their fried menu.  Sometime they prepared their dried menu way in advance and re-heat them when somebody place an order.  I'm not a fan of re-heat food.  That's why I only order pho.
author: Stan D.

description: Just wanted some pho because of bay area weather! Got the combination pho, medium size bowl. The amount of noodles was about two fist full (girl hands lol), a few pieces of each of the meats. As I slurped the soup, I noticed the very strong taste of vinegar... Then it was all that I tasted in my broth even with the pho condiments added which sucks. I really wanted to enjoy my pho but it starts with the soup...
author: Luc L.

description:
Every single one of my Vietnamese friends agree that Pho Hyun Hiep is the best in SF. 
They're spot in Daly City is just as good and I go there 5 times a week during the cold season. 
The pho is super solid but I recommend getting the beef stew #32. The meats a bit more gamey but the broth is too die for.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Great customer service, extremely fast table service, nice big bowl of noodles, warm tea and huge WANGS! 

Upon walking in the door one of the servers pointed to a table and my friend and I sat down immediately. Within seconds another server came with a pot of tea and 2 cups.  I felt welcomed right away.

Another minute past another server came up with menus and waited while we ordered.  She made some helpful tips on popular items my friend and I got the beef noodles and a side of wings.  


And would you believe, only two minutes longer and our food arrived on the table, the wings took a little bit longer, but we were eating soup within minutes and that was awesome!

The soups were priced at $6.50 for a gigantic bowl cooked perfectly and seasoned very nicely.

After a few bites of soup noodles the wings came out and they were gigantic and perfectly crispy. I always love getting wings at these soup places and these were some of the best I've had.  They were big and thick and juicy and plump and better yet crispy on the outside.

I recommend this place if your hungry and you don't like sitting around for an hour waiting for your food because you're going to get it right away here.

The price point is incredible for what you get and the service tonight was outstanding!
author: Justin G.

description: I just came from Sacramento and I love it here! The food good and service was fast!! Will be back here for sure.
author: Cindy X.

description: Favorite Pho restaurant in SF. I've been coming here since I was a little kid and the one thing this place has for sure is consistency. I could not visit for months and come back to get exactly what I expected- a nice warm bowl of pho done right. Great service and a delicious bite for a cold day.
author: Kenneth W.

description: THIS IS BY FAR THE BEST PHO SPOT AROUND. extremely fast and organized service. I love love love kevins!!
author: Rachel M.

description: When I walk in they already know what I'm going to order haha. I love this place, it's my go to! The service is fantastic, honestly one of the best pho place I've ever been to!
author: Ernalyn C.

description: Excellent pho broth. I had their #13 and shrimp cake appetizer and they were both delicious! I will definitely return for more!
author: Young Y.

description:
Hello.  I'm a dumb ass white person.  

Kevin's Noodle House is one of those places that causes me to pause and consider all the past ratings I've assigned to various businesses in which I've dined.  It's price point is so ridiculously reasonable (huge menu with almost everything ranging from $5 - $8) and its satisfaction level so high that, while it might not deliver any earth-shaking experience, the yelp math somehow adds up:

Really delicious pho (and bun) + amazing prices = 5 stars

But what do I know?  I'm just a dumb-ass white person who resides in Marin County where, last I counted, there were a total of two joints serving pho, neither of them great.  

Kevin's Noodle House is hella crowded but somehow that line moves insanely fast.  Tables turn quickly owing to the rapid delivery of pho and the acknowledgement that this is not a place to linger.  Beware though:  if anyone in your party orders bun, your pho order will be timed for delivery along with the bun (as it should be) and you'll wait longer than you would if you were dining only with other pho eaters.  

A medium bowl of well-done brisket pho was $6 plus change.  A bowlful of beef bun (noodles, veggies, meat) was $8+.  The place serves no alcohol so this might contribute also to the pace at which things move along here (as well as the ridiculously reasonable end of meal tab).

As I fished through my pho I could be heard saying "If I lived nearby I'd be here all the time".  As I left I could be heard saying "Can we move nearby?".

In a tip from 2 months ago yelper Sean S noted that Kevin's Noodle House is "for dumb ass white people".  What can I say?  Guilty as charged.
author: Tracey A.

description: I come here whenever I'm craving for a quick, cheap, and decent meal. They seat you down pretty quickly even when it's busy so the wait time is never too bad. The pho is pretty good, it's not the best but you get what you pay for. I have to say the rice plates are really good but unfortunately, it never fills me up to the point where I feel full. Everyone who works here is really nice. I've never had a terrible experience here once and I've been here plenty of times.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I always hear bad things about this place, but my experiences here are actually not bad at all. A lot of people tell me that this place is far to be vietnamese, I really don't care what they say, as long as I enjoy their food I will be happy.
My favorite in their menu is number 7. Lots of meat and the broth tastes good. The service there is not bad as well. If you go after 6pm on any day you might encounter a waitlist with some tables ahead of you, average waiting time is 15 mins which is not bad. Additional note: Finding parking around the area is pretty hard, specially at night, so you better go earlier than planned.
author: H C.

description:
Mediocre pho. SF simply does not know how to do pho the right way. Broth was off...definitely too much msg and fish sauce. 

Owners of you're reading this, please go visit Pho Anh Dao in Sacramento, CA. The best Pho in the world exists there. 

#truth
author: Lee S.

description: My family and I come in here regularly for lunch or dinner.  My aunt is especially picky, but she loves this place.  I think it's the only place she'll go for pho.  I usually get the #4 small and it's still a decent size!  My aunt's favorite is the 55C which is a chicken and shrimp vermicelli dish I think.  They also have a location in Westlake, but I like this location more, even though parking is harder to find.
author: Jonathan W.

description:
This place is your basic Vietnamese cuisine on irving street. The first thing I noticed is it was PACKED for a Wednesday night. Judging by the number of reviews, this place is pretty popular. The service was very good and quick. One unique thing about this place is that the menu has different sized bowls of different soups, which was to my liking. I can't finish a full bowl of pho, so I ordered a small which was the perfect size, and I paid less in the end.

My friend and I ordered the spring rolls, I'm a pretty basic white dude, so I got the beef ball and rice noodle soup, and my buddy ate some beef stew. The spring rolls were amazing, probably the best I've ever had. They tasted super fresh, and the peanut sauce made them better. My Soup was pretty good, broth, beef, condiments, everything was great. I would go back here, but I like the Vietnamese place on Noriega street with the yellow awning and the name that I'm not even gonna bother to pronounce better!

This place has great Vietnamese food, and will serve as my second in command neighborhood pho restaraunt.
author: Jim D.

description:
Always the best pho on a foggy sunset day. 
Good for larger parties / family. 
Food is amazing.. Fresh... Delicious..
author: Frances L.

description: My go to for some amazing Pho and a great price! Parki g not too bad as well!  If you,are familiar with Pho and want a good quality place for just focus on the food go here.. If you want a location for ambiance not the best place..but i rather have quality food!
author: Jay A.

description: The tastiest pho broth I have had in SF! We got a large special combo and it was enough for two of us. We even requested fewer noodles because the portions are so generous. The plain bubble milk tea was also very good with no sugar (add ice yourself though to cool it down). Five stars at this price point.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Came here and they were pretty busy.
This was my second time coming here and the pho was pretty good. Average pho.
There's a lot of flies in the restaurant though, which was a downside.
I got a mocha tapioca and it was so good. I wasn't expecting it to be so great.
Overall would come again.
author: MaryAnn H.

description: I really love this place. I live nearby and go at least once a week. Service is super fast and the food is so delicious. My favorite are the spring rolls and the chicken noodle pho. The fried chicken wings are also amazing. The portions are also large and the price is really great!
author: Diane R.

description:
Pros: Decent pho, spacious restaurant, quick service. 

Cons: They fudge your receipt to increase tip. Use cash or go somewhere honest. 

When pho craving creeps up, I'd go to Loi's down the street or PPQ across the street before considering Kevin's.
author: Andy B.

description: Love this place.  Always fresh always fast service.  Came for Mother's Day and left very satisfied with my family of 4, two young adult sons and husband look forward to coming to Kevin's.
author: Dahli M.

description: Kevin's noodle house is one of those staple pho places. There is nothing super special about it but it is solid. The pho is always pretty good and is a great comfort food. Sometimes the fresh spring rolls don't taste super fresh (like the skin around it has gotten a bit hard) but it generally is pretty good. The service is always prompt but not super attentive. It is one of those, get in, get out type of places. If you are in the area and are craving pho then I would recommend this place but it isn't a place that I would travel across town for.
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
Busy rainy sunday night.
1 waiter for entire place. Had to get my own fork or wait forever. 
Ordered chicken pho. Broth and noodles weerre good. 
Chicken was rough that i dont even feel that i had chicken for dinner. I love kevins spots. I wouldnt come back to this location.
author: nina s.

description:
Every time I come here I always order the same thing: medium size beef ball pho and sometimes I ordered extra beef ball. I never really eat the noodle just the broth and the beef balls.
It's an ok pho and I like the place because the service is good although sometimes is hit or miss.
Price is cheap the place is good but I still prefer Y&Y in Inner Richmond.
I'll return if I am in the area.
author: Ty N.

description:
My favorite pho place in the sunset! The food is really good and really cheap and really fast! What more can you ask for? They have a lot of tables and the turnover is really quick so don't be afraid if there's a line outside. I always get the chicken pho medium and it doesn't disappoint. It's about $8 for a bowl and I am beyond full after I'm done eating! 

Parking can be hard, but that's with all places on Irving. Gotta be aggressive in getting a spot (:
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Its delicious, however the reason for it is they use MSG.
They obviously dont care about the consequences od MSG consumption.
author: Eziz T.

description: I wouldn't say this is the best pho I have had. It is mediocre and something you'd want to grab if you're close by. Nothing special about their broth, on the bland side. Their bowls are a lot smaller than the usual mediums at other restaurants. There are three locations, two in daly city, and one in the city. I have been to the one in the westlake center in daly city, and they're pretty much the same. The bowls are small, and the price is kind of high for their quality. Maybe if you're really hungry and wanted some pho, coming here will satisfy that but nothing more.
author: Katie L.

description:
Been coming here for like 8+ years and its been really cool seeing its popularity grow too! We used to be able to come in with as many people at any time of the day and still be seated right away but when I went a week ago, the place was PACKED!
