Glad to see family businesses like this doing well ^_^ but sad I have to wait now haha.

Long story short, this place is my go-to for solid pho. They also have great rice plates and vermicelli, which I like to get when I wanna be "healthy" haha. Prices are super reasonable and everything tastes fresh, delicious, and authentic. Not the fanciest of places but hey it should always be about the FOOD and glad Kevin's has got their priorities straight :)
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Large selection of noodles, and most of the bowls (if not all, I don't remember) are offered in three sizes. The broth is so tasty, and the pho noodles are cooked perfectly. Worth the drive out here.

TIP: Come before 7 pm to avoid the crowd and the wait!
author: Jaching H.

description:
The only complaint I have is the lack of parking options, however, that is not the fault of the restaurant. The pho makes up for the difficult parking situation however. 

The wait time is relatively short, and the broth tastes amazing in my opinion, and "very authentic" according to my very picky mother. The noodles don't stick together either, which is an issue I have with many other restaurants who serve pho. 

11/10 Highly reccomend
author: Iris W.

description: Five years ago I wrote a review for this place. I was eating here above average, and then I stopped and don't come here at all...but this place is soo good! and it's popular on Irving. I love their menu. There's a lot to choose from. You want pho, you want noodles, you want barbecue, you want egg rolls..you got it. It's clean and well-run. I also used to get their boba drinks. I love this place, but I always want fried chicken and egg rolls(#41) and it's not good for my diet. If you want a satisfying Asian fusion comfort food meal on Irving, go for this place!
author: Denise C.

description:
A very traditional vietnamese pho restaurant. I ordered the dac Viet house special and was very satisfied with the taste! He soup had a very beefy flavor and the overall experience was enjoyable.

I'm giving this place a 4 star because, although the pho was good, it wasn't like amazing or extraordinary. that being said, if you need your pho fix this would be a great place to check out! Also, I personally do not like the smell of incense and the restaurant was filled with burning incense sticks (just a personal beef of mine that slightly affected my personal experience, but not included in my review since I could be the one odd dude that doesn't like the smell of incense)
author: Lawrence L.

description: Ordered the beef pho #9 and it was not a disappointment! The broth itself was favorable! Usually, I add fish sauce to it but the broth was good as is! Added chili oil, lime, siracha sauce made it even more yummier! Worth coming back here for sure!
author: Sally S.

description: Awesome Pho for the price! I love their sliced beef soup and their vermicelli is also not to shabby. If I where to complain about anything, I feel like their beef quality could be better and sometimes their basil is a bit wilted. But for $9 for a huge bawl of soup there is really nothing to complain about!
author: Michal D.

description: Most people come here for pho. Yes, sure,  their pho is very yummy. I agree. But what's also really good here is their rice plates and fried shrimp cakes!!! I usually order #37 (Grilled pork chop, shredded pork, egg with steamed rice) and # 41(Grilled pork chop, fried shrimp cakes, egg with steamed rice) the steamed rice is so fluffy, I donno how they do it. Can't find better rice plates anywhere else!! True story!!
author: R C.

description: Yuummmm, and very quick service and food. Excellent broth, they got that classic #1 beef pho done right for sure
author: Yvonne C.

description: Grew up eating pho here during my high school days about 3-4 times a week. I stopped going since I went to college and finally returned a few weeks ago. The pho didn't change, but when we ordered their fried chicken - it was tasteless with too much batter and dry. I'll stick to my small pho with beef on the side (#17 I believe haha). And their avocado boba is delicious!
author: Amanda C.

description: Kevin's noodle house is the place to go for pho, rice plates and vermicelli. This place is usually packed but you can get seated within 5-10 minutes since people always eat and leave right away. Parking can be difficult at night but honestly, it's not that bad. After 6pm is free meter! I usually order the chicken pho (pho ga) or the vermicelli. Everything comes out within minutes especially the pho since it's already made and ready to serve. The soup is nice and hot, noodles are chewy, and the veggies (mints, bean sprouts) are good. I definitely enjoy this spot better than the one in Daly City. I'll be back here as usual! :)
author: Monica W.

description:
I enjoy coming to Kevin noodle house, it's convenient. Fast service . Great food. It's like walk in walk out, very clean. They close early.
But I enjoy eating their noodles also their rice plates.
Its also a good go to spot to eat alone if you're too busy to meet up friends for a meal. I would encourage people to check Kevin noodle house if they want fast service and great pho for a reasonable price
author: Kenneth G.

description: Amongst my visit from Seattle, I'd like to include this pho place as one of my favorite pho spots even though it's miles upon miles away. Everything that I got was authentic and reminds me why I love SF so much. The broth was very flavorful and the beef melted into your mouth! The price isn't over bearing  and it's a great place to be in and out.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
Came here after I've been wanting to try this place for a  while. Staff is not engaging and kind of not pleasant. They don't say thank you when you leave. They don't really great you. They just point and say sit there. Wasn't feeling it. 

I got the vermicelli with shrimp. Shrimp wasn't grilled. Tasted pretty basic. Like they cooked the shrimp previously and then warmed it in a microwave to serve. Disappointed forsure. Vermicelli was good but I mean you can't really go wrong with noodles.
author: Seven R.

description:
My main (and first) pho spot, Kevin's is a delightful place to go out with friends. Though not too flashy, you come here for the food, not the ambiance. I usually go for a #17, which is Pho with rare steak.

Pros
-Service is fast
-Broth is amaazing
-Noodles are cooked well
-Good portion size for the price
-Public transportation is close by

Cons
-Westlake location is better
-Meat isn't always the best

Overall, 8/10, would recommend.
author: Chris O.

description:
Definitely one of the better bowls of pho you can find in San Francisco. It's served with better cuts of meat than most other pho restaurants and has a very distinctive broth, having a very noticeable clove taste and aroma. 

Lots of seating so you won't be waiting too long. But one of the best things about it is that the amount of time between placing your order and slurping hot noodles and broth is really short. You'd probably spend more time at a McDonald's drive-thru.
author: Erich D.

description: This place was packed 10min before closing which obviously looked like a good sign. The host was polite and we were seated promptly. Food wise, the beef noodle soup I ordered was good but did not really wow me and the rest of the menu looked pretty standard for your regular sunset district Vietnamese restaurant. The chicken wings were tasty but again weren't anything amazing. Overall, I thought Kevin's was satisfying and totally did the job for a big group at 9pm. Kevin's was good for its cost but if you are looking for a more authentic  restaurant I would explore further along irving. Kevin's is a good place to bring friends before/after sunset at ob on any work day of the week.
author: GianCarlo L.

description:
Not bad not bad. Big portions and fast service. Perfect when Karl the Fog is making his appearance and it's chilly out. The only thing I wish I knew was on the menu, the first pho combo has a S-M-L option. The options&pricing goes all the way down for the rest of the phos... n00b, I know.

All in all, I wouldn't make the drive all the way from the east bay for it but I would come through again when there's a fat line for San Tung.
author: Janet L.

description:
After a full day of lounging in my bed with a throbbing head injury (aka a hangover, as the youths are still calling it), I decided it was time to venture out of my home around 7PM. My old pal Sean C and I hadn't seen each other since he brought me to Outside Lands, and he had a craving for pho and convinced me it would cure my dwindling hangover. My mind's eye darted to Turtle Tower (to which he protested, is "too Chinesey", whatever that means) then to PPQ, but he suggested Kevin's Noodle House, where I haven't been in years and years and years. 

While I circled the block for the third time, I noticed the large group of people hovering outside the door of Kevin's. The place was packed, but luckily Sean snagged a two top and was ready for fall in his flannel, and also ready to let me have it for making him wait around for 15 minutes. I'm perpetually late for every event I ever attend, it's an actual problem; if I were a saint, I would be Our Lady of Perpetual Tardiness. 

Anywho, he ordered us two Cokes and the Fried Chicken Wings ($7.25 for 5). I kid you not, these are some of the best wings I've had, the Vietnamese know how to do it, and Vietnamese Fried Chicken (VFC) is now my new addiction. First of all, they are large and in charge; hot, juicy, and light, I think they use Peanut Oil to fry the chicken. We both are aiming to get hypertension in our youth, so we added salt to these bad boys. So good!

I had a small #6 Tái, Chín, Gu, Gân, Sách (thin sliced steak, well-done brisket, tendon & tripe) and it was excellent. A good size for a small and only $5.75. I noticed as we were leaving that someone had ordered the large flat noodles in their soup, and I kicked myself for not asking for them. The service was fast and to the point, which I appreciated. Really good stuff, I'll certainly be back for more. And my hangover was cured and I slept like a well-fed baby last night, to all those wondering.
author: Crystal C.

description: The pho broth was very flavourful. The rice noodles did not have that weird aftertaste. The spring rolls were not as tasty as the ones I had at other places. Overall, the pho was good but nothing out of the ordinary.
author: James S.

description: Typical pho restaurant customer service. Conveniently located near 19th and Irving near the 28 for SFSU students who want Vietnamese food.
author: Danae L.

description:
Whenever I'm craving vietnamese food, the first place that comes to mind is Kevins Noodle House.

I really like their vermicelli bowls with beef and pork as well as their eggrolls. So good! I think the amount of veggies in the bowl was just right and the taste was not bland at all. When I'm in the mood for pho, I always go for the medium sized bowls of beef balls and noodles or the #2 (which is like the XL, but medium sized). Super flavorful and perfect for the chilly SF weather.

Their service never fails either! I feel like no matter how big my party is, we always get seated immediately or within 5 minutes. Plus the wait for food has always been under 10 minutes. 

Very clean place and decent prices but it sucks they only have one restroom :(
author: Kathleen S.

description: Long wait, weird tasting broth, kept having to ask about our drinks, and forgot one of our orders. Do yourself a favor and walk across to PPQ which is way better.
author: Amy C.

description:
This place is definitely overhyped..

I came here on a Saturday evening and the place was pretty packed. For a table of 4, we had to wait 20-30 minutes. When we were seated, we weren't even offered water. 

I got a medium bowl of pho with mixed meat for $6.50 and I was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED. There was only 5-6 pieces of meat in there, and all of the same type despite the description on the menu. The bowl was big but there was not much stuff going on in the bowl.The taste was very average. 

For the price that I paid I can definitely get something better and more.
author: Wendy F.

description: This place is really affordable and really good. Service is fast and efficient with a diverse menu of soups, vermicelli, and rice dishes coupled with diverse drink options. The portions are good and filling to the tummy. Their vietnamese iced coffee was k with a strong coffee taste. Egg rolls are hearty and yummy. Clientele is diverse which means this is a popular joint. Enjoy some pho. Thankz!;)
author: David H.

description: I still enjoy coming here if I'm in the area, but the portions have gotten smaller! Order a medium and up!
author: Jenny E.

description:
For the past couple years, Kevin's has been my neighborhood go to for basic, simple, no frills pho because of its consistently good pho broth, fast, cordial service, and affordable prices. Disclaimer: it's definitely by no means the best pho in town, but the broth is always flavorful, the ingredients are relatively fresh, the noodles are never too soft or overdone, and the meat is average portioned.

I usually order the beef pho with meatballs), phõ gà (chicken rice noodle pho), and the combination rice plate (2 chicken wings, grilled pork chop, egg roll over rice). The vietnamese coffee is pretty good here too and they even have an iced vietnamese coffee with boba that has decent pearls! The portions are always large, especially considering the price. I live nearby so I have always been a short walk over, but even during a super busy night I've never waited for a table for longer than 5 to 10 minutes. More than you can say for anywhere in this city. As far as customer service, many Asian restaurants wouldn't exactly win the award for the friendliest or most attentive, but Kevin's is above average needless to say. 

Overall, a good spot for when you're sick, hungover, or in a rush and just want a good bowl of pho.
author: Andrea D.

description:
Pho Huynh Hiep and Pho Phu Quoc across the street are probably the 2 most well known pho shops in town on that side of Irving Street. In addition to being very fun and challenging to (mis)pronounce, they are in some ways both mediocre tried and true standby's. Personally I might do better at Yummy Yummy, but thanks to the San Tung #1 and #2 crowds, parking 8+ blocks up might be even more challenging.

I've been to PPQ far more over the past decade++ than PHH/Kevin's Noodle House.

For some reason I have never tried venturing in here, until finally I caved in a month+ back. Then came back a 2nd time last week, only because a parking spot had freed up right up front. It's like that Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis movie from 1955 where Jerry's character was pretending to eat a big fat juicy steak, and just so happens his upstairs neighbor has a quarrel with his wife and tosses his steak out the window, and he catches it....

Bottom line, two pretty inconsistent visits of the same bowl and coffee. Flank, brisket, tripe, tendon is what I normally get, along with a cafe sua da (iced coffee with condensed milk).

The first time the coffee had way too much condensed milk in it. The second time i asked for less milk and they gave me like 5 milimeters worth in height (WTF, I said less, not miniscule!). Get the balance right!

There is not much of an issue with the quality of the tendons, brisket, or flank. But on the 2nd visit, the pho noodles were mushy, clumpy, soggy, and just too soft/overcooked. There is a Cantonese term for this monstrosity, better pronounced as "lum peht peht", and that's not a good texture unless you are a teething infant, or an old toothless man.

The broth is a tad too heavy, and obviously is enhanced. This is a far cry from the clearer cleaner broth that I prefer at Pho Y 1 (E Capitol) San Jose. Then again, no contest.

Bean sprouts as usual don't look vibrant and had shades of brown (uhm they should be white right)? At least not as brown as the oxidized uni at Tenroku :-o
Most of the customers here look like they would enjoy Tenroku a lot as well.

If memory serves, the location on Facebook if you try to check in, seems to say Kevin's NOdle house. Not noodle, nodle. Maybe NO(dle) was a sign...
author: Ken K.

description:
The service here is very fast. There were at least 20 peole ahead of us and our wait was still only about 15 mins. Food came out within 10 mins of ordering.

I got the pho ga tom, it was a little more oily than what I'm used to and the pho had more of a pure chicken flavor with no hint of any other spices. Despite those factors it was still good and my soup cravings were satisfied. If wanting something a little less straight forward stick with actual pho.

My boyfriend got the dac biet bo vien with steak on the side and was very pleasantly surprised at how good it was. 

Spring rolls were "meh" for me seeing as I felt they didn't taste very fresh.

Four stars mainly because it's the most satisfying bowl of pho my boyfriend (the ex connoisseur) has had outside of San Jose so definitely recommended if you're in the city!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Big solid steaming bowls of hot noodle soups.

Your choice of meats/seafoods.

Very fair pricing.
author: Robert M.

description:
We visit Kevin's often, along with its archrival across the street, PPQ. The pho here is pretty awesome, and the broth is thick and amazing. But guess what -- there is not one. single. vegetarian. option. on. the. whole. menu. That's right -- not a stick of tofu, a veggie-based dish, a rice with green stuff, nothing. So bear this in mind if you have anyone in your group that doesn't eat meat. This seems like a fairly large oversight that could be remedied with minimal effort.

That said, if you are down with beef and chicken, the food is pretty darn good, and this is a place that fills up on cold, foggy Sunset evenings.
author: K C.

description:
I have tried out a few Pho places in SF and this has got to be the most reasonably priced with best taste too . Although it is out of the way for me, If I am in this area again, I will surely stop by here.

SF has alot of average and crap PHO places but this one really stands out to me, 2 reasons, Price and taste. This actually is as good as the one in Oakland! I didn't even know there was another location until I stumbled across this location. This location is much smaller than the Oakland location but seems cleaner. The tables are not sticky here and there aren't any flies buzzing around your head. Another plus, there aren't fans blowing full force directly over your head, causing your side swept bangs to blow around everywhere and cooling down your soup prematurely either.

The service, fast, although we had to ask for jalapenos and water 2x, and the water didn't come until we were over half way done with our meal.

1 large Pho Xue lua for him, Medium Beef stew with Ho fun noodles for me, $13.. can't be beat!
author: Sharon N.

description:
Really awesome, light food. 

I got a chicken pho and the spring rolls, both of which were great. It's generally pretty crowded, but there is spacious seating so it wasn't too bad. The service felt a bit rushed, which I guess is understandable given that it is always crowded, but it would have been nice to try to slow the pace down when actually being served.

All things considered, would definitely go back again!
author: Marilyn M.

description:
The city has very few places that serve good pho, and for good reason, this is a perfect example of why it does! Meat is not fresh, soup is bland, noodles stick together. Rice is not cooked and the bbq pork is from the refrigerator. The beef in the pho was still cold when they first served it to me. Find your pho elsewhere, in San Jose, Oakland or even South San Francisco, but dont look for your quick fix here.

I could stomach this place, but my girlfriend got nauseous afterward, perhaps its the food, perhaps they pay the health inspector under the table...

Service is a horrid at this place, I wasnt even finished with my pho and i get the bill. I pay my bill and the busboy with his cart is directly behind me. Do they want tip? nah... just table turnover.
author: Alvin L.

description:
I'm not a pho person, but I love me some Vietnamese rice plates. If you're looking for a review on their pho, you should just completely ignore this review.

Their rice plates are SO FREAKING GOOD. I can't even begin to tell you how beautifully flavored and seasoned the meats on their rice plates are, and they definitely don't skimp out on the portions. They also serve a small bowl of the pho broth with your rice plate (no noodles, but it's alright--I never eat mine though). They get pretty crowded because it's so damn popular, but their service is quick so you won't really ever have to wait long. There's also plenty of tables.

Note on service: they're not going to be incredibly attentive to your every single need, and it makes sense because it's such a high volume restaurant and they need a quick turnover to accommodate as many patrons as they can. Nonetheless, they do come around to fill your water every now and then. Just don't expect a greeting every time you come in the door, when you leave, and a "how are you doing" throughout your meal. It's not that kind of place, and if it were they would definitely charge more.

It's perfect comfort food, and they've stayed consistent with their flavors and their portions for each of my visits. Now I know why they've been here forever.
author: Bettina P.

description: Wanted to give this place a try but they don't offer veggie broth for their pho :( i decided to go to yummy yummy instead and they offer it!
author: Nando R.

description:
The beef stew with thick noodles is amazingly delicious. It has the right amount of flavor and spice within the broth. The beef stew was tender and a good amount (unlike some viet places that give you just 2 small pieces). The amount for a small size was smaller than other viet places because most smalls are usually the size of mediums so it's perfect for someone who doesn't have too big of an appetite; otherwise get a medium! A small was only $5.75!!! That's an incredible price for dinner in SF! 

The durian shake that I got (that everyone was not fond of! =P) was really tasty and a good price at $2.75 because some other viet places charge up to $6.00 because durian usually cost a lot more than your standard strawberry or mango powder).

Total price including tip and tax was $11. Now that's a very appetizing and affordably delicious meal for SF! Will definitely come back!

The bathroom was a bit of a wait and they ran out of toilet paper and paper towels (and they didn't replace it quickly enough throughout the day) but just ask them and they should get to it. Too bad they only have one unisex bathroom because it's always awkward to be waiting for 1 bathroom... =/.
author: Sandy E.

description:
I like it here! our local go to spot for Viet food. 

Pho noodle is decent ... but i think soup can be more flavorful.... 

But other food dishes are pretty good too... and I really like their shakes and smoothie drinks there too! 

I go back every month! 

Service is decent, fast and relatively clean.
author: jess c.

description:
I've been coming here with my parents since I was a wee child. I LOVE KEVINS. There's nothing better than a nice hot steaming bowl of pho anytime of the day! My favorite are their #13, #17, #23 and their pork chop with egg rice plate! Also their iced vietnamese coffee is not bad. 

Additionally, I think their prices are pretty fair. I've never spent more than $10 for myself alone here. A small is about 7$ but the medium and large are a bit more expensive. But usually a small can fill me up! 


Tip: They give you a plate of bean sprouts, basil, a few slices of jalapenos and a few slice of lime for you to add into your noodles! Soooo good, I put everything in!
author: Janet K.

description:
This review is strictly for the Pho, as its the only thing I order here.  The Pho is awesome--best Pho broth I've ever tasted!  Highly recommend the #17 or the #29 with beef broth.

5 stars for the Pho
4 stars for the service
2.5 stars for the ambiance
author: Tanya N.

description: Went the rice route this time, which is not an uncommon path for me. Rice plate w/ BBQ pork, egg, shrimp cake, salad. Excellent ! As good as their Pho', and almost as good as the rice plates in San JO. Dunno why they wouldn't go fully authentic w/ a Com tam (broken rice) style meal since they have all the ingredients, except that broken rice. On second thought, I don't like Broken Rice, too much drama.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
I used to come here all the time in high school, now over 7 years later I come back here to get pho for my 12 year old siblings and realized that their kid sized pho was more like baby size pho :( it was 2 bites and they were still hungry so we had to order another one for them both... 

I also had to wave the waiters down, they werent very attentive and no one came to take our order until i did that. 

other than that, I also wished they had a vegetarian option because since Ive become vegetarian, it has been very difficult to find a decent place to eat with a selection of items i could choose from. 

food tasted fine, portions are pretty small compared to their chain restaurant over in daly city, i guess i expected them to all be the same...
author: Jessica C.

description:
3.5 

Pretty solid Pho here for it being SF.  I grew up in San Jose, so my Pho benchmark is pretty high.  Actually with that being said, this is top tier SF pho.  The broth is what distinguishes it from other SF spots.  

The rice plates here are standard.  They pork chops are well seasoned and the fish sauce is pretty good. The shrimp cake was good as well, crunchy on a the outside with the cake on the inside having the shrimpy goodness I expected.

Service here is quick and efficient.  It does get pretty busy because of its location and parking can be a disaster.  

If you are looking for good pho within the city limits, this is probably your best shot.  Authentic and reasonably priced!
author: Veasna H.

description: They are not customer service oriented :( . Their soup is really salty and their tables quite dirty.
author: Jonatan A.

description:
Came here after a long walk at the Golden Gate Park. This place serves fast and gives the check right about when you're going to finish. 

Seating: Pretty fast, should probably have a clipboard to manage those waiting since two people were about to go seat before my boyfriend and I even thought they knew we arrived first. 

Food: DAMN SO MANY OPTIONS FOR CHEAP. You have a choice of small, medium, or large bowl and different types of combinations of noodles all listed! I ordered a small bowl of pho and that food coma me easily. 

Service: Quick, super nice, totally deserve good tip. 

Prices were all about $6-7 per person which is super cheap in SF.
author: Corie L.

description:
Kevin's Noodle House is probably the reference Pho joint for me in SF.  Turtle Tower is fine but Kevin's Noodle House is absolutely what I expect as a transplant from the South Bay when entering a Pho restaurant.  Meat is good, noodles are good, and broth doesn't stray far from the tried-and-true taste you're looking for.

There are many more Pho places to try out but Kevin's to me is no-frills, pure comfort food.
author: Chris C.

description: Meh in every sense of the word. I remember it being better a few years ago but based on our most recent experience, would only come here if I was in the area and desperate for Vietnamese food or a quick dinner.
author: Steve L.

description:
In sorry but this place has went done the toilet. I used to come here 4 years ago and stop coming last year after my boyfriend aunts found a hair on her food. 

Today I was in the neighborhood so I stopped by. The noodle tastes good as usual but on my last bite I felt something strange so i stop n carefully took it out and guise what ? It was a piece of plastic in my noodles. So I showed it to my boyfriend . In anger he called over a waitress. He said "ma'am look at this" and she said what he said my girl found this in her noodle this is PLASTIC. All she said was ok and left. NO APOLOGY!!!
author: Kelly C.

description:
On the rare occasion that I make it out to the Sunset (because it's usually way too far and way too cold to the other side of the city), I always try to get my fill of Asian food. I found this Pho place on Yelp and saw that the reviews were fairly high (4 stars)! And typically pho restaurants get a max of 3.5 stars since most of them are hole-in-the-walls. 

Like every other day in SF, I chose to come here on a cold, foggy day. I came here with my roomie to get a nice bowl of soup and because we were craving durian. I'm pretty sure we're both born with unique and sophisticated palettes that allow us to enjoy the taste of durian, instead of claiming it's the worst thing on Earth (as others have sworn). I ordered my default pho (pho tai with bo vien (meatballs) since I don't like tendon, flank and all of those weird things that hang off of the meat) and we shared an order of fresh spring rolls. To top off our meal, we both got durian shakes and boy was that tasty. They probably use frozen durian here since it's pretty hard to get it fresh here and the restaurant would definitely smell like it if they opened up fresh durian, which it didn't.

Overall, the restaurant was very clean, especially for a pho restaurant. It's close enough to UCSF, so I bet they get a lot of students stopping in. The meal was cheap and I was able to get my Viet food fix in and my fill of durian for the month.  When I make it back to the Sunset next year, I'll be sure to stop in again!
author: Sophia H.

description: I love their Pho!  and very cheap prices being from San Francisco. Large pho bowls range around $8-$11.
author: Miguel E.

description:
Best Vietnamese food!!!! I've tried many and nothing tops it. 
Pho, spring rolls, summer rolls, Viet iced coffee and soy bean milk so fresh and yummy.
author: Gladie C.

description:
This place has great pho at reasonable prices. Vietnamese mother approved. She liked it so much she came back by herself to have another bowl. The bowls range from small, medium and large. I'd say medium is a good size to order, unless you really want to leave feeling bloated then get the size up. Prices range from $6.75 to ~$10 depending on the dish. 

Depending on when you go, there is usually a short wait (~20mins). The service is typical for a Vietnamese restaurant, but the food comes out fast. I thought it was cash only but I'm pretty sure they take credit card now. Definitely the best place for pho in the sunset!
author: Hanhie D.

description:
If you are hungry and short on time, forget fast-food burger joints and eat Vietnamese instead. I have found another Vietnamese restaurant that cooks your pho/meal in a blink of an eye...maybe two blinks!

Unlike PPQ, located right across the street on Asian-friendly Irving St., this is a bigger and cleaner restaurant with Health Department score of 94. Also listening to music on my nano was not necessary either. 

For lunch, I ordered the #41 combo plate. For $7.50, the rice plate had an egg roll, two pieces of fried chicken wings, a thin pork chop and vegetables with the customary dipping sauce. As you know, chicken parts do take time to cook. The chicken wings were decent. The thin pork chops were too salty for my satisfaction. The rice plate sounds good initially when I ordered, but turned below average. 

The workers were very nice to me. I might come back and check other items from here. 

You gotta love Irving Street.
author: Matt G.

description:
One of the best PHO in SF. Low fat , yummmmy !!!!
Must Love VN food
You Can Order same kind from MR President ate in VIetnam trip !
Enjoy guys !!
author: Nguyen N.

description:
3.5 
Pretty good pho. 
Had the pho dac biet bo vien.  It comes with steak, well-done brisket, flank, tendon, and beef ball.  The broth is pretty good and the noodles weren't bad. 
The spring rolls were questionable though.  The vegetables inside it seemed like they were sitting out and wilted and the shrimp was really fishy.
author: Heejin L.

description: This place serves standard Vietnamese fare in a pretty competent manner.
author: Dom L.

description:
Food (3/5): The other two in my group got the medium sized pho (#2 and #8), while I got the vermicelli with grilled pork and egg roll. All the food was good but not outstanding. The vermicelli had good flavors, but it didnt look very fresh when it came out, and that was a bit off-putting. We also shared the fried shrimp cake appetizer, which was pretty good. The flavor reminds me of those pink shrimp chips! 

Service (4/5): We were seated quickly, and food came out quickly too. 

Value (4/5): Each bowl of noodles was less than $10, and the portions were pretty sizable. I think Yummy Yummy has way better value, though.

Overall I think this is a solid place to get your pho fix, but I wasn't as impressed as I expected to be. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing?
author: Abby S.

description:
My last days in San Francisco and my biggest disappointment was that I was leaving this little gem behind.

No matter what city I am leaving in my first priority is to find the best pho there! This place has the best!!! Whether I am in Sf, Denver, NY, anywhere, hand down this is the pho I wish I could have everyday!

There is always a wait around dinner time but they are fairly quick. No alcoholic beverages but there is a little bar just a few doors down in case you have a long wait.

Make this stop a priority in SF!!!
author: Kelsie B.

description:
Good food for the price you pay, accepts card, and convenient to many other nice dessert/drink spots! The parking on Irving is pretty difficult unless you don't mind paying meter. 

For SF pho places, Kevin's is the one I go to most haha. I do like their Daly City location as well, but it's usually very crowded there. Personally always have to get the Seafood pho~ (#29), but #1 is the best bang for your buck.
author: Lilia T.

description: I love Kevin's he and his family make good Ph in the middle of sunset. Always get the pho fav biet with extra basil
author: Cm Tú Đ.

description:
First of all, you can probably tell from my profile but I'm not from SF. However, I've visited Irving street numerous times and I couldn't help but notice that there were numerous Vietnamese restaurants on the same street. I mean really, how do you compete when there are so many options?

Apparently after talking to one of my local friends, I learned that they each specialized in something and Kevin's Noodle House was known for their cheap and affordable pho. If you've been here yourself, you'll know that this is entirely true. Kevin's Noodle House (not to be mistaken for other noodles) serves huge bowls of pho for low costs. Personally, I don't like all the meats in the combo bowl so I ordered #10 in a large size.

The meal itself is like your typical meal of pho (cept they actually accept card); you have your napkins, chopsticks, small dishes, and your sauces to the side. Your order comes out in less than 5 minutes and is hot and ready to eat. Personally, I like to use a good amount of hoisin sauce and Siracha but this was not the case. the broth here is pretty tasty but you probably don't want to drink too much of it according to my mom. 

Overall, it's a decent bowl of pho for a low price. Parking might suck since you'll be looking for parking on a busy street , but it's pretty nice if you've been craving pho on a cold day.
author: Wiseley F.

description:
This is one of the better Vietnamese Restaurants I have gone to. They have somewhat attentive staff and serve pretty decent food.I love Vietnamese food and this restaurant is probably up there compared to the ones I have tried. 

At Vietnamese restaurants I will almost always order a rice plate unless its a cold day. If its a cold day I would order something Pho related. I've had multiple rice plates of theirs and my favorite would probably be Com Bo Nuong. The Beef is cooked well and has nice flavors all throughout. Something I don't really like would be their fish sauce. The flavors are not of equal balance and I taste more spicy than I do of anything else. For soups I would get Mi Hai San which consists of seafood. They give a fair amount of meats in this dish but I think it can be slightly more. I love Egg Noodles when it comes to soup and that's why I order it instead of   other kinds. For the Appetizers I have had the Goi Cuon and Cha Gio. Goi Cuon is pretty standard, but I think each roll is lacking in one half of a shrimp. Their peanut sauce tastes heavy in peanut and is thick. I think they should add pickled carrots and radishes in their peanut sauce. Im not a fan of their Cha Gio for how its made. It looks like a normal chinese egg roll and does not look appetizing.

Overall this restaurant has good flavors and I would recommend going here. The staff can sometimes rush you but it isn't that bad. The food also comes in decent portions even though I think it can be just a small bit more. Presentation and atmosphere is standard and nice as well.
author: Bill L.

description:
My BF found a hair in his rice place.  They said nothing and replaced it with the same dish.  There was a piece of gray plastic in the replacement dish. 'Nuff said. 

No apologies or acknowledgement, but they did not charge us for it.
author: Colleen L.

description:
Very good Pho spot in the Irving area.  The fiancé and I were craving some Pho on a recent chilly trip to the bay.  We were in the neighborhood and saw a good amount of people are the restaurant so we decided to give it a try.  I ordered a Rare Steak and Brisket pho and it was very good.  The broth was flavorful without being overly oily.  The steak came our rare and fresh (it's a real pet peeve of mine when the steak comes out like it has been sitting in the broth for a while).  It was tasty and tender as was the brisket.

Overal, it was a good experience.  Service was prompt and..well as good as it gets for an asian restaurant.  The food is all that matters...well the price too...and both were on point.
author: Rob P.

description: So comforting to eat on a cold, rainy day in SF. Nothing will ever compare to home made pho but I really liked this pho place compared to others I've been to. Meat is tender, broth is as flavorful as restaurant-made pho can be, and it's oh so cheap! If you want a delicious, satisfying meal under $10, I definitely recommend this place.
author: Christy L.

description:
This is our go-to pho place in the city. Not fancy, but the food is on point and service is quick. Beef broth and vermicelli bowls are good and though not as traditional, their chicken pho is very tasty.

Has a few other locations in the bay area, we hit up the Daly City one sometimes and it's about the same.
author: Brennan K.

description:
Man Ive been eating at the joint since high school. This place is still around and good. I especially like the noodles that they use here. The broth in their soup has lots of flavors and doesn't taste watered down. Their eggs rolls are freaking hella good. Their crispy, crunchy and aren't hella small. Price ain't bad about $7 to $8 for a dish. 

The rice dishes are really good. The Beef stew has lots of beef. Can you believe that. Some spots have way to much tendon and other stuff with little beef but they got a solid helping. That's another thing that impressed me about this spot. The Viet Ice Coffee here is pretty good. All these years of eating here not once did I realize I couls ask for a to go cup. Here I am trying to down my coffee as were leaving like fool (shaking my head).

This place gets packed often. They do a solid job getting everything cleaned up so we ain't waiting long. Over a dozen years eating here and still my fav spot for Pho in the city. They got another spot in DC that's pretty good also. I think there's more but this is my fav.
author: T C.

description: I swear their soup has crack, it's so freaking addicting and tempting not to finish the entire bowl of soup!
author: Stacey T.

description: This place is a go to favorite for me and my bf. Always fresh and very quick and friendly service. It's obviously a family owned and operated restaurant which is always a great feeling walking into. So many options for food and all yummy and served w/ a smile and gratitude.One time a girl at the cash register even shared some of her chips with us when my bf joking asked if they were good and if he could try some. She generously poured a cup full of her snack and offered it to us. I just love the vibe here and always see friends and family gathering here for a warm healthy and yummy meal.
author: Sandra Z.

description: I love Vermicelli! Its my favorite dish and I love to get it every time! The food here is always good and the prices are great. Each of the restaurants I've been to are clean and well kept with great food. I also reccomend the spring rolls. I'm still exploring the menu, there are more things then Pho, which I'm not a fan of.
author: Thomas J.

description:
Being Vietnamese and spoiled with my Mom's homecooking makes it hard for any Pho restaurant to please me. I'm glad to say that both my experiences with Kevin's Noodle House was pretty good :) 

(+) Rice plate. The Com Tam dish was extra filling and delicious. I LOVE the Tau Hu Ky  from this place (fried shrimp wrapped in crispy bean curd skin). It's kind of hard for restaurants to distinct their tau hu ky from each other because it's very simple to make so Kevin's did a great job and making an impression on me with their com tam plate. 

(+) Seafood Hu Tieu . The second time I came to Kevin's was on a very windy and cold day so their noodle soup hit the spot. I'm really not a Pho person (probably because I don't eat meat but I'm also just sick of it). The broth for the Hu Tieu was on point, not watered down like many other places where you cannot even distinct the different broths from each other. The portion was just right for a large !

Prices for KNH is pretty decent for the quality of the food. I've had worst food for a ridiculous price so I as pretty happy. Expect to wait a long time if you come with a large group or at the wrong hour. The place isn't that big but the service is pretty fast!
author: Tram N.

description: This isn't the best Kevin's in the chain, but pretty decent. But it makes me wonder...are there multiple Kevins that run all of these restaurants? An unending chain of clones that make great ph and cm dia every day alongside the occasional Thai tea. I hope Kevin #27 is doing ok.
author: Calvin H.

description:
Came here on a whim one day because me and my SO felt a pho craving coming in and this place did not disappoint.

The pho here is served in a huge bowl and packed full of meat. The broth is really nice compared to other pho restaurants and their rice plates are great as well. My favorite rice plate is the grilled pork chop and I have to say that the grilled pork chop here is the best I've ever had. A bold statement like that deserves praise for this restaurant and much deserving of a 5 start in terms of food. 

Service is fast, but some of the wait staff should check around if the customers are doing okay. There were a few times I'd like a cup of water if something was off about the food.

Nonetheless, this place is a great go to stop for massive bowls of pho and great rice plates!
author: George Z.

description:
After walking around Ocean Beach area, we went to Sunset for dinner option and decided to try out Pho Huynh Hiep 2 AKA Kevin's Noodle House. This place was clean and fully packed. Turn around time was pretty good, we only waited 10mins for a table.

We ordered 2 items:

Dac Biet (Medium) special combo with thin slice of steak, brisket, flank, tendon & tripe - really disappointed, the beef broth was bland, not much dept, taste water down compare to other Vietnamese place, really lack of that beefy soup flavor.

Bun Tom Thit Nuong grilled shrimp & pork with veggies and vermicelli - portion was small :( usually I couldn't finish this plate at the normal place I go to in Milpitas. And sadly I finished this plate and still have room for dessert! The fish sauce was nearly water, no hint of sourness or spicy-ness?
author: Sandi C.

description:
This place has been my family's favorite pho place for many years... but I will have to find a new place. Took the family for dinner. Pho was good as usual, but I bit into an egg roll and almost shattered my teeth on a dime sized piece of glass! I literally cracked the glass in half.
The waitress who initially was concerned, called over the manager. He saw the glass, and I could see in his eyes as the gears in head started. "Should I comp this order of egg rolls or be a dick and say sorry and walk away?" As he walked away, so did we. We paid (no tip)and agreed there are many other pho joints around that don't put/drop foreign and dangerous objects in the food... and if they do, they make an attempt to make it right. There are people that would have made a BIG scene, or sue if they got injured. Do not take this lightly. EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK. CHECK YOUR FOOD FOR NON-FOODS!!!!!!!!
author: Robert K.

description: Love love this place.. We rush in by 9:30 pm.. As they will close by 10:00 pm..staff said no need to rush.. Relax n eat..!! Order my seafood clear noodle soup.. And combo pork chop rice plate..come with bowl of soup.. Also got 2 cans of my favorite soy milk..!! Food always comes out fast n hot fresh from kitchen..!!!
author: Crisy G.

description: Initial service is a bit slow because there are a lot of tables and only a few wait staff. Once you ordered the food comes out really quick. The broth for the pho is nice. Great value for a large bowl of pho.
author: Benji S.

description: For having such a long line outside this place seats you ridiculously fast. Within minutes we were seated, had hot tea, waters, and had already placed our orders. Our food came just as fast, we got a large combo seafood pho and a medium chicken pho. The broth was delicious and the noodles were super filling. We were in and out in under an hour; great place for a quick meal if you're in the area!
author: Sam L.

description:
My roommate wanted to meet up for dinner and she was dead set on pho.

This is the first time I've been to this Kevin's Noodle House but it's sort of the same as the on in Westlake. This Kevin's seems more spacious and looks nicer on the inside but the service is generally the same. Fast and pushy.

We both ordered rare beef pho kids (lol) and I ordered the coconut shake with tapioca. 

Everything arrived by 5 minutes. I've had that pho before so I didn't really care for it but I was pretty excited about that coconut shake. I took a sip and found out they gave me a lychee shake. 

In some ways, this disappointed me but at the same time I didn't care about it enough to ask for a different shake. I didn't have a problem with lychee flavor and the price would have been the same anyway. I guess I'm more miffed about the carelessness than anything.

I don't particularly care for Kevin's Noodle House ever, but the food is not that bad and everything is really cheap.
author: Sofia R.

description: My favorite pho in SF!!  I'm here once a week and hIghly recommend.  I also love their beef stew.  When I'm not in the mood for noodles, I go for their combo plate which is great.  Everything here is reasonably priced.
author: Kevin N.

description: Unbelievably great Pho. This place is constantly packed with locals, the service is great, and the good is to die for. Would 100% come here again... at least once a week
author: Ria M.

description:
Great food, I had the shrimp roll and the beef stew noodle pho. The roll with the peanut sauce came in 6 pieces which I was sharing, and they were delicious. The beef stew noodle pho I got the large which was more than enough for two and had me craving to come back for more.
Service was fast and the price was great, I will definitely be back to try again!
author: Colly M.

description:
I love this place. It hits the spot. I usually opt for the #13 takeout. If I'm sick, cold, or need a pho fix I always choose Kevin's. I discovered the noodle house in their Walnut Creek location and was very pleasantly surprised at the full and rich aroma of the broth, noodles, meats, etc. And the price is right. So happy Kevin's is so close to where I live in the city now.
Yum.
author: Suzanna G.

description:
Come to Kevin's Noodle House for good, cheap, and consistent Vietnamese food. I don't just come to Kevin's for the food, I come here for the quick service. When the restaurant is not packed, the food can come out in under 5 minutes. That's faster than any other fast food chain! However, when there is a wait, it still doesn't take too long. 

They have a large menu to satisfy those Pho cravings plus other Vietnamese noodle dishes. I like their Beef Rice Noodles Soup with beef balls and their brisket. The meat and noodles pair well with the salty broth and the condiments on the side (hot sauce, sriracha, and hoisin sauce). Other dishes that are good includes any of their vermicelli noodle plates. The fish sauce mixed with the noodles create this sweet, yet tangy flavor. The grilled meat is also nicely cooked and compliments the dish.
author: Jessica E.

description:
Stellar service from a very warm, patient staff. Fresh broth, fresh noodles, very fresh greens, therefore excellent pho. Hot tea is served. They take your order down with an iPad, so no screw-ups. 

If there are other people standing around when you come in through the door, look for the sheet to put your name and party size down to help everyone keep track of which group is to be served next. Customers tend to overlook this, maybe because they're too eager to sit down and chow down. :)


Also, because I like to note random details, I noticed one of the staff members did something that'd typically go unnoticed and one that I actually really appreciated thanks to my father's feng shui teachings. In the back corner of the vast main dining room, there's a vestibule that leads to the restroom, and in the doorway between the vestibule and the dining room, there's a door. The staff makes a conscious effort to keep the door leading into said vestibule closed such as to keep that "bad" energy from the restroom away from creeping into the main dining room. You know...Chinese philosophy. (And you say: But it's a Viet joint!) Oh whatever. *I* appreciate it.

Good for: quick 'n' cheap meals, parties up to 6 (a handful of tables can seat 8) people, solo diners, casual dinner dates. Don't be that guy who brings in a party of 14. Yeesh.
author: Kaitlin G.

description: Tasty beef pho, though I was surprised mine had tendon because I ordered a version that was supposed to not have tendon. Super quick and friendly. Lots of reviews said the portions were small so I ordered a medium but think I could have done fine with a small.
author: Lewis O.

description: I went here today(7/13/16) with my three Asian friends ;). I'm the only vegetarian of the group; Don't go here unless you like avocado spring rolls and rice but my three Asian friends liked their food.
author: G-Dragon Girl K.

description:
Definitely one of the better places for pho in town...Kevin's knows how to make some bomb broth! The menu is pretty extensive with tons of different types of pho as well as other noodle soups, rice plates, and vermicelli. My go-to choice though, is ALWAYS the #1. It's the X-Large special combo, and it's filled with various types of meat, tendon, and tripe. Add some bean sprouts to that as well as Sriracha and you've got yourself a bowl of wonderful goodness. It's perfect for any day - especially on cold, foggy days though. 

Service here can be a little spotty at times, but the food always tastes great and it's usually my go-to place for pho. Just beware that the wait can get a little long during peak times (both at lunch and dinner). Don't be too alarmed though because the turn over rate for tables is pretty fast. All in all, Kevin's is a very solid spot for pho, as it's quick, relatively cheap, and great tasting.
author: Aaron W.

description: The pho tastes good like pretty much any other pho place. The only problem is that the portions are tiny. After eating one whole bowl I'm still hungry.
author: Lex A.

description: Kevin's Pho Place is now my pho place  the rice dish has decent portion size to fill a hungry college student's belly while meeting your eating budget. The pork chop was very flavorful and juicy and the shrimp cake itself was simply delicious. The only thing i would complain about is the swarm of flies which most restaurants have trouble dealing with but overall the dishes are always consistent in leaving you satisfied.
author: Bernard W.

description: My second favorite pho place in SF next to Pho Tan Hua in the tenderloin. The broth is amazing, only down side is no vegetarian options.
author: Sara U.

description: A very typical Asian joint, won't take Discover or Amex but expects you to pay cash or use Visa. Strolled in after a long time jogging around to fill in my empty stomach. This place had some great reviews which kind of made me inclined towards settling with vietnamese lunch. it's a pretty crowded joint with folks waiting to get seated and some typical rude waiters asking you to write your name down even before they ask if its dine-in or to-go. For to-go you head straight to the counter and an old lady with absolutely no smile on the face resembling a disgruntled school teacher hands you the menu to order and after you order the only word you get is "15 min-uu-ttes". I got a combo rice plate, took them about 30 min not an issue given the rush but what drives you a bit crazy is the haphazard way they arrange their to-gos but the packing was good enough to withhold the ride home. Food was not great but not bad, will I return is still tentative but if nothings around then won't mind giving it one more shot.
author: Arvindram R.

description:
When me and my friends are craving Pho in the city, the first place we think about is Kevin's Noodle House.

Their Pho is authentic with great meat and not that pricey, which is basically the only ingredients you need for great pho. Service is always friendly and food usually comes out pretty quickly. Tea is free also, so they aren't stingy.

The other thing I love about this place...... IS THE DURIAN DRINK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I LOVE DURIAN! Everyone always claims it smells like sh*# and it tastes like even more sh%!... I just think everyone's crazy or just too mind boggled by everyone else's claim that they in turn follow and agree what everyone else says. I think Durian is one of the best and most unique fruits out there.

The way Kevin's Noodle House makes the durian drink is so delicious! It becomes even more creamy and rich than the fruit is already by itself. I love it when I order the drink and take a big gulp, then blow the flavor to all the people that dislike durian. What a delightful scene! Muwahhaha.

With great pho and an even better durian drink, Kevin's Noodle House is definitely become a regular place to hit up.
author: Benjamin W.

description:
Pho is very good, not as large beef portion as other pho shops, but excellent broth. The chicken broth is simply the best ever... but there is pork in it, so wife had rice dish instead.
We wil be back.
author: Henry M.

description: I can say without a doubt that this restaurant is one of the best noodle houses I've ever eaten at, and I am extremely picky about my noodles. The rice noodles were nicely cooked, the broth was flavorful and home style and the seafood was tender and bountiful. Their shrimp cakes were like little golden fried pillows of perfection, and they were not over seasoned or over cooked. Most def gonna be back for another bowl...or two!
author: Love L.

description: It is perfect for pho. #22a is my classic Chicken . I especially like it for to go orders because it is so fast! You don't go to this place for the service, not saying it is bad but they are definitely looking to flip the table quick. Get in, eat, and you're out!! Their Thai tea is really good, and their chicken wings are Bomb! Crispy without being too greasy. Good hangover food that is for sure !!
author: Julie H.

description:
We stopped by here after a long drive into the city. We all wanted something to fill our tummies but not too heavy.

The restaurant is not to eye pleasing from the outside but is worth it for the good food.
I am still trying to convince myself I like pho, so I was a bit nervous to get a big bowl of it. I was really happy with the pho and the large amount of toppings they gave me to put inside. 

The spring rolls were also fresh and good. Not the best rolls I've ever had, but tasty. I as usual, loved the sauce that accompanies them and doused the rolls in them.

My favorite part of this restaurant was the large selection of bubble tea! Normally restaurants only have tea or coffee to put the boba inside of. This restaurant here had tons of unique flavors from avocado to mocha. It was awesome! Good prices and great tea. 

The prices here vary from 5-10 dollars a person. Also many of the plates are huge and could easily be shared!
author: Issy D.

description:
Trying to find a pho place in a hurry. Read the reviews and decide to give a try. Ordered #2 , chicken pho, fried wings  and spring rolls. 
Loved the #2 beef meatball pho. The broth was perfectly balanced. Beef tendon soft and meatballs bouncy. Thumbs up. 
Chicken pho is tooooo salty. And too much MSG. Taste good first try then becomes too much after that. 
Wings are hot and crispy but way over cooked. 
Gonna give a try cross street at PPQ next time
author: Ben G.

description:
I come here twice a week and order the exact same thing... that's how much I like this place!
There is absolutely no wait (for dinner on a weekday), but I'd suggest coming during non-peak hours on the weekends. Wait time is usually pretty fast considering they get their food out in less than 10 minutes.

Pho - Their pho is so good! Warm and served super fast! They don't skimp on the noodles or the meat and the broth is flavorful. They bring out the beansprouts, basil, mint, limes, peppers for you to add too. I order the pho with raresteak and brisket. Absolutely delicious.

Rice plates - When I'm not feeling pho, rice plates are the way to go! Their porkchop rice plates sure hit the spot. They're large plates with flavorful porkchop grilled to perfection. Sometimes it's a little burnt, but you just deal with it. Haha I get the plate with the sunny side up egg, porkchop, shrimpcake and rice. Also comes with a side of soup (broth).

Eggroll - Their fried eggroll did not impress me at all. I would not get it again. It's not what I expected from typical Vietnamese places.
author: Carmen C.

description: ohmygoodness. CHICKEN PHO? this place gets pretty packed early in the evening but everything moves fast. got our orders really quickly and for the price, its really good (so many toppings are added into each order). i like that they have different sizes as well for each bowl. the beef pho isn't as good as the places on the east coast but definitely recommended 'cause they got chicken phoooooo
author: Monica L.

description:
This is one of my favorite pho restaurants in SF.  I actually really like the one in Westlake but been here on Irving many times as well.  Today was kinda off.  The beef broth didn't have much depth and somewhat not simmered for the required hours.  

#1 had little amount of sliced beef today.  Was sad about that. 

Price is good and service is fast.
author: Kevin L.

description:
My go-to place for the best pho and vermicelli plates in the city. The place is consistently packed. You will not be seated unless your entire party is present. They have great service and offer free tea, which is nice. I usually go with #40, which is pho with rare steak and flank. The broth is really clean and stays hot. If I'm not in the mood for soup, I go with #55b, which is vermicelli with grilled chicken and egg roll. The meat portions are quite generous for both dishes!

Tl;dr - #40 and #55b
author: Emily W.

description: Hair in salad, when we showed the server (and have him the hair!) he just said sorry and didn't take the food back. Soup was too hot to eat, it was so hot the server wouldn't let us touch the bowl. Pretty disappointing.
author: Phoebe D.

description:
The best pho in town by far!  The babe and I go here regularly and it never disappoints.

Pros:

1) best pho broth
2) cheap
3) pretty clean and well lit restaurant
4) fried imperial rolls are tasty

Cons:

1) the wait - seems this place has become even more popular if that is possible
2) street parking is a hit or miss in this area full of restaurants and bars
author: V C.

description:
Pho so good... Soup base is amazing. Also great attn to detail with components


Price reasonable service fast
author: Kevin C.

description: Good for late night pho cravings, last time I was here I ran into a couple who were learning to use the chopsticks and they were so cute! Pho is delicious and they have the perfect portions!
author: Alena N.

description:
Pho Huynh Hiep 2 ( I did not know there was a 1???) is one banging pho house....and so much more.

Thank you Yelp for steering me to this great little resto.

We ordered the Pho Ga Xe Lua  (aka bonless chicken soup with noodles)...that shit was really fly...medium order is huge. Plop in the basil, lime, bean sprouts, and jalapeno pepers....add a dash of fish sauce......best pho I have had in a long time.

The broth is really flavorful, deep , and tasty.

Ordered two apps:


Cha Gio which is deep fried vietnamese egg rolls taro, clear vermicelli, pork, shrimp ....really good...and nice dipping sauce.

Goi Cuon which is another roll consisting of shrimp, pork, lettuce, vermicelli wrapped in soft rice pepper ....did not care for as much but the sauce which was thicker with peanuts was AWESOME.

For three people 2 med chicken pho, 1 small chicken pho and the apps.....35 bucks including tip....this place is awesome.

kiem tra xem nó ra
author: David G.

description:
Pros: It's got a good reputation. It's also my favorite pho place in the city (though I haven't been to many).
Cons: Growing wait time over the years.
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
If you like pho, here's where you go. As legit as it gets in SF in my mind.

Super quick and cheap. The large bowl is Huge but if you're hungry, step up to the plate. Ou might want to throw a side order of shrimp spring roll in there too
author: Jarrett H.

description:
Nom nom nom!  Yelpers were right, this is THE spot to eat good pho in this part of town!  Their broth was beefy, noodles were chewy, the beef was perfect.  Ahhhhhh... The bowl of hot noodles really hits the spot after a windy cold day hanging out in the city.

Very good!  Very very very good!  

NOTES:  Parking can be challenging during dinner time.  Food comes out in 5 minutes!
author: Jenny T.

description:
I'm a traveler from Los Angeles, and I think this Pho place is decent. The price here is fair (a little slightly more pricier than LA obviously). Very spacious on the inside. They serve tea, surprisingly. I tried the Pho Chin Nam, it was efficient enough to be on the yummy category for me. The size of the bowls are surprising; the large is very huge.

Customer service was good. Very attentive. No complaints.

This is located on Irving street, and I think you are gonna have to spend a lot of time finding parking, especially on the weekends and/or holiday. It took us about half an hour just to find parking, and we parked by around 25th street, so it was like a few blocks of walking. No complaints.

It was also a bonus for us as one of the famous Bay City tea house, Tpumps, was located right across the street from this restaurant! We have one in Pasadena down here, but the ones in SF are usually slightly better.

I'll be sure to come back here if I want to eat pho when I'm in the Bay Area!
author: Kenny N.

description:
Great late evening spot for a bowl of pho. Service is quick and polite and they don't skimp on the nourishing ingredients.
I got the #1 combo: rare thin beef, brisket, beef ball, tendon and tripe. I never thought I'd say this but tripe doesn't taste bad at all. Actually, it's mostly tasteless, yet at adds a nice and new texture to the soup and noodles. The broth is well made as well-- not that instant taste, and you can see globules of liquid fat/oil floating on the surface adding extra flavor kicks with every bite.
I like that the menu lists every possible combination of beef pho, many with photos. Can't wait to return. Oh, I found the Med size to be perfect.
author: Brian J.

description:
My girlfriend had just returned from a late flight from Italy and we needed to grab a late dinner.  Most places were closed by 9pm, so we headed to 19th and Irving to see what was open.  Luckily, there was a pho joint with it's lights on so we headed in. 

There were closing soon so we had to order fast.  I went with their pho combination.  When it arrived, I quite enjoyed the soup.  It was a bit more oily than normal, but the flavor had definitely developed.  The meats were tender and tasty, but I felt the tendon was cut a bit too big.  Otherwise, it was a very satisfying bowl of soup.

While the soup was hot, service was a little lukewarm.  It might have been that we were there a little late, but otherwise it wasn't that friendly.  It's been challenging to find a great bowl of pho in SF and luckily this place is legit.  Hopefully the service warms up a bit though, which would really make this an even more solid eatery. 

Food: 8/10 

Service: 6/10 

Price: $ 

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Honestly, I went to Kevin's cause PPQ across the street was closed. PPQ peeps were on vacation. Got a boneless rice plate and added an egg roll to go.

DISAPPOINTED. The rice plate was definitely full of rice and not much meat. Sadness. Also, The sauce that they use is slightly different and the egg roll isn't the typical imperial roll..

Meh. Of course it's all relative. I just had a hunkerin' for that five spice chicken with rice and an imperial roll from PPQ. It's okay. Service was fast though--so thank you! Price isn't bad either, but I just wished I got A LITTLE more meat. :))
author: Mariel A.

description: So so so dayum good!! Looking forward to returning again and again. Service was FAST!
author: Nicole J.

description:
I loved this pho place! The pho bo kho (beef stew pho) was sooooo delish! The broth was light & tasty. And there was a good amount of beef inside!

There are a lot of servers & they take your order right away. Your food comes out within 5 minutes. They have 3 sizes - small, medium, and large!

The place is clean too! My new fav pho place! I will definitely be back! I'd love to try the regular pho too!
author: Alysha K.

description: Fantastic! Glorious!! The very Pinnacle of human achievement in the arena of Vietnamese noodle soup! Delicious, Timely, cheap and fresh! You will not be disappointed. The superb of paragon Vietnamese noodle soup restaurants!
author: David S.

description:
My friends & I were craving some warm soup because lately, there have been record low temps in the Bay Area. We walked in and were motioned to sit at an open table near the front. Less than 5 minutes later, the waiter asked us to move! That is very unprofessional & it was just poor customer service. We decided to wait for a table away from the door. That took another 5-10 minutes. By that time, we were pretty hungry. It was a busy night so it also took awhile to get our order. 

Once we ordered, we got the fish cakes to start; then we got the, extra-large chicken pho (shared between two people) & a large beef pho. This place had really slow reaction times to customer needs. This, unfortunately, has been my experience at most Vietnamese pho places. We were waiting for more tea & cilantro, but the waiter didn't get them until toward the end of our meal. At that point, we were practically finished eating! As for the food, the chicken pho was really good & hot enough when it got to us & the fish cakes were really tasty! I would give this place 4 stars for the food alone, but the service definitely bumps it down a star.
author: Brittany D.

description:
The pho is always good here.  It's also the only thing I have ever ordered.  I've tried some other dishes that my friends have ordered though. There's a full page of drinks on the menu that includes lychee drinks, boba drinks, coffees and teas.

The tables are large and have a lot of space.  If I'm in a group, we usually opt to come here rather than the shop across the street. They are also very fast in getting the food out. The pho comes out almost instantly after you order. I am always surprised at the speed of the service. Overall, the service is standard.  Sometimes, it seems like they are just trying to hurry you, but that is when it's busy. 

I give this place four stars for the food, speed and a very spacious dining area.
author: Jeffrey N.

description:
I have been here countless number of times. I normally order pho with rare steak.  The food is consistently good and worth the price I believe.  

A recent time I went, I was not given tea.  Which is normally given for free to customers.  I had to ask for it.  Besides that one experience out of over 20 now I'm sure. I would suggest trying this place out.
author: Nathan A.

description: Good solid Pho. Great flavor and quick service.
author: Rob J.

description: This is my favorite pho place in the city!! When I was living in the city I went here at least once a week! I love how quickly the food comes out and how consistent the food is. The pho here always hits the spot!
author: Mimi C.

description: Great food, ok service. The place is newly renovated so looks nice. I had the spicy beef pho and it was delicious! Will definitely be returning.
author: Amna P.

description: I have been here lots of times but now I decided that I will never come this bad service restaurant. I ordered always same thing when I went there. I said exactly NUMBER TWO SMALL SIZE without cilantro and even she checked the menu one more time. But when I get my food there was cilantro. I called service and I said I ordered WITHOUT CILANTRO. I was very impressed cause she said it is just little just take them out. Okay. With this, I'm fine. I have two hands also I can do it by myself. But the attitude was not nice at all. Also when I get my check, I thought it is expensive than I counted. She put my menu MEDIUM SIZE. I called service again and I said I ordered small size and even you checked it again. Ha She said no you said medium size and you already ate this. So just pay. And then spoke Vietnamese language. Are you kidding me? I could pay one dollar more for medium but with this kind of attitude? No!!! This restaurant service is awful and terrible.
author: Seulki H.

description: Usually I like the Kevin's noodle house in west lake. So I thought today would be the same. I was wrong. Small ass pork chops with my meal and suuuuuper soggy rice! I usually get an extra side of rice to match my meat but this time I had so much leftover because it was gross that it was just a waste. Even for me and a toddler. She drank the side soup. Only reason why I'm giving it a 2 star and not a 1 is because maybe it was just a one time bad experience bc I remember coming to this location before and it was good. Maybe I just got pho then but I dunno, whatevs, it was bad this time around. Service is what you'd expect. They didn't even refill my small cup of water.
author: Jamie B.

description:
This is the go-to place in the city for the best tasting pho.  Definitely my favorite place in the city. Basically everyone orders pho here. Service is fast. Get seated, order and they usually bring your order out right away (if you ordered pho).

Gotta go for pho dac biet with everything in it. All the tendons and tripe. Yum. The pho broth is delicious. I usually spend the first few minutes just drinking the broth. This place really hits the spot for pho. Good broth, fast service, good prices.
author: Truc D.

description:
Kevin's !!

Seriously the best place to get pho around here. Noodles are great, broth is good, it's just a wonderful bowl of pho.

Pho-real. It's so good.
author: Bianca M.

description:
I forget how good the broth is here. When the steaming bowl o' pho arrives, the headiness of the meat kinda lightly wallops you. Still has a light clarity to it, but this is one of pho joints where I don't feel tempted to drown my noodles in sriracha and hoisin.

The noodles were perfectly cooked, not too crunchy hard or sloppy soft.

Good amount of meat, and the tripe actually had some gaminess to it.

Excellent for a foggy cold day after walking up to the top of the tiled steps on 16th Ave!
author: Kevin L.

description: Our go to place for the best pho & fastest dinner service! The workers are always so nice and accommodating! The line to go in is always long but I've never waited for more than 10 minutes and once you get in, you won't wait more than 10 minutes to get your food!! Number 17, 24 and the fried egg rolls are bomb!!!!
author: Dayna Y.

description: Crowded evidence of a popular location. Service was quick, they were generous on their meat portions in their pho soup. Prices very reasonable.
author: P C.

description:
Here are some reasons to make you believe this place is good:

1) Take a peek inside, it's always busy
2) You know a restaurant is good when you see all colors of the race eating here
3) Because I said so

The spring rolls are fresh.
The Pho Tai is pretty darn good- make sure you get the beed on the side.
The rice plates are monstrous.
The Bun Thit Nuong is one of my faves.

When anyone asks me for recommendations for Vietnamese food, I would suggest this place.
author: Linda N.

description: I haven't actually had a sit down meal here in a while so hard to rate. When I used to eat here once a week it was good and inexpensive. I think over time their pho has gotten more expensive but that's life, I just don't want to accept it haha. It would be nice if they had a couple of other big fav, crab meat and pig blood, and bun reiu (always forget how to spell it). I would still always go here if I were in the sunset in that area. Always quick service and their 3 color drink is yum.
author: Austin C.

description:
This place is one of the best. Who ever is making the broth here is on the prime of their game. So sweet and flavorful. There are tons of really good pho places in the South Bay that feature larger portions, more ingredients, etc. but Kevin's definitely has its own unique taste. Maybe it's the generous use of cinnamon in their spices, or the fact that everything in the bowl somehow blends so smoothly together, and then add their garlic chili paste and it becomes a pho experience like you've never had. 

And Grandma is still on the top of the Thai iced tea game. Quite possibly the best Thai Iced Tea in the Bay Area. 

Come here for some of the best southern style pho in SF. 
They make their food with love.
author: Justin C.

description: Kevin/Chris's Pho place is one of the best on Irving. It's $7 on average for a nice bowl of pho, perfect for a cold day or any day, really. Their beef broth is excellent and doesn't contain many fillers - just some thick cut onions and cilantro. This means that you won't have to pick through onions slivers thinking its pho noodles - yay!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
I am halfway familiar with the popular Vietnamese dish, Pho, and wanted to seek some out while in San Francisco. We basically did a search by location and this was the best that came up. It was a cute little place, not super hole in the wall, but just one big dining room with not a ton of space. We got our own table against a wall and in time, our server brought us tea. I remember asking for ice water, but it never came. I didn't press the issue. 

The noodles were actually really, really good and came out super fast. I think that's why you come here, not for the stellar service. We had a huge plate of cilatro and bean sprouts and jalapenos for the table, and lots of hot sauces and hoison sauce to play around with. I enjoyed the skirt steak, but not so much the beef balls. They were a little tough. (Insert tough beef ball joke here.) All in all, we had a good (and filling, for the small size which was super inexpensive) lunch here and if in the neighborhood again, I might swing by this place for a second try. More steak, less balls. And I'll demand ice water!
author: Amanda R.

description:
Supporting my ongoing quest for delicious pho in SF, friends of mine who live in the area suggested trying out Kevin's, so, in I came one night with Anna T, ordering regular bowls of their standard pho.

Only briefly wondering why the bowls that arrived in front of us were so massive (we later found out they gave and charged us for larges), we dug in to servings of bouncy noodles in clean, tasty, broth, that managed to balance flavor and healthiness quite well (other places I've been tend to either have bland, clean broth, or tasty, fatty broth). There was, however, an unusual aftertaste that I couldn't quite pinpoint: and like other Yelpers who've made note of it, I can't say I was a huge fan of it either.

For $8.50 after tax and tip, you're getting a great deal on some pretty good pho. My favorite is still Golden Star, out in Chinatown though. Sure, the broth is more fatty and oily, but for the sake of flavor, I'm all for it.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - My memory's a bit fuzzy already, but I seem to recall that Kevin's had a large interior, with plenty of spacing between their tables for ease of maneuverability.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out, so I can't comment.
author: Johnny W.

description: I don't eat pork and I always ask what type of broth is in the chicken pho. First couple times when I asked what was in the chicken pho broth, they told me it was just chicken broth. Multiple times. Then I went and I asked again cause I'm always careful and the man tells me that it's always been a mix of pork and chicken broth in the chicken pho ): I had been unknowingly eating pork broth. Pretty disappointing.
author: Brianna N.

description: This is my go to place when I'm craving pho. Cheap, fast, and good food. The only downside of coming here is how sketchy the area is (the windows of the restaurant are barred down, there are lots of warning signs outside about leaving valuables in your car, etc.) If you can overlook this, I would highly recommend Kevin's Noodle House. One other thing I'd point out is that if you come here near closing, expect to be asked to pay right after you order. While it might come across as weird/rude, I'm sure it's because they're just closing down the register for the night.
author: Austin W.

description: A little bit above average Pho joint. Pretty crowded restaurant so plan ahead. Got their #1 House Noodles and their beef stew noodles. Yummy
author: Johnny N.

description: Pho was mediocre. The broth has a strong beef flavor but lacked the spices that make up traditional southern Vietnamese pho.
author: Molly L.

description:
