This place is a HIT or MISS.  I've gone twice and the first time was definitely a hit!  The pho broth was spot on and very satisfying...which is rare for a picky pho eater like me.  The second time, the broth was bland and not at all the Kevin's I remembered.  

Could've been a new pho fav, but it was just too inconsistent.  

Darn, this place had so much pho-tential...
author: Lyn C.

description: The pho is amazing. Very good boba as well. My only complaint is with the service: my friend and I asked twice for water, from two different women, and water was never brought to us. The place is always packed. The food is totally worth it, but just keep in mind during your experience that you might get overlooked.
author: Emily Y.

description:
Got the thai pho and it was exactly what I was craving. Food is cheap and cheerful. I like that they have 3 sizes unlike other places I've been to. Sadly I must say the spring rolls were not on point. They all stuck together and they lacked flavor. 
Apart from that I say try it!
author: Maey P.

description: This is like my 3 or 4th time coming here. Simple & large portions.  I love the blended red bean drink. Soup is kinda salty &  I can tell has MSG. Usually get #1 Pho noodle soup. Don't usually have to wait.
author: Thomas C.

description: Great pho with rich broth, Good quality tendon, brisket, tripe, beef.  Portion and price is great also.  Service is awesome.  Love the fact they bring the Check early enough so I can pay and leave rather than waiting for the check.
author: Sam A.

description: The place is decent, service was fast, and the food order was accurate and tasted authentically for ph.  Only issue was the appetizer (gi cun) was brought out much, much later than the main course (ph).
author: T D.

description:
I've come here a couple times -- my first being on my first night in Sunset at my new place. This restaurant was recommended to me by a friend who is familiar with the area.

The service was very quick. Once we walked in, we were immediately asked how many and were pointed toward a table. A few minutes after being handed the menus, they were back to take our order. Another 5-10 minutes after that, our food was in front of us!

I like to get the seafood with glass noodles, size small, and it's perfect! I'm huge on seafood, so I get my fix, and the glass noodles are quite tasty. The broth is good, but I like to add a little spice to mine with some chili peppers. This is definitely a solid pho place in case I have a craving.

The staff is also pretty nice (my dad asked for the difference in sizes and the old man just asked if he was a little bit hungry or a lot hungry. Hahah!).
author: Leana L.

description:
I have a few days off, and have decided to maximize them by exploring neighborhoods in the city that I don't see much of. 

On this cold summer day, I headed to the sunset, both outer and inner. After getting a tea in the outer regions (review to follow), I hitch hiked out of there back to civilization (fine, I took the N, but for the sake of the story, I'm calling it hitch hiking), and was craving pho. After carefully analyzing the Yelp profiles of several nearby Vietnamese joints, I ended up here.

Glad that I did! It was 2pm on a Monday, and there were several tables of people, which was a good sign. Something about the place feels warm and cozy, despite its relatively large size. And despite that after ordering, I needed to talk to my server, went up to the counter, and was greeted by an older lady with, "What you want!" It was actually funny.

Anyway, the pho was great. I alternate between seafood and veggie, and couldn't find either on the menu that didn't have chicken or beef broth. I asked the server, and unfortunately they don't have a veggie broth (I've come to realize those are somewhat tough to find), but they do have seafood (my server helped me find it - the menu is rather big). You can order small, medium, or large bowls, prices ranging from around $5.50 to $7.50. Fantastic deal!  It came out within about 5 minutes, piping hot and fresh, accompanied by basil, lime, sprouts, and jalepeno, all bursting with flavor. I had ordered a medium, and took half of it home.

I don't even live in the area, but will definitely go back.
author: Jessica C.

description: Such good prices for such delicious pho! It's a very filling meal for around $7 a person, which is harder and harder to come by in the city. They are super friendly, but be ready to wait in line if you go during busy dining hours, it gets pretty packed. It isn't too difficult to find parking nearby, so that is always great. I always order the chicken pho with beef broth. I don't like to eat red meat, but the beef broth always makes pho taste infinitely better so I try to get my pho with chicken meat instead of beef. Make sure that you ask for white breast meat (if that's your thing) when ordering, because one time I didn't ask and it came with meat off the skin and off the bone that was really dark, which I don't enjoy eating. The service is very fast as well, they do a good job of turning as many tables as possible since they always have people waiting at the door, which I appreciate a lot. It is also a great place to stop by after walking/hiking at the GG park, especially if it was a chilly, foggy day out. Nothing hits the spot like a good bowl of pho!
author: Emily H.

description:
Pho-tastic! Need I really say more. 

Okay if you insist... Open late, serves good pho and bun fast, across the street from underdogs, cheap, clean, filling and the imperial rolls are yum!
author: Jade W.

description:
One of my go-to spots for Pho since high school. Hadn't been here in a while since I left for college, but of course our server & the cashier were the same friendly faces I've always seen working there before.

I'm usually a #1 on the menu fan - but that's a pretty big bowl of pho for a small asian girl like me, so prepare for leftovers or to share, unless you have super high metabolism which I unfortunately am not blessed with. Pretty good rice dishes - my favorite is anything with the pork chops. Vermicilli is also a good solid choice.

This restaurant is right on Irving & off of 19th so it's a busy thoroughfare, with plenty of buses to get you to & from this part of the sunset. Parking is street/metered or free street parking if you don't mind walking further/squeezing your car in between driveways.
author: Courtney Y.

description: Pho is meh. Nothing special about the soup, very bland. Noodles are more chewy then normal pho (not bad though).
author: Edmond K.

description:
I'm between 3 star to 4 star on this place. Not a fan enough to make the 30 minute trek to eat here but good enough that i'd eat here if i were in the area. 

avocado smoothie - yum - but i'm not sure how one can mess that up (its just avocado, milk, and honey...)

their pho noodles are alright, meat cuts are actually pretty good. wouldn't say i'm in love with the broth...

efficient little place.
author: Vicki T.

description:
Dirt cheap pho and incredibly quick turnaround service, who can complain about that? My friend and I walked in and were able to nab one of the last open tables (it was packed).

I ordered a medium pho and was absolutely stuffed when I walked out (with some soup left in the bowl).  My bowl cost me less than $6. To splurge, I also got an avocado shake. I was definitely pleased with my dessert treat. For less than $20 (that is including tip), my friend and I got a very well portioned meal.  I'd definitely go back.
author: Michelle K.

description: We are seasoned pho enthusiasts, having eaten this delicacy for over 20 years, and from San Jose to LA to Vietnam.  We came to Huang Hiep 2 for the first time today and loved it.  The noodle was cooked just right, not over-cooked like many places tend to do.  The amount of meat was plenty and tender and soup abundant and flavorful.  Not that it needs our review, but thought I'd add my vote anyway.  This is a keeper; can't wait to return to try its vermicelli with grilled pork and shrimps.
author: T L.

description: I've only been here once, but my roommates swear by this place! It's pretty packed most of the time, but turnaround is really quick. Lots of seats, as opposed to the other Vietnamese place across the street. I got the bun to go so I haven't tried the pho yet. But it was pretty tasty. The girl behind the counter was really nice so maybe that means service is good!
author: Sherry L.

description:
JJ and I ducked in here early on a Sunday night (5 pm) for a post-walk warming bowl of pho. He had the chicken, I had the beef 'n' stuff, added the jalapeno, basil and sprouts, squirt of lime, mix of sriracha and brown sauce (hoisin?) = two very happy campers. The noodles were great and the broth was sooooooooo good, I kept drinking more even though I was full. 

Next time, I'll order the small - yes, my eyes are bigger than my stomach - as the medium was way more than enough. 

The service was quick and the place was already packed. By the time we left, there was a line already! Obviously a local favorite.
author: Mi M.

description: pho tai and hu tieu nam vang with cha gio. a bit disappointing since the fried egg rolls were lacking enough meat and noodles clumped. broth light on pho, ok on hu tieu and thirsty after. fast but not that good as the total reviews portray
author: Rob C.

description: Outstanding pho, good service, nice atmosphere. Very fresh ingredients, highly recommend. Fair prices
author: Alex J.

description:
I went here a few times--every single time for the pho, of course!

Now we all may think we can make this at home and we probably can, but Kevin's Noodle House allows us to eat huge quantities of it for a relatively cheap price.  It's not the best pho I've ever had.  I try to keep it vegetarian because the meat didn't agree with me a few times here, but it's very tasty soup if you're looking to try pho for the first time.
author: Sam K.

description:
Very good food~
I shared pho and bun with my friends and the both was so yummy! My facorite was the side soup for the bun, cause the soup alone had so much flavor and i wanted even more! def will come back here. :]
author: Unha K.

description: Don't come on crush hours!!!! Poor service on these time !!!!
author: Chiem E.

description:
As an avid vietnamese cuisine reviewer, this place had one of the better tasting meals. We tried the beef stew, seafood pho w/ egg noodles, and pork chop & rice. All dishes had very generous portions. The chops were not dry like many places. The egg noodle option is something I will always get. Yum! Many sishes offer a Small, Medium, and Large order size wich makes it very nice. Its the firat time I've ever seen that. 

Child friendly, popular, & fast service. As with many restaurants in SF, parking can be challenging. Patience is required. This place is surrounded by many many restaurants. Its worth a short walk if you park a few blocks away.
author: Lee W.

description:
LOVE this place. 

I'm from Boston and I've eaten my fair share of pho--probably way more than my fair share, actually,

First of all, the guy who greeted us was super nice and friendly. He told us there was a bit of a wait due to an issue in the kitchen, and even after we left to go get a drink while we waited and we came back, he seated us right away. The service was a little slow after that, but it was probably just because of the problems in the kitchen. No big deal.

At every other pho restaurant I've ever eaten at, they have been SO stingy with the beef balls. If I get the Pho Bo Vien, I usually only get about 3-5 slices of beef ball. At this place, they gave me a whole bowl full! I got like 12 pieces of beef ball! I was incredibly happy. The quality of the food was great as well. 

Overall, I loved this place and would definitely come here again when I visit SF next time!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Average Pho place.  Service is quick.  5 minutes from order to delivery on your table.  There are always a line during lunch hour, but it should not take too long to be seated.  Dining area is clean and bright.  Great service and attentive servers.
author: Steve L.

description:
Small: Medium: Large. Kevin gives a choice to consumers of his tasty bowls of pho, something unique in my experience. This last visit I wasn't as hungry, so ordered a small bowl of Mi Bo Khov (Beef Stew w/ yellow noodles). It was delicious, with ample chunks of meat and tasty, meaty broth. My companion ordered the Dac Biet (the combo beef and noodle dish), and was well pleased also. 
Kevin's can get crowded, and those waiting have no place to stand except right in the entrance--which can be a nuisance. The host managed the queue entirely by memory, without aid of writing down who came when, but it seemed to work fine. The restaurant is situated half a block off of 19th Ave., which can be a boon or a curse. As anyone remotely familiar with the area can tell, parking can be a challenge.
author: Brian G.

description:
Here's my experience in a nutshell:

Great Pho!
Huge portions.
Love the marinade on the pork chops.
Suicidal fly flew into my tea; asked for a new cup, never got one.
Avocado shake, pretty good--a little too sweet. Downside? Raw boba.
Customer service is nonexistent.

Overall, I'd probably return since the Pho was better than other Vietnamese restaurants I've been to.
author: Juliette R.

description:
4 stars for low prices + high quality. 

I don't know why, but it's a rare day that I'm in the mood for vietnamese food...luckily today was that day, & I used the fact that I had to move my car as an excuse to drive out to the sunset for some PHO! 

But when it came down to it, I actually didn't order the pho, I got the beef stew with wide rice noodle. 

And I'm so glad I did. 

I ordered a small bowl ($5.75),  which was more than enough for me (mind you I don't always have the biggest appetite) & I left with enough leftovers for lunch tomorrow. 
 
The stew had a very mild sweetness to it and did not skimp when it came to the chunks of beef. Very full flavored and after a couple spoonfuls of chili oil, I found it had a nice kick to it. 

My boyfriend ordered a large 'Dac Biet Bo Vien' ($8.25) pho, which was HUGE (seriously massive! but my 6'4" bf loved it so much he said he could have eaten 3 bowls) and full of all sorts of beef & beef derivatives. He was super happy with his order, as evidenced by the fact that he ate it ALL. 

I'm not the biggest pho fan, and I found the broth to have a strong beefy flavor, which was a little heavy for my taste, but I think that's a matter or personal preference. Luckily, I preferred my beef stew to the pho my bf ordered, and he preferred his pho to my stew. 

The restaurant had a somewhat sparse feel to it, a big room with lots of tables & a few paintings (with a distinctly 'asian' theme) lining the walls, but the place was full & lively. Very low-key and casual, which I had no problem with. The service was EXTREMELY quick...I'd say it was a 3 or 5 minute wait between ordering and getting our food. Kudos for the fact that one of the waitresses was able to let me know whether or not the beef stew had any sort of shellfish in it (allergy), which is sometimes a bit more complicated to figure out. 

Considering the price, quantity, flavor & expediency, this place definitely earned 4 stars in my book. Great for a foggy evening out in Inner Sunset!
author: Kaden F.

description:
while we had a hankering for Loi's for years, and it is real good, ya know, this one is now the bomb. Just healthy, delicious and inexpensive. The egg noodles are perfect. A medium #25 will run you 5.95 and fill you up with the best soup around with jumbo shrimp, yummy fish cake slices, chicken and beef slices with sliced onions, green onions and ground meat sprinkled-a nice touch. WOW! Don't forget the jalapenos, lime, sprouts and cilantro..

We used to go to the other one of the big three (the one across the street PPQ) and while it used to be my fave, it has slid of late. Lost the touch or something. 

What else can I say about Pho Huynh Hiep-just the best. Oh yeah clean friendly and fast! Gotta check it out.
author: Lantz G.

description:
I prefer this house #2 rather than #3 in Westlake.  Seems roomier and cleaner.  Once seated, you're given menus.  The server is quick to take your order, and once placed, it comes quickly to your table.

We wanted to go to PPQ across the street, but it was waiting room only, so we jaywalked across the street.  This place was a decent substitution since we were wanting a bowl of pho noodle soup.

Broth was satisfactory.  My beef wasn't quite as good as PPQ's; a bit tough and chewy.

A good crowd even on a Thursday night.  We were in & out within the hour.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Kevin's Noodle House is one of my all time favorite pho places to go to in San Francisco. For $6 - $8, you'll definitely get your money's worth of pho.Their menu is extensive and they offer different types of noodles and rice plates. 

Things I love about Kevin's:
I absolutely adore their chicken broth. 
They offer the clear noodles! (seafood with clear noodle- must try if you haven't yet)
They have excellent customer service.
You get seated quickly and your orders come out within minutes.

For a cold night, Kevin's Noodle House never fails to make me happy :)
author: Ada C.

description: Great pho as usual. And fast service. As usual. Tummy is happy. Bill came up. And then. Immediately this rude ass mofo with orange and grey sneakers came up to me. So actually I finished signing the merchant copy before he came and I was still signing the customer copy for my archive on top of it after he came. Without asking he rudely took the signed merchant slip underneath away. You do have a good eye jerk but there aren't people waiting and its 2 hours until it closes, so can you not be rude and wait until I left because you're not the only one having a bad day here. Disgusting.
author: Winson W.

description: Nothing is more satisfying than coming home after a weeks trip to have a hot beef noodle!
author: Rebecca L.

description: Was back recently after a couple years in the South Bay. I will always love them for nostalgia, but I have to admit most spots in SJ beat them hands down. Cheaper too. This is still one of the better spots in the City though.
author: Lily G.

description: Ive been coming here for the last 2 years it is by far the best pho place around the neighborhood they give you ample amounts of meat and they serve you a quick and timely fashion sometimes there's a bit of a wait but usually it's worth it. Also one time my friend forgot his phone on the table and they immediately return it to him so there's an honest crowd that works there as well will probably go in there for next time too.
author: Jordan S.

description: Stopped by at 11am for a quick bite and was pleasantly surprised by the speed of the service -- I sat down, ordered, and received my pho within 5 minutes. The staff ain't messing around. The only criticism I have is I didn't get much meat, but for a meal this cheap and quick I'm not complaining. Worth a stop if you're in the area.
author: Becky C.

description: Broth is good and service is fast. For a quick Phô fix, without the wait give this place a try.
author: Co C.

description: Today I went there and the waiter asked me to sign. I am first before the other two guys. It's not up to a minute that the waiter forgot I am the first; instead, he gave the seats to the other people. I am pissed off and decide to not to eat there. Never ever again!
author: Michelle G.

description:
I just went to this place again yesterday and since I'm eating meat again... I'm going to write a more useful review.

I ordered the pho with beef, tendon, and tripe.  LOVED it.  But I ordered a small and I was still hungry when I finished even though I'm not that big of a eater.  So order a medium or even a large.  The small is simply too small.  I kept fishing for more food even when all the meat and noodles were gone and even thought about ordering another bowl.

But it was gooood.
author: Vivian H.

description: By far my favorite Pho restaurant. Sit down, order, and food comes in 5 minutes. Now that is efficient! I can always count on Kevin's to satisfy my hunger and pho cravings. The broth is always on point, the noodles are springy, and the meat is always just thin enough to get a nice mouthful.
author: Keith L.

description: Literally one vegetarian option which is avocado spring rolls. They were pretty good but I expected at least one vegetarian rice plate or something. The boba in the avocado shake was good though.
author: Waanmathi V.

description:
3.5/5

First of all I'm Vietnamese, so the best Pho of all time is the kind that my mother cooks for me.

Second of all, I'm from the South Bay so my pho taste buds standards are high.

Let's just say 3.5 is high for the rest of the pho places I've tried in SF!

Kevin's is clean for the most part, quick, immediate and sometimes suspiciously too quick to come out as soon as you order.

They've recently updated by using a computer touch screen ordering system which the owner was absolutely stoked about, she reminds me of my aunt so I call her auntie whenever I come in.

I used to love their Avocado smoothies but recently, it's started to taste differently. Guess a nice big Pumpbo size Tpumps will have to do whenever I order a #2 from there going forward.
author: Nhu D.

description: Best pho on Irving/ in Sunset by Far. The piles of fresh veg for soup & complimentary pot of green are LOVELY. Super fast, super convenient, affordable, but at times on weekends around lunch SUPER BUSY lots of queueing! This is a great pho shop!
author: Julian I.

description: Pretty good pho; it might not be the most amazing I've ever had but it's definitely fresh and tasty (broth, meat and noodles). The aspect of the restaurant that amazed me most, besides the incredibly fast service, was the price of the food. Elsewhere in the Bay Area, you'd get the same quality food for 8 or more dollars whereas here, it is less than 7.
author: Ruobin W.

description: Right now I'm sitting here. How terrible costumer service. No menu. Took long time take order. Waiter throw my food. Stuff no smilie face at all. They just forget about it.
author: Bill B.

description:
I absolutely LOVE Kevin's. I go there all the time. Best food for a hangover, when feelin under the weather or just want a quick bite and it's AFFORDABLE. Especially as a student.  It's fast, tasty, and affordable. what more could you want? 

The tea they serve is great as well. I highly recommend 17 with the beef on the side. It's a great place to bring people who come to see the sunset and the people who work there are great.
author: Laura D.

description:
How have I never reviewed Kevin's?!  I'm definitely here far more often than my check-ins suggest.   In fact, I kind of live at Kevin's during the months that I don't even bother trying to feed myself at home.

The restaurant set up is not fine dining (obviously) and tailored more towards groups of 2-4.  There are a line of tables that are suited for solo-dining (or two people if they're willing to make the squeeze -- I like to park myself at one of these tables with a book, a notebook, and scarf down my delicious, delicious pho, or stew, or rice plate, and just decompress for half an hour to an hour).

The broth is heavier than PPQ's across the street, but if you're like me and you like to taste the beef that your broth was stewing in, it's a great choice.  Soup comes out, on average, about 5 minutes after you order, and they're really good at filling your tea pot as soon as the lid pops open.

Also, they definitely give me a really generous amount of meat (as much as I wish I could say it was a regular-perk, it seems to just be standard practice for them; I never actually get special treatment...), and when I have felt the need for extra broth, they're always willing to provide.

Also, the tamarind candies that come with your check are my favorite, so it's all win here!
author: Emilynne A.

description: Such a great place! It was packed, but my friend and I were seated quickly. Service was good, and the pho was amazing.
author: Grace P.

description: My boyfriend lives in SF and I live in SJ and this has been our "go-to" place for 3 dates already! My family is Chinese but lived in Vietnam for quite a while before coming to the states, so they know how to cook Vietnamese cuisines and dishes. I never really had the need to go out and eat pho because we can easily make it at home. HOWEVER, this is by FAR the best pho place I have ever been to. They're most definitely not cheap on their meat, pho, and veggies. Their large bowls are HUGE and it's only $8?? Wtf! SJ needs to step up their game because their regular/small bowls are approximately the same price but it also tastes like crap. You're definitely getting your money's worth here at Kevin's Noodle House.
author: Amanda L.

description: Just okay. The prices and the service was fine. What you would expect for a pho house. No vegetarian options which was bad for my girlfriend as she didn't eat anything. Probably should look into that, not hard and they would make more money.
author: D R.

description:
Fast service. It is much cleaner now since they remodeled it. The food is good, even though people HATE on this place. I hate the Westlake one, it's hella dirtier than the Irving one and the Irving one has better meat.
#1,2 and 3 allll the way.
Lets go eat some PHO!
author: Tiff C.

description:
Definitely one of our go-to pho places. Fast service and very cheap as you would expect from a pho joint. Their rice dishes are also quite good.

I only wish they would give me more tripe! "We want more, we want more~~" - AT&T commercial

xD
author: Cheung L.

description:
It was a cold and foggy day in Inner Sunset, so my friend and I headed over to Kevin's Noodle House for a warm bowl of pho.  This was our first time there, so we took a while to look at the menu.  This must have been unusual to the guy working there because he checked up on us several times to take our order (but we weren't ready yet).  When we finally decided on what to get, he put in the order, and literally within one minute, we had food on the table!  It was pretty amazing.  My friend and I shared:

-Spring roll (about $6): you get three rolls, each cut in half and served with a side of fish sauce.  It was alright.  Pretty standard.  

-Pho #1 (about $6.50): this was a huge XL bowl.  It was more than enough to share between the two of us.  The flavor was fine, pretty average in my opinion.   

All of the sauces were at the table and well-stocked.  What I can say about Kevin's Noodle House is that it's fast, inexpensive, and a fair option for pho.
author: Samantha L.

description: I really like this Pho spot because the server we have every time we go there is always the same one and he is nice and doesn't rush you like some others do at other Pho places I've been to, service is average, and the food is great and cheap! :)
author: Alyssa C.

description: This place is definitely overhyped. I don't understand why reviews raved about the pho, the noodles were overcooked, the tripe was hard and stringy. The soup was mediocre, the beef bone flavor is not quite there and watered down. However their vermicelli dishes are very good, my bf gotten the porkchop combo with egg roll and the portion, taste is great! Wish I had gotten that instead.
author: Courtney Z.

description: This is by far one of the most decent places to have a good bowl of pho in the city. A tip for my fellow Indonesians, order number 27 with soup on the side, no sprouts or vegetable, and thick noodle. Put some oyster sauce (the black sauce) and sriracha to get a vietnamese version of bakmi bangka!
author: Arnold K.

description: The sauce for spring rolls is the closest to what I always have back home, not many restaurant in the city serves this kind of thick peanut sauce like it here. Other dishes are on average but I the sauce got me!! Oh, their deep fried fish cake is another one worth to try.
author: Yanakon D.

description:
Need a pho fix after a night of drinking or just a cold San Francisco day (which is everyday) this place will do the job.

They have a large varieties of pho.   I always get the chicken one since it's healthier but it's a little dry sometimes.  The portion use to be bigger but isn't it always like that for places that's been in business for a long time.
author: Mimi P.

description:
Fast Service, delicious piping HOT pho on a foggy SF day, multiple locations in the SF area, good spring rolls and imperial rolls, and.. that's all I'm gonna say. If you love pho, come here. If you don't love pho, bring your friends here and you can eat the other plates! Yummy. Be sure to add all the toppings like mint leaves, lemon, bean sprouts.

If you are a big eater, ask for extra meat or extra noodles on the side!
author: Amy Y.

description: This place is great! Good food, lots of it! Very inexpensive. Great value. No frills ambience, but we really loved it. We'll be bringing friends back. The fresh spring rolls are awesome.
author: Midori H.

description: Love Kevin's! My boyfriend and I come almost once a week and always get 22A. Ask for white meat!
author: Ashley H.

description: Service was alright. Had to ask the man for water, and the veg for the pho. Didn't get lime or jalapeño but will def come back because the pho here is very good. And got their plate of egg rolls which are also yummy and crispy. Doesn't come with that much salad. Only One piece of lettuce.
author: Karina H.

description:
OK, so, I have gave Kevin's another try (alright...make that.. 10+ additional tries) since my last post. After reviewing this place and giving it a 2 on my last yelp review, I knew that there was something that I must have missed about this place my first go-around, so I came back... and then back at least 10 times since then within a span of probably 2 months or so. I LOVE Kevin's... it's affordable, delicious, and almost ALWAYS on point.

#46 hits the spot - It's porkchop with rice served with chinese sausage, a shrimp cake, and soup rounding out to be a very incredible and satisfying meal. Also, people that I go with tend to like getting an egg on top. Apparently it "seals the deal" on this meal.

Kevin's... I'm so sorry that I didn't believe in you my first time around, but best believe that I will be a loyal customer for many many Sunday morning hung over meals to come... :)
author: Lillian N.

description: The best and quickest pho place in the city.  You will spend more time finding parking than waiting for your bowl of pho.
author: Brian H.

description:
I think most of the time I always get  the number#41, I think its a very generous plate of food for such a small price.
Two big chicken wings, 1 pork chop, 1 eggroll and a generous portion of rice, a small bowl of soup.
The beef stew is good as well, except there's not enough beef in the bowl, for a slight upgrade in price you can get more slices of beef.
The pho is good as well, as my girlfriend always orders pho.
Fast service as soon as u order, the food comes out real fast.
Highly recommended.
author: Corey W.

description: Solid 4 stars for pho.  Very fast service, as expected and par for the course on flavor and portions.  Would go to again, but nothing that blew my mind.  I'll have to try their Banh Xeo and spring rolls next time to gain more perspective.
author: Kyle I.

description: Yum! Came to get a pho fix and was happily satisfied. The fresh rolls were amazing! So fresh and the peanut sauce was delicious. Pho was good. I'm still trying out pho all over the city to find out which is my fave but I think I'm off to a good start!
author: Daphne H.

description: Best Pho in San Francisco. Really quick service. Can be in and out within 25 minutes.
author: Anthony H.

description: Fast service and consistent food if you want a quick bite. Food literally comes out within 5 minutes or so. They give more meat in their noodle soups than the Daly City location.
author: Julie L.

description: Probably the best place for pho in the city (other than pho tan hoa), but be warned that the quality is not always consistent..
author: Lisa H.

description:
A good place to go for some easy, fast pho. The service is quick and consistent.
There may be a wait on the weekends. The place is packed during busy days/hours.
I've been here many times and I would return whenever I'm craving a simple, hassle-free pho lunch.
author: Nona T.

description:
Having grown up in the San Jose area, I found it very hard to find a pho place in the city that came close in comparison ... that is until Kevin's Noodle House!  The food is delicious, cheap and the service is fast!!!  We've dined in as often as we have ordered to go and great experiences all around.

My husband (also named Kevin so he feels particularly loyal to this establishment - haha) is usually the adventerous one and has had everything from rice plates, to beef stew noodles, beef pho and their cold rice noodle dish.  I normally stick to their chicken soup with either clear noodle, rice noodle or egg noodle - you can't go wrong!
author: Whitney Q.

description:
I can't get over how friggin' fast it is to order Pho here. I also can't get over how the little old lady waitress is able to remember everything you order while she's organizing chopsticks, sauces, and soup spoons at a table within distance of being able to hear what you ordered. Of all the Pho places i've ever been, i've NEVER been to one quite like this. It only takes about 3-5 mintes to get your order to your table (usually the Pho, when I ordered Fried Rice once, it took a little more time). This place gets a little full, even late at night but they're still able to seat everyone. Good to the last drop, definitely on the top of my list for places to eat on Irving.

Thank you.
author: Jay A.

description: Kevin's is not consistent in quality, but on better days, this place has perfect pho- the kind you don't want to ruin with hoisin and Sriracha sauce. On those days, I love the clear, rich broth, which is redolent of beef, marrow, anise, cloves, ginger and charred onion. It doesn't hurt that the portion sizes could satiate 1.5 times the multitude of hungry lunchers Jesus fed, nor that they do so for less than $9. But if you're still hungry, there are so many yummy, sugary shakes (avocado, durian, three bean, cantaloupe) that you'll leave feeling shaky.
author: Tianyi S.

description: Ahem, started coming here in my middle and high school days way before Yelp existed. Solid place and quick service, not to mention dirt cheap for a huge bowl of pho.
author: Lena R.

description:
Constantly craving their #1 special, though I usually get the small one teehee. Tried to down the whole bowl of #1 the other night and only made it halfway through before food-coma'ing.

This place is the serious go-to for good, solid pho. The broth is sometimes salty but it's hearty and tasty. Usually I ignore the oil, but nevertheless I don't chug it down, just take an occasional spoonful to satisfy my thirst (ironic, I know). Those noodles... they just go right down. Soft, slippery, and slim, they have the perfect texture and taste great. They don't skimp on the flank or tripe, either - there's a good portion to match the noodles. Sometimes the meat is tender, other times it's tough to chew through, but it's not much to complain about for the price.  $6 bowls of pho are seriously great meal deals! 

Their 3-color-bean drink is not bad either; it definitely satisfied my Vietnamese drink craving :) Green jelly, nom nom nom.

Have had other pho orders here, but nothing is as good as #1 on the menu. Guess that's why it's #1!

Wouldn't come here expecting award-winning food, but there's a reason for the four stars: cheap, fast, convenient, and yummy. Oh, and you can make a Teaway run afterwards, like I usually do - it's just a few blocks down. If you haven't tried this place for pho yet, put it on your list!
author: Tina Y.

description:
I come here because this is as good as it gets in the area. I don't like my pho soup filled with salt and MSG, and this place has the least amount compared to the one in the area.  

I tried many pho places and most of them either put the noodles straight from the fridge, or the meat is overcooked. I normally order #17, pho tai which is rare steak. The steak is well done when served, so I order it on the side. However this means that the steak will be medium, since the soup does not stay hot long enough to cook the meat. 

Overall it is still better than most places in the area.
author: Tony L.

description:
I've been here a handful of times and have gotten take out WAY more than that - Kevin's is always consistently good. Recently, they've been rather popular, for good reason!

The spring rolls are always freshly made with fresh ingredients. (pro tip #1, call 5 minutes ahead of time and they'll be ready as you walk in the door - because of this, spring rolls are a staple in my diet now; pro tip #2: if you like spicy, unload some Sriracha into the peanut sauce....NOM!)  

The broth of the pho is always flavorful but not overly greasy tasting. (pro tip #3: if you order take out with a beefy pho, you may want to warm the broth a bit before you throw in the raw beef - otherwise it probably won't cook all the way through) I've never been a big fan of chicken pho (pho ga?), so I haven't tried it here, but a trusted source gets it every time she goes.

I recently had a 3 color drink to finish a meal here. If you're craving one, it will definitely satisfy, but for sweets and sweet drinks it may be worth checking out some of the boba places in the neighborhood. (T pumps is just a block away)
author: Max S.

description: Best pho joint in the Sunset. I'm here multiple times a week and it never disappoints. Friendly staff as well!
author: Alisha L.

description:
Their pho is cheap and the broth is SOOOOOO yummy.... Awesome hangover food.

Other comments: The restaurant is pretty big and the service is fast. I love that they have a stash of spoons/chopsticks since I kept dropping my spoon in my broth.
author: Jolene L.

description:
I've lived near this place for over a year, but whenever I've needed my pho cravings satisfied, I usually go to the one across the street from this, PPQ. So after numerous tasty visits to PPQ, I finally decided I need to be fair and give this place a shot. 

So when I came here, I couldn't decide what I wanted, so I decided to judge based off the pictures. And after a few minutes of browsing the menu, I decided to go with the Beef Stew. While this is not really a Pho dish, it would at least give me a feel for how good their food is. Let's just say that I definitely loved what I got but it didn't blow me out of the water. 

Whether or not this is better than PPQ is tough to say for now. I will definitely have to try the actual Pho here before making that assessment but what I can say is that their stew was delicious so I expect great things from their Pho as well.
author: Gajan K.

description:
I have tried lots of Pho throughout San Francisco and beyond. 

.. and I always end up back here.

The broth is amazing. The boba is great. The price is extremely reasonable. 

I always order a medium 17 with Thai iced tea boba.

Also, it really is the fastest to go food. I can call when I am a few blocks away, and it's ready to go in less than five minutes.
author: Kathleen A.

description: I practically live here. I go here at least once a week and I've been going here since I was born.  My mom at here 5 times a week when she was pregnant with me.  Every time I eat pho at another place I always compare it to kevins.  10/10 would bang.
author: Kira L.

description: #2! I usually call in for pick up since i live right around the corner and they usually tell me that it will be done in 5 mins. I hang up and walkover and BOOM it's there on the counter. Everything is packaged so nicely too, soup, noodles, garnishes, the raw meat. Their service is much better then PPQ across the street, i actually get acknowledged and get my food immediately!
author: Lily S.

description: It's close to home, quick service, food comes out quick, cheap, and tasty. I get the #17 pho on cooler days and #51a on any other day. Their dessert drink with coconut milk, red beans and jellies is also delicious!
author: Noji N.

description:
My favorite place for pho. Delicious, fast, cheap; I always leave a full & happy girl.

A note regarding meat, specifically beef:   #11 (well-done flank steak) is just strips of fat & tendon, no actual meat. Gross.  If you want slices of tender, delicious beef in your pho, get the brisket instead. Trust.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
This is good.. not quite great though.  When I visit SF with family, this is where we go for pho.   Consistent quality and decent service- it is run by Asians so I just expect to have them come for my order quickly, get me some tea and bring me my pho all within approximately 10 minutes. And that is what they have done.

Broth tastes just like it should.  Noodles soft yet chewy.  Give plenty of basil, cilantro, lime, chilies, and bean sprouts.  Decent prices about $5 for small bowl that is perfect if I'm not too hungry.
author: Kimberly C.

description:
How is it possible that this place has an average of 4 stars on Yelp?  It is the worst Vietnamese food I've had in the city.  My boyfriend agrees.  Neither of us are Vietnamese but we eat it once a week.  We love it.  This place was terrible.  I don't mind a bad atmosphere or bad service (this place has both) if the food is good (which it is not).  Therefore this place has nothing going for it.  Oh, except that it is cheap.  I'm pretty sure that's the only reason people like this place.  

I was in the mood for some fried fish, but they had none.  Fine.  I wanted banh mi (Vietnamese sandwiches), but they didn't have that either.  My boyfriend wanted crab pho, nope, sorry, no go.   Fine again.  We had the fried eggrolls.  They tasted like Chinese eggrolls, not Vietnamese.  My boyfriend had some beef pho.  It was awful.  In fact, it left a bad aftertaste in your mouth.  And there was an odd sweetness to it, as if they added cinnamon.  I had the pork bun (a rice vermicelli dish).  The noodles were cold and the pork was all fat.  The dish as a whole lacked flavor.  Nothing was spicy, which was a big disappointment.  Everything we had had no savory flavor and was way too sweet.  I kept adding hot sauce and I couldn't get the food spicy enough. 

We didn't even finish our meals.  We had a few bites, paid and went next door to get some pizza from Irving's pizza (now that IS good).  If you want good, cheap Vietnamese, try Sandy's on 9th and Irving.  Not much to look at but the food is consistently good and the family that runs it is very sweet.  I won't cheat on you again Sandy's!  It is just not worth it!
author: Melissa M.

description:
I went to this place a few times before, and the taste is pretty good. I was ticked off at one of their waitresses a bit because not once, but twice has she not given me water when I asked for it. Other than that, I feel like this place is very nice.

I'd personally like it if their serving was a bit bigger, but that's just me being greedy. Still a good place to eat, go try it yourself!
author: Kris T.

description:
This is as good as it gets for Pho

My wife loves it and she is incredibly fussy as is my 6 year old boy who is also intesely suspicious of change of any sort loves it for the chicken and rice and spring rolls

My little girl is never happier than when slurping noodles here

They manage to do brisk turn around with often long queues with charm and politeness - they never forget you.

The bowls arrive promptly with all the kit and no matter how frail you are when you arrive, when done you are set fair for the world.

And lunch for 4, $30 - not the usual SF ticket price 

Its not a place for fine dining though - but who really cares about that
author: Max A.

description: I like this place. It's not bad. But it's not something so ridiculously good either. I love their broth! The noodles are good as well. I would recommend the egg rolls before hand .
author: Anonymous ?.

description:
From what I heard Kevin's noodle house has better pho and PPQ has better "other food".  I can't say which is better since I have only had Kevin noodle house.  I would say like other Vietnamese pho places this one has fast service and food comes out super fast as well.  The pho has an amazing soup base and the portion is generous. The soup base taste meatier than other places and I think I can vouch there is no msg in the pho here.  I get a little reaction (almost like an allergic reaction) when I have too much msg, and this usually happens when I eat pho at other places but nothing here! Happy to say I will be coming back here again. 

What I recommend: pho with brisket and tendon. I think #12?
author: Jenny C.

description: My favorite local go to place for good pho. Perfect for post Tahoe trips or rainy or cold nights when you want something to warm you up. Service is quick.
author: Alice H.

description: Food was okay but the lady that rang us up gave us attitude when we asked for separate checks. The food was alright but the service.....not so much.
author: Stephanie H.

description:
less than a day after a homicide in front of this place, i sit for a bowl of hot pho. 
http://tinyurl.com/yc6pvn3

 today i broke a 12 hour fast so i order a large bowl of beef pho.
the place is packed by the way, so who says Asians are superstitious.
bad karma or not we gots to EAT baby!
so i sit and order.
quicker than you can say faster than a speeding bullet, a hot bowl of thinly sliced beef noodle soup is placed in front of me.
it really hit the spot
BUT two hours later i am parched bone dry and have to down much liquid. there was way too much MSG in that broth.
the dish was good but not as good as PPQ across the street.
which was closed for some odd reason.
the staff was inside the restaurant and the door was unlocked but they were not serving customers.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Fast service, great food. Also great prices. Kevins never dissapoints! 
The beef stew is to die for!!!
author: Katie C.

description:
My family has been coming to Kevin's for years and really enjoy the service and food.  However, since they closed and upgraded the restaurant the prices have gone up several times and the portions are smaller.  I'm very  disappointed.  10.00 for a rice plate?  Pho with almost no meat in it?  No.  
4 stars to barely 2.
author: Tina S.

description: Aside from my review about loving this place, which I still do, I just wanted to comment on their utensils. The chopsticks are sticky a lot of the time so I'll have to pour tea on a napkin and try to wipe them (even though that doesn't always make it better). That lack of cleanliness sometimes just bothers me but other than that, the pho is always great paired up with the less than 5 minutes it takes them to get your pho to you.
author: Amanda L.

description: This place has some of the best pho in the city for sure! Although I didn't like the deep fried egg rolls very much, the pho made up for it. (My bf liked them) I had the pho ga and my boyfriend had the beef pho which was ridiculous. I've never had beef pho that I actually liked and I thought it was delicious. I'll definitely be back.
author: Irina M.

description:
Will hit the spot at the right price. 6.95 for a x-large. The eggrolls are crack too. grilled pork chops over rice GOOO as well.

Food always comes out fast.

Been here many times, never a bad experience. Except that time my boy and his girl got into a fight...
author: Shock S.

description: Pretty solid. What appeared to be a long wait was only 10 minutes. They have iPads to take orders. They offer three pho sizes S M L. The small was good enough but for $7.50. He recommended the #2 even though I usually go for pho ga. The broth was delicious. Would come back if I were in the area!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Hands down one of the best pho places in town. It is a must have when in this part of the town and in the mood for hot soup. 
Today was much crappier weather in the city than in a past week, so after work made a stop to get some hot soup. Wow. I've been coming here for some time now and have never been disappointed. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes this type of food. Few times I did order something else from their menu, but it tasted the same to me as in other places, but their soups are off the damn chain. So do yourself a favor, try their soup, you won't regret it (I know I never do)
author: Abe L.

description:
I'm tough to please. Their pho is not the best, but it comes out FAST. I always appreciate that seeing as i'm always hungry.. 
Sometimes the broth comes out not hot enough so it doesn't seem to cook your noodles all the way.. I've been ordering beef stew with ho fun noodles lately because it's so cold out and this dish is super filling. It's not the best vietnamese beef stew with noodles, (go to Loi's for that) but my friends and I eat here every week so it suffices. 

Order the fresh spring rolls. The rice paper wrap here always seems to be just moist enough so it's not hard on the outside like at some vietnamese places.
author: Susy C.

description:
Favorite pho place in San Francisco. Cheap, comes out promptly, and delicious. I always get their seafood or vegetarian pho and it's absolutely delicious. Their plates of bean sprouts and basil are always fresh and they're also super nice. My sister is also very picky, and she loves their beef pho and rice plates. Place is also huge, I've only had to wait a handful of times (and for less than 5 minutes).

Only con is their chopsticks are sometimes sticky, but hot tea definitely does the trick!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
2 stars for their noodle soup dishes. 

their beef pho soup is not very good -- kind of salty, kind of soy sauce-ish, and all this grease floating around. meat quality of their steak in the pho is below average too, a little thicker and cut of meat doesn't seem as good. the price matches the taste ($5/for a bowl of small pho). their oyster sauce seems generic, consistency seemed off. 

friend got beef noodle soup, and it was also greasy, and the broth was sweet? which is a weird flavor for beef broth. 

i agree with some of the other reviews -- really not sure how this place got 4 stars. definitely do not think this is better than the average viet restaurant, both quality and taste are below average, although i have to admit their prices are very cheap. but it's not like pho is very expensive anyways. i would much rather pay an extra $2-3 for better quality & better tasting food.
author: sharon s.

description: This is my go-to for Vietnamese in the Sunset. I'm not a huge fan of pho, so I have tried a few of their other dishes and have been pleasantly surprised. They have great service, too! The coffee is strong and delicious. The servers don't bat an eyelash when you ask for egg noodles. And the meat in their vermicelli dishes is grilled and cooked thoroughly but not dry. Parking is great throughout the day and the large dining room makes it easy to get seating quickly.
author: Lourdes J.

description:
It's definitely fast service. The minute I order the Pho comes in like 5 minutes!

But their chicken broth pho dishes are only okay. I think the PPQ Pho place across the street does better with the chicken broth.

But! I their beef broth tastes good and their prices are great! So I definitely recommend this place!
author: Michelle L.

description:
This was the go-to place for pho when I was a SFSU student.  

8 years later, this is still my go-to place when in the city and when the fog calls for some warming up.  

Went on a short hike with some girlfriends on San Bruno Mountain and it was 36 degrees..BRRr!  We were chilled at the end of the hike so we decided on soup and ended up here..again.

Like always, seated promptly and given fast service.  Broth is so-so.  I've had better, but you can always doctor it up with things on the table.  Service is always attentive and quick.  Portions are more than enough and we always leave feeling satisfied.  

Will always be back for more...=)
author: LC B.

description:
Everytime I'm in the city & craving pho.. this is my go to place - LOVE THIS PLACE.
Their meat slices are generous & delicious.
This place is usually packed everytime I go which is a good sign ;)
author: Christina July K.

description:
I've been here a handful of times over the years, and it never disappoints when i want a bowl of comforting noodles. Their XL bowl really is EXTRA LARGE. and super yummy. the floor is clean, the bathrooms are clean. very nondescript, but also a nice place to with friends and and eat and chat. not a loud place, nor a hush hush kinda place. 

nothing super special, but when i'm in SF and want noodles, this is the place i like to go because it's not super special.
author: Vicky L.

description:
Kevin's Noodle House seems to have remodeled since I have been here, which is years ago. The restaurant looks better than it has in its previous years, but the restroom is still the same old ugly looking room. This restaurant is huge and could very well seat around 100 people. There's usually no wait at all even at lunch hour, which is amazing.

The beef pho is above average and is pretty good. I won't say it's amazing, but it's cheap and it really hits the spot good. The broth is nice and flavorful. The rib-eye beef quality is decent. This is a great place to go to get a quick and cheap meal. Only down side to this place is the parking sucks in this area.
author: Steven B.

description: Not only do the have great pho, but the place is clean and the service is good. Went for the first time just to get a to go order and will definitely be back to eat in. Fantastic neighborhood spot especially on those frequently foggy nights.
author: Jared C.

description: i got an egg and pork rice dish and it was pretty good. i dropped my egg though and they didn't want to give me another (probably fair...)
author: Sonya Z.

description:
[M]ona: 3.5 Stars
[W]ayne: 3 Stars
Average: 3.25 Stars

+ VERY Fast Service
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Spacious
 
[W] Kevin's Noodle House.....man there's like a million of these! This is a place to be if you want to get something quick and cheap. The nice thing about this type of restaurant is that they're usually open late. So when everything else fails, you can always rely on a pho place haha. Nothing really special about this Kevin's Noodle House from the rest. Their menu is the same as everyone elses, and the food as well. As an appetizer, we had some shredded pork spring rolls. Their #1 was the noodle soup with tripe and flank steak. Lastly, Mona had the smaller version of mine.
 
[M] Everything tasted pretty normal as usual. The only thing is that I usually enjoy the Shrimp Spring Rolls with the peanut sauce but the Shredded Pork Spring Roll was quite interesting as well. The noodle soup tastes like any other noodle soup with the raw bean sprouts, basil, tripe, tendon, and flank steak. Just remember to add that hoisin sauce and it'll taste even better : )
author: Mona C.

description: A bit of a wait, but the broth hits the spot. It's definitely one of the best pho places I've been to in SF to date. I also like the fact that they offer three different sizes of pho: I'll take a small for lunch, a medium for dinner, a large for when I'm hungover.
author: Margie C.

description: I'm from san jose. I've had plenty of better pho. This is without a doubt the best pho place on Irving near UCSF and SFSU. But nothing beats San jose pho! Great place to go after a long night with the homies. N'ah Mean?
author: Nicholas D.

description:
I ordered the Bún Gà Ch Giò (grilled chicken, fried egg roll, lettuce, carrots, and peanuts with vermicelli). I thought the noodles were a little bit under-cooked, but the chicken and imperial roll were tasty. 

I probably won't come back because the portions were tiny compared to many of the other Vietnamese restaurants I've been to. I finished everything in my bowl and still left hungry!
author: Stella L.

description:
I always got the combination one (eyeround beef , stripe ,meatball, etc.) 
I dont recommend the seafood ones~ not so good. 
I go to the locations on Westlake and Irving and the foods in general are not bad, but not anything special either. 
However, I dont like the service much because  waiters seem to be not so well in providing you good service.
author: Hallie N.

description:
Probably one of the better pho locations. Lots of seating. Clean(er) than other places. I've been here lots of times. It's a go-to place the morning after a night out the previous day. 

I usually get the rare steak pho or I'll do just the noodles in beef broth. Both tasty & portions are generous.  I like bean sprouts & usually I'm with other people who like bean sprouts too. What happened to giving  plate of bean sprouts for each pho order? They used to do that a while back. WHAT HAPPENED?! I mean I guess people don't finish it, but don't look at me like I'm crazy when I ask for more...PLEASE. 

For the most part, the staff is nice. There are some who are a little rude. You ask for something & sometimes they look at you funny AND don't respond back so you're not sure if they're going to come back with what you asked for or not. 

Parking usually sucks because it's on Irving & 19th Ave. I feel lucky when I find parking within 10 minutes. It's a very busy street. There's mostly metered parking & some residential parking.
author: Jessica A.

description: For the first time in forever I've finally had a bowl of phó! This is a really nice spot and very affordable! Great experience and great people! I recommend it!
author: Shaniah M.

description: Really good pho. Not the super-aromatic hard spice profile you get at Pho King, but amazingly meaty, and generous.
author: David G.

description: They'll only seat you if more than half your party is there. The fish sauce didn't really add much flavor to the vermicelli. The egg roll didn't have a lot of flavor either. But they gave a lot of meat in the 52A.
author: Emily L.

description:
Cheap, tasty, unpretentious food. Perfect.

Plus once the nice maitre d chased my girlfriend and I down twice to give us first my forgotten scarf then secondly her keys. Now that's service with a smile.
author: Tis T.

description:
Cheap and the food has a good weight to it - aka large quantities are served. 
Pretty good Vietnamese food on top of that so I would say coming here is very satisfying. It's always crowded but I've never had to wait long for anything here - except for the bathroom. But then again - I would say that that is mainly a ladies problem.
author: Gee H.

description: Service here is horrible. I went on a weeknight and wasnt offered a menu for ten minutes, got up and got my own menu, had to call the waiter over to take my order, wasnt brought any water, but the food came out quickly. The Vermicelli bowl was not made well, it didnt have a good sized portion of veggies, the chicken wasnt fresh and the rolls were chewy and there were only 2 small ones in the bowl. My boyfriend go the beef pho which was tasty and I did like the broth. We waited another twenty minutes after finishing our meal and was never brought the check. We went up front to ask for the check and pay. There are better spots in the city with way better service. Go across the street  and get decent service and better food.
author: M K.

description: Not a fan. Steak was chewy and undercooked. The rice was also undercooked and crunched when chewed. They didn't have wine or beer. I'd recommend going elsewhere.
author: Karen M.

description: Yay another good pho place in the city!! Came here for lunch with the bf and his friend. I ordered #51 from the vermicelli bowl section. The noodles are super fresh, soft, and not too sticky. The beef was a little on the salty side but was still tender. The portions here seem to be very big for the price you pay. I noticed on the menu they have a decent selection of boba drinks also. Gonna have to try one next time!
author: Marissa C.

description: Don't go. Just don't do it. Yes, the food may be cheap, but that's about the only good thing about this place. The servers are VERY rude, and when they say 'no' to a customer, it seems like they are scolding a little child.  I've never been treated like that as a customer and would advise you to never come to this place.
author: Stephanie A.

description: I love this place for pho and their food in general. I usually order spring rolls and a #2. Although parking is super hard to get around here it is definitely worth looking for it to go here. I also love that it is surrounded by so much other places with boba and easy to get here with bus. My family, friends, and I love going here to both walk around Irving and get a quick and delicious dinner so we can get boba before or afterwards.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
Awesome Pho that fills you up without robbing you of your wallet? sign me up!

2nd best pho in terms of their broth I've had so far (Its been forever, I haven't been able to find out which place had that heavenly pho from my childhood)..the one back home definately don't compare.

about 30 minutes by muni from my place but so WORTH it. The pho comes out super quick so that you're not starving as you wait. Good service :)

So many choices and damn reasonable prices. Hope to try their rice/vermicelli platter sometime soon.
My regular bowl is the #13 (Steak & Brisket). Not a big fan of tripe or meatballs and such.

shoot for a medium, if you're starving go for the large. It's HUGEEE.
author: Ellie C.

description:
not too experienced in the Pho world but i thought this place was really good. Drove by and decided to stop in, staff was super friendly and order came out really quick 
(less that 10 min) for takeout.

I got a thin steak pho and the BF had grilled chicken, shrimp cake and rice.
Pho was really hot and tasty got takeout and was still super hot when i got home.
rice dish was good but the shrimp cake was kinda blah.


definitely stop by this place if you need some pho its well worth it!
author: Adriana L.

description: I drove across town to go to Kevins Noodle House.  Been here before and I enjoyed it.  This time was so much different.  The staff is beyond rude and bordering on hostile in some cases.  The food was just okay.  My soup came out in about one minute from the time I ordered, so if you're in a hurry that is good.  Problem was that it wasn't prepared well.  The waiter was severely pissed off at everyone and everything.  Every time I had to ask for anything I was met with a serious attitude.  I also watched him yell at a party of 4 that was trying to sit down at a table that he didn't want them to sit at.  This was the worst possible experience of customer service I have dealt with.  I will not be going back.  If this waiter worked for me in my customer service oriented business, he would be dismissed immediately.
author: James L.

description:
Best pho in town, bar none. Dirt fuckin cheap, and the food is prepared damn near instantaneously. 
Got the worst self-inflicted hangover in your life? Order a #33, large and call me in the morning...
author: John E.

description: It was very good I got number 8 it was so good and it's cheap I got extra noddles for 1.50 and rice for the same price it was very good and the medium was big but it was so good that I didn't finish it but the thing that suck was that they didn't ask if we need anything they just brought are food and that's all and the guy left but it was good just for that they need to fix it
author: Rosalind B.

description: Big pho restaurant for people in the sunset. I come to this one because the wait is a lot shorter than the pho place across the street. The service is quick and there are many tables. This place has a lot of the typical Asian paintings for decor which I like instead of a bland wall. The bowls of pho are big and the broth is flavorful.
author: Jason L.

description:
Seriously?!  How did this place maintain a 4 star Yelp rating?!!  The beef slices are way over-cooked and the broth and beef all tasted stale and left that oily stale beef taste in my mouth for the rest of the night - yuck!  

On the positive side, service is friendly and fast, the place is very clean for an Asian restaurant and it is pretty cheap. 

I vote for Yummy Yummy or Turtle Tower over this place any day.
author: Rosalyn C.

description: we use to go to this place every time we had a car.we went here last weekend everything seemed fine like always but when I got home my mouth felt really strange kind of swollen and I had to eat a menthol cough drop before it went away. I had the runs and my tummy kept making rumbling sounds all night and had to use the bathroom. it lasted a full day. my husband said since I had the seafood noodle maybe the seafood was old but usually you can taste it. so we won't be going here for quite a while I think they changed the name of the place. might have changed owners.
author: Nellie J.

description:
True, southern Vietnamese pho joints are a dime a dozen.  But despite that, after checking it out, I think this is at the top of my list for the following reasons:

- Rare steak is lean (without all the fat trimmings).  I go the #17 and it was exactly how I wanted. 

- Super cheap (S,M, L bowls are $5.25, $5.95, $6.75).  And the large is huge!

- Broth is very flavorful and without that thick layer of oily bubbles floating on top that you often see elsewhere.

- Service is quick and the place seems pretty clean.

Can't ask for much more (except the fried egg rolls were just average).
author: F. P.

description: Definitely one of the best pho place I've been to - just happened to find the nearest one after leaving Golden Gate Bridge and driving south. Had #42 rice plate - excellent! The shrimp cake that was included with my rice plate was out of the world. Appetizer fried spring rolls were perfectly cooked. My friends had pho and said it was their best. Fast service and was busy during noon lunchtime on Saturday. Parking is hard to come by in the neighborhood area so be patient and will be worth the wait.
author: Bill M.

description:
Hands down-- best place to get pho.

Their broth is flavorful, yet light and isn't laden with msg. $5.25 S $5.75 M $5.95 L if I am not mistaken. A meal for two is less than $20-- you can't really beat that. They have many options of pho that you can choose from. I haven't ordered their rice plates or vermicelli bowls before, but their bowls of pho keep bringing me back. Their pho comes out ridiculously fast too... We order, turn our heads for a bit and see the server bringing out our orders!!!
author: Jay Z.

description: 5 stars for the amazing pho, 2 stars for the terrible sham of a bun they put out. I haven't found a worse grilled beef bun; meat was tough and chewy. Kind of dry, like they make the grilled meat ahead of time and they just throw it on top of the lettuce and noodles. Pretty much nothing else in the bun except for fish sauce and a bowl of chicken stock. GET THE PHO! Only thing worthwhile. Also had the grilled beef rice dish. Same tough beef as the bun.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
GREATEST CURE FOR A HANGOVER!

#1 Beef Pho with the beef on the side for extra rawness with hot chillies in the oil!

Das it! End of review
author: Brendan L.

description: Deeeeeeeelicious! My go to pho shop and the only pho shop in sf that my Vietnamese boyfriend approves of so far. I usually order number 2 or number 1. The sf location gives you more meat and the daly city location tends to give more noodles. Try the coconut shake!!!!!! It is the bomb dot com!!!!!!!!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Pho- good.  Huge portions.  Lots of choices.  Pictures for those who don't know what things are like...
Obviously very popular, every time I've been it's been packed.  
I can't say it's bad in any way, just not my favorite.
They lychee with pearl shake was very good.  

It's worth going.
author: Song H.

description:
I came to the restaurant, sat down, looked at the menu and ordered my bowl of Pho.  As I was trying to check in on my phone, the bowl of noodles have arrived.  It was amazing how fast they were.  The portion is perfect.  If you ordered a large bowl, it will fill you up.  

The broth was good but the meats were just ok.  I personally think the beef at PPQ across the street is still better.

Overall..............I would definitely come back.  As we were leaving the restaurant, my friend Robin asked, "Guess how much time is left on my meter?.............I put in half an hour."  We both looked at the meter and we still had 10 minutes left.
author: jason g.

description:
This place is so reliable. Every time I go I order almost the same thing so I don't need to look at the menu for that long. We all look up and he's already at our table ready to take our order. 

In less than 5 minutes (if it's a pho dish) the food is out and ready to eat. I love how fast it is, and it's consistent. 

If you want great customer service, you're going to the wrong place. Sometimes when we want the check, it takes a while, but you can always go up to the counter and pay. Make it easier on yourself. 

I've been getting Seafood fun (flat noodles). I forgot what number, but it's tasty if you want a different taste from the pho. If you want pho, number 1-4 are the best bets. 

Most Pho bowls can either be small, medium, or large. Sometimes the medium and the large seems the same in account of the noodles. 

If you want a good, dependable, tasty bowl of pho, come here and you'll be served right away!
author: Leanne K.

description:
Phobolous!

There's a lot of good Pho places in the city so when we had the craving while we were driving around Golden Gate Park, I checked the Yelp feature on the iPhone and this place came up on the first list. 

Located on Irving, where there's plenty of other good options but since we haven't been here before, we trusted the reviews. Parking is a pain but that's expected in this part of the Sunset District.

When we arrived, we noticed that there weren't that many diners, and when we received the menu, I had a bit of a trepidation since it looked exactly the same menu as Pho Huynh Hiep 3 in Daly City (2 star rating from me). I asked the server and she replied that it was the same owner.

My thought process was OK...the floor is clean and their restroom is a lot cleaner than the DC location so let's just give it a try. Service was quick, efficient and a lot friendlier here. The Pho was excellent as you can tell they use fresh ingredients here. What makes a good Pho for me is the broth, and this broth was alive. 

Yes, it satisfied our craving and we left home happy. We will definitely be back here for the Pho and the very clean restroom.
author: John G.

description:
My buddy ABD said this is his favorite Pho place in all of sf so we had to come here. It wasn't bad--the broth wasn't as flavorful as I wanted (nothing can beat my Pho Clement broth) and the meat was also alright. I would dine here again but i wouldn't go out of my way to make the trek there!

One thing I will say is that its brighter and cleaner then the janky-er pho places out there and I guess in that way they are more Americanized and i guess appealing, but sometimes if you want the real stuff, you gotta hit up those sketchy hole-in-the-wall joints!
author: An-Nhien L.

description:
I love their rice plate! Yummy, meat, shredded pork and eggs! The way to eat!

It just sucks that there is only one bathroom. Especially when you have a group of 6 and half of them wanted to go to the bathroom before we left.
author: Mandy D.

description:
I've been eating here for more than 10 years. The quality has gone down significantly. Beef selection is poor and the meat is tough. I am quite disappointed.

I usually order PHO #2 or PHO #3. But the slices of meat was really tough to eat this time. In the future, I will order the PHO with round slices and ask them to buy them on the side. I hope this will preserve the tenderness of the beef slices.
author: Janice T.

description:
Normally go across the street to the other pho place, but decided to go here when the other place had too long of a wait. I was pleasantly surprised. The pho is actually cheaper here than across the street. Service was good, and staff friendly.

I got the medium pho bowl which for a petite girl was just right. =) I always ask for the rare steak on the side and when they brought it out it was in nice large slices, and looked fresh, not frozen as some places have it. The well done flank was tasty, and the tripe ok. A little too long and stringy for my taste. I would have preferred it cut up more.

Overall good place. Didn't have to wait, and yay! they accept credit cards - Visa or MC.
author: Jenn D.

description:
When my bf and I came back from Lake Sonoma one day we were sooo wiped and tired from drinking in the sun. We were feeling very sick for some reason. (I think it was from dill havarti cheese that was left in the sun....and we drunken munchie devoured it without thinking)

We didn't have any appetizing food in the fridge that wouldn't upset our stomachs too much. So thanks to friend's helpful reviews and the fact that it is about 3 blocks from our apt..... it was match made in heaven.

+We ordered 2 large chicken pho togo..... WOW... they are large... 
+++CHEAP.... $10 for 2.... amazing
++Mmmmm spicy delicious sauce *droool*
+++ I actually dont really know if it was necessarily "better" for my stomach, because the pain switched from upset stomach.....to pant bursting button uncomfortable stomach
++++++++ Down the street from me. lol

Conclusion: I would love to go inside and check the place out and try some other dishes. Maybe I should go there for dinner tonight.....
author: Julia D.

description:
My go to place for pho and bun
Good portions and cheaper than the competition and it's fast 
My only "complaint" is that the mama san and husband who run the place are not friendly and in fact very unpleasant and even rude.the man looks like he hasn't smiled in years and she's never nice which is strange
author: james m.

description: Came here a few times and it was okay. I always preferred to go to the one across the street but all my friends liked it here so I decided to check it out. I think around the second time I came I was eating my pho and I saw a fly in my soup. I thought that was the most disgusting thing ever because I've never experienced anything like that. I mean of course I also thought I saw wrong. But when I went the other day I saw another mini fly on my lettuce in my rice plate. After that I'm just never going to go back there.
author: Sul L.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a child! They have pho, rice dishes, and vermicelli dishes.  

Everytime I come here, I order the #1, Extra Large Pho (Hold the tendons, please!) 
Always consistent and also satisfying. Their Vermecelli with pork and egg rolls is also excellent.

One complaint though. That old Asian man ALWAYS forgets to bring out water when we ask. 

If you're in the Sunset and craving pho, this is the place to go!
author: Daniel S.

description: I haven't had pho in 2 years, because I've been out of the country. Glad that my first bowl back was here. From what I remember, not all pho places have al dente rice noodles with great tasting broth like this place. Their pho is also quickly made, cheap, and perfect for a cold summer day in San Francisco.
author: April D.

description: I have been here so many times!!! The food is good, the price is amazing, and it comes out fast. This place is almost always busy and the staff efficient. Rated four stars since the place could use a little updating for the dining area, and the staff can seem very abrupt, mostly cause only a handful of them speak english, but still a great spot!
author: Sam K.

description:
The best overall quality to quantity to price Pho around. It's fast, friendly, and consistent. I've never complained about the food because it always came out the same way so you'd know what to expect each and every single time.

They have plenty of tables so there's room to accommodate larger parties. The food is quick to come so even if there's a line, people are usually in and out shortly. 

I think in all 12 years of coming here, I've only ordered four different meals. The #1 for it's all around variety of everything to fight hunger with, and the #38(?) because beef stew is amazing. I can never recall the number of the rice plates by memory, but it's always either the Porkchop with Crab Cake or the Shredded Chicken, both with a fried egg. 

This is the perfect default restaurant a regular can have. Whether it's finding a place to eat after a long day of work or celebrating your 18th birthday because your friend who was supposed to throw you a party totally forgot and decides to make it up to you with the best meal $6.25 can get you, Kevin's Noodle House never disappoints.
author: Andrew A.

description: What to eat on a chilly night in SF? PHO. Good portions, awesome prices, attentive service. This place is also slightly bigger and you won't have to wait, unlike it's competition across the street.
author: Sarah J.

description: I always get the pho ga every single time. It's usually consistent, but on occasion, I find dark meat and I HATE dark meat. So, I usually just take those pieces out. But, other than that service is ok and the food is cheap. Make sure you're wearing a jacket or sweater or something because it always feels cold inside.
author: Fallon P.

description:
Probably my favorite pho place to go in the city
only problem is, i am never in the area.
but for all the occasion that i did eat at this place, the pho was great.
broth was hot, noodles were not sticky
they added more soup and less noodles over time.
probably to get cut back on cost.
i always get #1 with either ice coffee or the spring rolls, but usually just the #1

alot of my friends dont like coming here because they say the owner is horrible and the service is horrible. i personally never had a bad experience here.

more that willing to come back, if i am ever in the area and planning to get pho with a friend.
author: Andi I.

description: Great food for a great price. The wait wasn't that bad on a Sunday afternoon and the service was quick. We got our food right away.
author: Alana R.

description: So good! Staff is always friendly and fast. #17 is great and the fresh spring rolls. Super quick and delicious meal. I always recommend to friends.
author: K I.

description:
I've never had so much amazing pho in my life and it's all due to this place. I'm always looking for a great bowl of pho that's convenient and quick, especially when it's cold and raining out.

My typical order consists of a medium sized #13 Tái, Gu - Thin slices of steak, well-done brisket. It's delicious and cheap! You'll notice that after you order, about 5 minutes later, your pho is ready. 

The broth is so savory and flavorful. I like the thin noodles in my soup and the beef is nice and tender as it cooks in the broth.
