The sprouts, jalapeños, lime, and basil leaves are fresh and delivered on a plate for you. It's also a huge portion for me, I typically leave some noodles in the end cause it's a bit too much.

I've heard the vermicelli and rice dishes are okay, but I really only come here for the pho. I've had a few of their drinks, and I'd recommend the watermelon slush drink with boba. It's literally tastes like a blended fresh watermelon. It's delicious and refreshing.

Service is very quick, as soon as you enter, they usually seat you. It's one large room, so you can see which seats are open. The older employees give you tea and cups, and the younger ones take your order. If you get pho, it's really speedy, plates take a bit longer, but you'll get your food quickly.

Oh, and everything is really cheap. Pho is around $5-$6 depending on the size, which is a great price for a filling meal.
author: Andrew T.

description:
I went here reluctantly for the first time after my favorite PPQ, across the street, had a waiting line and we were short on time. The extra large Number 1 was frakking huge and the broth was terrific. The beef servings, including tendon, were very generous as well, however many of the beef slices were unfortunately tough, removing one star.

The service was quick but the waiter forgot a clearly ordered round of waters all around. My wife however was not impressed with the broth or the fattiness if the brisket. 

I cannot remember these issues at PPQ, so while this place is OK as a back-up, PPQ remains my favorite.
author: Glenn H.

description:
Went in for lunch with son & daughter #1 and the place was packed.  That's already a good sign!  Started with fried shrimp balls & fried fish cakes. Yummy without grease. Nice & crunchy without oily batter.
I had beef pho with tripe. Broth was good without being too salty. Plenty of noodles and meat.
Service was as fast and as polite for a Vietnamese restaurant. Order taken correctand the younger workers delivered the food quickly.
Prices were cheap...2 appetizers & 3 pho's under $35!
author: Lana H.

description:
I always get rice plates. Unfortunately I'm not a fan of pho (I know, crazy right?). There's something about large ingredients in soup that rubs me the wrong way. Nevertheless, I always get a beef rice plate with an egg on top. Heaven in my mouth on a hungover Sunday. I end it off with a Taro slushy boba drink.

Maybe it's just me, but the people that work at these places don't seem too happy at all! And the servers (different from the waiters) don't say a word. It's odd, but hey, the food speaks for itself I guess 'cuz we just keep on comin' back!
author: Jennifer A.

description:
Good solid Pho. Had a medium bowl, Dac Biet Bo Vien, Combination beef with beef balls. Very good. Lots of noodles, meat and had a good aroma. Service was attentive, the place is clean, well lit and spacious. Not something you can say about all vietnamese joints. 

Prices I noticed were also pretty good. I think my medium bowl, which was a very decent size was only $6 I think. Definitely a good stop for a cold day.
author: Phuoc K.

description: This place never ever seems to fail me. It's hella busy during lunch hours, but after the rush dies down, the wait is 5-10 mins. My boyfriend and I always get pho and it comes out within 5 mins. The service is decent and the restaurant is evenly spread out. We finish our food, pay, and then leave. Hands down the best pho place!
author: Lisa K.

description: As good as phö gets! My go to spot! Grab a bowl of the beef stew with rice noodles-- my fav! Shakes are a plus!
author: Estebander M.

description:
A huge bowl of delicious soup for $6.50 is definitely worth at least 4 stars in my book! I was also tempted by the $3 smoothies/shakes but was trying not to over-order... It took me about 10 minutes to park (at 7 PM on a Thursday night) and my parking spot was still VERY sketchy but that is not their fault... I came in and ordered take-out and my food seemed to be ready moments after I ordered it. The gentleman taking my order was super nice too!

I ordered the simplest chicken pho. It came in a huge bag with one big container of broth, one container of chicken, noodles, etc, and a bag of other goodies. I ate some of the fresh sprouts from the bag on my way home!

At home, I devoured nearly the entire huge soup. I shared a few pieces of the yummy chicken with Ruggles which made him a very happy dog. The fresh basil from the "goody bag" was delish and the side sauce was addictive too. I wish I lived a bit closer so that it would make sense for me to come back more often!
author: Meghan P.

description: This is my go to spot for hangovers. After a night of drinking, I always need a big bowl of pho the next morning and Kevin's is always my spot. They are SUPER quick and their pho is good enough. Not to mention, they are pretty damn cheap too. The only thing I'm not a huge fan of is the service. But at the same time I don't really care because I'm hungover. Just need someone to bring me the food, no need for the chit chat or smiling.
author: Lina L.

description: Good pho. Came fast. Nothing particularly remarkable about it. Given the reviews and recommendations we had expected more. The broth was flavorful, with a strong taste of star anise, but on par with most other good pho we've had. I would have no problem going again, but also wouldn't seek it out either.
author: Randall K.

description:
good pho, cheap prices, open relatively late!

I've had better pho, but for the neighborhood, it's open relatively late, so if you are craving and you don't want to go elsewhere it'll get the job done.  

Service is quick...get in, get out, what more do you want?
author: Jason Y.

description:
Come here once in a while with family.
We usually order the Pho special and side orders of their Spring rolls and Deep fried egg rolls. The atmosphere is casual and service is friendly. The food is good, and we always leave satisfied.
author: Nancy F.

description:
My most visited place to have that hot , delicious pho!

Quick seating, quick orders, quick service - fantastic!

Sizes and prices are positively mind-blowing to me since Australia deso not serve big servings at such a cheap price as the ones here.

Another line that's worth the wait!
author: Erika K.

description: Go here for the pho--22A is AMAZING. Yes, the broth is great as everyone else has said. I love simple, flavorful soups and this one hits the spot. Spring rolls are alright--not terribly large or as fresh as the other Vietnamese place I go to. Charbroiled rice plates are okay, but lack again in flavor and portion. PHO. Get the pho here!
author: Liz L.

description:
Never was really a fan of Pho. I have only been dragged to eat the venerable Vietnamese national dish because of my other half's penchant for soupy noodles. That said, I made a discovery that makes me want to come back here every week.
The vermicelli (dry noodle) dishes did for my western palate what KFC did for asian palates as a crossover cuisine addiction. 
Best broth I have ever had. Maybe its MSG. Whatever it is, it's delicious. So much so that I make noises when I drink it. 
What are you waiting Pho?
author: Randy C.

description:
I use to go to this place all the time but recently stopped when I wanted to try out other places. Their soup is tasty and they give a lot of noodles, meat and soup. 

I recommend their beef stew or just their regular number 1. They also serve tapioca there.

This place is great for groups because of all their seating, they have a restroom and the place does not look dirty. Located on Irving so theres a lot to do after youre done eating.
author: Tim M.

description:
This place is more of a 3.5 but still pretty good. The pho broth was delightful, was not to salty, had a balance of flavor, and was not filled with msg. But the downer was that the meat was dry and the noodles was not the best pho noodles i've had. But overall pretty good, especially compared to pho in Orange County. Prices range from small 5.30- 6.75 for a large ( pretty good prices for the portion)

Summing things up: Good pho, great prices, and huge portions! I would definitely come back and might make this my new place for pho when i move to SF :)
author: Reiko n.

description: Been here a few times, the food isn't bad. However every time I've dined here, the service has become progressively worse. My fiancé and I waited just over half an hour to be seated. Saturday night; I get it. When we were seated, we waited about 10 minutes before they took our order. They forget half of it. I tried getting the busboy's attention on three occasions where we literally made eye contact every time and he ignored me. I finally asked for the check. Waited for about 10 minutes before we decided to get up and pay at the counter. That took about to 10 minutes. The only good factor was that he apologized and gave us a slight discount on our meal.
author: Paola A.

description:
This place can get crowded quick!! We had a reservation for about 30ish. Yes, it's a big number but we called ahead of time. When we got there, the restaurant was completely full and we still had to wait 20-30 minutes for all of us to be seated. I forgive them though; can't expect a restaurant to hold 30 spots at the same time. They worked fast to clean up and get us all seated asap.

I like this place for their flexibility! HUGE PLUS! Noodles and soup come out hot only after a little while after you order. You can get extra noodles, extra broth, and ask for your meat on the side uncooked as well. Good job KNH!
author: Sally C.

description: Solid pho at a reasonable price. I always order their number 1 (typically the combination pho at most places) with extra beef balls, and it's never let me down. I especially like the texture of their noodles, which are slightly chewier than at other pho places.
author: Nevin L.

description: Nice job on cleaning off the tables for every new guest.  They turn around tables quickly here so if there is a wait, it's not too long.  Nice and pleasant staff.  Got the 13 steak and brisket.  Tasty.  Medium size was pretty good size.  Price point was good too.  Also got a viet coffee.  Delicious.  Definitely a solid pho spot in San Francisco.
author: T. E.

description: This is my favorite pho place in the bay. The prices are great, the service is insanely fast, and the food is downright addicting. Me and my boyfriend have become regulars here. We always get the beef brisket pho and the spring rolls. Yummy.
author: Victoria V.

description: Pretty good pho, but not to the quality of many other places. It get's really busy with high school kids often, but take out is super fast and big portions.
author: Jeanine O.

description: I usually go to Westlake, but at Irving St. very friendly service, that is why I give them 5 stars. Shrimp cake was delicious by the way
author: Francis A.

description: Pretty good pho, nothing CRAZY here. They have a boba selection if you're craving something sweet here. Great service, super fast. 4 stars because they're good, not 5 because it lacks of uniqueness from other pho shops.
author: Lauren H.

description: Kevin's is great! There is always a line out the door here. I come here about once a week and it has the best Pho in the city and also the cheapest. Love this place.
author: Courtney H.

description: I love pho and this place tops my all time favorite list. Good job you guys, keep up the hard work.
author: Andrew P.

description:
I've never really been around this part of SF, and apparently there are TONS of pho restaurants in this street. Since me and my friends went on New Years, the other pho place we wanted to go to wasn't open for lunch (New Years = LOTS of hungover young adults who want pho... still don't understand why it was closed??) 

Lucky for us, one of the girls is familiar with basically every pho place you can think of in SF. We walked a couple of blocks and ate here. Everyone ordered pho but me so I was a little upset that the old man who took our order mistook the extra thick noodles I asked for, for pho noodles. I was already upset because some random guy during NYE kicked my foot and caused my nail to detach from my big toe (sorry I know gross), but my food made my mood much better.

I ordered regular noodles with basically everything on it. I really liked the shrimp and the crab meat in the soup. I even ate most of the chicken meat (chicken is my least favorite food). Overall, food was great, noodles were delicious, service was good; nothing really bad to say about this place.
author: Michelle R.

description:
To begin with, I really don't know how to judge pho places. I mean I always go with Vietnamese people so I guess they never take me to bad ones so I haven't had something too bad. I mean seriously it can't be that hard. Soup, beef, noodles - that's about it.

I got the #3 which was just pho with a whole bunch of different cuts of beef. I had a good time takling with friends and eating some food on a warm summer day.
author: Nina Y.

description: Love this place. Been coming to this location for close to 10 years now:)  pretty much eat the same #13 Pho with rare steak and some fresh spring rolls on the side:). Rarely deviate but when I do it's normally towards a rice plate of some kind. Pho is usually my weekend treat or when the SF weather is cold or just to nurse a hangover. Also get a drink to go. Avocado shake is filling. Or even Vietnamese iced coffee:). The only thing that cracks me up every single time I go is when I ask for a glass of water it usually takes 3 tries;). LOL
author: walleworld w.

description: I usually get my random cravings for Pho and I had a really bad one this time.  Sometimes I can get pretty picky and upon trying this place, it was pretty good!  I thought it was one of the cleaner pho places I've been.  Beware, it can get pretty crowded and busy at times.  We had a bit of wait.  I thought the servers were pretty nice and checked up on us.  The food was pretty good with good flavor.  The noodles were not overcooked.  (I've had places were the noodles ended up being soggy).  I always asked for my meat on the side so that they give the raw beef on a plate with it.  This way, I can swueeze a bit of lime juice and cook it in my soup the way I like it especially since this way the beef is still tender and juicy.  (I usually like some of my beef rare and recommend it for those that like their beef that way to give it a try if you haven't already!) Just make sure you dont wait to long or the soup cools down and will not be hot enough to cook the meat at all.  And, oh boy do I love tripe :)!  Overall, what more can I ask for? Definitely would come back if I have another pho craving, which I do get often :)! Hey, who can resist a good bowl of pho?
author: Teresa W.

description:
It's simple, folks:

hands down ---- THE BEST PHO IN SAN FRANCISCO.

Always super-packed. Food comes out promptly. 

PHO = Best cure for a hang-over.

The beef pho is the absolute best here in the city. I live next to another pho spot, but I'll travel all the way to Kevin's Noodle House for THEIR delicious pho. 

The thai iced-tea was alright. My bf quite enjoyed their Vietnamese coffee. 

Be sure to order the spring rolls!
author: Drea B.

description:
Probably one of my favorite pho places in S.F. I come here time to time with gf whenever shes craving pho. I order #1 while my gf orders the seafood one. Portions are large depending on the size of the bowl and reasonably priced. My favorite appetizers are the shrimp cakes. Service is decent-good sometimes.

If you want something quick and filling, this is the place for you.
author: Jae C.

description: I always order the pho ga, the ultimate comfort food, which always is accompanied by fresh herbs and sprouts. The efficient staff are wonderful and accommodating, and the service is excellent. It is the perfect place to warm your belly on a foggy day.
author: Jen O.

description: Big large bowl.  Very consistent. Across the street charges extra for hot sauce "satay broth".  As soon as I piled the chili paste into the broth this soup came alive!  Huge portions too.
author: Johnny B.

description:
This is probably one of the best Kevin's Noodle Houses in their chain of restaurants. The service is usually pretty good, and the food is quick. They offer a large variety of Vietnamese rice and noodles. I havent tried their rice plates, but I know that their pho is one of the best in the city. 
The prices are decent, not too bad.
author: Bik H.

description:
#18 or rice platter! 

Parking is easy to find if you go at the right time. Service is fast.
author: Yolanda L.

description:
I usually love the pho broth and enjoy the noodles. At Kevin's, both are equally awesome. Service is also astonishingly fast and efficient. 

Definitely a gem worth coming back to.
author: Eric F.

description: Pho was decent. But when we (party of 2) wait 45 min for pho as 5 parties seated after us are getting served, it's just not worth it.
author: Nam N.

description:
Summary: 
This place is one of my hidden San Francisco treasures.  I have been eating here for over 15 years - yes kids, it's been around at least that long - and it's been my favorite, consistent go-to phó restaurant during that time.  

Pros: 
- Familiar faces working here, day in day out, year in year out.  
- Consistent, always excellent phó.  Other very good menu items if you're not in the mood for phó.  
- 4 types of phó noodles to choose from - thin and wide rice, thin and wide egg.  (My current favorite is the thin egg noodle)
- Clean!
- Asian families, teenagers, hipsters, older folks, everyone! come here to eat.  It's comfortable, hits the spot and provides great value for the money.  I've brought friends, family, international visitors, and even a first date (she demanded phó) here over the years.  A neophyte friend of mine didn't say a word during his entire consumption of his first ever bowl of phó (combination phó with thin rice noodle, extra large) and only when he was finished did he finally speak, proclaiming "Excellent!".
- Seafood noodle soup for the pescatarians among us.   Hold the beef!

Cons:
- As with most phó houses, limited choices for vegetarians.  Lettuce, bean sprouts, basil, and carrots only get you so far.

This place used to be called Pho Hyunh Hiep but now goes by Kevin's Noodle House.  Thankfully the food and staff are unchanged even though the place was refurbished about the same time as the name change.  

Go on a cold day, get your phó on, and revel in the comfort that such a simple, delicious food provides. 

For those of you that are new to the game, I would suggest either the standard sliced beef phó or the combination phó with either the thin rice or thin egg noodles.  Their dry vermicelli bowls are a good introduction too.  Enjoy!
author: Xaman E.

description: I got the beef egg noodle soup. I would say it was okay--it was too sweet for what I'm used to, but the egg noodles were good. Service is alright, but fast so you won't be waiting for long for your order.
author: Michelle Z.

description: Great service, excellent Pho.  For locals, this is ubiquitously known as a Vietnamese food hotspot, and whenever my family and I can't decide on where to go, this is our go-to spot.  Very casual atmosphere and reasonable prices.
author: Matthew W.

description: Much small portion than before... The large pho is like a small/medium pho in other restaurants.
author: Cof Y.

description: This has been my go to pho place in sf for years. It's the only one in sf that doesn't rely on msg for flavor. Their pho is delicious, quick, cheap and their drinks are fresh. Yum!
author: Jen P.

description:
This is just on the Beef Vermicelli/Bun: The meat was not good, no spice to it at all, lots of chewey/fatty bits I had to spit out, the egg roll was teeeeny, and the noodles were oddly dry/cold (as though cooked in a big batch and then not reheated for my meal). 

Sunflower has a the same dish that is 5-star superb in comparison (tasty spiced beef, huge egg rolls, great noodles - honestly, all the same ingredients just much better quality), and the same price!!!

Apparently Pho is the way to Go here... if there is a next time
author: Sarah X.

description:
A long time ago, I would go to pho joints for the rice plate.  Eating a large bowl of soup for dinner was just plain stupid to me.  But look at me now, a grown ass adult that loves pho and probably goes to Kevin's every other week.

Kevin's never disappoints me at all.  99% of the time you don't have to wait for a table, the staff is fast in taking orders, if you're getting pho it'll come out a couple of minutes after the order is placed, and the price is great for anyone on a budget.

Here is my standard meal (I honestly don't know why I open the menu anymore.  I already know what I want and I doubt it's ever gonna change):

Medium #13 - Tái, Gu - Thin slices of steak, well-done brisket:  The broth has a good beef flavor and the rice noodles are cooked just the way I like them.

#A2 - Gi Cun - Fresh spring rolls:  Rice paper is fresh and not stale.  Tip:  Add some srirachi to the peanut sauce for a bit of a kick.  You can thank me later.

Vietnamese iced coffee:  Coffee for the true java/caffeine heads.  Be ready to feel your heart pumping and being wired for the next couple of hours.

And if you don't like pho, you can always get a rice plate.  Those are always delicious too.  I've been to a bunch of pho restaurants and all I can say about them is pho-get about it! (okay, not a funny joke)
author: Suzi K.

description:
Seriously? This place has a four-star review average?

Went here with a group of people, we didn't want to wait at PPQ across the street. 

We should've waited. 

We all ordered different rice plates. I had the "grilled" pork chops with sunnyside egg over rice. The pork chops looked like they were pan-fried, were incredibly salty, and just not good. The egg was perfectly cooked though. 

Chicken soup that came with all our meals tasted like MSG soup. Let the soup cool off, then drink it; you'll see what I mean.

Bf ordered "grilled" pork, also looked like it was pan-fried. He found a short, curly hair in his rice after he ate half his plate. Well, we all lost our appetite after that. 

Service was okay. 

I wouldn't come back here. Ever.
author: Evelyn C.

description:
Great Pho Dac Biet! Similar to Pho Dac Biet in at Pho An in Bankstown, Sydney Australia!!

Would definitely recommend!

FYI Tip around 15% or higher
author: Steven T.

description:
Went there on the search of great pho - 7.5/10 on the pho scale. 
Poor vegetarian options.
author: Sid R.

description: Fast service and tasty Pho! It's also really nice because you can order a small and it's the perfect size! I like the steak Pho :)
author: Bonnie N.

description: Good stuff. Bust pho in tone and at these prices, excellent value. I've had pho half as good, for twice the cost at other places.
author: Justin O.

description: It was ok. The spring roll was all noodles. The pho was decent but it was expensive compared to Bolsa however I am told that is the normal price for Northern Cali.
author: Mickey D.

description: I love this place, they hand check every dish for cleanliness. The food is good tasting.  Staffs are very friendly, and professional. They love our kid :). Highly recommended. Pho is good.
author: Tek C.

description:
My rating is based on the grilled pork chops over rice.

I'm reserving 5 stars for a place that is comparable to Super Bowl that sadly closed a few years ago in Cupertino. The pork chops dish at Kevin's Noodle House is flavorful but a bit too fatty and greasy for my taste. I also wish that they gave more of the vegetables that are soaked in vinegar because it cuts through the grease and fat aftertaste left from the pork chop in your mouth.

The red bean drink is super tasty. I like that the red beans are blended into the milky drink. It's the best I've had in LA and SF.
author: Margaret R.

description:
Great pho joint

Delicious broth, egg rolls are even tastier than they look, chicken wings FTW!!!

Super cheap!

Service is hit and miss as expected. Had to get up for a drink and young waiter was standoffish.

definitely worth checking out!
author: Dan A.

description:
Cheap and cheerful and delish fresh pho...YUM
we stumbled in here late on a Thursday night...rainy outside..and we were so pleasantly surprised by the good service and really yummy food. The Thai iced tea with boba was great too!
author: Koshika S.

description: Best bowl of pho I've had in a while!!! Super yummy broth. They give you a lot of fixings and I love noodles so I always order an extra side. I love pho and this place is on par. Thanks Kevin's for a good big bowl of hot delicious soup!
author: Vanessa C.

description: This is the place to go for pho on irving street. I ordered my favorite, the rice noodle beef ball pho and it was fairly good. I ordered the small and it filled me up, but then again I am a relatively small girl. The pho tasted msg free and wasn't too greasy either. However, the workers weren't really attentive and it wasn't a busy day either. I had asked one of the workers if my order was coming out soon (seeing how everyone in my party of 4 got their order already) and he ignored me. Then at the end of the meal, my friend had asked the waiter if he could split the bill and the waiter said okay, but he never came back. We ended up having to flag down another waiter to do it. This issue wasn't too significant and didn't really bother me that much though. In sum, I would definitely come back if I'm craving pho on Irving!
author: Cindy L.

description: This place is great! love the Pho.  Sick? Down? Cold? this place will bring you up.  The Buhn is also great here (vermecilli bowls).
author: Jaime F.

description:
Do you have a cold?
Is your nose stuffy?
Fingers so cold you can't feel them?

Then its pho time at Kevin's noodle house. Whenever I have a stuffy nose, or its just freezing outside, I come for some Pho.

Service is quick, every time I've visited I've never been ignored or had a problem with staff. Sipping on warm tea while waiting 5-10 minutes for my Pho. When I'm sick with a stuffy nose, I take a handful of napkins and put them next to me while I eat my pho. By the time I'm done with my soup, I've used up almost all the napkins, and my nose is cleared up. 

Yummy yummy pho. I'll be back soon.
author: Sophia G.

description: Always had a decent bowl of Pho here, mostly the beef combo which is pretty much the same  but a few change of ingredients and its goes to number#.....etc. Service is friendly and meals always come out under 5 minutes or less, no matter how crowded in here. The rolls, fried or the spring rolls are pretty decent. This place is much roomy compare to the one across the street. Prices are excellent and is very good value for a meal at lunch or dinner.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
Kevin's is definitely one of my favorite places for a bowl of pho. Their broth is always consistent, tasty and rich. My daughter and her SO come here often and hold in high in their recommendations for comfort, deliciousness, price and quick service. We all do :)
I stopped by last week with one of my sweetest, but pickiest friends and we both got the beef stew and split the fried rolls. They were out of the thick noodles and we got the rice noodles instead with the stew. OMG, I love how rich and soupy it was without being heavy. Lots of meat, tendon, a couple of carrots and as always plenty of sprouts, jalapeno, basil and lime on the side. My friend loved it and was very happy.
I have never had to wait to be greeted or seated by employees there. The food comes along speedily.
It's my go to.
author: Betsey L.

description:
Starving on a cold day, my friends and I decided to bus to irving for a quick fix. (Yes, bus. 3 college students without cars, lame. -___- ) 

I always get the beef stew with egg noodle (#33 I believe) at the westlake one, so I thought I'd get it here too. Since it's basically the same restaurant at different locations, I was expecting it to be just as good. Sadly, I was sort of disappointed. The taste was pretty different from the westlake location. It wasn't TOO much of a difference, but it was really noticeable to me. All I tasted was carrots. I'm not a big fan of carrots so I noticed it right off the bat, I don't remember the beef stew ever had carrots, but if it did, it wasn't this much where it drowned in the stew. But they gave me a lot of meat, so that's a plus.
My friends had no trouble with their pho, so I guess it was just me.

I wouldn't mind coming back here though, just won't be ordering their beef stew.
author: Harriet W.

description: The noodles taste like shit and overpriced , wouldn't recommend people to go there..............
author: Pip P.

description:
I'm kind of surprised that I haven't reviewed this place yet, but since I went back to the city recently and ate here, I've decided that they deserve a review.

In all actuality, this is your typical Vietnamese restaurant with cheap prices and huge portions. Your orders will arrive in under ten minutes, the place is decently clean, and if you're a major meat-eater, they give you hellaaaa meat in your pho. They have good nuoc mam, so your dry vermicelli noodle plates will be yummy!

I've missed my Vietnamese food quite a bit. Yay for pho places in the Sunset district!
author: Colleen M.

description: I guess you have to go here for the pho.  I ordered a rice plate with grilled chicken and fish cakes, and while edible and reasonably flavorful, every Vietnamese chicken rice plate I have ever had was significantly better.  I'm new to this neighborhood. So I'll give it one more try and order pho, but so far I'm unimpressed.
author: Timothy M.

description:
After a mandatory zoo excursion with only coffee&tea to keep us going, my friend and I stumbled into the closest noodle shop around. Bearing in mind this was a Saturday around late 1ish, we didn't have to wait around for too long...but dang it was packed! We took a look at the menu, and right away noticed how low the prices were. The bowls came in small, medium, & large, and the small wasn't even that small either.
Finally jumped into my not so tiny Hu Tieu. An abundance and equal ratio of clear noodles to steaming fresh broth, mixed assortment of chicken, pork, and shrimp, and I was good to go... and all for exactly $5.70 (not including tip)? And to think that they accepted my visa without so much as a grumpy face speaks to their overall flexible awesomeness.
author: Emmie L.

description: Let me just say that I did not think pho was good when I first tried it. But Kevin's Noodle House is beyond amazing. The broth is extremely flavorful! Their sizes are crazy too. You can order in small, medium, or large and they are very generous in terms of quantity and the price is super cheap! I always get their chicken pho and make it very spicy. I love adding lime, basil, and sprouts to my pho. In the end it is a recipe for happiness. I always get their vietnamese iced coffee as well. This place never disappoints and the restaurant seats many!
author: Diego L.

description: Very good food, very Asian-like service.  Fast in fast out. One time, I got the bill, and placed it in the middle so I could look at it while I was taking out my wallet.  Two more waiters came by with new bills, so that by the end, there were 3 bills on the table within 3 min.  Bottom line: good food, but eat FAST!
author: M M.

description:
I love coming in here on a cold San Francisco day and enjoying some piping hot Pho with some pals! I always get the x-large bowl with combination everything... so delicious!

And the service is so quick, not even a few minutes for everyone to have their food!
author: Wilson T.

description: Came here back in the day and thought this stuff was good. Now after leaving the city and heading down south, I realized that the soup is very bland compared to the good stuff.
author: M C.

description:
It is what it is...an awesome affordable place to get authentic Vietnamese soul food.
-The Pho is tasty, authentic, and warms you up from head to toe on a cold winter (or summer) day. Brisket, beef balls, tendons, and tripe are all flavorful.
-The Pork chop is thin, tender, and perfectly seasoned. The piece of fat at the end just melts in your mouth.
-The fresh spring rolls are light and refreshing. The wrapper has perfect consistency. The shrimp and vermicelli are both fresh and tasty.
-The chicken wings are fried to perfection but lack spices and seasonings.
Overall, this is a spacious and clean place to enjoy some good ole Vietnamese home cooking. Its also nice that you can come here after dark without looking over your shoulder for those wacky TL characters!
author: Siao W.

description: yesterday my bf & i were craving pho since i was feeling under the weather. we decide to check this place out. it was nice. they give you complimentary hot tea which was awesome because my throat needed it. i order the small pho. but then thought it was too big for me so my bf decide to have it & i ended up ordering a kids size. it was nice that they allow an adult to get a kids size since some places don't allow it. over all it was great & fast service. we will definitely come back when we are in the area.
author: Giselle G.

description:
More deserving of three stars as I don't go out of the way to go here anymore. They used to have the best fuh in SF (almost went every weekend, before versions #3-5 opened up). Since then it's average-at-best. My guess is they stopped using MSG, or lessened it.

Service is still good though, and I've always liked the easy-to-get-to location (right off 19th Avenue), though parking could be more hit than miss. Sometimes, it's best to park over on the 20th Ave side and cross the street.
author: Peter L.

description: Love their bbq chicken over rice. Very good shrimp cake. Some of the waiters were not very friendly.
author: Suwito S.

description: I come here at least once a week for the chicken pho soup. I'm addicted...it's a serious problem. This place is a definite MUST try. So cheap and they're portions are so big. Go go go
author: Kellene R.

description:
6/5 stars because I've been here at least two dozen times and they always do a good job. 
Fast. Mindblowingly efficient. My go-to spot for pho when my mom is too lazy to make some at home (I know, D':).  Just don't come here too late at night; the broth will be saltier and more MSG-induced than the beginning of the day. 

Out of everything I've tried there, they're good for their beef phos, imperial rolls and vermicelli/rice plates. 

Your bowl of pho will come out faster than you can blink. 

They're magical. I love magical.
author: Rebecca N.

description:
Pho-ck yes, this is a place to solve a pho fix. 

The broth is good, the servings are fair, and the prices are cheap.  In addition to the pho basics, the menu offers Vietnamese noodle bowls, wonton/egg noodle soups, and Vietnamese rice combo plates.  So far, I opt only for the pho because my first experience with their seafood egg noodle soup was below stellar--the broth was very salty and tasted powder/bouillon based.
author: Diane N.

description:
This is my staple in the Sunset.  It's either this place or the one in Westlake.

I've always been curious about PPQ, but why mess with a good thing?  I like ordering their pho tai with the meat on the side.  The place is fairly clean, service is fast & friendly, and the food is consistent.
author: Michelle S.

description: Well worth the 15 minute wait . Little spendy for pho, but really good.
author: Justin A.

description: Extremely friendly staff, decent pho, cheap. Good place!
author: Priyam D.

description: They have some very tasty and affordable combination plates. The staff is friendly and their service is fast even if they're crowded. It's a great place for pho in this area and I would definitely come back.
author: Mark C.

description: The pho here is below average and the service was questionable. They got our order wrong twice and had to keep going back to get it right. The staff made it seem like we were bothering them and that it was our fault that they got the order wrong. I won't be coming back.
author: Michael S.

description: Underwhelming.  I've had much better noodles from Saiwalks in the Marina.  Portion sizes are absolutely huge so small is plenty. Had it not been so highly recommended from several people, I think I would have liked it better.  Servers come by once and then you never see them again until they bring you a check. Doesn't help that the table next to us flicked chili sauce all over my partner and myself and didn't even apologize.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Came here for a late lunch after going to Lake Merced and it was a satisfying lunch experience.

We ordered the pho with beef balls, tripe, rare beef and a pork chop rice with shrimp paste and egg.  

The pho noodles were good and the meat selection/combo was good. The pork chop rice was also grilled with a great flavor and the deep fried shrimp paste was good. If they offered the egg casserole as most traditional Vietnamese restaurants do with their pork chop rice I would give it an extra star as it is my favorite side dish but they only had a fried egg on this one.  

We also had the Vietnamese coffee (really strong and delicious) and the watermelon slush with boba (fresh watermelon taste and the boba was soft and sweet). 

Our bill came out to $23, definitely not bad but a little bit more pricey than what we normally pay for pho down in L.A. 

Don't know if we would come back "pho" sure but wouldn't rule it out =)
author: Betty C.

description: I loooooooooove this place. I have been here several times for the pho. I have tried both beef flank and chicken. A noodle soup is only as good as its broth - and PHH2 has theirs down to a science. Tea (jasmine?) included with your meal. Quick and friendly service. A definite must-try if you're in the area.
author: B L.

description:
Vietnamese Fast Food is how I would describe this place.

#17, meat on the side.  Thank you!

- Quick service: ALWAYS got my order within 5 min.
- The pho hits the SPOT!!!  Also relieved my hangover momentarily. hehehe
author: sandy h.

description:
Would try this place again (and will order appetizers) but not looking forward to the service.  Went in with a baby at night, and they suggested the front side table, but I declined - citing the cold coming in through the doors.  In fact, most patrons were bundled up, with some still in their jackets.  The soup warms you up after awhile, anyways.

We mentioned to the host that we needed a booster chair but no one helped us, so we just stood by our table with the baby in our arms.  Finally, we just scanned the room until we saw the stack and I got it myself.  Then we sat down, and after awhile, my husband got up to get the menus himself.  Our phos came quickly, and my husband asked the server in Vietnamese for a cup of room temperature water.  The guy left with a backwards look at us, and a woman stepped in to see what we wanted.  So, some of the staff don't speak Vietnamese, but they won't let on.  We ended up with a glass of cold water.

The chicken and the pho broths were good, my husband said.  Flavorful.  We finished them pretty quickly.  The stack of veggies that came with the pho is smaller than in restaurants where the clients are predominantly Vietnamese, but it was adequate for our needs.

I have a feeling my medium pho was actually a small -- like someone else reviewed.  There were only 3 slices of beef and 3 significant clumps of tripe, with just a small mound of noodles.  I was still hungry afterwards, so we left to get some tapioca to fill me up.

I'm still nursing the tapioca an hour later-- to block out the MSG sting on my tongue.  My husband didn't notice; "Maybe that's why the soup was so tasty," he replied.
author: Christine T.

description:
Cheap, quick, and somewhat clean (compared to other Viet places in city).
A1 nice and crispy.  

Pho broth not too bad.  A little watered down home-made chicken broth, but can't complain.  Still tasty.  

Rice dishes are okay (chicken/pork).  Wasn't fan of the shredded pork though, a little too dry.

Service very quick so even if 5 tables in front of you, it's only a 15min wait.  Guy someone remembers everyone's placement too without writing down names.  That's amazing in itself.
author: Rodney J.

description:
This review is simply based on the menu.

A few friends were visiting from out of town and we were wandering about trying to find dinner. A guy on the street recommended Kevin's and we walked in and were seated immediately. We asked if there were any vegetarian items available and were told no. We promptly left.

I consider myself a very easy going vegetarian. White rice and some veggies, I'd be fine! But nothing? I'm out.

For those of you who enjoy meat, yelp reviews show this may be a decent place. But for vegetarians, this is not your stop.
author: Mai W.

description:
Great Pho. This is my favorite place. 
Great Soup
Great Noodles
The Meat was only okay. It varies from time to time. 
Does not get too crowded.
and...CHEAP.
author: James T.

description: Seeing as I'm not a huge fan of Pho, I was surprised how much I enjoyed the Pho here. The broth was tasty, and the array of condiments was impressive. They also gave us a large-ish platter of delicious (Thai?) basil to add to the soup. Very affordable and filling meal.
author: K F.

description: To be completely honest, I've never had a real bowl of pho before, so I can't really compare Pho Huynh Hiep to any pho places out there. With that being said, rainy days call for some sort of piping hot bowl of soup and since my boyfriend and I always have Ramen, I suggested that we go get Pho for a change. Upon Yelping, I thought to myself "WHY HAVE I NEVER BEEN HERE BEFORE?!" My sister's been working in this area for about a year now and I never knew that Pho Huynh Hiep existed. Thank you, Yelp gods! I honestly can't remember the number of the item I ordered, but it was a beef broth with beef slices. Simple and easy, and oh so good! The beef broth was sooooo delicious and really tasty! The noodles were vermicelli style and enough to fill me up. The total was under $20 with imperial rolls and a mango tapioca shake, which was definitely reasonable!
author: Joyce E.

description: Decent menu. Never really checked up on us to see how the food was or if we needed anything. Tasted pretty good tho n fair prices
author: Philip L.

description:
The Pho here is absolutely amazing! The actual noodles here are smooth and slender, made to perfection. The beef and tendons here is just wonderful; tender, and succulent complimented with the broth that was a delicious mix between salty and sweet! This lovely package all comes under 7!
The staff here is great, they all pretty talkative if you spark up a conversation! :) I love how fast the food gets finished too; the cooks ready your pho before you even have time to realize what you just ordered! 
Overall great service, scrumptious pho, and cheap prices too!
author: Anthony H.

description:
This place has been my go-to pho place for as long as I can remember.  They're always busy whenever I go (which means they are doing something right), but you get seated right away and your food is served ridiculously fast. It's a given that you can never go wrong with the Pho, but don't overlook their Beef Stew w/Rice Noodles (#32), which is delicious and not to mention really cheap at something like $5.25 for a bowl. Their Vermicelli w/BBQ Pork & Imperial Rolls are also yum. 

Fast. Cheap. Delicious. Can't ask for much more than that.
author: Felicia C.

description: Solid place for pho! I used to live half a block away, and I'd come 2x-3x a week! My all time fave is the #24, which is a combo of chicken, pork, shrimp, and fish cakes in chicken broth. I usually also get a taro smoothie, and either the deep fried egg rolls or fresh spring rolls. Rice plates are good here too, but I always go with the pho.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
Good Pho, good prices... typical Vietnamese restaurant service. 


I really like the broth they use for their pho and the portions are generous for the prices. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but, if I'm nearby and looking for Pho, I come here.
author: Russ N.

description: This place is my favorite pho place in San Francisco! The people who work here are super nice and the service is quick! My friends and I are in love with the food, and seem to come here every week or sometimes even more than that.
author: Amy S.

description:
Disgusting is how I would describe this restaurant!!!!

The asian men brings out your bowl of Pho with their thumb dip into your soup.  The older man that works there is rude as well but it is what you would expect from a Vietnamese restaurant.  

Bathroom was dirty as well.  They have so many people working inside and not one person can care enough to upkeep the bathroom.

Prices are cheap so you can't expect much from them.
author: C Y.

description: So happy to find this little gem, during our trip in SF. The Pho here is so good, in fact we made sure we make a final stop here before we fly out! The price is also very reasonable, and the service is super fast!
author: Yuhua Z.

description: I always get some sort of beef pho, which tastes good and is pretty cheap ($5.25 for a small). The broth can be a little oily, but only sometimes. I've never had to wait for a table, whether it's just me and my friend, or me and a group of people. They never rush you which is nice, so my friends and I can take our time eating. I'm usually here for lunch before heading off to swim practice, and the portions are perfect so I don't get hungry in the middle of practice, but I'm not so full that I feel like throwing up. I will be back here many more times in the future!
author: KC W.

description: Obviously very popular place, not crazy about roving bus boy station parking next to you while you are eating so they can perform sanitation effort right on your flank, kind of gross and loud and distracting. Food was okay, service good and fast. Prices fair. Beef soup decent flavor but floating pieces of fat (brisket schratnel) was a bit much.
author: Matt H.

description:
Me and my friends always come here for Pho! They make the pho very good and fast. Once you order, it will come within a couple of minutes. People usually always get the number 1 X-Large for like $6.75 whicih is a pretty good price for what you get. I sometimes get the rice dishes as well. They're still good! It usually comes with a small bowl of soup also! The food that you get here is a affordable price and it can really fill you up. 

The service is okay here. Sometimes you have to raise your hand to get the bill but sometimes they may not notice you. 

I sometimes think that the dishes or utensils you use are sticky or something, but a lot of pho places are like that since people make the sauce. 

Tapioca here is pretty good here imo also.
author: Henry K.

description:
Great cheap eat - healthy food and quick service. 
Nice go-to place for staple Vietnamese food.

Portions seem smaller than before, but for the price - it can't be beat in SF.
author: Maki T.

description: Seriously the best pho that I've found in the city. I love how fast and inexpensive Kevin's is. You can walk in, eat, and be out of there in less than 30 minutes. Great hidden gem in the Sunset!
author: Abigail W.

description: Pho Huynh Hiep consistently has the best pho. It gets crowded pretty fast during peak hours, but the service is speedy (I can usually get in and out in about 30 minutes), and the food is always delicious. I've tried other places in the city, and I always come back here because nothing I've had so far comes close to being as good.
author: Christopher S.

description:
One of the best places to get pho in the city. I live in the Tenderloin and even though there is Little Saigon, I make the travel because it's that good. Their services are fast. I always order the number 2 and fried chicken wings. They come out in 5 minutes.

I haven't really ordered anything else from the menu, I just can't pass up on their pho.
author: Binh H.

description: Wife and I always come here at least 3 times a week. Love love pho here,.... The restaurant is clean to compare to most viet rest I've been to. And it looks like this place is pretty well known to Caucasian people too. We come here so much, the owner even knows our name and order. #16 is usually choice. Sometime, I get #42 rice plate.....
author: Ben B.

description: cheap, quick, and delicious. The service is nothing to write home about, but they do their jobs efficiently and you food comes out ridiculously fast. A favorite spot for a quick, filling, and yummy meal.
author: Amanda F.

description:
I grew up in San Jose, so I consider myself to be quite the Pho snob. I am convinced you can't get a bowl of Pho anywhere else BUT in San Jose (oh and I guess Vietnam, too).

I've been wanting to try Kevin's Noodle House for quite some time now. Kevin's Noodle House is a Southern Vietnamese style Pho restaurant (most common). Based on its Yelp reviews and good recommendations from friends, I had to give it a try. My impression was that the Pho was going to taste very homestyle and San Jose-ish, but there was nothing special about it. 

Pros:
-extensive menu with lots of options to choose 
-everything is under $10
-variety of meat options (including seafood and vegetarian)
-quick to serve after ordering in minutes

Cons:
I don't know if it was because I got a small bowl of Pho Ga and Thom (chicken and shrimp) but...
-little to no meat in my Pho (small scraps of chicken and literally 2 shrimps)
-soup could use for flavoring
-the "Small" is really small 

I'm still trying to look for a Pho place in SF that keeps me coming back. Turtle Tower is the place to go for Northern style Pho, but am I really going to have to venture to SJ for some good ol' Southern style Pho?
author: Linda T.

description:
Great place! I decided to try a different place, since Yummy Yummy has gotten to be so crowded and expensive. We found those place, which is incidentally only 10 blocks from that other restaurant. 

Overall I really like this place a lot. We came around lunch time, and by the time that we got our food, the place was completely packed. We each ordered a pho, the beef and the chicken. I had the small size. They offer small, medium and large bowls. 

The chicken pho was definitely different from those I had at other restaurants. The skin was included with the meat, and there was a mix of light and dark meat. My boyfriend really liked the flavor of his beef broth. He also ordered the thai iced tea. And OMG it was freaking awesome!!!! I would recommend that to anyone. Honestly, it's one of the best that I ever tasted. And apparently, the teas are very popular, because there was one lady working behind the counter that was making fresh cups the whole time we were there. 

I would definitely come here again. The pho is cheaper, the drinks are amazing, and the service was very good.
author: Steph G.

description: I ordered a medium bowl of pho with slices of beef and beefballs (about $9). We were served maybe 5 minutes after ordering. The broth and noodles were very good. The beefballs and slices of beef were not so good, which is why I am giving 3 stars. It was just an average bowl of pho in my opinion. The restaurant is nice and clean, and the servers are fine. Average prices as well.
author: K T.

description: Best pho-king Pho in SF! I have never once been disappointed with my meal. They seem to always be busy but never had to wait more than 5 minutes to sit.. No matter how packed they are. Thank you, Kevin, for always delivering delicious pho.
author: Jen Z.

description: It is often difficult to decide between Kevin's noodle house and PPQ across the street.. But more recently I've noticed that Kevin's noodle house has slightly improved on their quality of foods! The prices are overall cheaper and the service is quick. Don't expect anything fancy, you're only going to get a nice warm bowl of pho.
author: Kev L.

description:
Pho is my comfort food. If I'm feeling under the weather or on a particularly cold and foggy day (and there's no shortage of THOSE in SF), pho makes me feel all cozy.

With that said, Pho Hoa Hiep (also known as Kevin's Noodle House) is the place I go when I'm looking for Pho. The cafeteria style restaurant isn't impressive but that doesn't matter. It's all about the food.

What makes pho good is the broth and PHH's broth is just savory enough to compliment whatever meats you decide to add to your soup. 

The portions are perfect and the prices are just right. Sometimes I'm not in the mood to finish their regular size, so they let me older the kiddie bowl (even cheaper!). And I love that they give you an adequate size plate of bean sprouts and basil to add to the pho.

Their other dishes are just as good. The vermicelli bowl is very fresh tasting, while their rice plates really fill you up.

Let's just say I never leave this place hungry. Oink.

Oh, and if you only want a snack, they have some really great boba/tapioca drinks. Everyone should try an avocado smoothie. It's not as weird as you think. Yum.
author: Viv C.

description:
This place rules. Rules, rules, rules.
I usually get a medium sized bowl of pho with the well done brisket and steak. I think that's the #13 or something random like that. The broth is yummy and hot, the beef is good, the noodles are good. The pho here is just great. It's only about $5.75 give or take a few cents. 
Don't expect amazing service (them coming around asking if everything is okay), although I'm sure that goes for any noodle place like this. But if you need something, it's as simple as asking.
Whenever I crave pho, I go here.
author: Lori C.

description: Had lunch with a friend here on a Tuesday about 130pm, had one of the chicken rice noodle pho bowls (small, medium and large bowls available), really enjoyed it.  Good spring rolls.  Not too loud, able to find a table upon walking in.  Found parking a block away.  Would definitely come again.
author: David C.

description: Best pho in SF, I've had the chicken pho and the thin slice beef and brisket pho, both very delicious and yummy. I suggest you just come here when your craving pho you will be satisfied.
author: Michelle G.

description: The pho here is mediocre and parking is always an issue. However, the food is pretty cheap and even if there's a line, it goes by very quick. I usually get my order within 5 minutes of actually making the order.
author: Sharon M.

description:
Extremely fast service. Even though the place was bustling with people we were seated right when we entered, and our orders were taken a few moments after we were ready. A few minutes later, our table was filled with hot, yummy smelling food.

I had the Pho Dac Biet and it was delicious. The soup was a little on the sweet side, but I like sweetness. I loved that they had 3 different types of chili sauces (sriracha, garlic chili sauce, and hot chili oil).

I took one star off because one of my friends ordered the fried chicken and she said it wasn't crispy at all, like it was just microwaved.

So, come here on a cold day (pretty much every day in SF), for a quick piping hot bowl of pho!
author: Katherine T.

description: I live a block away, and this place never fails in rescuing me from a brutal hangovers. The broth is delicious, the people are nice, and the service is pretty fast. What more can you ask for?
author: Austin R.

description:
Long over due for a update. 

I ordered the beef stew with the wide flat noodles--I always get this when I order noodle soup.

The most nastiest beef stew I have ever tasted!
The soup was really thick and starchy--from the noodles I am guessing?
The carrot was very over cooked :( 

I usually order stuff besides the noodle soups here..but I haven't ate here in a while, so I forgot....I should always remember now..
author: Janet Z.

description:
They brought out the wrong size pho bowl and were quite unapologetic about it. However, the food was good and the service was fast-ish. 

I will come back because the prices are great and the food was flavorful and didn't taste of too much MSG. I can't wait to come back and try the other stuff on their menu.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Love this place! Literally have nothing bad to say about it.
The food is consistently good and you always get a bang for your buck. My favorites are the beef pho and the fresh spring rolls. Their boba smoothies are pretty good too!
Prices are ridculously cheap for the amount of and quality of food you're getting. 
Service is always fast, polite and curteous (though nothing to bring home about)
I've never waited more than 20 minutes for a table (even during rush hours with 6-7 parties ahead of me)

Overall, I really recommend this place!
author: Marlene C.

description: I got a medium for under $8 with egg noodle for free! Enough for two people. It was really good, and they gave us free tea. There was also a bathroom! Lots of seating, Will be back to Kevin's!
author: Diane S.

description:
Not bad, not bad at all. 

If you live in the city and you like pho, you've probably already eaten here. Cant complain. Good food. Cheap prices. It's like a Vietnamese version of Fast Food. If you live in the city and you've never eaten here, I dont know whats wrong with you..
author: Linh P.

description:
Compared to the pho places in Hawaii, Kevin's Noodle House is beyond the best. 

First of all, the price!!! It's almost TOO cheap for the amount they give! The price I pay for a medium size here is the same price i'd pay in Hawaii for a small. Their medium is also equivalent to a large in most places I go to in Hawaii! 

I always have great noodle to meat ratio :3 I love that! Their broth is tasty and the food is derrricious. I give them 5 stars because of how cheap and good they are :) 

Till next SF visit, Pho Huynh Hiep 2!!! Hahhaa
author: Camille D.

description: Very good Pho.  Went with a friend who lived in Vietnam for a year and said it was the best she's had in SF.  Get the iced coffee with condensed milk, sweet and delicious.
author: Sancho T.

description: It's everything that you expect a pho place to be. Fast service. Yummy noodles. Good soup... and the soup is actually pretty damn good!
author: Connie Y.

description:
If nothing else, a good pho has to have a tasty broth.

Kevin's broth was way way way too salty and much too beefy (not the good kind of beefy). It had a really weird taste.

Also, the fresh spring rolls were terrible. No sign of shrimp inside anywhere, despite the menu implying (read: stating) that they  came with that.  They were stuffed with white noodles and that's pretty much it.

Do yourself a favor and walk across the street to PPQ for some real pho!
author: Roxane W.

description: I ordered take out from Kevin's last night for the first time.   The restaurant was clean and full of people on a Sunday night and the service was quick. I ordered the 22A (chicken pho) and the fresh spring rolls.  The chicken pho was good, but bland- I added a lot of hot sauce.   I would like to go back and try a beef pho. The fresh spring rolls were exactly as expected- simple, fresh, with a nice peanut sauce.
author: Christy L.

description:
Cheap, no frills, spacious pho joint.

I have never had to wait.  A small bowl of seafood pho (my favorite) will run you about $5-6 bucks.  And the food is great!

The place is fairly large, but you're definitely not coming here for ambiance or to impress a date.  And the best part... they're open at 10am for those of you that are looking for a late pho breakfast.  Mmm... pair that with a nice Vietnamese drip coffee with condensed milk and you've just paid less than $10 bucks and will leave totally satisfied.
author: Christine K.

description:
Nice little Pho joint near by in outer sunset. Nothing special caught my attention to give this place five stars.

Four stars for prompt service, good price (5-6 dollar Pho), and lots of noodles and meat in the soup.
author: Kyle M.

description:
Cheap Vietnamese food, with great portions.

That's all I can say.

I order the pork chop with eggs and shrimp cakes.  Yum.

I have yet to try their Pho though...I have to be in the mood!

I like this location, and the Westlake one.  Parking is better at Westlake.
author: Fannie S.

description: Super quick, super delicious pho. Also great vermicelli bowls and rolls. HUGE portions. I don't know what else to say!
author: Jenny J.

description: i like it great deal. big group may be waiting but put your name down and you'll be seated in no time. wait staff will take your order fast and food will come even faster. one of the best broths for pho I've had.
author: B S.

description:
Phantastic. By far my favorite pho in the city. 

This place is always slammed, and although their other menu items look good, I get the same thing every time. Large #17 (beef pho) to go.  For around $7, a lot of bang for you buck.

The beauty of taking it to go is that you can have multiple bowls, and customize it exactly as you like it.
author: Phil P.

description: This is another place where you come for the food, not the atmosphere. I'm really picky about the freshness and quality of the food a restaurant serves. Kevin's is one of my favorite places for pho noodles. We always order the same...chicken pho noodles.  Their broth is very flavorful and the chicken is cooked just perfect!
author: mimi c.

description:
Restaurant was packed when we arrived.
Was seated within 10 minutes or so.
really good pho.
got the che ba mau which was good too
fast service :)
would definitely like to come back here next time I'm in SF!
author: T H.

description:
What's good after a Zombie War? Vietnamese food.
Actually, Vietnamese food will do me right any day.

It was cold and rainy and we decided to go warm up with some Pho.
When I got there, aw man, I really did want pho, but 85% of the time I order a rice dish.
Com thit nuong. ANYWHERE I go, this dish tests the place for me. 

I was so badly craving both. They were fantastic. I ordered a rice dish and then a children's bowl of pho ga. OMGosh it was so good. I finished both, fulfilled my cravings and left the rest of my table wondering where the hell I put it all.

This place was really good. They were very accommodating to our nearly 20 person party. The food was so good I couldn't stop eating. It was nice and cheap too. 
CHEAP, those words are almost as sweet as FREE. 

Great place, I'd love to come back time and time again until they remember my name.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
I finally came back after a long hiatus and I don't even know what kept me away! Their bowls here are really cheap and they give you the option of small, medium and large bowls here. 

I ordered a combination noodle soup with pork, shrimp, fish cake etc with wide flat noodles. The soup was really delicious too and light and flavorful. Any place that serves the wide flat rice noodles and light and tasty soup is an automatic winner in my book. My Small bowl only cost about $5.25. 

Need I say more?

Cheap. Delicious. Minimal Wait.
author: Connie C.

description: I've been here several times with my friends. I usually just order the regular #1 here and it's definitely up to standard for a pho restaurant. The waiters are friendly and prompt and you can expect your food to arrive in less than 10 minutes. The noodle soup I ordered was flavorful, not fantastic, but all I could ever expect from a bowl of pho. I definitely recommend this place over Kevin's at Westlake. They are reasonably priced, your average $7-8 for a large bowl of pho.  I would definitely come here again to try their other dishes.
author: Veronica L.

description:
3.5 stars. 

This is my togo place for pho with friends. Super greasy, super fast, super cheap, it's like the fast food of the pho world. 

Service is prompt. Nothing special but not horrible either. They get things done. 

Honestly, I'm not too fond of pho at other places, the soup tastes like apple juice/cider to me. I assume it's because it's all made from scratch and it's fresh and nice and all that jazz. Here, you can practically taste the MSG. But I guess I like the taste of MSG and this is about the only place I would get pho.
author: Bonnie L.

description: I like everything from kevin's noodle house. They are so yummmmy! One time, I went to Daly City Kevin's thinking it would be as good as the one from sunset. Wrong. The sunset one is so much betttter!
author: Fong C.

description:
Going off to college and coming back to SF is a must go for Kevin's

I've been going here for pho for about 4 years! Always reliable. 

I walked in and got greeted to a table instantly and was spoke to in Chinese. I find this kind of funny majority of the workers speak Cantonese and assume you do too!

I ordered a typical #42. Shrimp cakes(AMAZING) and porkchop.
NOTE! Be careful with the sunny side up eggs because there is a recall on eggs...
But... I ate it anyways... haha

Well I'm not in the hospital right now so the eggs should be fine. 

Kevin's is always a reliable place to have a good portioned, reasonable priced, and tasty Vietnamese food.

Coming back before I go back to college out of town!
author: Tony C.

description:
Was super unsure whether or not to come here. Why? All the good pho places are in the TL! But that's on the other side of the city, so.....

We came here! And I was really surprised! I looked at the menu and most of the dishes were $5.25. I've never seen pho that cheap before. I got a medium dish, which ended up being $5.95 (but that's still not bad!). The soup was delicious and the meat was still chewy. I didn't think the bowl would be that big, but it was amazing. I plopped 12 jalapenos in it, and the broth was just mouth-watering.

I would've put 5 stars for the food and it's price, but I'm going to knock off one more star because of the guy who was handing our food. He repeated the dish numbers, and none of us had ordered it. When we said the correct number, he just nodded and changed his original number. Skeptical. I still think it was the wrong order. Oh well.
author: Karen L.

description: If you're looking for garlic noodles this is not your place. Garlic what? Garlic who?  If you're looking for delicious pho or bbq shrimp, this is where you need to be. It's dull on the inside but all you really need is for the soup spoon to find your lips.
author: Jen Y.

description: Ok. This might sound crazy but I got the xl pho, and when I have pho I usually finish my bowl wanting more, but I honestly got bored of my pho like halfway through. I still finished it but that literally never happens to me and food. It was like wow ok, it's salty, where else can i go with this and i just hit a wall. It wasn't the worst pho i've ever had but I really don't get the rave reviews.
author: Misha T.

description: Whenever my friends and I can't figure out where to eat, we always always always end up here.Though everyone else here seems to like their pho, I'm more of a vermicelli person.  You can never go wrong with their bbq pork vermicelli. On top of that, their drinks aren't all that bad. I actually really like their pearls.
author: Melissa C.

description: Best pho I have ever had. Definitely the best in SF. The broth is so yummy and they have the perfect ratio of noodles to broth. Also their meat is delicious n not gross like some places. The service is super fast. Only downside is they don't give you water unless you ask. Definitely a good spot to satisfy your pho craving!
author: Rhonda J.

description:
I've been coming here for years now and... I'VE NEVER NOTICED THAT THE #3 IS THE SAME AS #1 BUT SMALLER. utterly failed :/

 Anyways, this is truly one of the best places to get pho in SF. The noodles are great, the meat is plentiful, the veggies are fresh, the broth is tasty, place is clean, the price is decent.... I mean comeon, what else can you possible want from a pho place? 

my favs:
#1 extra large combo pho
(now) #3 medium version of #1
the cold noodle with the eggroll 
chicken wings!
author: Stacy L.

description:
I felt that I had to update my review for this place. Honestly their pho' has NEVER disappointed me. Maybe having a little problem getting our ice waters with my non asian crowd clouded my taste buds. 

Now that I've thought about it more clearly. I've been coming to this restaurant for 10 years. I can't remember once "EVER" leaving not having a belly full of delicious pho'. 

This place is a gem, I regret only giving it 3 stars beforehand but I felt it was honest at the moment.
author: Tip S.

description: I love this place! My friends and I come here every Sunday!  You must try their fried eggrolls...the best in town! !!!
author: Jain P.

description:
Star 1 for fair prices & generous portions!  
Star 2 for photos of every item on the menu next to its appropriate name!  (Like Dennys, but good for you!)
Star 3 for serving hot tea immediately!
Star 4 for having order out in under 5 minutes!
Star 5 for proximity to the public library!

Grad students rejoice!
author: Pedro K.

description: Had the egg noodle (dry) and was mediocre.  Nothing spectacular and wasn't bad so just A-OK.  i like the location-close to SFU when I need to eat a nice hot bowl of egg noodle or pho.
author: A G.

description: I used to come to this place alot and judging from some of the other reviews I think that all us former regulars agree that the pho has definitely been changed. Me and a group of friends used to come here every week and I would get the fried chicken to share with a #2 and a vietnamese iced coffee. But now the fried chicken is bland and so is the broth in the #2 not to mention that the ice coffee tastes weaker than before I'm not even sure how they screwed that one up. I would still come back but it'll never be the same as the good old days.
author: Norris T.

description: Changed my ratings for this place from 3 to 5.Didn't realize how good it was until i left the neighborhood. When my wife was pregnant with our first child I think we ate here like once a week. Nice friendly people, the place is always clean. Broth is spot on.  My wife likes the rice plates, and kids love the avocado shake.
author: P P.

description: It's really not that special. I felt like they could have given more noodles. The main reason why they get 2 stars is because this place isn't sanitary. The chopsticks are all sticky. A tip for you would be: ask for a fork or clean your own eating utensils with the napkin soaked with your tea.
author: M L.

description: One of the best pho's in the city. Not a fan of PHH3, however this one is the best. Service is always on par, as well as the food, and prices.
author: Alissa M.

description:
Kevin's Noodle House presents a solid pho option that somehow both delivers and is unmemorable.  This may not be their fault.

The standard for this style of pho is not very high.  The thin flank is expected to become tough as you tackle the second half of the bowl; the noodles are expected to become soggy as they soak up the broth; and the broth has hoisin and sriracha sauces that it can forever use as crutches for its lack of flavor.

This is the landscape for pho everywhere.  

I do not blame Kevin's for offering pho that is mistakable for pho from most other restaurants.  

The price for an extra large bowl is quite fair, and the ingredients provided with the order are abundant.  The service is also prompt.  I would recommend Kevin's Noodle House to those who experience pho cravings.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Literally, I spent my whole high school here.  Being a high schooler back then, with no job, the allowance i got from my parents could only afford, getting a quickly's or wonderful foods drink then going into Kevin's noodle house for an after-school meal.  The rule was for vermicelli you go across the street to PPQ, you want Pho then Kevin's noodle house ; and depending on what rice plate you want you go to the one that you prefer to make that particular rice plate; ex: five spic chicken rice plate, go to PPQ, and Kevin's doesn't have five spice chicken.

But basically, you really could never go wrong with this place for pho.  The noodles are firm and supple but sometimes it's a bit mushy like it's been in the soup for too long, but don't worry it's  like a 1/100 chance it happens; I'm only saying this because it has happened to me maybe like 2 times, and I eat here a LOT. The broth is heavy with flavor and not bland (unlike PPQ's, NEVER go there for pho, taste like they use swanson broth and then throws in some onions). 

Service is good, if you can speak vietnamese because they literally do not understand what you say. It may take a while for them to understand or they nod their head and ignore your request because they don't know what you want.  But they're always smiling and very nice. The old man, that's balded-ish, is super duper cutesy.

Overall, this is the place I choose to go to for my pho cravings.
author: Betty C.

description: Me an my little Vietnamese sis come here alot. I have to say, the eggrolls, on point. The chicken wings? bigger and tastier than most places, annnnnnd, their broth, oooooh so good when you're sick and cant taste anything, even better when you can! not too oily, just enough flavor, but I have to warn you, make sure you plan a trip to the gym after, otherwise your body will retain so much water its insannnnnne. They get my stamp of approval, and everytime we go, we try to figure out who Kevin is... the older gentleman bussing the tables? or is it the son sitting behind the counter? its vietnamese feel good eats for a cheep preicetag, and mommy likey.
author: Jen M.

description: I had a great lunch here yesterday. I was solo and sat immediately. They promptly had a free pot of tasty tea at my table. I ordered a large #31 the beef stew with wide noodles and it was amazing. The noodles were perfectly done and the braised beef chunks easily tore apart with chopsticks. The large size was more than enough and I left plenty of beef behind (and I'm 6' 2" and 200 lbs). The total bill was just under $8 before tip. Highly recommend this place for Pho.
author: Pete B.

description:
My work's go-to place for Pho.

Cheap.  Around $5-6/bowl.  Fast!  Pick-up in 10 minutes or less.  Consistent!  Good, good, good.  Always good to rely on a place that has consistency so you know what to expect!

I've recently discovered their beef stew.  Though totally different from traditional Vietnamese cooking (namely served w/noodles instead of crusty french bread!) the stew flavour isn't bad itself.  Could be a bit thicker.

Note: order a small stew & receive a ton of noodles and little beef.  order a medium stew & receive a sh@t load of beef and a small order of noodles.  This is a $.40 price difference.  WORTH IT.
author: Kimiko Q.

description: I come here pretty frequently since I'm a college kid on a budget. It's my go-to for pho. It's not phenomenal pho, but you definitely get your money's worth and the pho is pretty good. Yes, they use MSG, but its an authentic place. Of course it will. The service is also very consistent because the workers are generally the same. Every now and then when they're understaffed for the day, they can mess up on an order if you make a modification like no pork in the spring rolls, but they've gotten better at it with their new system. They won't attempt to start conversations with you, but they're quick. It's worth stopping by if you're in the area and craving pho. My only major thing against this place is that they always give you your check while you're still eating instead of when it looks like you're finished or finishing, even when there isn't a line. Maybe it's to prevent people from dining and dashing, but I feel like it's kinda rude.
author: Nikki R.

description:
Relatively clean. Loud chairs if you move them around :(

Service is relatively quick, especially if you're just getting pho. Other items that take time to cook may take 5-10 minutes. They're quick to take your order and give you your bill which is a plus in my book.

Yummy broth for pho, and I love the bun here :)
author: Erica A.

description:
This is properly the best PHH I've been to. The location sucks though because there's rarely any parking due to the fact is on a busy street. The pho and rice plates here are really good and the service is quick! You can be done within 30 min of walking in the door! 

The soup base here for their pho taste better than other PHH because it isn't filled with MSG and sodium. Their rice plate is a good portion. 

This is one of my go to Pho place in the city!
author: Jenny G.

description:
This place is my FAVORITE pho place! This place is really good, but then again I don't know what it makes it exceptionally good compared to other pho places haha. But it's my go-to place for pho whenever I'm in the city.

I always get #17. Their shakes are also really yummy! Particularly strawberry and avocado [not together of course].
author: Miss H.

description: I made the mistake of getting a kids size bowl, just cause I wasn't that hungry. There's not enough heat to get the noodles softened, so they stay in their block form. Somehow, the flavor just isn't there- I would assume its the same broth. Ugg, I was so badly craving a good bowl of pho and this place failed! Even the egg rolls were lacking something.  Sorry, not my favorite spot.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Love love love this place. 

Ridiculously cheap prices for some really good food. Whenever I'm craving pho (especially on a cold day) I drive on over to Irving to get some of Kevin's Noodles . I always get the flank noodle soup (or whatever it's called) either small or medium, depending on how hungry I am . They give you generous amounts of soup & noodles for about 6 bucks a bowl & I can never finish.

Aside from noodles, they have an assortment of rice plates and appetizers. Personally, I've never gotten one, just because the noodles are the best. The noodles come with a plate of raw bean sprouts, some herbs, and lemons for added flavor. You can also ask for the meat to be put on a separate plate if you don't want it to overcook in the soup.
author: Desiree C.

description: On a cold rain day, I enjoy a hot bowl of pho here.  The food is good for the amount they give you and how reasonably priced it is. You definitely wi get your money worth.  This place always seem to have a good amount of customers coming here to eat.  The service is decent and the place is roomy. They never been a time where I had to wait long to be seated.  I like the jasmine tea they service with the food.  It has a nice smell and taste to it.  I have tried other phone places in sf but, this place has been the best which is why when ever I crave for pho,  this is the place I go.
author: Nancy T.

description: good food shitty service. enough SAID.
author: Jared Z.

description:
I didn't even know they had multiple locations! So I was happily surprised to stumble across this one in the Sunset (whereas I usually go to the Concord one all the time). 

Cheap and delicious. Super fast. Really filling with large portions. Everything is good... although I have yet to try their drinks.
