I really love how they have a small size for pho, which only costs $5.25!!! Can't beat that and it's the perfect amount of food for me. I've also had their noodle bowls and those end up being delicious as well. My only complaint at this location is that they never seem to include cilantro on the plate of basil and bean sprouts that come with the pho. Otherwise, it's perfect!
author: Janey L.

description:
Kevin's is delish. Consistent, cheap, and comforting pho! My go-to for late weekday nights or when I'm craving some hot, filling pho on a weekend morning after a crazy night out. You'll find a mix of customers here, mainly consisting of young asian kids in large groups, older couples, and occasional groups of tourists. 

Love the pho ga, pho with brisket, and all their rice dishes! I also enjoy their seafood...huge, well cooked shrimp & other goodies. Their broth is always piping hot, which I think is super important..nothing's worse than luke-warm pho. All the drinks at Kevin's are super tasty & reasonably priced. Try their milk tea, mocha shake with boba, and the fresh squeezed orange juice.

The service at Kevin's is simple and straightforward. They take orders quick, and as with all Vietnamese food, dishes are served quickly. 

Parking can be rough, but you can also take the 29, 28, 71, or the N and walk within a block. You can't beat the prices and flavorful food!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
My boyfriend and I LOOVE this place.  The food is super quick, super delicious and we always have this awesome server.  Gotta figure out his name next time.  
Oh, and the prices are really great, especially for the serving sizes.  Thank God they have a "small" bowl.  It's actually huge and I can barely finish it.  And I can EAT!
author: Yvonne R.

description: While nothing compares to Pho's Little Saigon in San Mateo, this place is a hard runner up. Good vermicelli type dishes and good Pho. Always good service and they're very quick!!!
author: Nick O.

description:
Made new friends down here. Kudos to Willie for paying for the foods.

Parking.. is a little bit difficult.. since it's right in the middle of the area that surrounded by groceries stores, corner stores and restaurants.

I went there with my gf, her friend and her friend's friends. So it's like there are 5 of us altogether. All of them ordered some type of pho and stew. I got tired of having pho every single time I went to Vietnamese restaurant. So instead, I ordered Rice with Pork Chop with Shredded Pork.

Their orders came out first.. obviously - it's pho.. it's like the quickest to make and serve. But I don't mind waiting a little longer. I've been trying to get a taste of their (Vietnamese) infamous Pork Chop Rice. And then it came.

The pork chop, the shredded pork all sitting on top of the white rice.. so beautiful. It came with some soup. It taste delicious too. I'm lovin every bite of my food.

I'm also glad that the price of a Pho house in SF also the same with the one in my city, Philadelphia. Cheap!

Service.. just the same with every Pho restaurant out there. Regular. Nothing special.

There's a reason behind this 4 stars.. and not 5. When my new friend paid for all of our meals, and he already gave them tips and all.. we were still staying there to chat while drinking tea and stuffs. About 1/2 hour passed by.. suddenly one of their waiter stood closely to our table and started to glare at us repeatedly.. like wanted us to just get out and moved our conversation somewhere else. We got the hint and felt uncomfortable. So we decided to bounce. Too bad...
author: Yohann S.

description: Great place to get Pho and other dishes.  I usually go there for the vermicelli (cold noodles) with their shredded pork, shrimp rolls, and grilled chicken with fish-sauce vinegarette.  Their soup bowls are in three sizes so you have control of how much you want to eat.  Some places bring one standard size and you basically throw away uneaten food or you force feed yourself.  Yay, no need to gorge yourself of pho noodles!  They also have bubble tea drinks as well as smoothies.  The sound can get a little over the legal decibel limit but it also adds to the feel of being at a traditional pho house.  Writing this makes me hungry again even though I just ate dinner...

To Pho or not to Pho? that is the question. Which place is the best place to have pho? I dunno, but in San Francisco Pho Huynh Hiep #2 is pretty decent. I've come here a few times before and I can honestly say that it is not bad at all, I like coming here because of the large dining space that accommodate 10-12 people at one table by pushing tables together. 

In terms of waiting time for food, the pho and other soups come out right away and you're not sitting there waiting forever. Pretty much the broth that the pho comes with has been cooking hopefully all day and night and all they have to do is just get your ingredients and just pour in the broth. Not bad if you want a fast pho experience. For rice plates it might take a few more minutes, but not much longer.

It is one of my go to places. Rice plates, Cold Noodle dishes, Soups are all pretty decent. Not the best, but pretty darn good.

***I posted a pic and just looking at it makes me wants some now***
author: Michael J.

description:
Awesome atmosphere; great noodles, great service.

Good mix of soup and noodles at an awesome price.

My favorite place for Pho.
author: Wilson L.

description:
Came here a couple of times before. 
-Seating was quick. 
-Quick and friendly service.
-Nice and warm + kind of quiet.
-Food was mehhh. Ok, not that bad.
-Tables are cramped if you're sitting with 8 people and you're next to the utensils. 

I wouldn't mind coming here for another bowl of pho.
author: Reginald W.

description:
came here once with my friends service was fast, but the pho was okay, it wasnt the best, but it did have a good beef.

second time came here with the ex, had the rice noodles with the egg rolls, it was way too greasy for my liking. but the ex had #1 and thought it was good, but not the best pho hes had yet.
author: Stella J.

description:
My dad and I used to come here at least once a week! It was a great way for us to spend some time together and eat some great pho. The owner already knew what we wanted before we even sat down.

I always get the beef noodle soup, it had everything in it. I loved the flavor and they give you a good amount of beef. 

It gets pretty packed during lunch time but luckily theres alot of tables. 

I tried the boba once but didnt like it. Had to go to Wonderful Foods 2 blocks down.
author: Jean T.

description:
Giving 5 stars for delicious pho. I love a good soupy noodle dish at the end of long days.. and now living at the edge of the inner and outer sunset there are a wealth of  vietnamese places to choose from. I have been to this place a few times and every time I have had an outstanding experience (price, flavor, fast service). 

What I loved is that each  soup dish that I picked (randomly from the 100+ dishes that all seem to be the same thing) had its own flavor, all of which were really good! I guess the dishes are pretty different! I can't remember the names of the dishes, but I do remember that #35 was especially YUM YUM. 

We also had a noodle bbd chicken dish which wasn't as good. The chicken tasted a little weirdly cooked. I'll have to give it another chance! 

Moral of the story: Flavorful delicious pho and a great price!
author: Sirina K.

description: Everytime I visit SF, my cousins always take me to this place to get pho. It's just the go-to place to get good pho. It's not the best, but it's still good and hit the spot, plus it's cheap! $6 for large bowl of pho and beef, brisket, meatballs, tendons, what more could you ask for? I will point out that they give you a lot more noodles than meat, but I don't mind having more noodles. They are really quick with the food unless they're crazy busy. But they're not the cleanest restaurant, so don't be surprised if you find an eyebrow hair in your soup. It happened to me the last time I ate there but in my experience, the dirty hole in the walls usually serve the best food =P
author: Panina H.

description: Pho was mediocre and A1 (fried spring rolls) was literally in edible. They were so dry and freezer burned. Surprised at the high ratings.  Very disappointing.
author: Chelsea D.

description:
Standard Pho place.  Their beef is fresh and you can order the meal with the beef on the side. That way you can cook them the way you like them.  I like mine relatiely raw.  

Their chicken broth soup noodle is one of the best.  And not many places serve the Clear noodles, but this place does.  It is a little more expensive than the couple of Vietnamese soup noodle places down the street.   Regular size bowl is about $5.50, which is not bad in the scheme of things. 

Service is super-duper fast!  The old man waiter approaches you 1 minute after you sit down.  If you turn him away twice, he gets impatient with you.  They move their customers in and out - FAST.  Be prepared.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Was gunning for PPQ but got done in by the CASH ONLY (I had only $6). The bright shiny place across the street had the VISA/MASTERCARD sticker which got us in the door.

Being a PPQ loyal, I wasn't expecting much. Service was surly beyond belief, bordering on the absurd. Our server was visibly annoyed when we didn't realize that some of the pho numbers (which already had prices by them) in fact could be ordered in any size.

We'll have the #9.
What size?
Well, just the regular #9. It says it's $5.25.
What size?
We don't quite understand...
[the huffing and puffing sound of disgust]

Then, I asked for the A2 (fresh spring rolls). About
5 seconds later, I said I meant the A1 (fried) not the A2.
[the huffing and puffing sound of disgust]
So, you want A2 [huff, puff]  instead of A1? [huff puff]
Uh, yeah. Sorry about that.
Then she sticks the order pad in my face and scratches
out A2 with a big thick pencil and writes in A1 emphatically.
A1 instead of A2...RIGHT? A1 instead of A2...RIGHT?

I'm far sighted so I have to lean back a bit to see what the hell she's writing. Uh, yeah. Sorry about that. I nod.

After she took the order up, we decided to change one of our #9's to a #37 instead, risking certain decapitation. She made a blood curdling scream but then put away her machete and went about the other tables.

After that, smooth sailing. The pho, a medium, at $5.95, was plenty large. The portion was good, well cooked, with high quality beef. The broth was above average and the noodles were good. The pork chop over rice was not too fatty, well cooked and 4 large pieces. The A1 was fried and crispy, staying hot for awhile. The veggie garnishes, was fresh as was the accompanying bean sprouts.

4 stars food, 1 star service but with extra credit for some amount of entertainment value  = 3 stars.
author: Henry Y.

description:
Service: Typical Vietnamese
Food Eaten: Pho, 3 color dessert
Price: Its pho...
Would I come here again: Yes!

4.5 stars but since you can't do a half, I'll bump it up. I think out of all the places I have ever eaten pho at, this probably tops it. The broth is tasty, the noodles done just right, and it doesn't leave me wondering where all my meat went. Unless I feel like experimenting, this is the place I come when I am craving some good pho!
author: Richard L.

description: Definitely satisfied! I went here once with my friends and once with my brother and sister. The first time I got a kid's size bowl because I wasn't that hungry. It was actually really filling for just $3.95! The second time I got a medium size bowl of noodles. I was very full for just $5.95. This is place is works really fast as well. They are ready with your food about 2-3 minutes after you order. I love coming here for lunch whenever I'm in the area.
author: Maggie H.

description: Not a fan of this place. The food is not that good and the service sucks after they take your order. I asked for water 2 times on 2 separate occasions and never got it... Wtf at least they are consistent with that.
author: Mark C.

description: I have noo idea what the hype is about this establishment... it sucked. the broth sucked. the noodles sucked. the seafood cut into huge pieces sucked. I had the #28 and i just didnt get the richness of the flavor from the broth. I asked them to give me the beef broth but with seafood..still nothing...NAADA...and what is up with the different style of noodles? thought there was only one standard noodles for pho, vermecelli no? i've had pho twice out here and they would ask me "what kind noodle?" . i would respond with, "pho noodles." and one gave me ramen noodles and now Kevin's Noodle gave me huge spaghetti noodles. really strange. well after this experience my pho adventures in SF are going to have to be put on hold. till next time!
author: Sady C.

description: A great pho place in the city. The broth is not too salty compared to many of the other pho places. The portions are perfect and not too large. The shredded pork and grilled pork rice plate was delicious. The shredded pork wasn't too dry. There was a good ratio of meat to rice. A great place to go for cheap and delicious food. You will leave feeling just right.
author: Eve C.

description: Last week, I ordered myself a beef stew, and it was big. Well it makes you full and such. The meat was good and the soup was legit yummy. The service is quick and I love coming here for some beef stew.
author: Sandy C.

description: Been going to this place forever now. Both food and customer service at this location is stupendous! A complete opposite of the one on Southgate, Daly City. I love the imperial rolls, pork chop rice plates and #26 (soup). The honeydew tapioca drink is also refreshing.  Prices are reasonable, restaurant is clean but parking can be tough especially at night. There is a metered parking lot about 1/2 a block away but even that can be full at times.
author: Michelle G.

description:
One of my favorite places for pho. 

They never disappoint whenever I'm there. I really recommend their beef stew. There so much beef in there... 4 stars only because whenever I order a drink, they always forget to bring it to me but theyre quick to charge me when the bill comes. =/
author: Julie T.

description: Fast. You can be in and out in 10 minutes. I love coming here because they're open until 10pm. Their broth isn't completely composed of sodium, only half way, which is a lot less than the other pho places. They get in you and out and full and warm. Especially on the cold winter nights when I have to finish projects for work. Instant fullness and its not to heavy where I cant think because i'm so bloated. its a delicious fast meal that makes you warm :)
author: Mish L.

description:
I stopped in this place the other day and was immediately seated and served tea.  I ordered the tái (#17), my regular for pho joints, and a Vietnamese coffee and was promptly served.  The broth was a little darker than what I'm accustomed to (a different variety perhaps?) but the soup was tasty and fragrant (I'm pretty sure I could smell cinnamon).  I thought the meat was a little overdone (like maybe it didn't go in right before being served), but overall I was very satisfied with my meal.  Coffee was delicious as usual.

Great service, great prices.  Would go again.
author: Matthew B.

description: "So how's Kevin"? That was one crazy Saturday night. Stumbled into PHH2 about 45 minutes before closing. For some reason, we thought they opened late. I wound up getting the large #32 pho bo kho and a viet-iced coffee. It's their beef stew version, and it was served hella fast. Good flavor from the beef, clean broth and not too oily, noodles were cooked right. Parking is atrocious (yea, I know - it's the outer sunset). Fairly clean place. I'll definitely come back here...
author: Derek N.

description:
I would've given it four stars. It lost one because one of the waiters was fucked up. My friends and I asked for a few cups of water. And he was like "you have to finish it or else we will not give it to you." We were all thinking, your water is tap anyway, you got nothing to save!!
Anyways, the pho here is pretty good. I always come here for pho when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Annie H.

description: We went here hoping for a little pho and some springs rolls.  We got just that.  I had the combo number one and thought it was pretty average.  The fresh spring rolls were solid however.  As a whole, I would give this restaurant a 2 on food ("it's okay"), a 4 on price (pho ranged between $5-9, easy to eat on the cheap), and a 3 for service.   Again, if it were only about the food, it's a 2, but given how cheap it is, it's decent bang for your buck.
author: Gary C.

description: This is by far my favorite pho place in the Sunset. I usually get a number 1 and it's always good. I also like how its open later than most things in the sunset.
author: Eric M.

description: The pho tai was solid, spring rolls were weak on flavor.  Open clean place, and good service.  I liked the egg rolls eaten with the lettuce wrap and dipped in sauce.
author: rino f.

description: Actually not bad. I enjoyed my food. Located in the sunset so parking was difficult. Prompt service.
author: J C.

description: This place is good. We know Pho and this is good place. The food is clean and fresh.
author: Ddc C.

description:
Good stuff, good stuff. And very fast service! We ordered up and it was delivered in about 10 minutes.

Spring Rolls- win, excellent dipping sauce.
Number 1- win
Mi- great soup, sucky noodles. Instant ramen-y. Then again, I'm not a huge fan of noodles anyway. But excellent broth and toppings!

And I love that they have all the awesome condiments right there on the table to spice your pho up. Three choices of chili sauces, fish sauce, vinegar, etc...yummy yummy yummy.
author: Carnley P.

description:
Great, fast and affordable!

This place is hits the spot on a cold winter's night. 

Every time I head back into the city I come here to grab a quick bite before heading home. The only thing I don't like is waiting in line during the dinner hours starting around 7-830pm is when people rush in the most, so I recommend getting here early if you can. 

***Recommended: #1 or #2

**Highlights: Affordable and delicious 

*Low points: Dinner hours and street parking
author: Amy C.

description:
I've only been here twice. (from what i can remember at least)

First time i had the #1 noddle, which was veryy good. Second time, i had their seafood #29, a-OK, compare to the one in Oakland.

Can't really complain since this place is fast and cheap, as well as clean. Their portion is smaller than Oakland, less noddles. But again, this is the only place we like to go that's nearby when we do crave Pho.
author: Viola C.

description:
So much yum. Hadn't been since years ago when we lived a block away, tonight we wanted fresh spring rolls, kinda-late-night, and since Tay Giang was not answering the phone at 9:20 for their 9:30 closing time, I saw this had the best reviews in reasonable driving distance.
Two orders of #A2 - Gi Cun spring rolls [non fried; peanut sauce, YUM]. We ate1.5 orders & saved the other half for later. I got the #43 - Cm Bò Tàu H Ky, steak and shrimp cakes over rice with salad. Really yummy, and the shrimp cakes in particular were amazingly flavorful. Salad comes with a dressing that reminded me of the sweet rice vinegar that comes with cucumber and onion at Thai places...I dipped my salad veggies in it, and was sipping on it once the salad was done. Love it.
My husband got the #13 - Tái, Gu beef pho. Delicious broth, all the cold veggies & herbs came in a separate bag to stay fresh, broth in one container and noodles & beef in another, so that the rare beef would stay that way until you pour the broth over it. Awesome. Our Fiestaware 1-quart serving bowl was the perfect dish for the task. ;)

Will definitely return; everything was tasty and the drive wasn't too taxing. Will probably eat-in if we're in the 'hood and it is convenient, as well. Really friendly cashier-dude.
author: Ali W.

description: This place does not have good service, I asked for more veggies and water and they did not come and give it to me, I had to ask two times it was so annoying.
author: Poison I.

description:
I prefer this location to the one in Westlake.  The service is more attentive and the restaurant appears to be more bright and appealing.  Really, you can not go wrong with a steaming bowl of thinly sliced beef accompanied with bean sprouts, cilantro and a squeeze of lemon.  YUM!  Chicken wings doused in some nuoc mam cham...optional.  LOVE IT!  

I think the only challenge to this place is the parking, but if it's meant to be there's always an open spot willing you to go to here.
author: elizabeth c.

description: Awesome meal and healthy portions. Recommend the special combo #2 medium. Has all major ingredients including beef ball, and a good amount of noodles. Will definitely eat here again.
author: Tony N.

description: This was our 3rd time coming here and this time was very disappointing to us and our guest. Two dishes that my husband and friend ordered was the same and they both looked at each other and said the same thing. That's it! They were both still hungry after eating the noodles, grilled pork & egg roll. They were very shocked that it looked like they took 1 order and split it between the two of them. This time we decided not to go back again. There are many other Pho houses around to enjoy.
author: Kim F.

description:
Kevin's Noodle house is just an example of Asian "fast-food."

The food always comes out near instantly, making one wonder whether the food was precooked and just reheated (rice plates and vermicelli).  Noodle soups also come out almost right after you order.  Talk about fast food.

I usually opt for the #2 The combination beef noodle soup (the one with the beef balls) or if I'm really hungry, go for the #1 because its an X-Large.  Sometimes I'll go for the chicken pho, but only if I don't feel like going to the Tenderloin for Turtle Tower.  Other times I might try a rice plate or vermicelli as pho gets boring after so many times.  The imperial rolls are okay, have had better.  The chicken wings are VERY oily and not the best also.  The plus with their chicken wings though, is that they make it themselves in the back.  Other places uses frozen stuff and just toss it in the fryer (ABC on Noriega).  Food is okay.  Very cheap and very filling.   

Just wish the soup didn't look like dirty toilet water -_-  But hey, what pho restaurant has soup that doesn't look like that? Always ask for extra lime as it makes your food taste better, and gets rid of the smell.  I also wish the quality of their food was better.  The beef is rubbery a lot of times and has too much fat.  The tendon, which should be very soft, is always too tough for my liking.  Tripe is something I forgo at this place because of how chewy and raw it feels when I try to eat it.

Service isn't the best here.  A group of around 5-6 I came with, asked for ice water, and they just laughed and yelled "ice water."  We never did get that ice water until we asked them for the 3rd time.  Terrible.  If we ask once, you should just bring it and not be so rude about it.  

I guess I'll be coming back here whenever PPQ -right across the street -  is packed like it always is when I go.  If this place is also packed, then I'm waiting for PPQ.  For what you pay, and how fast the food comes out, it gets a 3 star in my book.  If the food was a little better, or if they even had what I could call "service," they would probably get a 4 star.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Came here early in the morning with my family.  We were all underwhelmed.  Usually there should be a big plate of veggies with bean sprouts, basil, and saw leaf.  We had 2 bowls of pho and they gave us a small plate of veggies with bean sprouts and TWO stems of basil.  Where is the saw leaf?!  The pho wasn't that great.  The broth was lacking and the servings seem smaller than other places.  

My bro and sis got the rice plates.  They don't have traditional broken rice.  The bean curd skin on the shrimp cake wasnt crispy.  The meat marinate was average.  I guess SF dont have good Viet restaurants?  With 400 reviews, I was expecting at least average.
author: Tommy D.

description:
Ugh... The parking in San Fran is driving me bonkers... I hate parking here... It's worse than LA. 
Well. So I figured all the good Asian food must be out of Chinatown since I couldn't find any there. Came all the way out here after a long day of walking. 
All I can say is... Everyone who loves this place hasn't been to Westminster to eat pho in LA. 
So it's not the greatest and I left feeling disappointed since reviews were so high. We had ordered a large plain noodles pho just for kids and the amount of noodles was basically a med just in a larger bowl. Ok. The pho dac biet in medium size was fair in price but just lacked flavor in the broth. The cha gio was an upset , pretty much just sat on our plate. I can make ten times better and that's exactly what the kids said. So don't get that.  
Will I be back. Never. Fellow Sanfranscian  Yelpers, I have to think twice before checking out these spots. Where do I find good Westminster food in SanFran? (hmm...did i just answer my own question?)Maybe someone can help...
is wasn't worth the effort to park and the total bill was reasonable but it just wsn't good. it felt like the broth was broth, not beef stock...and yes there is a difference. ANd another weird thing the server asked me was did i want chicken broth or beef broth...? huh? i was a bit dumbfounded for a moment. We do get BEEF broth with pho  correct?(unless its chicken pho)  is what i should have said...
author: Mrs H.

description: So I've been here a couple of times and the place is open and clean. There is a good amount of choices here like majority of the Vietnamese pho restaurants. I tend to order different types of beef pho mixtures here. They serve fresh cut limes and veggies to throw in as well, which I love because a lot of places have wilted basil leaves and old limes that are dry with very little juice no matter how hard you squeeze them. LoL The service acknowledges you right when you walk in the door and the food is served quite fast. This is a good place to go for a quick fix of pho and don't forget to add some hot chili sauce to SPICE UP YOUR LIFE!!! ;P
author: Anji W.

description: #17 all day everyday. Also, best egg rolls I've ever had. And the pork chops are awesome as well if you don't want phó.
author: Jeremy H.

description: This "Kevin" dude knows his pho. This place is the perfect place to visit when you're hungover, sick, or just plain hungry. The customer service can use some improvement but lets me honest: most pho restaurants focus on the pho and nothing else, so I've learned to accept that and just enjoy the pho for what is: damn delicious!!
author: Nancy L.

description:
3 stars overall based on food.  Not great, but not bad either.  Its one of those places you'll go to if you're around the neighborhood and hungry, but probably wouldn't go out of your way for.   

+1 star for giving me free soup and offering tea right off the bat when the weather suddenly got cold.
author: Tuan M.

description:
What the pho! I like this place ;)

I just got some today. The waiters may be old, but he take cares of me. 

Nothing more to say, they know me best.


It does not taste like a msg noodle soup.

Many people recommended #1 on the menu

I recommend the thick yellow egg noodles for my seafood noodle soup ;)



Sometimes i would order the dry noodles to go. Currently, eatting the to go order now. Suckers =p
author: Ernest S.

description: I can't really go wrong with Pho, especially in SF. This place does not disappoint taste wise, but the service was lacking. Since my friend frequents this restaurant, I told her to order me the best Pho on the menu. She went with her favorite, which was the medium sized beef. Even though she said 2 mediums, they brought us a small and a medium. Instead of making a second medium, they simply added more broth to mine and brought it back. It was rather disappointing b/c there wasn't much to consume. However, it did taste amazing and I loved all of their fresh ingredients and sauces to add to the mix. We also ordered the egg rolls, which tasted amazing w/ their table sauces as well. Yummy! I like that they provided us with free tea as well- always a nice perk! Oh...and on a Friday night, you can expect a wait. So earlier is better.
author: Sonya D.

description:
Fast, cheap, adequately clean, and most importantly, frickin good!

I ordered the standard combo in a large to share with my friend, who ordered the rice plate that had pieces of fried chicken and eggroll. The soup and the noodles were very tasty, and according to her, the rice plate wasn't bad either! Mmm, the eggroll was amazing, especially paired with that orange-colored sour sauce!!! This makes my heart-and cholesterol- explode, but it's worth it!

Will definitely come back!
author: Tara V.

description:
It took me 3 tries to start being able to stomach pho.  My first 3 tries in Downtown Oakland didn't end up too well.  But then I moved to the city and found this place and it's great!

It's a pretty big spacious place so you can go with a lot of friends.  You'll be seated fast and I think just about everything on the menu is less than $10.  It's super fast, super cheap and very filling.  

It's pretty clean considering the many Vietnamese places I've been to and the other restaurants on the same street.  They do take Visa, Mastercard, etc., which is nice especially when you go with your friends and want to worry about splitting the bill later.  

The food always comes out really hot, the meat isn't a questionable blue color and they have plenty of hot sauce, hoisin sauce and it comes with your standard basil, sprouts, peppers and lime.   The broth is light yet full of flavor, not too oily, meat portions are good and the veggies are fresh. 

If you're looking for awesome bun (shhh..go across the street) this place does have decent bun, rice plates, etc., but the Pho here is so so so good. I never get the large because I am very satisfied after a medium.  Unlike some other places, I don't go home with a huge MSG headache afterwards either. 

I've been there with 1 person and also with 30 other people and we always get seated quickly and get our hot bowl of pho just as quick. The only thing is that a large group might have a hard time all finding street parking right away.  But just wait on the side with hazards, something will open up quick. 

I've had their drinks there too, pretty decent.
author: Eileen A.

description:
I LOVE PHO HUYNH HIEP! 

Come here for the perfect hangover food, the perfect sick food, the perfect comfort food...heck, the perfect anytime food.

Let me start off by saying that Kevin's Noodle House #2 on Irving is by far the best out of all the other Kevin's Noodle Houses out there. Fast service, efficient staff, and consistently good meals.

I have never had a bad experience at this pho joint, and I've been going for 7 years straight now. Give or take the occasional nasty mop and fan placed in front of you while you're eating, the cold gusts of wind that slap you in the face every time the door opens because you're seated just a couple feet from the outside pavement while eating your meal, and having to asking for water a few times here and there...Pho Huynh Hiep 2 is as good as, well, as any pho joint can get!

I love it. And trust me, I'd like to think of myself as a pho connoisseur, the food will not disappoint.

If you're new to pho, I'd suggest ordering number 15 and/or 17--they're my favs. Try those for starters. :)
author: Jasmin W.

description: This is my go to SF pho place...eases the cravings and depending on the day it is pretty good
author: E.W. S.

description:
GOOD FOOD, HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!

My friend and I come here for their curry soup and pho. Usually we know what we're getting so it's not a problem. But the last time we came here, I quickly changed my mind right after I placed an order...so I waited for my friend to finishing ordering first, and then told the waiter to take two things off of my order and replace it with ONE thing. Simple, right?? Apparently NOT. Our waiter was young, maybe in his early 20s, and seemed to understand English well enough, but he kept asking me to repeat my order over and over again like 5x. Then after patiently repeating my order to him multiple times, one of the chefs STILL brought out one of the things I asked the waiter to take off. I told him, 'I said no tofu. I didn't order this.' So he went to the back, asked the waiter, and then just came back and put the dish back on our table without saying anything and started to walk away. I stopped him and told him to take the dish back because I didn't order it. 

Then, to make things worse, my friend found a metal object in his soup. The manager came over and apologized and offered a new bowl, but my friend asked to have them take his soup off the tab. I asked the manager if we could get the checks and a couple of boxes. He said okay, and then just walked back over to the front register and sat there!!! After 5 mins of staring at him in disbelief, I stopped another waiter to ask for boxes and the check because our waiter seemed to have disappeared. 

This was a HORRIBLE experience for me and my friend, we tried to be nice and patient about things, but their service just lacks!! We will NOT be coming back. You guys just lost a couple of regulars.
author: Esther K.

description:
The food was good, but nothing really sets it apart from all the pho places I go to in Chinatown and the TL. Plus they don't have two of my favourite dishes - bun bo hue and beef carpaccio with lemon - both of which I can get at Golden Star. On the plus side, their prices are extremely reasonable.

I got the beef stew with clear noodles for an extra 50¢. I thought clear noodles meant the skinny glass noodles, but instead they were like regular pho noodles, but clear and chewier/gummier (called hu tieu, I think). Though there was lots of beef brisket, there wasn't enough broth and most of my noodles were left uneaten just because I ran out of soup. The broth itself was ok but could've been more flavourful.

My friend got the grilled beef & shrimp cake with rice (#43). I didn't get to try the beef but he gave me one of the fried shrimp cakes and I really liked it, especially the crispy tofu skin (dried bean curd) it's wrapped in. We also split an order of shrimp spring rolls, which, again, were good but tasted like spring rolls you can find at any other Vietnamese restaurant.
author: Steph L.

description: I had to drop it down a star, because I went in with high expectations on a very cold day, and my noodles were overcooked and soggy. :(
author: Ming-Jou C.

description:
Service is quick right when you walk into the door.  Plenty of seats available. Its a pretty big room. 

Order the Pho, and its on your table in like 4 minutes. Super quick and really easy on your budget. 

Sometimes though the food can be really salty. Its really random every time I go there.
author: Chris L.

description: This is one of the top restaurants I go to for pho, the small is the perfect size for me and their noodles are always good. If you're not in the mood for pho the vermicelli is great too, I would recommend the 55B which has a crispy egg roll, tender chicken, and veggies over noodles with two sauce/soups to go with it. Surprisingly, the shakes with boba are pretty good as well. The place is big which is good because it fills up pretty quick but the only negative thing is that the service isn't all that great, so I have to knock off a star for that.
author: Rachel M.

description: Yummy noodles, fast service.  The only drawback is parking.  It is always a headache.
author: GM A.

description: I personally like this place better than the Kevin's Noodle House at Westlake. Although the portion seems small, I think the pho here is still pretty bomb. I would probably come here more often if there was one closer to my house.
author: Tony K.

description:
This my go-to spot for Pho in the Sunset/Richmond district.  Consistently flavorful broth when you order the beef Pho and comes out ridiculously fast (under 3 minutes).  The number of Vietnamese people eating here nightly should tell you that it's authentic and up to snuff.

I normally go for the #3 (combination-medium) to get the full mixed beef taste including the tripe and tendon.  Vietnamese coffee and three bean drink are good as well although I would skip the boba/milk-tea drinks which are way too artificially.  You can get better drinks down the street at TeaWay or at any one of the many dessert-drink shops nearby.
author: Roger W.

description:
22C. Its my favorite.

I finally got to try their taro milkshake with tapioca ($3). I thought it was a little too sweet! Don't let the ice melt. It taste better when its cold. Eh. At least it tasted better than Quickly's taro tea. I also thought their tapioca balls were kinda hard. 

2.5 stars  for my boba drink. 3.5 stars for my noodles.
author: B B.

description: Its enough to satisfy a pho craving and the food comes out quick. It's a bit overrated and I do not think this place is worthy of a four star rating. I ordered the #1 Pho noodles and the broth was way too salty. 2 slices of lime was still not enough to cut down the saltiness. The meat was tough, and there was only 2 piece of tendons. I've definitely had better pho before.
author: Michelle H.

description:
I love pho! Nothing quite hits the spot on cold rainy nights after a long day at work.

This place does it right - cheap, fast and friendly. I tried  c Bit Bò Viên - special combo w/thin slices of steak, well-done brisket, flank, tendon & beef balls. It was truly spectacular!

I will be back for more!
author: Linda b.

description: Amazing. Wish I lived closer so I could go at least once a week.
author: Baby E.

description:
Came here with 2 others today and haven't had pho for awhile! Most bowls of pho are priced at--  (S): $5.25  (M): $5.95  (L): $6.75. I went with a small bowl of pho with my steak on the side, as the other two had larges. Yeah, I am pretty pathetic when it comes to eating carbs. Anywho! 

The man who took our order didn't breath down our necks as most places seem to do. Gave us all the time we needed, which wasn't much and we flagged him down to take our order. Food came out shortly afterwards, and they brought our ice waters out, promptly. 

Good pho is all about the broth and this broth was bangin'! Wasn't murky and completely oily making it impossible to see what was underneath all that gunk, like its competitor across the street (Sorry PPQ--had a bad experience there when I found a crane fly in my soup, partial way of eating my pho, GROSS). My raw steak slices were cut really thin, and layed out pretty. 

Our check came after we were all done with our meals, which is refreshing, as most other places slam that bill on you once they want you to hurry up and leave. Come here if you just want a tasty, cheap, meal that will get you wanting to crawl into bed afterwards. :)
author: Ada T.

description:
I enjoyed the pho but I don't know if it was that amazing. But broth does hit the spot and it's clean and flavorful. What I really enjoyed was the pork chop plate, which tasted great. 

The place is relatively clean, and a good size -- a bit like one big room. The plates and forks bothered me because they're so cheap they kind of clatter but that's a random, personal thing. 

Service is okay, I guess. Nothing to complain about but nothing special.
author: Sydney E.

description:
I enjoy the Pho here.  The broth is flavorful, and the portion of meat is reasonable.  

For a Vietnamese restaurant, this place definitely a lot cleaner than others that I have dined at.  A nice plus sign for Kevin's Noodle House.

While ordering however, our server was extremely rude.  My dad asked her if he could substitute his Tripe for Beef Balls instead.  He's not a fan of Tripe.  Now truth be told, the tripe, I'm sure is more expensive and Beef Balls.  But the servers response was definitely very unnecessary. She responded to our "INSANE" request with a stern NO, plain and simple...as if it was a huge inconvenience or something.  I mean she could've said "Sorry, no substitutions."   

She can't use the "I don't speak English " card, I won't buy it.  She was speaking perfect English to me as I was ordering my food.

While this experience is somewhat petty, it started off our meal on the wrong foot.  

Overall, this place is great getting food out quickly.  But our sour server really needs have an attitude check.
author: Cass J.

description:
I've been coming here for years. It's been my go-to spot for pho since I was in college years ago in the City. There is a huge menu with a good variety of Vietnamese foods and drinks. Pho, Rice plates, Spring rolls, Avacado smoothie, Cafe Sua Da, etc etc. 

- You sit FAST. 
- Your order FAST. 
- Your food comes out FAST. 
- You get the better than average service than the typical pho restaurant. 
- AND they are consistent everytime!
author: Rie P.

description:
It's alright. Not the best I've had but one thing I do like is the choice between blending my red bean drink or keeping it whole. I had the small #8, thinly sliced beef and beef balls...the bowl seems smaller than other vietnamese places but eh maybe it was just me. The broth had a heavy in oil consistency so don't expect much. 

Although it was busy, service was good and obviously run by a family judging from the young kids working the counter.
author: Crystal C.

description: Your typical Vietnamese pho place, perfect for a cold night in SF. Don't think it's anything spectacular other than the fact that it's dirt cheap. It was surprising to me than a bowl of pho in suburban Vacaville is the same price as a bowl of pho in SF. If I were you, I probably won't use the chopsticks here cause they're super sticky and smells like toxic chemical. Since I don't have the strongest stomach in the world, I asked for forks, but the service is lacking is so many ways. We had to ask three different servers for forks and finally got them 10 minutes later... UH THANKS.
author: Michelle L.

description: Instead of playing restaurant roulette on Irving, I decided to Yelp since my friend and I were in the mood for pho. I'm glad I did- because this place has good food and drinks for a good price. 1 medium bowl of pho ($5.95) with an avocado smoothie ($3). The service was speedy too, I don't like that it gets packed, because I don't want to be sharing a table with some random stranger(s), but I understand why it does get packed.
author: Karen D.

description: Your ordinary pho that you can get almost anywhere for this quality. I don't find it all that authentic. The prices are reasonably cheap. I don't want to name all the cons about this place so: one of my favorites is 51A the dry noodles with beef/pork and egg rolls, I also like how they don't give me weird stares when I just ask for pain noodle in beef broth without parsley and another favorite is the egg rolls. Other than that I have to admit that the service is horrible. They make you wait for long periods of time to get your check. They are nonchalant. They are exceptionally rude. They talk shit about you in multiple languages when you point out there is something wrong with your bill.
author: Jess W.

description: Top ranked pho place in SF. We either get pho with beef or chicken, and every time you get what is expected. The portion sizes they offer of sm, med, and large are helpful for different appetite levels. I usually order chicken and it comes out almost shredded and tastes amazing. They use a great  broth and the noodles are always cooked right. The food comes out almost immediately after ordering even with a jam packed restaurant, which it usually is any week night around dinner time. They are cheap, fast, and very delicious.
author: Chayne J.

description: Most pho places have really bad service but I was surprised this one was okay. Of course there was a bit of a language barrier but I got what I ordered. I know pho has a lot of msg but this place was extra msg-y.
author: Brenda I.

description:
Around six dollars
Costs a hearty bowl of pho.
Irving Street Bargain!

Brisket's taste, like tuna!?
Steak was thawed, rainbow sheen! Yet, 
Clear and beefy broth.

Pho has three sizes;
Medium will be a feast,
Large will fill your bath.

Food arrived quickly.
Time to wipe the chopsticks down,
Al dente noodles.

Better pho exists,
Because of weird beef taste.
Try the bun next time.
author: Suo L.

description: The room mates I had when I first moved to the city could not stop talking about this place. The first time I ate here I knew why. The pho here is still one of the best I have ever had. This is my go-to place for pho when I am in the neighborhood and I often go out of my way to come here.
author: Nick L.

description: I'm from socal and not a big fan of pho around norcal in general other than a few gems in Oakland, but this place wasn't bad at all. The pho is as it should be and since I'm not very good at describing flavor I'll just say it was pretty good. Service was ridiculously fast where we got our appetizers within a minute (yeah, I know, that usually isn't a good thing) and the pho came out 2 minutes after that. Clealiness is as it usually it usually is in a Viet restaurant. Overall I'm glad I drove out of my way to try this place. If you're not sure which of the few pho places to try in SF, this is a safe bet.
author: John N.

description:
Friendly enough staff and clean facilities.

Great tasting pho.

NASTY after effects...ew.

Diarrhea.

Enough said.
author: Alex D.

description:
Let me start off by saying I make it a point to try pho where ever I see it in the bay area. Pho is a meal the rejuvenates me even on my shittiest days, but not every bowl of pho leave me feeling that way.

The beef pho at Kevin's is the FRESHEST and RICHEST pho I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing. My partner and I live around the corner and we are considered regulars (Once a week, at least 5x a month) and when we feel like pho it is always the number 3 and number 13.

The broth is liquid crack, that is the only phrase that comes to mine. The ratio of noodles is on point and the sprouts/basil/limes are ALWAYS fresh. The service is FAST, yet friendly. And it is always packed, what does that tell you?

When we venture off the pho menu the vermicelli dishes are delightful, as well as the spring rolls, fresh to order.

Bottom line if you want good Pho at a great price and fast, Kevin's is the only option.
author: Laura C.

description:
BOBA review

why  pay $4.25 for an Avocado smoothie at Wonderful when you can get one at Pho Huynh Hiep for $3?? exactly. You shouldn't... Instead, get your exotic flavored boba smoothies at Kevin's Noodle House!  They are all the same price, and all of them are delicious!  The boba is just as good as Wonderful.  It has a nice sweet taste to it.  I love their jackfruit and avocado smoothies.  They also have Taro, coconut, lychee, and the list goes on... Their smoothies aren't too sweet and have a nice refreshing taste to them.

Try them the next time you go to get pho here.  Not to mention, their egg rolls are DELICIOUS.  way better than any Imperial roll.
author: Diane L.

description:
pho takeout review: awesome.

i placed an order and actually didn't eat the food until the next day. i was pretty happy. i'll definitely drop by again.
author: T R B.

description:
This place is okay.  It's pretty much like every other hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese restaurant and offers the expected standard selections - Pho, Bun, Rice Plates, Spring Rolls.  The place is brigher and slightly nicer than PPQ across the street.  Pho, I think is slightly better at PPQ, but it's cheaper here.

The time I was there, they had the doors open and the place was filled with flies.  We're talking like 40-50 at least.  So, it was not a good experience... I've not been back since that experience.
author: Paul K.

description:
I love their pho kids menu! because i'm a small person. I normally go to places  and order the smallest pho bowl and i can't finish it and i feel like i'm wasting. i got the pho kids beef noodle thing. it was good! i also got Vietnamese coffeee with sweetened condensed milk. and it works for me. caffeine normally doesn't affect me. but this time it did! whoot. the vietnamese coffee is slow drip and i was like what is this thing? so it drips and it's slow =( i got impatient and poured the coffee from the "dripper" into my coffee and clumps of ground coffee beans came out with it, but no biggie. i'm not picky with my coffee.

i came back from ocean beach last night. so freaking cold even when you're next to a bonfire. it was nasty. sand was all over the place. you got a tornado of sand and fire sparks. so this pho place was especially nice compared to the beach. 

and i still have sand in my ears!
and i got locked out of my room five times.
this was the highlight of my yesterday.
author: Emily K.

description: Kevin's is our go-to pho place because it's fast, cheap, and the portions are huge. They don't have all the varieties like PPQ (across the street) has but their basics are great. The large size is gigantic so even my husband who is a big eater only gets the medium. Two can dine for $15 which is hard to beat. The wait is never long for a table and once you order the food usually arrives in 5 minutes or so. They also take credit cards which is nice for a change.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I love Pho simply for all the puns you can make with it.  But punny biases aside, this place has some of the best Pho I've ever had.

I got the Pho with beef flank and beef brisket.  The meat is standard, which is not a bad thing.  When you order, just get a Pho with whatever meats you usually like, and chances are, you'll like them in your Pho.  The noodles and broth are what make this place more than just another Pho place.  The noodles are perfectly cooked: slightly chewy and delicious on their own.  The broth, garnished with your taste for cilantro, basil, etc., is clean and flavorful.  The smell of the broth alone jump-started my taste buds.  The best part of the broth is how there isn't an excessive amount of oil, which makes the broth more refreshing than heavy.

I also had the Fried Spring Rolls, which tasted more like "fried" than it did "spring."  The finished product tasted like any generic egg roll you might find in the market.  Not the worst, but nothing to rave about either.

Despite the disappointing starter, there's no doubt in my mind that you will leave this place pholl of pho, in a good way.

GET:  Pho (any)
author: Michael K.

description: This is the spot for my beef pho fix... there pork chop rice plates are good too, standard pho place
author: jonathan h.

description: Delicious, delicious, delicious chicken rice noodle soup with green onions. White meat, non-oily broth, nice spicy sauce I could mix in to my hearts content. Will be back very soon.
author: Erin W.

description:
Oh, how I love Kevin's Pho on a cold day. 
It's a lot of food so last few times I ordered the children's steak bowl. The soup, the noodles, sprouts, chillies and lime make for the perfect bowl of soup..The spring rolls are also very good as well as their crab cakes. 
Oh yes and their desert drinks are really good too, especially their taro shake.
This is a great family style place with really nice people and great food. I definitely recommend this restaurant.
author: Denise S.

description:
Pretty good pho and rolls. Sinh to bo (avocado milkshake) is pretty yums too, I can tell they actually use a good amount of avocado unlike many other places. Plus, I'm lactose intolerant and I still order this so it must be that good.

p.s. Dad says it doesn't beat pho from LA though. But then he says nothing can compare to pho in Vietnam, so his standards are pretty high. (p.s. i'm from LA)
author: Jenn L.

description: Best pho i've had in a long time.  Loved the chewiness of the noodles, and the flavors.  You get vast amounts of food for very little money.  I hope to be back soon
author: Lolailo Y.

description: Pho was not as good as when the first opened a while back. Soup is lacking flavor and the the portions are just ok!  It's close to the house and pretty much the only one in the area.....
author: King L.

description: FAST, CHEAP, YUMMY & ADDICTIVE. Ever since the first time I came here, I always thought their service is great, lightening fast & the PHO is AMAZING!!! Love it here. Tried other places in the city and they just don't compare - AT ALL.
author: Diana T.

description: Go to place to get your pho if you're in the Sunset/Richmond area. Though I prefer Golden Star down in Chinatown just because I have eaten there more as a kid than at this one.  I can't complain though since it's literally across Golden Gate Park from where I live.
author: Dustin W.

description:
We always crave pho when we wake up on a Saturday with a banging headache.  One of those headaches that doesn't quite count as a hangover, but definitely alcohol-induced.  The cure: a nice, steaming bowl of pho.

Sit down, order a small pho tai with beef on the side and rice noodle substitution.  Let the aroma of the soup flow through.  Take a sip if you'd like.  Let the broth warm up your tummy.  You'll feel better in no time.

Just try not to wake up before they open.  Because it's the longest wait of your life.  Seriously.
author: Jenny L.

description: I am very down with Kevin's. We came in here after a few hours of hanging out at Chug Pub, which is just down the street. Needless to say, we were hungry. I ordered the Brisket pho which was great, very rich and tasty. The only downside I see to this place is that they don't have any vegetarian pho broth, so just to be aware of if you are not a meat eater. Otherwise I would highly recommend.
author: Shayna S.

description: This is now my go-to pho place in the Bay!!! Yay!!! I've yet to discover a pho place that reminded me of the pho I used to get when I lived in Fresno. Their pho was very very delicious, we also got the egg rolls, which were very yum as well. Also, the fact that they have parking, accept cards, and have a rather large dining room is a big bonus! I was referred here by my girls at Glen Park Nails and they did not steer me wrong. Love it!
author: Maya B.

description:
When we want pho, we usually go to PPQ across the street. But the Bun Tom Nuong -- vermicelli with shrimp -- at Kevin's cannot be beat. The shrimp are fresh, hot and grilled to perfection, and you get generous portions of noodles and greenery along with them. It's a perfectly proportioned, perfectly flavored, perfectly cooked meal. You also get a cup of chicken broth along with it, which is nice on a rainy day.

Make sure not to order the dish with pork, which is fatty and tough. Just go for the shrimp -- that's what it's all about.
author: Val P.

description: It is the place that I come often for Pho. I love their giant portion and it is just cheap as hell. But since the broth comes out not quite hot therefore my steam hearbs are not ever cooked, and that is a reason why I took one point off of it. Also, I love their Che 3 Mau. It is so so so goodddd!
author: Loan L.

description:
Came here on a rainy Thur night.  It was pretty crowded but we didn't have to wait.  The pho is pretty decent for SF standards.  The Mi was pretty good too; however, minus -1 star for not deveining the shrimps.

Service was pretty std for a Vietnamese pho joint.  They take your order pretty quick and your soup arrives on the table w/in  5-10 min.
author: Michelle T.

description:
One of my favorite places to get pho in the city. The food is very delicious, it's cheap and the portions are more than generous. You'll wonder how anyone could ever put down an entire XL pho but apparently they can. I'm 6'2'' and the medium size suits me just fine.

The restaurant is no secret to the local Sunset crowd so expect lines if you're going during peak hours. It's a popular joint and rightly so.
author: Anthony C.

description: Never had pho I didn't like but this place is really good! Had the beef vermicelli with egg roll and a side of pulled pork.  The pork was a little shady but somehow it grew on me during the meal. Beef were nice little cuts of meat. Good fresh spring rolls too. As with all pho the price is nice and low. Some of the best bubble tea I have ever had.
author: Tony N.

description: This is my local pho house. Sometimes we'll come here two or three times a week. Great portions, good value, friendly service, super fast - from ordering to your table in less than 4 minutes. Usual dishes: fried shrimp cakes, beef stew with rice noodles, the #1, the #2 (same as #1 but one size down and with beef balls). Definitely try the avocado shake!
author: Stephen Y.

description: Come here all the time, just because it's near my house and the pho is filling. The flavor here is a lot better than a lot of other places I've been to as well. I'd say their prices are decent, the service probably recognizes me and my friends by now, haha, and overall, decent. But now with the shooting that happened recently, I'm probably not going to be there for a bit, sorry!
author: Diana L.

description:
Everytime I'm lazy and hungry I go here. To Kevin's.
I LOVE the pho. 
LOVE IT.
I sometimes really CRAVE it

Super duper fast too.
The service is fine, sometimes you have to repeat things a couple times- but they're always fast and efficient.

Here's my only question.
Who is Kevin?
Is it that old man who looks like Yoda?
He's my favorite.
He doesn't really say much- just kind of points.
But it's effective.
author: Betty K.

description:
OMG, A GOOD PHO PLACE IN SAN FRANCISCO??? UNHEARD OF, UNTIL NOW.

I am a HUGE pho snob...if that even exists, just because I used to breathe, eat, and sleep pho (yay mother). Just when I was giving up hope, I see this little shop on the corner of Irving and decided to give it a try. I've been to multiple pho joints in the city, and have never been REMOTELY impressed.

I don't know if it's a San Franciscan thing, but going into a eat-in pho place, I don't expect much for ambiance or service...all I need is my pho ASAP, and for my pho to be delicious so I have no complaints about the inside decor nor the service.  What I love is that there are a bajillion tables, so there is rarely ever a wait and you will get your food fast. 

AUTHENTICALLY VIETNAMESE! Menu items are in Vietnamese, coffee is served Vietnamese style, and they even have tamarind candy in the front for when you're done and want to pay your bill. 

Amazing #8, Beef and rare steak pho, super flavorful without tasting like a bowl of MSG...I could eat a large bowl and a half! COMPARABLE TO THE PHO IN SAN JOSE...and that is saying a LOT.
author: Anna T.

description: My favorite pho noodle place. Good service
author: Cathy Y.

description:
A Vietnamese friend of mine took me here on a cold windy winter night, and pho always hits the spot.  

The noodles were a bit soft and overcooked, but the most important thing, the broth, was flavorful and didn't taste like it was artificially boosted with a handful of MSG.  Worth the hike out to the Sunset.
author: Patrick Z.

description: that beef stew was delicious! meat was soft and tender, you can tell it was slow cooked, the broth was flavorful but not overly salty...yummy!
author: Long C.

description:
Kevin's is Pho King Good.  
Yup that's right.
#1 please!
For Asian customer service they are good here.
Kevin please adopt me so I can eat here for free.
author: Po L.

description:
When I crave pho I come here! 
I really like their pho because the broth is good, the noodles are yummy, and they have all the necessary condiments (plum sauce, chili paste/sauce, limes, bean sprouts, basil . . . .etc) My friend actually likes this place better bec they have like "real" chili paste as opposed to its neighbor PPQ who only has rooster sauce. 
I've also had their buhn thit which was pretty good too. I like the ones that come with the egg rolls. yum. 

Overall, its a pretty typical vietnamese restaurant. Still expect to wipe your chopsticks and spoons with napkins for you sanitary concerns. =)
author: Tim B.

description: Pork Chop over rice, egg rolls and bbq beef over vermicelli, Pho noodle soup, spring rolls, yes pleaseeeeee!!!
author: Nancy N.

description: My favorite pho place in San Francisco!!! Absolutely love this place it's delicious try number 17.
author: Chloe A.

description:
I came back in oct 09 and the broth was murky and taste wise not very good. Either off day or they've gone downhill.

I tried the regular Pho this time and found the broth to have a very deep beefy flavor, definitely from a long simmering of bones. All the beef, tripe, and tendon were very good. I haven't tried all the Pho in SF yet, but this bowl is likely a top contender.
author: Derrick V.

description:
We bumped into this restaurant when my friends decided we want some pho. Since we were in Irving and immediately saw a car leaving a parking spot outside of this restaurant we decided we'll just give this place a go. 

You see, this is one of those "meant to be" moment that you know you'll have a pleasurable experience to your taste buds! I ordered a no.7, a medium size bowl, my friends ordered a medium no.2 and a seafood size small. We love the beef broth and my friend love the seafood soup (chicken broth??) also.   I think it's a good price for the portion in the bowl, will definitely return if we were in the area :)
author: Bella A.

description: If your hungover on a Sunday...this is the spot to be. LARGE #8 and fresh spring rolls is all you gotta know.
author: Bryan C.

description: I visit SF a few times a year and now have another place I'll be frequenting.  It's not for the ambiance or the decor.  It's not for the white table cloths or drinks with umbrellas.  It's all about the gallon of pho bubbling in front of my face filling my nose with anise tainted steam.  I'm not asian but I consider myself a well versed pho addict.  This placed put the cravings at bay for the night but I'll be back!
author: Jon G.

description:
Ate the #1 item pho.  Word of advice..if you walk into a vietnamese restaurant and you don't know anything about the place, order the first item.  It's likely the best thing they have or are known for.

Anyhow, had the beef pho with all the wonderful meat, tripe, etc.  

Verdict?  It's aaa-ok!  It's average in my book.  Nothing where I would go ride the N muni line for 45 minutes to get here.  No sir.  But if I'm in the neighborhood and feeling for that warm, yummy soupy feeling when pho hits your belly - I'll come here.  I still think Yummy Yummy near 12th & irving is a bit better.

It is rather cheap for pho in the city though and they give a fairly good amount.  Definitely clean..and doesn't smell like some TL places.  

Oh by the way, if you want to ask for a "knife" make sure you enunciate clearly...or they'll give you"limes".  Nothing wrong with that - I love lime juice in my pho.  Just a simple observation.  :)
author: Yup S.

description: Have been to this restaurant a number of times over the past few years; my earlier visits were just "so-so" but the past couple of times I've dined there recently I seem to have enjoyed the food more so than before. The portions fair and prices reasonable. It's a good place to go for the basics: pho, bun, or com thit nuong.  They also have a good selection of shakes (not sure if it's real fruit, powder flavoring, or combo of both), and pretty good cafe sua da (although I'd say it's on the lighter side rather than strong/bitter I've had elsewhere).  The restaurant is kept clean, service is fine, and food comes out quick.
author: Kent W.

description: Solid place for pho. It's cheap and quick. Definitely a fall back spot for me. Service is always hit or miss but the food is consistent.
author: Preston L.

description: Love this place. I'm an usual at Kevin's Noodle House. Always come here with my dad, the waiter knows my usual. #1 & #10 (no green onions), cilantro on the side, and 2 iced waters. But lately now, they been giving smaller portions of the noodles on the small. I try to not come here often now, just because they're gypping me for the portions. But other than that, this place is good.
author: Emily L.

description:
Mozart and Salieri. Ali and Frasier. Coke and Pepsi. All great rivals have their respective venues of play, whether it's 18th century Vienna, Madison Square Garden, or on a shelf of two-liter bottles at the supermarket.  And on opposite sides of Irving Street at the busy 19th Avenue intersection, few rivals are in as close proximity as Pho Huynh Hiep 2 and Pho Phu Quoc, also known as PPQ.

So what's there to know about these two contenders? For starters, both serve a mean bowl of steaming pho', the perfect compliment to a cold evening, or the perfect way to recover from a cold or to fill an empty stomach.

By coincidence, I went to both Pho Huyn Hiep 2 and PPQ about a week apart.  Both times, the weather was cold and misty.  Both times, the dining areas were crowded with clientele busily chatting away between slurps. And both times I ordered my usual, #1 hold the tendon and tripe (all cartilaginous goodness is always a little too much for me).  In most pho' restaurants, that'll leave you with steak, flank, brisket and sometimes meatballs, with rice noodles in a delicious broth.

Both restaurants serve an excellent bowl of pho'.  I think PPQ sets the benchmark for what to expect from a typical pho' joint with a good broth/noodle/beef ratio, though the bowls could be a tad larger.

On the other hand, the extra-large bowl at Pho Huynh Hiep 2 is tremendous.  I did notice the broth to have a little more texture to it, just a touch thicker with a fuller flavor.  Disappointingly, their ratio wasn't as good--I found myself at the end of our meal scouring the bowl for loose strands to no avail.  The noodles were also slightly overcooked.

So what's the verdict?  Honestly you can't go wrong with either.  The dining area Pho Huynh Hiep 2 is twice as large as PPQ, so on a crowded night, you're likely to get seated faster, in my book this can be the deal-breaker.  They also have larger bowls to accommodate the hungriest patrons.   But on a lazy afternoon when both shops are equally empty, I think I'd tip my hat to PPQ.  They've got the edge when it comes to a well-balanced bowl of pho'.

So if it's crowded, you want a different take on broth, or are simply famished, go to Pho Huynh Hiep 2.  If it's quiet, and all you want is a standard bowl of pho', go to PPQ.  Either way, you can't go wrong.
author: Tony L.

description:
I ate here quite religiously in the early part of the last decade. It was always quick, tasty, and affordable. 

It's cleaner looking now - new chairs and tables. :)

We returned last week and ordered smalls and while I wasn't hungry after the small, I was still left wanting so we walked down the street and got some dim sum. Om nom nom nom.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
This is a great pho place. I didn't think so at first - then I tried PPQ across the street and I realize how much better PPH was. The restaurant is big inside, plenty of tables and chairs and people just come get their noodles and go out- so getting a table is pretty easy here. If you don't want noodle soup, they have rice plates and bun (rice noodle) bowls. 

Came here last night with a friend because I had a craving for pho. I ordered a #3 - which is basically a medium combination beef noodle soup without the beef balls. The soup was very tasty and full of flavor. Nothing like a hot bowl of noodles on a cold day right? My friend order the glass noodles seafood soup - which looked really good too. The fish cake appetizers was on the salty side, and nothing special and I probably won't get this again - but this is called Kevin's noodle house, and not Kevin's appetizer house!
author: Betty S.

description: This place is pretty good and fast service. Also the price is very reasonable and affordably cheap and the pho is good
author: Kayla C.

description: I have past by and think about trying it. Well tonight I finally did and it was worth! My friend and I had vermacelli bowls. They were delicious and came out fast and and warm. They gave us a free little soup and it was good definitely on this cold night.
author: Nadia N.

description: This place served boring, average pho. It's not the best pho I've ever had but it's far from the worst. The service was fast but they kept forgetting to refill my water
author: Dar E.

description: Best pho in the city. #17 for life (pho tai). Straight up steak. Get it on the side and cook it in your hot pho soup to your liking! Only way to do it. Enjoy :)
author: Timothy L.

description: solid 4 for a noodle house.  Special beef was tasty and cheap for extra large bowl.  Porkchops and rice was tasty too.  Located in the Golden Gate Chinatown area.  Too bad it isn't closer to downtown union square or else would be frequenting a lot while on vacation.
author: B W.

description: The Bo Kho is hella good!! As for the pho is good but doesn't compare back at home.
author: Jangalina J.

description:
When I was pregnant most of 2009, I always had major munchies for Vietnamese food (and I still do). We found this place just walking around our neighborhood at the time, and I was always pleased with their food and service. It's usually always crowded, but nothing crazy that I had to wait in line outside for. Of the many Asian restaurants Irving St has to offer, Kevin's is most definitely my #1 choice.

#43 was my usual order (Grilled beef, shrimp cake w/ steamed rice). I usually order this at almost any Vietnamese restaurant I go to.
author: Anio D.

description:
Love it here.

This is my pho place. It's the best thing for a hangover!!!! I sometimes secretly drink too much the night before so i could get some Pho here in the morning.

The service is well... there is no service you order and they bring it to you all in a matter of minutes and then they forget about your existence, i usually go to the counter and pay and leave.

The soups are good, i usually get the chicken pho or the beef pho, both are good!
author: Kristina S.

description: I've gone to this place many times through the years and they seem to be consistently good. I think they're better than the PPQ across the street. Unfortunately, there's no Bon Bo Hue or Vietnamese sandwiches, but it's not on the menu anyways. I usually have their Pho Dac Biet or Beef Stew noodles. Both delicious.
author: Alton Y.

description: I haven't been to this place in like 2 years, but today I was around the neighborhood, thought I get some Pho! I haven't had a bowl of Pho like that in a long while. It definitely fulfilled a craving.  Got the number 1, which is like the special with everything(all the meats- tendons, meet, etc). The broth for the Pho is also good. Other places I've been to lately, had a really bland base, but this place makes it good. (its a bit oily).
author: Jason H.

description:
I love this place.

On a cold Monday afternoon, what am I craving? A hot bowl of PHO! 

#1 special please. Soup is great, no MSG, a nice big portion. 

I just ordered a #1 to go as I type this. YUMMM!
author: David L.

description:
This is the ideal place for pho...cheap, fast, and most of all yummy!  

I got the #23 with wide rice noodle, chicken soup, shrimp, fish cake, slices of pork, and chicken for $5.25 (small) last time I came here with my family. You definitely should consider cleaning the utensils with some water before you eat though. The chicken broth was really delicious but I would have expected more noodles...maybe I should have gotten the regular pho noodles instead. It was still everything I wanted plus more in terms of quality and taste though!

The staff was accommodating when we wanted our bean sprouts to be cooked a bit in boiling water first too. You just need to feel comfortable waving them down to get what you want since it gets pretty loud in there during their busy hours. Expect a quick meal since the food comes out within 5 min and your tummy will be satisfied.

Parking around here isn't TOO bad but you just gotta get lucky!
author: Karen Y.

description:
What the pho?!? What do you mean no one will pho with me? (sigh) My friends and I used to come here every Friday. Not. No. Mo. So sad that we can't make it happen anymore.

Our typical order: small pho with a side of raw beef, fresh spring rolls, fried chicken, pork chop plate with two shrimp cakes and two fried eggs, an extra side of shrimp cakes, an extra order of two fried eggs, an avocado shake and one lychee boba. Oh yeah...that only me and the homo bff's order. We're fatties. Cheap fatties. All that food costs less than $25. 

Clean restaurant, cheap price, good food. I hate the location though. And it's so cold afterwards!
author: Maureen B.

description: Nice and clean spot for pho. I ordered a combo beef pho and was able to replace the regular pho noodle with the ho fun noodle (which I LOOOOVE!!) The service was super fast, even when 90% of the tables were full and we came during lunch hour. Their Vietnamese ice coffee was also pretty bomb. The soup was tasty. Would like to come back and try other dishes as well and for their ho fun noodle!
author: Amy L.

description: This place is good, but I like Loi's more.
author: Forest S.

description: This is my go to pho spot in town.  I love how quickly they fill your order, crucial when you're starving.  I always get a medium bowl of pho (beef flank or chicken) and some spring rolls.  When I'm really hungry the beef pho hits the spot.  When you're sick I recommend the chicken.  It has a very filling but light broth.  The service here is pretty terrible.  They never refill anything unless you ask and they don't engage/speak to you unless it's to take your order.  Fortunately, the food is really good and they do everything quickly.  A great fast food place.  Oh, and it's CHEAP.  Win.
author: Chloe G.

description: I wanted to eat at Loi's first but the place was packed and I was too hungry to wait any longer. So I walked over here for some pho. The place was slightly empty with only a couple of customers -about 5 filled tables. I was seated after I got someone's attention. The waiter came by to take my order when I was ready and I ordered a small #2. Within 5-10 minutes my food comes out with the side of bean sprouts, a slice of lime, jalapeno slices and mint leaves. Compared to Loi's I would say it was a little smaller. After I mixed in everything I was ready to dig in. To my disappointment the noodles tasted funny and a little sour. (I think they didn't rinse it well enough). The tripe? was almost nonexistent. There was a couple of tendons here and there and the beef was not as good as the ones at Loi's. Same for the soup, I think the noodles ruined the soup. It was bland and flavorless. And it was double the price from Loi's $6.50 compared to $3.95? One thing I will remember about this is the piece of plastic I found in the soup! Sorry, you lost me.
author: Carmen L.

description: Love the Hu tieu Bo kho. They give you lots of meat and the broth is so good. Could have had more carrots. My bf had the pho  number 3. He loves it. I would have to say their portions is really generous. Service is friendly and quick.
author: Kim B.

description: Being inexpensive and asian does not excuse a place from having poor hygiene/sanitation.  I ordered the chicken pho noodle soup and found a feather in my soup.  Gross.  And then when I pointed it out, they unapologetically took the bowl back and brought out another bowl of the exact same stuff.  I'd say if you're going to eat here, stick with the regular beef bowl soups, but i'd rather not take my chances here.
author: Irene K.

description: nothing else was good .except spring roll was fresh.  . noodle and soup were not hot enough. My stomach did not feel ok.
author: Justin K.

description:
Pho! This is a simple Vietnamese comfort food item. It is ubiquitous within the community as such, it is expected to be good. 

The general rule of thumb for Vietnamese food is, whenever one enters an establishment with Pho in the name, you order Pho or it's many variations. Everything else (Vietnamese food items), you'd order in a Vietnamese Restaurant.  

Pho at PPH is far from good but close to decent. The overall flavor shows that they tried. 

=)
author: DAVID N.

description:
I wouldn't call myself a vietnamese food connoisseur by any stretch of the imagination, but I was slightly underwhelmed by my Kevin's Noodle House experience (who is this Kevin anyway? very elusive...) I ordered a large steak and beef ball soup and was a bit disappointed by how dry the steak was. The beef balls were good but not good enough to redeem the steak. The crispy spring rolls tasted authentic but they look like regular Chinese spring rolls and the texture is different. If you've had vietnamese fried rolls with the rice paper wrapping, you'd know what I mean.

To echo my fellow yelpers, the choice of size is KEY. My lady friend who has a significantly smaller appetite than myself ordered a smaller version of my beef noodle soup and we were both duly satisfied.
author: Jordan G.

description: I come here at least twice a month, service is great. The food comes out very fast and hot! The pho here is the best I've had, broth is always on point. I would recommend trying the egg rolls, they're crispy and delicious!
author: Lena ..

description:
While their pho isn't especially spectacular as far as vietnamese noodle houses go, the one thing that stood out was that they have small, medium and large sizes to choose from. 

For me, that makes a difference, because I can't EVER finish an order of pho. That being said, I ordered a small beef stew with rice noodle and FINISHED it! Was a decent portion size and filling enough for lunch. Definitely will return there to try other dishes now that I can FINISH a soup! :)
author: cindy c.

description:
Spring Rolls with shrimp are awesome. 

The noodle soup with thin slices of steak Not so awesome. Actually pretty much blahh. My wife had Chicken with Egg Noodles and did they just pop open some Maruchan in the back and triple the price?

We had to go eat ice cream afterwards to rid the blahness from our senses.
author: R J.

description: I am a long time customer of #3, but recently moved to the sunset. Having moved to the sunset, I have started going to #2 and was pleasantly surprised to find that this one is EVEN BETTER THAN NUMBER 3!!!! The same exact menu, which means they have all my favorites. The service is a little better than number three, though they some times forget the odd order of spring rolls. A block from the N line makes it super easy to get to, so I suggest making the trip.
author: Thomas E.

description: I've been going to this place for the past 9 years old and it still tastes exactly the same as it did in the past. Almost the same people work there and they're always very nice to me.
