It's a cheap eat and the service is good. If you're in a hurry just go pick up the check at the register instead of thinking that part of a dining experience requires a waiter to bring you the check. Are you that lazy to walk 20 feet and pay? When it's busy and they're not picking up your check just go bring it to the register. They're doing 500 things at once, can you blame them for forgetting things here and there. Again it's 20 feet of walking.
author: Danny P.

description: I am convinced this is the place to go for Pho. Their seafood noodle soup is wonderful. Vermicelli is amazing too. There is usually a line to be seated but it moves very fast.
author: Ame M.

description: Hey, I made a Yelp account to review this place: mmmmmmm Pho. Just order the number 1. And you are welcome ladies and gents! Best weekend outing with my son. Wandering around the sunset looking for a clarinet for my son then stopping by to have two big bowls of delicious broth, beef, noodles, and happiness.
author: Mark P.

description:
My Favorite Pho place in the city. 

As good as it gets, tasty, fast, you cant go wrong with the xlarge special for 6.75!! whoohoo, 3 cheers for kevin!!
author: Amy S.

description: I was completely and utterly disappointed! I'm a big fan of Kevin's noodle house in Walnut Creek, but I just moved into the city so I was really excited to try it out here. Boy was I let down. First of all, I don't expect much in the way of service when it comes to Pho restaurants, but the girl who helped me, Shu, was not attentive whatsoever. I was given hot water upon being sat so I asked for iced water. Doesn't come. I ask the person who drops off my pho for iced water. Doesn't come. I flag down Shu again and finally get my iced water. Lets not even talk about trying to get a refill. That's another story in itself. I ordered the 22A, which is just your basic chicken pho. It was disappointing a well. While I've always been a fan of the food and service at the Walnut Creek location, this pho was much more bland here. As for the sprouts and basil on the side, they did not look fresh and were slightly wilted. I almost asked for a new set up but I didn't want to be a pain and figured I probably wouldn't get it considering how hard it was to get a glass of water. When I asked for a diet coke though mid-meal that was brought rather quickly. (Maybe cuz I'm paying for it??) All in all, if I check out Kevin's again it will be back in the east bay, definitely not this location. Too many other good options in the city.
author: Nick M.

description:
Nothing like good soup for a hangover! 

Too bad I don't get hangovers and I don't like pho. But some of my friends who do get hangovers like to come here and nurse their heads and stomachs back to health. (then hair of the dog is in order.) 

But PHH has other dishes that don't involve soup. And the ice coffee is outstanding!
author: Kevo M.

description:
If my little sister Carleen could only eat at one restaurant for the rest of her life, it would be Pho Hoa Hiep.  

I don't even bother asking her what she wants to eat...I already know the answer will be a resounding  "PHO HOA HIEP!"  She wants it like crack.   If you are also a pho devotee, try this place.
author: Sid D.

description:
This is my pho joint. When I'm sick, I'm at Kevin's. When I'm hungover, I'm at Kevin's. When it's cold out, I'm at Kevin's.

I've strayed a few times -- and always ended up disappointed. So now I don't even try. 

The broth is so good -- it's damn near addicting. The noodles, veggies and various meats -- all good. 

Sick/tired/hungover/cold/hungry? Go to Kevin's.
author: joann p.

description:
Went here for dinner with a couple friends on Monday night and it was pretty crowded.  Now I've been to few Pho places around the bay area, the prices are reasonable.  We were seated right away and ordered chicken wings.  

When the wings arrived, we werent given any plates which we expected so we can eat them easily.  Instead, we tried our best not to drop bits of the wings over ourselves while we had them.  

The pho was good, but you cant really go wrong with PHO!  There's another location in Walnut Creek that I think is a little better.  But overall it was a good experience.  Nothing fancy.
author: M L.

description:
Really glad I found this place on a whim when the rain started pouring and walking around Golden Gate Park was out.

This is seriously the cleanest Viet place I've been to! The restaurant is typical, but it's big, service is fast, and the pho is great! Total was less than $6 for the smaller bowl. Definitely go here if you are in the area.
author: Laurie c.

description: I've been coming here for years, and this is has to be my favorite pho spot in SF! The broth is tasty, the service is ridiculously fast, and the staff is always nice. The chicken wings, fried shrimp cakes, and tapioca shakes are also great. This place never fails to satisfy my pho cravings!
author: Meesh N.

description:
My favorite restaurant in SF. I was born here, and have lived here for 30 years, and it is getting harder to find a place with good, tasty food, cleanly presented, and delivered hot and fast to your table for under $10/head. The only tricky part might be finding parking during busy weekend hours, but it's SF, and that's par for the course. Regardless, even if you get stuck paying a parking meter, the value of this lunch or dinner experience is well worth any such annoyance- except getting a ticket! (feed your meter!)
LOVE it. and that is not something I say freely. 
The imperial rolls at ppq across the street are superior, as is their charbroiled beef. But for Beef Pho of any variety, as well as Beef Stew, and also every rice plate I've ever had here, this is the best Viet food I think one can get in the area, possibly anywhere in town.
author: James W.

description:
*** Updated 10/5/09 ***

I don't know if PHH2 is the gold standard of Pho in SF, but it's certainly a good place to start.  They seem to have remodeled it since I was last here, and now everything from the sign to the menus, to the pictures, lights, and tables have a warm sheen.  It'll almost make you second-guess their dive credentials.  But make no mistake--this is still a drafty, fluorescent ca-pho-teria room at heart.  Not eating beef anymore, I tried the shrimp egg noodle soup, which was equally tasty.  But in Vietnamese places I find myself increasingly drawn to the "dry" vermicelli bowls with juicy pork and egg roll bites, and PHH doesn't disappoint on this count either.
author: Wes M.

description:
Man if you thought the Pho across the street was cracking, this is cracking times two.

I actually felt like I was back in San Jose eating the pho I used to always get back in high school. I got the usual beef pho and fried shrimp cakes to go along-- both DELISH. I think I'll be back tomorrow =)
author: Janell Y.

description:
I love pho! This is my #1 pho place, I think, worldwide. I love pho even more when it tastes as good as it does here. It's always pretty busy, which means that everyone loves the place. The service is quick and easy too. Great pho, rice dishes, chicken soup and fried egg rolls.

My favorite pho restaurant.
author: Carleen W.

description:
Yup Just ok.

It was freezing tonight in SF and I was thinking of kimchi jjigae but I've already had korean food 3 times this week and so my friend decided we should go to Turtle Tower but there was no parking so we head over the PHH. 

Here's the thing with me and Vietnamese food. I'm usually reluctant to eat Vietnamese food other than my mom because I feel that I'm going to hurt my her feelings LOL. So when I'm placed in this predicament I usually end up ordering a rice plate because anybody can do this.

Party 2
Order: Large beef and tendon pho
Rice plate with porkchop, egg roll, 2 fried chicken wings

Rice plate was fine.  Again, you really cant mess this up.  I did like their egg rolls.  The fried chicken was boring but their pork chop was lean, which is always a plus. Oh! The meal comes with broth.

Now to the pho.  It suppose to be a large but the contents were small.  The bowl is large and you get plenty of broth but where's the rest of the goodies?  I'd still be hungry after this "large" bowl but my friend enjoyed it.

I'll only come back if its with friends otherwise I'd go to the pizza joint next door.
author: Sun T.

description: One of my top three favorite pho places in San Francisco. Good prices. Good portions. They have seafood pho! Best alternative when I don't feel like eating beef. (:
author: Karla G.

description:
I really want to like this place. The variety of food is astonishing, the price is very affordable, and the quality of the food is good. Too bad that when I was there two weeks ago, all of the servers/cooks behind the counter were sneezing and coughing freely, without any attempts to turn their head or wear a mask.
The food is not bad, and I will go back, but this time I'll make sure to check the health of the people behind the food preparation counter first.
author: Carlo M.

description: Pretty good pho! Soup/broth was good which is the main determining factor in whether I think it's good pho. Came with the usual pho condiments (bean sprouts, lime, jalapeno). I got the pho with flank only because I love fatty slices of meat. Great for a cold and rainy day in SF. Though they could have given me more meat in mine, but I was still full at the end, probably from all the water weight.
author: Liwei Y.

description:
I used to be a PPQ fan, and I still am.  But Kevin's Noodle house seats faster and the broths are slightly different.  

The Beef stew is pretty good in both places, but something at Kevin's always brings me back.  I stopped ordering regular pho because you just can't beat the MSG goodness, the meat, and flavor of the stew.  Though, PPQ has a more spicier beef stew that initially made me a convert.

Also, the other Kevin's Noodle house in Daly City at Westlake usually has a better beef stew: right mix of meat, noodles, and veggies.  Shouldn't it be the same?  I don't know but there is certainly a difference.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
I come here for stress relief.  I order a #1 or #2 or #3, extra large.  I like mine with extra jalapenos and sriracha.  Once the sweat comes pouring down my neck, I know I'm at the right place.  

Can't go without the vietnamese ice coffee.
author: Winsor L.

description: first time venturing out from my norm on the peninsula. pleasantly surprised by the price and flavor of the beef pho. as soon as we sat down they brought over hot tea (not something offered at my peninsula spot). we will be coming back!
author: Jessica B.

description:
i used to hate pho, but i will eat at kevin's. something about their MSG infused pho is great... the price is cheap too, and it's FAST. it goes something like this: 

"hi what you like to order?"
"small pho tai meat on the side please!"
"okay! one pho tai coming right up!"

DONE. the soup broth is yummy,it warms you up like a shot of whiskey, and you're good to go. parking is biatch but it's sf, so i can't really complain.
author: A Y.

description:
This is my favorite pho place. I usually have the number 5 and share a plate of chicken wings. The portions are pretty hearty.

Update: This place never disappoints me. I came here for dinner tonight and the service was superb. My sister asked for extra hot soup in her pho to cook her sprouts and the waiter came out with extra hot soup plus steamed sprouts. They sure listen!!!

PS:  They are now called Pho Hyunh Hiep.
author: Sue L.

description:
"Decisions, decisions... which Pho restuarant should we go to?" my friends would always ask.

::raises hand:: Pho Hoa Hiep... PHO SHO!!

Forget about PPQ across the street, my parents always told me that place is filthy.

And Pho Hoa Hiep tastes better.

This has always been the pho resturant I go to for many, many (okay, maybe not so many since I'm still quite young) years.

I love their pho. I'll almost always order a bowl of pho when I go there. I also love their spring rolls (But of course, no one can beat my mom's spring rolls. Hers is the best.). Their rice plates are quite delicious as well! They also make tapioca/asian drinks which they would serve in disposable plastic cups so you can take it with you if you can't finish it in the resturant.
author: Nance W.

description:
My first time here was a few weeks ago with my dragonboat team after practice; we came in ~25 people all with obvious signs of hunger. We asked for a table and we got it pretty quickly, only took a few minutes for whoever seemed to be in charge to get the other servers to arrange tables for us. The moment we sat down, waters and menus we in front of us and within a couple minutes we were all ready to order. I got a # one with beef balls, which is simply a combiniation pho containing the regular suspects: tripe, beef slices, tendon and beef brisket; I really felt like beef balls that night so I got an addition order of those, which seemed to be the popular choice seeing how half the table did the same.
In any case, the food came out within 10 minutes and having experienced a number of extra large bowls throughout pho places from norcal to socal the bowl I got seemed generous for the price that  I got it for ~ 7$ for a decent bowl, which really meant I had nothing to complain about the size haha. 
Now the first thing I do whenever I get a bowl of Pho is mix the contents and try the soup. Of course the soup is going to smell amazing, but that's because the whole room is already filled with the smell of all the aromatic ingredients that it took to make the broth. Anyway, the broth was delcious: rich and flavorful, you could tell that they actually brewed for atleast a night because you could taste all the rich flavors of the spices and meats. 
Overall, this place really hit the spot and the rest of my team can vouch; would I come again? Of course! Given i'm in the area and craving soup, this place would be my near the top of my list of places to fulfill my hunger! Fair prices, friendly servers, decent decor, and tasty food, what more could you ask for? Oh i know...more beef balls! =D (they complimented the broth really well haha.
author: Jon K.

description: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant of all time. I have tried spots all over the US, from Seattle to Boston, and even in Vietnam. But Pho Huynh Hiep 2 serves THE BEST PHO ever. The broth is always steaming hot and flavorful, and the noodles have the perfect amount of pull. I also love their egg rolls, though their rival restaurant across the street's imperial rolls might be better. Never mind, I stay faithful to this one. While I was born and raised in the Bay Area, I'm currently living abroad, and this is always one of the first spots I have to visit whenever I'm back.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Good food, bad drinks, not the best service, affordable prices. 

I ordered the beef stew with the thick noodles, and I was quite satisfied with it.  The soup was a little bit oily, but they put a good amount of beef. 

The mango boba drink was all BAD! I've had waaayy better boba drinks elsewhere. I guess this place specializes in their food, but not so much with their drinks. If you want boba, I would recommend going down two blocks to Wonderful Foods Co (between 22nd and 23rd) after your meal.
author: Lisa C.

description:
For a chilly San Francisco evening or simply to satisfy a soup craving, and with an eye towards saving some money for a tasty brew later in the night, it doesn't get better than Huynh Hiep's pho.  The pho is always piping hot, the ingredients are fresh, and the beef broth is simultaneously sturdy and smooth.  Generally, I go with a number 17 medium, which comes with a healthy portion of lean beef.  However, when I'm feeling bold, the number one special, with lean beef, brisket, flank, tripe and tendon satisfies the adventurous soup connoisseur.

As a practical matter, the soup is delicious and inexpensive, and the service is quick and friendly.
author: Camilo A.

description: A nice place that makes pho just the way I like it. They have quick service too. It's a good sign if the restaurant is worth your time if it's almost hard to find a seat. Why do all the good pho joints have to be in the Outer Sunset area? :)
author: Gerard Y.

description:
We've eaten here many times and have not had a bad experience.  Sure there were times the service was a tad spotty but that was when the place was jammed with folks wanting their PHO!  The hubby and son always order the seafood Pho  but I like to try different items on the menu.  When I order Pho, I order the beef or chicken ones.

I like their marinated and grilled pork chops with a side of pickled veggies and white steamed rice, of which a small bowl of hot clear broth is served alongside!  The thinly sliced pork chops are juicy and delicious!  The pickled veggies compliment the grilled meat nicely. A sip of the hot clear broth, between bites, is heavenly ~ good side.

One of my fave drinks is the Thai Iced Tea but we also get the hot tea as well.  The hubby likes the Vietnamese drip coffee with condensed milk.  I'm not a real fan of their pearl drinks ~ get it elsewhere folks.

I'd rather eat here than at PPQ across the street where it's small and cramped and the food is not that great compared to this spot.
author: Beth W.

description:
There was a point in my life where I ate here three times a week at least. Their pho is fantastic. They are quick, efficient and surprisingly friendly.

I am a fan of the Hofun noodle. It's such a chewy, fat, well fun noodle. I always get the seafood pho with hofun (shrimps and squids lolz) and then get rare steak on the side. I put plenty of Rooster sauce in it and then slather on the plum sauce. FAN-FREAKIN-TASTIC.  They make a mean fresh spring roll too, mind you.

Now, here's the reason I love this place. Yah sure the pho is great, they are nice blah blah blah. But when it comes down to it...

THEY SERVE BOBA HERE. REALLY. THEY DO. GOOD BOBA, TOO.
Honeydew smoothie with tapioca + pho = happiness.
author: MrsKimch I.

description:
A curse on your family (at the other place that was closed 15 mins before their posted closing sign)!  May warts grow all over the feet of your proverbial walks in life.

Moving on.  Were it not for the cursed place I mentioned above, Marina and I would not have found our way over here.  It was around 9:15 on a Saturday night.  We found parking about a block away.  We had previously been shopping in Union Square.  I was getting a suit (grown up clothing!) and she got this nice pair of knee lenth clam-digger type jeans.  All on sale.  

After attempting to go to Chez Papa Resto and realizing how incredibly small that place was, we looked around at another french place before getting in to the car.  Whilst in the car, I told her about the amazing broth of pho.  It was spiced, cinnamon, anise, a bit of cardamon.  I sold it so well that we headed straight for the sunset.  

There was a false start (and we'd found such GOOD PARKING too), we ended up here.  I was famished.  Hadn't eaten since noon.  Not even a snack.  I ordered the Imperial rolls and the fried chicken wings.  The imperial rolls were nice and compact.  Meaty, tight, turgid tubes of fried loveliness.  

The chicken wings were HUGE.  I don't know what chickens these came off of, but the wingspan was the size of my hand!  Not just the palm.  I'm talking about the biggest wings ever.  The drumette looked like a full size leg drumstick.  

And now the pho.  Marina go the Pho Tai.  I got the Pho Tai Gan.  This time I paid more attention to the tendon.  This place had nice juicy thick pieces that quivered and shook in my unsteady hands.  The tendon was substantial and not chopped up in to sliced like the TL plcaes. It was something I could sink my teeth in to.  

I made sure to sip the broth before adding anything.  While I could still smell the anise and a bit of cinnamon, the fragrance was not as strong as at Yummy Yummy or Pho King.  But it was there.  A different style of broth.  It's ok.  Not all pho broth has to taste the same.  

Let us not allow pho broth to go the way of expensive trendy wines: suiting the tastebuds of that guy who gives out points just so they get a high score.  Let us embrace the individualism and characteristics of the broth.  Celebrate it by having a different kind each day.
author: Christina C.

description:
I'm a Sunset girl and have been since I was an awkward middle schooler with round thin-rimmed owl glasses. (I'm still as hot, no worries). Pho Hoa Hiep has a special place in my heart because the fam and I have been coming here for as long as I can remember - judging by the crowds and the fact that Kevin's is always consistently packed, I'd say we're not alone there, either.

Solid neighborhood pho joint with super speedy service. For more specialty items, I'd go elsewhere, but you just can't go wrong with their pho.
author: Betty W.

description: i have been looking for a place to get some authentic pho in sf for a long time. being from a family that cooks pho all the time, i have high standards for this kind of food. this place is as authentic as it gets. i love how they have so many options for pho, so you can get exactly what you want and the size you want. the noodles are tasty and cooked just right. the cost for a medium sized bowl is around $7 which is so cheap! you can't get many good meals in the city for that price.
author: Rebecca D.

description:
I have to admit that I'll be coming to this place very often. The pho comes really fast after you order it. I had no idea that there was an XL size until my younger sister told me. I thought it was hilarious, but it feeds her boyfriend quite well. He finished his before my sister did (she usually gets a medium). WOW.

You'll leave here satisfied, even full.

The tapioca here is good too! It's a little cheaper and the quality is good, just in case you don't feel like walking down the next block for a drink at Wonderful Foods Co.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Service: 3/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 5/5
Price: $
Portions: 3/5
Presentation of food:3/5
Presentation of restaurant: 4/5
Overall: 4/5

I'VE BEEN COMING HERE FOR OVER 4 YEARS. I LOVE THIS PLACE, THE NOODLES ARE THEE BEST (: I LOVE THEIR RICE PLATES TOO. I ALSO GO TO THE ONE LOCATED AT WESTLAKE, DALY CITY BECAUSE THERES FREE PARKING THERE ^.^
author: Eva H.

description: Great Pho place. Took my friend and his girlfriend who was born in Viet-Nam here and she loved it, but she did say her mom's was better. Wouldn't we all?
author: M R.

description: Its our "IN N Out."  Hungry? and need to eat fast and fairly clean?  Head here.  If you know what you want, you can sit down and eat a nice bowl of Pho within 5 minutes.  Reliable tummy filler.  We also sometimes get the combo rice plate with a fried wing, egg roll, and pork chop.
author: Tony And Candace T.

description:
Keep in mind, this is based on one visit, but also that I am a local who grew up eating at Pho Hoa Hiep 2 every week or so during my high school days at Lowell.

A bunch of friends and I enjoyed our visit here yesterday... like I said, it used to be Pho Hoa Hiep 2, and I'm not sure what happened there, but the pho has definitely changed, both for the good and the bad.

I ordered my usual Pho Tai, and found that it was still the same number #17.  Funny.  Anyway, the flavor is different now... slightly sweeter broth, but more robust than in the past.  The only downside is that the soup was way too oily...  You could see lots of oil bubbles on top when it was served.  It made every flavorful spoonful feel heavy, which I am not fond of when it comes to pho.  On the plus side, they allow you to have the rare steak on the side, so you can control how well-done you want the meat.  I like mine at a medium.

The bowls got bigger (good) as did the price (expected).  I didn't try anything else, so this is not based on the other things they offer, but simply on the Pho Tai, which is my benchmark for pho places.

Anyway, the service was still pretty fast as is with all pho restaurants, but it was not the infamous 30 second speed of order-to-served pho like back in the day with Pho Hoa Hiep 2.
author: Warren L.

description: Our family needs a go-to for Pho, and this is ours for San Francisco! Great service - really friendly and quick. Some of the best chicken broth I've had, and perfect balance between all ingredients in the soup. The avocado shakes are really fresh and tasty, and there is also a nice selection of other beverages. Good kids menu. Overall, a nurturing meal and incredible value for the price. We will go back again and again!
author: Marcie M.

description:
I never thought I'd find myself writing a review on a pho place since let's be real - it's not that hard to find good pho in San Francisco.  But, what brings me here is the fact that my husband and I found ourselves raving about the soup we had last night at Kevin's Noodle House.  You know how you know something is rrrrreallly good when both parties can't stop saying 'Wow, this is realllly good!'  Case in point - that's what happened last night.  I was craving something warm and clean, so we ventured to Kevin's because after all the pho places I've been to, his broth is the best tasting, non-MSG-flavored out there.  

The only reason I give it 3-stars is I still have serious issues with the bucket they push around the place when they're clearing off tables. I know it's efficient and it needs to be done, but  honestly, I just don't want to see dirty dishes while I'm eating a yummy bowl of pho.  It's not enough to drive me away, but it does make me consider wear a shield or something to save myself from the splash-back.
author: Jana H.

description: My favorite Pho place in the city. I love their housemade meat balls. I always order my Pho with fatty meat, tendon and meat balls. Their rice combo and bun are good too.
author: Lovetoeat A.

description:
yup. the roommate mel j. is talking about is me. I got her hooked on phoooooo!! ohhh nooo. I love eating pho because it's so soothing.Pho is the best  hangover food, or if you are feeling sick, it's great. We can take it to go too, so if you feel like eating some pho at home, you can order it at teh cashier and take it home. Their service is very fast, and food is great. O usually get number 17 the thin sliced steak, or seafood pho. their curry pho is also good, so if you want something a bit spicy, go for the curry pho. You can order different kinds of noodle too, there are egg noodle, thin pho, flat fat pho. 

I like putting everything they bring on a side too. lime juice, bean sprounts, thai basil. silantro, and a little bit of jalapeno. and in a little dipping plate, I put their plum sauce and hot sauce. gotta have it.
author: chihiro i.

description:
Ok, so I heard this place was supposed to be awesome. It was, but I was just a bit disappointed cause they didn't really have a lot of selections. At least compare to the place where I usually go. They didn't have a lot of vegetarian options either. I felt bad for taking my vegetarian friend there. 

I like the fact everything was fresh and clean. The broth was taaaasssty!! The best part, it was CHEAP!!
author: Perry S.

description: I recommended their  pho with beef balls very good.
author: Aniko N.

description: Came here with my sister and 9 year old son after a ski trip.  We were really hungry and had a craving for pho.  I go to this place off and on and food is decent, but  two things really irritated me this time.  First, we were seated before two other tables, but our order was taken last.  Their pho comes out pretty fast so by the time the waiter got to us, the second table was already eating their pho.  Second, we had a party of 3, but we only got 2 tea cups.  We asked for 3 cups of ice water and only got 2.  I guess they expected me to share my cup with my son.  2 cups = $2 tips = 2 stars.
author: Will N.

description: Pho place looks like all other pho places. Order and it comes out instantly. The broth is pretty flavorful. I got the small pho with tendon, rare steak and well done meat. It was a lot of food and was just what I wanted on a cold night. I asked for extra onions and it looked as though they didn't put it. There wasn't a lot of color to the pho at all, just brown, but it was good.
author: Lyly T.

description:
I'd have given this place 3 stars if it's not for my bad experience this time...

I have eaten here before, noodles are usually properly cooked (not over or under) and the dripping coffee was usually good.

HOWEVER, this time when they did not make the coffee right, where the dripping was not happening, I told the server while smiling at him. He simply thought I was impatient. He said "wait 5 minutes." I said it's been 10 minutes and I was about to finish my big bowl of noodles. He then walked away.

Another 5 minutes went by, he came back, looking perplexed. I reminded him again. Eventually he took the coffee back to the kitchen, only to drain what did not drip through, and then had the nerve lying to my face, "it's all done!" I rolled my eyes, giving him the despised look.

Obviously when I poured the coffee onto the ice, it only filled half of the glass.

While I don't expect A+ service, this is simply ridiculously unacceptable.
author: T L.

description:
Really...i've tried to top the overall quality and value of this place...and i really haven't been able to.  I've searched across the city, ventured down the peninsula, and even spanned the pacific northwest -- nothing really comes close to this place!

Service is normally quick - especially if you're getting pho!  The only drawback is the cleanliness.  I have to be honest...I anticipate the server's thumb taking a dip in my #3 or #10 bowl.  I'm hoping the high temperature of the broth kills any harmful, bowel-irritating bacteria.  Being the risk taker, by virtue of the fact that they see me as a regular, and because the food is so damn good -- i like those odds!  Pho shizzle!!
author: Juliet P.

description: I always prefer to go to PPQ over PHH, but I have to admit that PHH is not a bad alternative when the line gets atrocious at PPQ.  Between the two, I think the menu here is a little more extensive and varied.  The regular pho beef broth has good flavor, and might actually be a bit better than PPQ.  The beef stew was tasty but a little heavy on the oil/grease.  The Imperial Rolls were somewhat disappointing the first time I had them as well.  This isn't to say they were bad though; they were perfectly fine actually.  Rather, they were just unremarkable since you can get the same pretty thing almost anywhere.  Overall, not bad, but I'd still rather go across the street.
author: Mike L.

description:
This is one of my favorite pho places because PPQ across the street doesn't offer the "ho fun" noodles.  So I stick to my #23 medium and it comes out in a minute.  Anything more than a minute, we always say, what's taking so long??  They have pretty good tapioca shakes too if you like that.  Another trick I learned from someone who likes to eat a lot is to order a medium size with extra noodles, instead of ordering a toilet bowl size large with more soup and the same amount of noodles.

I'm not going to say anything about cleanliness, because let's face it - are there really clean asian restaurants that are this cheap?  Well that's my opinion.  

Also, I don't recommend Pho Hoa Hiep II in Daly City.  I found a fly in my soup and complained.  So they just scooped it right now and gave it back....
author: Stacey C.

description:
This place is very cheap..and pretty good!
I have never actually eaten inside this place but I have taken out numerous times.
The chicken noodle soup is very good and is well worth its price, even for a regular size! Beansprouts and mint leaves are also included in a separate bag to add to your soup.
The cold vermicilli dishes are also not too bad. I usually order it with a side of an egg roll which is very crispy and tasty.
This place also has pretty prompt service. Call in an order and it is ready usually in 5 minutes.
Only thing to stay away from is the boba drinks...go across the street to ICafe for that!
author: Miss H K.

description:
My friend Angel took me here to try out Pho - my very first time having this dish. I had the seafood pho; unfortunately there weren't a lot of vegetarian options but I wanted to try it.

I liked the little plate of herbs that came with the bowl of piping hot broth - a nice addition to the meal. It was definitely interesting, I think it may take some getting used to but I'd love to try it again.

The atmosphere was nice - a big room filled with people chatting about their day. The service was quick and attentive and the meals were cheap! Always a plus :)
author: Manda S.

description:
This place actually makes a decent bowl of pho, and that's about it. If you want good fried imperial rolls (the fried ones) go across the street, where the pho isn't as good.

Drink orders only arrive about 1/3 of the time, so like other reviewers have stated, you've got to remind them a few times. Especially if you order two drinks, like some soy milk and water, which really throws them off.

I only tried this place because it was packed, while across the street I saw only a few customers. If I'm craving pho, which happens at least once a week, and I'm too lazy to get to Clement, I may pop in here for a bowl of #13 again. Three stars for average pho and not much else.
author: Ben W.

description:
It is what it is.  

I have been going to this place ever since i was just a little high school student.  That was over 10 years ago, and i still frequent this place.  The service, if you can even call it that is pretty much non existent, but the food is so good.  I always get a number 1 and add beef balls, and fresh spring rolls.  I usually ask for water which never comes out, but hey, they give you tea.  

The bowl of PHO is pretty big and packed with loads of goodness.  I went through a phase where i ate that 5 days in a row, and i usually am seen here at least once a week.  I work right around the corner.

Im actually craving some right now....
author: Terence P.

description: Came here on a cold day in SF and picked this place b/c it had good reviews. I can't agree more with what has already been said. We sat down and looked at the menu. After ordering, our food came within 5 minutes of sitting down. I don't know if it was because it wasn't very crowded but if service is like this all the time, I will definitely come back. The price is definitely reasonable, unlike places with not too many pho places. The only downfall was the noodles; they were a little softer than what I'm used to but overall, great food! If we're in the area, will come by again!
author: Annie C.

description:
This is my favorite pho place. I always order the pho tai and it is wonderful. It is reasonably priced, and if you time it correctly there is no wait. During rush hours though it tends to be a longer wait but the food comes very quickly after you order. 
My friends have tried the rice dishes and imperial rolls and they are great. I haven't been with anyone who was disappointed with their meal.
author: Shizuka L.

description:
I don't really even know what I ordered, as in what the name of it was. My dining companions were slightly rude and said "we" were ready when I in fact had just arrived. And I wasn't bold enough to speak up because I just met them.

In any case, I quickly looked down and picked the "number two" because it was pho and it had beef in it. What a great choice this turned out to be. It had beef balls, slices of beef, tripe, and beef fat with plenty of noodles and plenty of broth. It was supposedly a medium but boy was I stuffed. And I had been holding back on my caloric intake the rest of the day in preparation, but I was still stuffed.

And then the bill came. Of course, mine was cheap, $6 or something. But then my dining companions pulled another one out of their hat and were trying to short the bill. $22 for a $20.40 bill? I think not. I had to prod them until there was $24 on the table, which still didn't seem like enough really but it was good enough.

Overall I don't know if it was mainly my hunger that convinced me this was so awesome, but I do know that I left thoroughly satisfied. Coming in after drinking a couple Tecates across the street, I didn't really notice much of what was going on around me but I also know that the service was good enough for me to not be in want of anything. Our food arrived very quickly.

I am going to dream about my pho (I hope).
author: Stu M.

description:
When with a group of friends, Pho HH 2 is the way to go. Usually, I'm at Loi's, but this place is better suited for a larger group of people. The storefront itself is quite large, it is is not uncommon at all to see the place packed. 
The pho comes out hot, quick, and huge! Quite tasty and cooked perfectly. Most notable for me is their beef broth. Haven eaten many bowls of beef pho filled with the works, this place seems to have the best soup.
Business wise, the place is relatively inexpensive at about $6 on average for a medium to large bowl of pho, rice dishes ranging from $6-8. They take credit/debit cards. 
Great place for a quite and warm bowl of pho in my book.
author: Zach L.

description: This place doesn't disappoint. Fast service, big portions, good prices, tasty pho. I was really starving to eat this one time. I think it was either a Friday night or Saturday night. Got a seat right away, and our food arrived in no more than 5 minutes. So satisfying when you're hungry. Drank all the broth, and had a huge food baby after. Not much else to say really. I think this place gives you bigger bowls than the place across the street.
author: Teng L.

description:
I give the Pho Tai Bo Vien like four stars, same for the regular Pho Tai... pretty typical awesome viet food... huge servings of tasty homemade soup, etc.

Free hot tea is always nice.

The A1 fried viet egg roll appetizer was good on the inside, but not the viet egg roll wrappers I am used to enjoying; more of a spring roll type thing.

All in all, I dig it.  Soup delivers beegtimes.
author: Blake C.

description: Super fast and pretty damn good Pho. The Eggrolls were yum,too. The bonus was when my friend got a purple smoothie (taro) which came in with a gigantic purple straw...worth the hike out to the Sunset...
author: Mimi T.

description: I'm not a huge fan of Vietnamese food but the noodle dishes here are quite tasty. The portions are ridiculously sized and the prices are outstanding. They serve you fast which is always good especially since I'm usually on a limited time in the city. The menu has a good variety to choose from so knock yourself out here.
author: Amy J.

description: After reading all of these great reviews, I had to give it a try. No regrets. By far the best pho I've had in a while and a perfect addition to my Sunday afternoon. It was a bit packed, but wait staff was friendly, even with a guy getting mad that he was not seated as quickly as he had wanted to be. You know how us pho fans can be.
author: George G.

description:
I have been here a million times (almost) and I have never had a bad experience. 

I've been to many Pho restaurants from here to Vietnam and they make one of the best here. And I like this place better than the place across the street. 
 
Decent prices. Great pho. Delicious rice and vermicelli plates. Yummy beverages. Awesome spring rolls. You really can't go wrong with anything you order here. I live in the Mission now and I make my way out here whenever I have a Pho craving.
author: Lisa G.

description:
I have to admit I have limited experience with Pho, but from the places I've been to this is the best. The broth was excellent, the noodles were perfect, and the accompaniments were fresh.

I got the chicken pho, my roommate got the BBQ chicken and rice dinner. I was surprised by the quality of the chicken. We also tried one of their jack-fruit milk teas (it was sweet but yummy).

Overall a good meal for piquito dinero!
author: rachel c.

description:
This place has always been a family favorite.  As a kid I used to come here with my parents pretty much every Sunday for lunch.  More recently, we've switched the the Westlake location because parking is easier there.  

Back to the food...The pho soup tastes great without hoisin sauce, which is the way it's suppose to be!! I like to order the steak, brisket and tripe (a little adventurous I know) .  Their rice plates are even better.  I love the BBQ chicken plate with "bi".  I've never tried anything else.  But why would I?

Cheap. Satisfying. Quick and easy. Takes credit card!
author: Helen V.

description:
Ordered the number 13-  beef noodle soup with thin slices of rare steak. small was pretty small, but it was the perfect portion of small....

they had every condiment I needed. broth was good, steak was good. i got my lovely bean sprouts, basil, and jalapeno slices. it was good. 

then we got the A1- imperial rolls.
they looked good, but as soon as i bit into them, they were so mushy, it was kinda gross. there was no texture to it, as if someone had already chewed the filling for me. UGHHHH.......
author: Heidi L.

description:
3.5 stars

I don't know why my friends keep telling me not to come here because their pho is actually not that bad . Their pho is not the best , but it's alright . I love how their beef balls are well-cooked and not all chewy . I LOVE their shrimp spring rolls . I love how its small & wrapped tightly . I think it tastes better that way =] The thai iced tea is pretty good too . It's nice how they give you to-go cups instead of glass . Btw , the thai iced tea does not have ice cubes in it .. it has shaved ice .
author: Eileen L.

description:
Thank God theres a decent Pho place in SF!!! 

Coming from socal and living in one of the largest Vietnamese communities, i experience the good and the bad. yes i know what an authentic pho tastes like and this place just hits it everytime!

The fact that the staff actual understands and speaks Vietnamese gives them another star! I've been to so many Vietnamese joints in SF and 90% of them have people that done't understand one word of Vietnamese. Are you effen serious.. you don't know what a cafe sui da is? 

So yes not only does the staff understand my orders, but the food is authentic and yummy! They have variety of different dishes that are pretty decent. I recommend the watermelon shake, yes its random but its sooooooo good! Not your first date place to go but something quick and filling.
author: Jacinta D.

description:
After an amazing night on the town celebrating my birthday, the consequences the morning after hit me like a ton of bricks. I could hardly get myself out of bed by 4pm to go get dinner here. 

Thank goodness I did! I went here for the first time today and I'm already craving the rare beef pho...(it's that good, I was just there a few hours ago)  the broth is sooo good and the beef wasn't tough like the other places I've been to. I also tried one of their egg rolls. It had good flavor and a nice crunch but yes, it was a bit oily. 

The interior is better than most vietnamese places I've been to and it seemed pretty clean. The service was okay (i find it easier to flag people down for the check but you have to expect that). 

Overall, a solid 4 stars. I can't wait to go back.

UPDATE: I don't know how they do it, but their pho is chock full of delicious endorphin-filled love. I LOVE YOU PHO HOA HIEP.
author: Julie M.

description:
One of my favorite comfort spots in the 'Set.
Been here a ton of times, and the pho is consistently good.
Fresh shrimp rolls are not recommended here but ordered anyways out of habit.
They're kinda skimpy/wimpy and served with Hoisin.
Weird.
Like I said, we get them anyways out of habit.
author: Barry A.

description:
I'm sorry, but the Pho Hoa Hiep on Irving is a bit too dirty for me. The last time I went there, I couldn't find a pair of chopsticks that weren't sticky. Yeah it was pretty bad. PPQ is right across the street folks.
As for the Pho Hoa Hiep on Clement, they're just plain gross! Even if you can get over the sticky chopsticks there, how the hell can you eat with those gross discolored spoons?! Seriously!
author: Ben C.

description: One of the better bowls of pho I've had.  And look out for that XL bowl.  It's TRULY extra large!
author: Joe K.

description:
This is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I'm a big fan of grungy, hole-in-the-wall type places, because they generally have great food. That's how this place was when I first started going there - a little run down, no fuss, but they've done a lot to fix it up, like new tables, new lighting, they redid the floor. It looks half nice now!

And the pho is fantastic. I can't get enough. The broth is savory and delicious, with plenty of noodles and meat, and the greenery tray is always brimming. I usually have to ask for extra limes, because I'm a lime fiend, but they've never been difficult about asking for extra anything. The price is oh-so-right for the portion size, and their drip coffee, while it does take a bit of time to drip, is worth waiting for. 

This place is cheap and delicious. I live across the city, but sometimes I'm just craving it. It's worth making the trek for.
author: Amelia G.

description: Wet/cold/rainy day. Perfect for pho...at Kevin's noodle house! Got the one with everything in it and I must say - pretty good taste! Don't remember having tripe in there, but I guess that's not for everyone anyway. I must compliment them on their fresh condiments (i.e., no rotten bean sprouts, limp basil, etc.). Everything looked really fresh.
author: Aaron L.

description:
This is my all time favorite vietnamese restaurant in Sunset. They just remodeled the store and I think changed their name too, although the workers are still the same. 

Food comes super fast and is really simple!
author: M W.

description: Kevin's Noodle House (Pho Huynh Hiep 2) is one of our go-to places to go for pho.  It is right across the street from PPQ, but it's cheaper than PPQ, and the service is better here.  I would say that the quality of the pho and vermicelli is comparable in both places. The only thing that PPQ has over this place is that PPQ has a more extensive menu whereas Pho Huynh Hiep 2 mainly serves pho and vermicelli.  However, if I'm in the mood for pho or vermicelli and I was in the area, I'd pick Kevin's over PPQ 9 times out of 10.
author: Tyler C.

description: I used to come here all the time and I switched and started going to PPQ across the street. I came back today and got the meatball and sliced beef pho Medium size. It was good, but in a blink of an eye it was all gone! Now I remember why I don't eat there anymore, they don't give you enough noodles! Still hungry.
author: Karen T.

description:
The pho is always good here.  It's also the only thing I order and have ever ordered.  I've tried some other dishes that my friends have ordered though.  Their rice plates are pretty good.  I've tried some of the pork chop and BBQ beef rice plates.  There's also a full page of drinks to order that includes lychee drinks, boba drinks, coffees and teas.

The tables are big and there's lots of space.  If I'm in a large group, we usually opt to come here rather than PPQ across the street.  They are also very fast in getting the food out.  The rice plates might be a little slower but the pho comes out almost instantly after you order.

The service is okay.  Sometimes, it seems like they are just trying to hurry you especially when it's somewhat busy.  The waiters hover over you while you look at the menu.  I always know what I want to get but I don't want to hurry the people with me.  This place follows the trend of Asian places that serve water to only those who ask three times.

I give this place four stars for the food, speed and a very spacious dining area.
author: Chris C.

description: This is my favorite spot to eat when my friend is in town. We always get the spring rolls and chicken pho and meat pho.
author: Christian P.

description:
Honestly this place was a lot better than i expected to be. Tonight i just dropped by and ate with a friend. And the prices are so much better than the one across the street. And this place is a lot cleaner than the other one. I am glad that i finally got to check this place out. Probably from now on im going to eat here instead of the one across. Not bad. Not bad at all. 

OK now the food. I ordered pho with beef and beef balls. Since i just took my wisdom tooth out it was difficult for me to eat. But it was really good, I still had a delicious dinner. I have to say they didn't disappoint, it came in like 5 min. What more can you ask?
author: Andrew H.

description:
This place is where I can always depend to go to for a quick nice meal.  Prices are very decent, and you get a ton of food!  I always get the big bowl of Pho` with tripe, steak, beef ... so good.
If you're in the neighborhood, and want something pretty in and out, this is the place for you.  Service is pretty quick too -normally don't need to wait anymore than about 10 minutes for any given dish (providing it's not uber packed in there!)
author: Anthony L.

description:
This restaurant has been our default place for the past 4 years! Not only because we cant think of anywhere else to eat, but it usually satisfies our cravings.

Everytime I come here, I want pho, but I always end up getting a rice place! #42 is crackin! Porkchops, shrimp cake and an egg over rice. Oh, and I love the msg soup they serve with it. Haha, the pho is good too! I love the tripe! Sometimes I get the 3 color jelly drink, which I love. The green jelly thing gets really hard sometimes (compare to other viet restaurants which the green jelly part is usually soft) and can like plastic, but.. the coconut milk with it is yummay. Will leave you satisfied for under 10 bucks!
author: Heather W.

description: Great price and you can choose size of your pho bowl. Best soup in the city. Full of young adults at late night. FAST service!
author: Veranna N.

description: Decent food, decent portions. Tried the #1 and grilled pork vermicelli. And had a Vietnamese Iced coffee. Good prices good location. Will most likely eat here again.
author: Jonathan M.

description: I haven't been here in a long time so I don't remember exactly why I don't like their pho but I remember not liking it and telling myself that I would not come back. I would rather go across the street to PPQ which is pretty good.
author: Helen L.

description: solid.  We like the places in the peninsula better like Pho Saigon, Saigon City, and now Bewesnick, but this is a good option in the city...
author: Seth S.

description:
I come here all the time I usually order Mi Hai San pho &  I also like their spring rolls. The service is friendly & good, prices are fair ,place is clean as far as I can tell, no complaints!  Be aware you can order 3 different size bowls of Pho & everything is measured out by the size you select.
I like this place & will keep going back!
author: Sparky W.

description: This place is always packed, but I have no idea why. The owners/staff are not very friendly, and the food is average in taste, the ambiance is average -- austere diner -- and small in portion size compared to other Vietnamese restaurants in the area. The vermecelli noodles are overcooked and mushy, the meat overcooked. The fried egg rolls are tasty and comparable to other good places. But then, it is one of only 2 Vietnamese places on the Irving strip so they can get away with not being so great. I've eaten once in the restaurant and ordered out twice, but have decided not to come back again after I've figured out that they pad the bill by $.50 to $.75 with each order, expecting the customer not to notice. I only noticed this time because I ordered with 3 friends, and all of our bills were slightly more than they should be. But when we asked if the menu prices were old, the cashier said no. They must pull in an extra $100 a day by bilking every order out of a few cents here and there...
author: Kate A.

description:
Good pho and also good pho beef stew (I'm always on the lookout for the best pho beef stew). I go here weekly...sometimes more often. The prices are decent and I think this place is better than the place across the street. 

Whenever I feel myself getting sick, I walk two blocks to this joint and the soup usually clears up any cold beginning to invade my body...pretty good remedy for a whole $6.
author: Zoeboe D.

description:
I can live of eating pho everyday and this place makes it great!!
If i'm craving pho, i come to here to satisfy my cravings.
author: Hugh L.

description:
My roommate turned me on to this place.  I'd never eaten any Vietnamese food before until I came here and when I visited for the first time, I'd just come from working out!  

I got the number 17 (Tai - thin slices of steak) and put all kinds of stuff in it when it came and YUM!!!!!!!!  I felt healthy eating it, especially after doing some serious cardio.  But I think after pouring in some soy sauce, the healthiness factor went out the door.

The service is quick and the food is filling.  Mmmmm, I could totally go for some pho right now.
author: imelda j.

description:
Any solid restaurant in the Sunset. (We sound like a broken record.)

We come here for the Pho. Priced well, solid broth, and generous portions. There's not much to write about Pho other than the fact that it's not the clumpy kind. Some Pho places keep their noodles sitting out so long that it clumps together in the soup. Well, not here. 

We also like that this place is family-owned. We've been waited on by two teenagers who we suspect are owners' children. Good way to teach your children about business early! Three stars for the value and one star for the cute family business!
author: Kel S.

description: Best Pho' in the Sunset! This is my go-to place when someone's visiting SF, or when i'm just grabbing dinner after work. Pick-up is always ready 5 mins after I call in the order. You can't go wrong at Kevin's.
author: Craig R.

description:
I ordered the cha gio and it was quite mediocre, tho correctly served with lettuce to wrap around it.

I had the Pho Tai Gau (small) and it was good, though nothing to rave about.

A day after, I had terrible stomach pains and I can only suspect this meal =(
author: Duy L.

description: Had pho with my family because of the good reviews from yelp. Pho was really good,  I would've given them 4 stars just for food, though their service was terrible. We had to ask 3 times for the extra bowls for my kids. At first we thought they didn't understand English, but their English was fine. And then my kids needed to go to the restroom. we waited 20 min in line. after that we told the waiter to check on it if someone needs help inside the restroom or if it's just locked itself. He just went by, so we told 2 other waiters. But no one took any actions. Finally the woman who looked like an owner brought the key to open, and nobody was in there. The bathroom was in horrible condition with someone's mess, there's no way you could sit on the toilet seat. We just gave up using the restroom, but told the waiter the condition of the restroom, and the waiter said 'we will clean it when we close it at 10pm'. My goodness,  it was 8:50pm! I will never go back this restaurant  because of their unbelievable service.
author: Eunsil L.

description:
After a freezing cold Ocean Beach surf, I couldn't think of a better grind than a hot bowl of pho.  I found this spot on Google maps on my phone and went to give it a try.  It looked clean, but most importantly, crowded.

Everything was really really good.  The meat was of 'better than average cut' for pho.  The broth was super-flavorful.  The sprouts and basil was fresh.  It's breakfast time as I write this and I think I want some right now.

I is the smallest think but I like it so much I'm going to go ahead and mention it:  When I ordered a Coke, they brought out a glass of ice, the can, and a straw.  Throwback?  I don't know why but I love that.  Kevin, I will be back.

Auf.
author: Dave K.

description:
I've been here and the other chain, in Daly City. 
Incredibly good food and at reasonable prices too!
I love the beef pho and there's one with chicken broth that has pork, shrimp, and fish cake. Mmmm...Delicious! One of the better places to eat pho, for sure!
author: Alison N.

description:
The Pho here is pretty standard. I like how their broth is still somewhat clear and not cloudy like I see at a lot of other places. This is usually an indicator to me as to much how sodium is put in. 

The large bowl of #1 is what I usually get and I always leave satisfied. 

I also don't get the MSG heebie jeebies I get at a lot of other places.
author: Derrick L.

description: You cannot go wrong with number 33 beef stew w/ egg noodle XL baby!
author: MysticZ T.

description:
Pho is perfect for a cloudy San Francisco weather.  You can warm yourself up with a bowl of pho from this place. 

I've been going here for a good 3 years and I come here whenever it's raining or cold.  I only order one thing from here and it's the Beef Ball with clear noodles.  I no longer eat the rice noodles that they have normally.  You have to special request the clear noodles when you order.  The clear noodles only come with #26 but if you want, you can change it on any noodle soup also. 

This place is not very clean but I haven't had any problems yet *knock on wood*  But this is very typical of asian restaurants, it's pretty much eat your own risk or you'll be building up your immune system with all the "germs" you put in your stomach! 

I always come back for more pho tho!!!
author: Kapo T.

description:
Here's the golden rule that my friends go by:
"If you want vermicelli, go to PPQ; if you want pho, go to Pho 2."


But in reality, Pho2 is really starting to go downhill. My boyfriend and I used to be regulars (I still remember what he orders, #17 large), and we slowly stopped b/c the food just isn't the same anymore. 

But (x2), the pho here is still better than PPQ.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
my friend and i decided to arrive at 10:15 so that we wouldn't be the first customers through the door but we earlier than their set open time. as we walked by casually, we noticed that though it was only 9:53am two customers were already seated and ordering. 

we sat down and though it was 10 in the morning three tables were already filled with customers and two tables showed signs of satisfied pho lovers. the lady who took our order actually knows Vietnamese since she wrote our orders in the language. that just goes to show that this isn't just another pho place run by Chinese people.

our orders arrived within 15 minutes and we ate as Vietnamese laced conversation filled the background. 

the food is decent and the prices relatively cheap. an order of vermicelli and pho cost roughly around 13 dollars without tip. pretty affordable for students looking for a cheap yet filling meal.
author: Wendy N.

description: This is my go to Pho place.  I mean.. honestly who hasn't been to Kevin's Noodle House?  The pho here is pretty good & the service is fast!  The only downside is that parking is a little tough.. since it is on Irving.
author: Kalok L.

description:
AKA Pho "Hip Hop"!  Nah, they don't got no rap in here.  The only rap they got here are the lettuce wraps.  Which, btw are pretty damn good.  I'm talking about the fried egg rolls (gia gio).  One may be fooled into thinking these are your typical eggrolls from your favorite chinese dive, but you will be happily surprised by the rice paper they use.  Its the thin translucent kind, not the yellow parchment paper.  Wrap these bad boys up in some lettuce, pop in some springs of mint, a quick dip in the nuoc mam (orangy fish sauce) and be on your way to eggroll heaven.

In conjunction with the tasty fried treats, they by far, have a lock on their beef noodle soup.  You can stray away and try to get all the fancy smancy soups, but they definitely have the right combination for their special soup (dac biet).  Usually positioned at the top of the soup list, the #1, it's your basic noodle soup combination special with flank, brisket, tripe, and all that good stuff.

Definitely the spot to hit up Saturday morning after a long festive evening, the soup here will replenish the fluids to the bones.   You;ll almost want to pick the bowl off and drink it like it was the nectar of the gods.

To conclude, this is THE spot for pho in the City, hands down.  Two thumbs and an eggroll up!

One unisex bathroom.  Not the prettiest of it's kind.  Hit up the bar across the street if you gotta sit down.
author: Isaac L.

description:
It's been almost an eternity since I've been here. I used to come here regularly a few years back, then discovered the Daly City one at Westlake and been going there regularly since. But today me and my bf decided to come here for dinner. 

We ordered the normal, 22A Medium (Chicken Pho) and the bf the #2 (the one with everything beef in it) with the rare thinly sliced beef on the side.The meal was good and definitely fills you up, but I think the PHH3 has more favor in their chicken broth. 
IMO the Thai teas at both places are majorly sweet, like 50% of the cup has been filled with syrup. Actually, they probably have been. So, we always end up having to dilute them with tea. Well, this time I actually ordered the Vietnamese coffee for the first time and really liked it! Plus, I really need my caffeine fix since I have to stay up and finish my final paper......and yet instead I'm yelping. I'm only on here to keep myself sane during this time.....:D

Parking can be a pain half of the time, crazy fast service (but then again all they have to do is throw a pile of rice noodles into broth and the added ingredients of whatever you order), cheap prices, waiters are okay most times, food is good and leaves you filled and satisfied. As for the drinks, if you really want good boba I would suggest to go down to Wonderful Foods for that....cause their drinks aren't really anything special. The place looks a lot nicer and brighter than a few years back. I would still go here, but I'll still give it a 3.5 even though I personally prefer the PHH 3 at Daly City.
author: Serena W.

description:
The vermicelli soups and bowls are all good choices. I came here during lunch break and did some take out. Not a bad price for thinly sliced steak flank, tripe and tendon. Comes with rice vermicelli, soup and leaf mint and bean sprouts. I love bean sprouts!!! It's better than cabbage...

If you're more of a snack person, you might want to try out their spring rolls. A great treat for the kiddies because of the tangy peanut sauce.
author: Jason C. J.

description: Legit pho. An old high school hangout spot. My family and friends come here a lot. Their rice plates with the grilled pork chops and the shrimp rolls are delicious.
author: Ruby L.

description:
Best Pho in San Francisco...Rice plates and cold noodle dishes are okay but not the best.   

Come for the Pho, Hu Tieu, or Beef Stew.  Drinks are yummy as well (better than Quickly's) .

And...service is faster than McDonalds!!!
author: Cin T.

description:
The pho here is great. Comes out less than 2 minutes after you put your order in, and it's hot and tasty.

But don't get any of the bubble/boba/tapioca drinks on the dessert menu because they're overcooked and mushy. There are much better boba options close by on Irving street.

Also, the menu says that the fresh spring rolls are supposed to come with shrimp, pork, lettuce, etc. But the actual rolls don't have any pork. Since this appetizer is the same price as a small bowl of pho, just get pho!
author: Elisa T.

description: The pho here is consistently good and hot.  Service is fast and it always seems pretty busy here.  I've also had the BBQ pork chop rice dish and that  was good.  However, I do have to deduct 1 star for them not serving broken rice.
author: H K.

description: The food is pretty good, and the prices are reasonable. What stands out, though, is the speed of service. The food comes out very fast, which is a great thing especially if your car is parked at a meter.
author: Kipy K.

description: I no longer live in SF, but when I did, this was my hands down place to go for pho. Albeit, parking is non-existent, especially being in the midst of a lot of other Asian stores and right next to 19th, but it is still SOOO worth it. When I go back to visit and feel like pho, I will return here. It is that good.
author: Kristina Y.

description: This is one of my go-to pho places. There is another location in the Westlake Center in Daly City. Noodles are always well-cooked, and broth is tasty. The fried fishcakes and egg rolls are my favorite appetizers. Also very inexpensive. I come here all the time!
author: D C.

description:
I'm going to count this as one of my great finds in SF.

Pho Huynh Hiep is a pho place ran buy Vietnamese people!  I had a Pho Tai for $5.75 and it's as good as they come.  They don't skimp on the noodles or the meat like some places know (looking your way Pho Hoa in the Financial District...).

The places is large, clean, and simple; great pho at a better price.
author: James B.

description: Best vietnamese pork chops I've had! They also give you a bowl of scrumptious soup. All for less than 8 bucks. Big Win!!
author: Oxworth C.

description: Definitely my pho spot. Typical pho menu and prices. Fast service as usual. But like most asians, I judge pho restaurants on their broth. Super yummy!
author: Kristin S.

description: Good comfort food spot when you feel like getting pho but don't want to make a trek all the way to the TL. They're fast, yummy, cheap, and easy parking!
author: Emy s.

description: Had to go dinner a couple of times here this week so I thought I'd give it a little update. I ordered the ketchup beef based soup with noodles and they give big pieces of beef, not really cut and this happened most of the time so it kinda disgusted me. I also ordered the fried pork with egg over rice, eh, it's mediocre but i've had better. Though i give them props for their tapioca taro drinks cause this is the only place I know that has pulp for now!
author: Vivian L.

description: The portions are SO generous.! I really love this place, the food comes out fast. The best soups I've had thank you so much!!!
author: James M.

description: This is the best pho in town.  If you want a good, quick and cheap meal, Kevin's is the best!!
author: Eric H.

description: Love the pho here not so much the service though. Oh and try the BBQ chicken rice plate if you don't feel much like soup, it's pretty good too.
author: Petra S.

description: Decent prices and fairly tasty. I ordered the pork chops w/ egg over rice. Very moist and soft when I cut into it. Perfect greasiness. Their drip coffee  is good too. Just be patient it does take a while. Noodles are also tasty too, but cant really differentiate from other pho places.
author: Thomas L.

description: Great food , decent price. The fish cakes is my favorite dish.
author: Ernest Q.

description:
Came here for dinner. A family of three arrived before we did. They got the table that was free. We sat with another family or friends that was two tables together. It was fine, but my mom was a little pissed about it. 

There was one menu on the table for the four of us. One of the guys came by to take our order and my mom said there was only one menu for the four of us. We finally got some more menus and then picked stuff out.

I had number 17 medium. It's just beef and noodles. My brother had the same thing but large. My mom had number nine and it was small. My dad ordered something with rice.

When the orders came, the bowl of medium and large were similar in size just a slight difference. But if you compare the small to the medium and large you could tell. 

It was just more soup than anything in the larger sizes. Overall it was pretty good. The only bad thing was the tea wasn't refilled until we were leaving. 

I'd come back again. The menu was easy to read with descriptions of what was in the noodles and you wouldn't order something that you wouldn't eat.
author: Jen C.

description:
this is my go-to pho restaurant in SF. It's cheap (for bay area standards), quick, and pretty clean. They remodeled a few years back so it's a little more updated and spacious. When I'm not in the mood for pho, I'll either order other noodle soups or their rice dishes. These are pretty decent.

i've never had a bad experience at this restaurant and i've been coming here for about 6 years now. parking is terrible though!
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place is probably one of the few good pho places in sf. Best hangover food ever! The broth is always good and the service is generally really friendly. Pretty authentic considering that alot of pho places around here are more Chinese oriented than Vietnamese which definitely makes a difference for pho. I think I've been to this one at least 50 times by now and hasn't yet to fail me on deliciousness. The other kevins noodle house in daly city is good as well but egg noodle beef stew cant compare to this one. When you are craving pho.... This is the place to hit!
author: Logan T.

description:
Oh ... how i miss you :(

My go-to spot when i dont want to cook when i lived in the sunset.  Now i must take 2 buses to get to you-- oh faithful medium #28 Seafood Wide Noodles... ::Drools::  how i miss you so :(
author: kate y.

description: This would be my third or fourth choice for pho in the city. Their service is alright. the food is alright. Usually no wait for table seating. It is also very clean. Definitely a place to eat after a long days work (: Parking however, is a whole other story.
author: Kristina L.

description: Every time i feel: sick / hungover / lazy / sleepy / etc., ALL i want is a large bowl of pho from Kevin's Noodle House (of which i'm glad there is a simple name so I don't have to try to pronounce "huynh hiep"). Too bad you have to see me on some of my worst-looking-pajama-wearing-lazy days, but I am always so happy to see you, kevin's noodle house.
author: Jamie J.

description: These people couldn't take an order for their lives. Every time I order food, they screw up in one way or another.
author: Jake S.

description: I don't know of any other place with broth this good. They are consistently, reliably delicious. I'm not really sure there is any place nearby with such a rich, hearty soup, which is why Kevin's Noodle House is... number one in my heart.
author: Elbert C.

description:
In the city, I don't think this is the best pho I've had, but it's decent and reasonably priced... it is, however, all the way out in Sunset, so huge deduction for location.
They're also pretty sparse on the onion and the small looks a lot smaller than other pho restaurant's regular/smalls, but on the other hand it does seem to be just enough. The noodles are good, the broth is excellent, and the meat is fresh. I always get tendon, and they don't cook it as thoroughly as I'm used to, so another docking for that.
This place also smells really odd, like cheese... it throws off the experience a little. Above average, but not the greatest, if I'm in the area I would come again but this would not be my SF recommended pho.
author: Jessica L.

description: Egh. This was my first try at Pho, and probably my last. I'm not sure if its how they made it here or if i don't like Pho overall but i didn't like it. The meat was very gross. The spaghetti was fine. And the soup itself just had no taste. Egh not good. and it smells bad.
author: Nikita K.

description:
I was born and raised in San Diego.  Being Vietnamese, throughout my childhood I was exposed to many various Vietnamese restaurants in SoCal - I've had good Vietnamese food, and I've had bad Vietnamese food.  

When I first moved to SF, I was expecting a slew killer Vietnamese restaurants - WRONG.  I don't personally know any Vietnamese in town (so there aren't many Vietnamese restaurants) and the Vietnamese restaurants that ARE here are owned by non-Vietnamese.  

I have to say, Pho Hoa Hiep made me feel like I was home.  The chopsticks and various sauces were already at the table, the iced coffee is dripping out of the french press at the table, I can order in Vietnamese at the table. and pay at the cash register in the back - just like home!  

Regardless of the surroundings, I have to say the offerings tasted just like my favorites back home.  

Recommendations: 
-Pho Tai
-BBQ chicken over rice
-iced Vietnamese coffee
author: Dong T.

description:
here's to pho, for being the best drunk / hangover food EVER

i discovered "kevin's noodle house" after an evening at nightlife at the academy of sciences. a couple of friends and i had the munchies and decided that we needed some pho. we ended up at this place after some careful yelping.

the truth is, whether you're drunk, hungover or sober you can't deny that kevin knows hit shit. the pho delivers on both quality and quantity. the portions are HUGE. definitely big enough to share and the best part is that everything is so cheap. i've had a few of the different phos, and they're all good. i'm particularly fond of the beef phos, because the broth is rich with spices, meaty and flavorful. definitely more complex than most phos. 

i'd also recommend the seafood pho. portions are equally generous as they are with meat. and you get a good variety from fish, to larger prawns to crabmeat to squid. 

definitely come for the pho. the springrolls are decent, at best.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Ahh Pho Hyynh Hiep 2 aka Kevin's Noodle House. I really like this place. Fast service, friendly atmosphere, and good food. I've eaten a lot of pho in San Francisco, Davis, and San Jose, and I can honestly say that.. this place is definitely top tier, amongst one of the best pho places I've ever been to. As a humble little boy, I did not like pho.. I would prefer the most blandest rice plates over pho anyday. However, once I moved to San Jose for half of my college years, I developed a taste for this type of food.. beginning in San Jose's Lees Noodle House. Ever since my love for pho bloomed, I've been searching for the best pho. For many years pho has been kinda the same everywhere, with varying degrees of soup and noodle thickness, and my love for pho has just been kinda .. yanno unexciting and standard. When I revisited Kevin's Noodle House after my passion for pho flourished, I realized that this place has some of the best noodles of the bay! 

The #1 pho is very good. The meat is very tasty, the soup is very savory sweet, and the noodles are perfectly balanced. These three things culminate into one very satisfying meal, be it breakfast, lunch, dinner, or even for all 3 meals. The pho is also quite cheap, price tag at around 8 dollars. very worth it. 

I would also recommend the rice/vermicilli plate with the charbroiled pork and egg roll. The meat is very tender, very juicy, and very delicious, while the egg roll is very crunchy and refreshing from the inside.. kinda like how spring is like. One gets the euphoric feeling of spring time when eating this plate. A nice warm sensation, like being under a tree under the bright sun.

Kevin's Noodle House is very good.. so good that there was a time when I came here to eat every single day of the week.. with anyone I could find who would be down to eat some pho.. I have no regrets
author: simon k.

description: a cheap source of good soup goodness. 5 or 6 bucks leaves you with a bowl of steaming hot meat and noodles in a delicious broth. whats not to love? cold weather attracts customers to here and the other across the street causing lines out the doors. pho is perfect for rain so for that I thank you.
author: Jake C.

description:
I swear the pho heals you after a night of binge drinking!  Definitely in my rotation, at least once a week.  The food is good, cheap, and fast.  I usually order a chicken broth noodle soup as it is one of the best in the city.  If I want beef, I have another spot (though its good here too).

Pho Hoa Hiep, my liver thanks you.
author: Ezduzit S.

description:
I used to go here for my pho fix until I found Yummy Yummy's (which is better and closer to my apt). The pho here has gone downhill, I think. The brisket is so fatty .. where's the meat? And the broth .. it's kind of smelly. Not sure how to accurately describe the taste as it's been a LONG time since I've gone back for pho.

And the oily eggrolls .. they're bad .. so bad that I would go across the street and order the good eggrolls from PPQ to go with my pho (I know, I'm so wrong, :P). The quality of the food here overall isn't great. But there are some things I might still order - just not the pho. The strawberry slush bubble tea is actually really good .. sometimes (it's hit or miss .. but how can you hit or miss bubble tea! aiyah)

I really don't think the place is great. I took my parents (who are Vietnamese and were visiting from Houston) here to try out the pho, and they hated it. Ultimate litmus test.
author: Anvy A.

description:
Great food at a great price! Very spacious inside and the staff are friendly.

FAW CHEH TAU and a SODA SEE MUI please!
author: Tony L.

description:
My favorite place to get pho!

The broth is really flavorful and the portions are pretty generous.

It's a great placet to grab dinner if you're in a rush.  The service is so fast that sometimes I don't even get to sit down and open my menu that the waiter is already asking me what i want!!  The pho comes out within five minutes piping hot.

A perfect meal for a cold day,  always makes me want to go home afterwards for a nap...good prices, nothing fancy about this place...  I'm a repeat customer..
author: Vickie Y.

description:
So.... This may be "the McDonad's of pho".. this may be the most americanized MSG'd out, dirty place... but i really really really like it!

On Monday, it was cold, I was hungry, it was late...
it was meant to be

My husband and I wandered up and down Irving looking for a pho place that wasn't on the verge of closing (I hate being the last ones in there when the owner's want to close)

And there it was, still open and packed with customers.  Their broth was HOT and rich.  Their menu had the perfect options for us.

The FOOD:

*big delicious tender pieces of tendon
*rich perfectly seasoned broth
*rare on the side
*bowl sizes were perfect!

I still love Yummy Yummy don't get me wrong.  But, Kevin's is my place for Pho.   The hunt if over!
author: Sonya C.

description: My go-to pho place, especially great on a cold day. Quick service, cheap and delicious pho. My favorite is #2, medium special combo with thin slices of steak, brisket, flank, tendon, tripe and beef balls.
author: Jess H.

description: The service was pretty bad.  I also ordered an iced coffee and didn't know what to do with it because the lady just gave me a cup of ice and separated condensed milk and coffee. She never explained how to mix it and I ended up not drinking it because I messed it up.  They use MSG in their food, but not as much as other places.  The Pho was pretty good, but I still don't like the fact that they put MSG in their food.
author: H. A.
