description: Kevin's Noodle House is probably the most well-rounded pho I have enjoyed in San Francisco. The beef soup is very rich and the noodles are always cooked perfectly with a "bouncy" texture. Although a little bit on the low quantity side (or perhaps I am just fat), the beef is excellent. The best part about Kevin's is the value (under $7 for a XL pho dat biet)!
author: Lou T.

description:
As most people know I tend to be kinda a critic when it comes to Vietnamese food. Can't help when you are born and raised on the stuff and have a mom who is the best cook ever. 

Anyway, some might not agree but there are few good Vietnamese restaurants in this city. A lot of them that are popular are either 1) not authentic 2) bland 3) don't speak Vietnamese!!! (not even food pronunciation!)

That said this place is one of my go-to spots in the city. Honestly, it's not the best pho i have ever had (gotta go to socal for that) but it does the trick to calm my cravings and its a heck of a lot better than the pho across the street. Anyway, it's real pho with good service and a decent price. Oh yeah - and there is never a wait!
author: Minh-Chi T.

description:
A dependable meal, whether it be lunch, dinner, or late night. Consistent pho , noodle, and rich dishes. Very fast service and the restaurant is fairly large so I've never had to wait to sit down. Large menu, gaudy colored tapioca drinks galore. Apparently the avocado smoothie is their best seller, but I'm not into that kinda thing... 
Friendly service. Relatively clean. Your average bowl of pho.
author: Jasmine O.

description:
This is the default Vietnamese place amongst me and my friends. I've been going here since high school and to be honest, the place has actually gotten better, both in quality of food and inside the restaurant. The owners have definitely upgraded the tables, chairs, the overall cleanliness of the place and it's definitely made it better for me to eat at and not feel grossed out.

I loved the pho... but now that I've gone cold turkey on beef... and I don't quite trust the chicken pho to be done right, I usually get the pork rice dishes. They're usually pretty good... a little greasy, but overall satisfying. Tonight, I got the sliced pork vermicelli with egg roll... I think I found my new favorite non-pho Vietnamese dish. I didn't quite enjoy the salad that came with it but even that was decent enough to finish.

Like I said in the past, if you want good Vietnamese food, don't go to Daly City, go to Irving Street... and go here. I don't know about PPQ because it's been forever since I've been there, but I definitely recommend this place.
author: Chris S.

description: Relatively clean. Decent pho and spring roll. Not the best but safe.
author: Brandon M.

description: I love this restaurant so much! I've been going here since middle school since my mom knows the owners and dang it is still good. We eat here like at least once a month since it's pretty much my mom's favorite Vietnamese restaurant that's close enough to where we live. This place has it's good days and it's bad but most of them are good(: Their pho is delicious and the raw slices of beef (tai) are cut really well! instead of being too chewy it's really easy to eat(: Oh, and they have really good smoothies with boba in them and their rice dishes are delicious, however I think that the best item there is still their shrimp cake (hu ky). Like seriously... Om nom nom~
author: Jeffery P.

description:
I came here on a weekday and it was pretty busy. The beefball pho with flat noodles were delicious ... and actually I wasn't really into eating so much food so we split the portions between the group of us. I really love eating imperial egg rolls with vermicelli noodles drenched in gnoc mum (sweet fish sauce)...damn that was good!

Any menu that gives you pictures and a number assignment is all good with me...it makes ordering that much quicker...service is brisk and steady...parking is always a hassle because the nearer you are to 19th Avenue, the worse your chances are...try the avenues further up the hill...like Judah, or even Moraga.
author: Pauline L.

description:
Nothing makes you feel good when you have a bowl of Pho on cold, windy night.  Recommended by my friend, we went up to San Francisco just to try out this place and it didn't disappoint me.

It sort of looks like cafeteria inside, as my friend describes, but it was very clean and of course, crowded by people who are eager to try out the Pho.  

One thing I love about this place, which distinguishes from other Pho place that I've been to  is that the meat here is super-fresh.  I'm not a meat guru or anything so before, I didn't think I'd be able to tell the difference between regular, stale meat and fresh ones, but here, you can definitely taste the fresh, chewy but not gummy texture of meat and/or intestines in the soup.  I think that's why people love this place and see the difference on Pho ... taste-wise.

I will definitely go back there ... ONLY IF I close by ... going to this place would be a challenge for me, since I live down in peninsula ... but if you live nearby, you should definitely check out this place.  You'll love it.
author: Misty C.

description:
Good pho (beef noodle soup). Super fast and fairly cheap. Great eats to accompany a hangover ;) I wouldn't say the Pho is super authentic but it's very close to home-made food. 

The rice dishes are basic but theirBBQ  pork over rice is right on with the Vietnamese flavor/technique. 

Good family restaurant with fast service.
author: My V.

description:
Mm this place is delicious!  The pho is great and cheap, and the portions are enormous.  Unless you're really hungry, get the regular portion and not the large. 

What I really loved about this place though is the crispy fried spring rolls!  I haven't had such good Vietnamese spring rolls in the longest time.  If you don't eat them very often, I would recommend wrapping lettuce around the spring roll and eating it together.  The lettuce balances out the flavor more.
author: Robyn F.

description:
The pho is always hot, flavorful, and abundant. I like the egg noodles. The chile slices are very hot. But best of all, the broth is a tasty chicken base and wonderfully seasoned. I am not Vietnamese, so I don't know if this is authentic or not; most pho restaurant's broth tastes watery to me. In any case, I enjoy the food, recommend and return. 

The rice plates are very tasty, although I suspect there is a fair amount of oil in the sauces.
author: YearOf M.

description:
This is my favorite Pho place in the bay.  Cheap, filling, and fast.  If only the one in Oakland lived up to the same quality of service.  Also, its great for hangovers or cold days/nights.

Recommended: Chicken Pho or the Chicken and Shrimp Pho
author: Michael G.

description:
OMFG!!!! you want a bowl of pho? get ur ass over to kevins. Its not fancy or exotic. its just legit pho and bbq cooked by legit vietnamese ppl who are super chill. Kevins isnt the most beautiful place but thats not why u came here with a terrible hangover or maybe slightly tipsy. its simply good food unlike PPQ across the street.

This is my fav place on irving and ive been coming here for YEARS. My proudest moment was getting tipsy with a bunch of white friends and piling over to Kevins for somedeliciousness and introducing the world of pho to them. WIN!

Number 1 FTW (unless u want beef balls), BBQ is pretty good if u want a break from delicious noodles, tender beef and amazing broth (i usually drink it all).
author: Ryan Y.

description: I originally wrote a really long review on this place. It started with the fight over a parking spot and the DISGUSTING food I ate here. I am changing it to simply - I feel like throwing up after eating here to attempt to save myself from potential food poisoning. I can just feel the bacteria churning in my stomach.
author: Jena D.

description: The five starts is specifically for the beef stew with egg noodles. To be honest, the other things on the menu are simply "good", but nothing special. The beef stew is delicious however, and it so salty it makes my tongue and mouth burn. In  good way.
author: simone H.

description: I grew up on Pho so I consider myself a connoisseur. If you want authentic Vietnamese pho, Pho Huynh Hiep is not the place to get it. The broth was awful and the seasoning did not taste right at all. The portions were big but that was about the only thing that was decent about the place. The dipping sauce for the spring rolls was not that great either. The spring rolls were ok. If you want the real deal, the closest would probably be in the Tenderloins at either Pho Hoa or Turtle Tower.
author: Chi N.

description: This was my seester and I regular spot on Tuesday for months. Until we decided eating carbs was evil and stop going. Boo-hoo fat genes. Steven the waiter dude is super nice and always smiling. He remembers our order without even having to tell him.
author: Sophia C.

description: This is one of my favorite pho spots in the city. I like how they're opened a little bit later than most pho places. To be honest, I like their pho better than Pho Garden & PPQ. They give you enough meat, broth isn't bland, & fresh ingredients. But, sometimes I feel like the amount of noodles doesn't meet the noodle to meat and/or tripe ratio. They also have some pretty good vermicelli dishes & spring rolls. I haven't tried the rice dishes yet though, but I heard they're pretty good too. So I gotta give those a try one day. They also serve tapioca drinks, which are just eh. You can really tell that its made from powder. So skip the tapioca drinks & just go to Quickly's or Wonderful's down the street after hitting Pho Huynh Hiep up. Reasonably priced for a hearty meal. Service is okay; what do you expect from an Asian restaurant? But the food comes pretty fast.
author: BrendaJoy G.

description: Sorry but I just don't understand what everyone is so excited about. I was really excited about this place at first and was thrilled when I was the drink menu but when I ordered my tapioca it was waaay too sweet and tasted like something from quickly and when the food came.... maybe i ordered the wrong stuff but it was just.... not my favorite. The good thing was that it seemed fresh but the smell and the sweetish seafood flavor was once again not my favorite.
author: Lena T.

description: I've been to this place loads of times.  I've gone to other Vietnamese places, but in the end I come back here.  "How romantic.."  When it was cold, I really, truly appreciated their broth.  I feel like I've been neglecting the soup previously.  I've followed people in dumping hoisin and srircha sauce in my soup but never had I enjoyed it plain.  And plain is it not; this soup's got great flavor to it.  For a cuisine that is based on noodle soup, the soup being good is very essential.  Duh! I ordered the number 1 which is a combination of meats:  tripe and tendons and beef.  It was really good.  It was like that cute girl you had a crush on and started wanting to see her more.  I gave Pho Huynh Hiep a one day break and came back to her the following day.
author: Brandon Y.

description: WOAH WOAH WOAH! The last time I came here was NOT too long ago and I just went in today with my friend and WOAH!... I feel like they downsize the taste of their pho.. I ordered a #8 small.. and the soup was just disgusting.. I was soo disappointed. Not only that.. the service got downgraded too.. No Spoons on the table? how the heck am I suppose to pick up the soup with my pho... and no napkins.. what am I suppose to whip my mouth when I slurp my pho? and I have to ask three times.. not cute at all.. I'm kinda disappointed and kinda proves that.. San Jose Pho is better than San Francisco Pho!
author: Lianne D.

description: this place inspired me to finally write a Yelp review after years of only lurking.  we were both fighting bad colds and the chicken pho here was delicious, warming, and cold-busting (with some spicy stuff added).  Also, it was reasonably priced and clean!  I'm a big fan and will return.
author: Marina C.

description: I eat a lot of pho and with all the pho restaurants around the city...please skip this place.  I've left a Yelp review about their Pho Huynh Hiep 3 in Daly City...that one got 2 stars too...though I think that this place is even worst then the DC one.
author: Patrick C.

description: Love that there is a kid's menu here. Big bonus for that. The chicken is kid friend, diced really small unlike a lot of the other places. The pho is good, and the broth is very fresh. My husband loves the bbq pork. Definitely, a good alternative to PPQ, which I feel hasn't been as good lately.
author: Gwenn G.

description:
I have been to this place for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and it never disappoints! I always get the pho and I never get tired of it. My brother lives right by this place so I always have an excuse to eat here, but regardless, the food is well worth the trip, especially if you are a little hung over (totally agree with you Vivian N.!). It can get pretty crowded on the weekends but the line goes fast. No real complaints here. 

Stick with the pho, wipe off your chop sticks and spoon with napkins, just to be safe, get the rare beef on the side so it's not well done by the time it gets to you, and enjoy every bite!
author: Alex Q.

description:
n my mind, there's 3 types of Vietnamese restaurants. The ones like Slanted Door (asian fusion), then there's the genuine vietnamese cuisine which serves other dishes than just pho, and then there's the strictly pho and rice dish places. In the latter category, I give this the HIGHEST rating in all of the bay area. You cannot go wrong with their fresh spring roll or fried egg roll. I usually choose #1 or #2 (whatever is not with meatballs) and if I'm feeling like going the distance, I will get a 3 color bean drink (BEST in bay area). 

As far as rice plates, I usually get the pork chop with 2 sunny side eggs. The great thing about this dish is that it comes with the pho soup base and you get the dipping sauce for your pork chop giving you many flavors in 1 dish!

Again, I want to repeat, this is the BEST pho place in the bay area!
author: Michael C.

description:
Mediocre and as my blind date said afterward, "This was a really cheap date."  Nice.

Aside from that, the food's really just okay.  Not great, not awful.  Very, very, very few vegetarian options.  Mechanically assembled fish and meat slices/balls/cakes galore.  Given the quality of the food, the relatively large space of the restaurant, plentiful tables, and competition from other (can I say better?) pho shops, you probably won't have to wait to start chowing down.
author: Lynn O.

description:
Satisfies my pho cravings. #9 is the the one I always get ... today i tried #1 at the Daly City one but I didn't really like it. 

Don't get the ice coffee.... it takes like forever to drip and it tastes so bitter and yucky even with condensed milk.

The young coconut juice is the one that comes in the can. It's not fresh, just to let you know!
author: Allyson L.

description:
This is a great place for food. They stay open late and the pho is excellent. You can spend about under $10 and fill yourself up. I always order the number 1, extra large with some thai ice tea. You can't compare the pho to other places. This is just damn good. 

Cheap. Fast. Good.

Friggin' excellent. The rice dishes are good as well. And the chicken wings. Oh god, they are good. I can knock back two plates no problem.

If you need to fill up fast, and don't have a lot of dough, instead of heading to KFC down a block, come here. Definitely better and more food for the dollar.
author: Clinton L.

description:
A nice, solid Viet joint.  Pho is good, rice dishes good, rolls are good.  Vermicelli bowls need some improvement.

When my sister in law first moved over here from Saigon after marrying my oldest bro, she found out she was pregnant and I was in charge since he was busy to take her out and get food to keep her happy (I guess she also kept craving the food of her home land).  She really liked this place and since she had the pregnant woman cravings, I found myself eating here repeatedly.  I got to try out much of their menu and I liked almost everything.

Only thing I think needs some improvement is their cold vermicelli noodles which can taste a bit soggy or old or just plain off at times.  Service is fine, nothing to gripe about.  I also like their blended drinks.

The only Viet place I would keep going to in this area of the Sunset.  I have yet to try their competitor across the st tho.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Yummm love the pho here! eggrolls here are so-so, but price can't be beat. That's why it's 4 starts...
author: Thee M.

description:
The restaurant itself is a very clean place, lots of space to walk around and comfortable wherever you are sitting. 

The food itself is decent. The portions aren't that big unless you are getting pho. Tastes good. Service is definitely super fast.. maybe a little bit too fast. As soon as we walked in, we were seated and got menus. Three minutes later, the waiter asked us if we were ready to order. 

Other than that, I liked everything else about it. Fast service, decent food.
author: R F.

description:
The rolls are good.  The pho is good.  Portions are so so.

Looking at the stars to rate this restaurant reminds me of the stars on GTA and that reminds me of the shooting on Irving.

That's it I guess.
author: Christopher C.

description:
I stumbled upon this place one day on my lunch break from work.  Ordinarily, I wouldn't have bothered but on that particular day, I had an extra hour so I decided to sit down and get a bowl of pho instead of quicker lunch options like the nearby pizza place or kfc.  I ordered a large bowl and was surprised when it came out immediately.  I ordered and the food came right out.  I've been back several times since and it never ceases to amaze me how fast the pho comes out.  Within 5 minutes of walking in, I'm eating delicious pho.  I've never been disappointed in the pho here.  Is it the best?  Maybe.  In all honesty probably not, but its definitely better than pho hoa.  The rolls are a bit more hit and miss.  Once my sister ordered the fresh spring rolls and well, there was nothing fresh about them.  But other than that one time they've never been bad, though they're nothing to write home about.  I usually just stick with the pho anyways.  As has been mentioned in other reviews, service can be pretty bad.  But chopsticks, condiments, napkins, spoons, even little bowls are all stored on the table so you don't really need them to do much other than take your order.  It personally doesn't bother me to much but I know it can be a sticking point to others.  My suggestion, drink the tea, keep track of what you ordered and pay cash.  Otherwise you could be in for some long waits.

It can get crowded and you might be asked to share a table, particularly if you are sitting at the larger center tables.  While I personally don't care for this, its not a deal breaker for me.  

Oh, I came here with my Dad one time and he wasn't supposed to eat rice noodles.  They were happy to substitute egg noodles for the rice noodles in the pho dishes despite the existence of a different egg noodle soup menu.  So they have that going for them.
author: Bryan P.

description: I used to go to this place all the time during high school, but looking back on it now, there's better pho places in SF. This place has very fast service and nice people, but I've tasted better pho. I'll still go here from time to time though.
author: Nick L.

description:
Would give this a solid 3.75 stars, so rounding up to 4.

I'm on a newly-started quest to find the best pho tai in San Francisco, and this is so far the best I've found.  The beef broth they use is excellent - extremely flavorful, with the full complement of spices you'd want it to have.  The price is right, starting from $5.25 for a small, and with your choice of sizes.  The lemonade is excellent.  The service is fast, and the restaurant is quite clean and pleasant, for a cheap pho spot.  But I'm subtracting a full 1.25 stars and deciding against making this my pho go-to because the beef itself does not taste as fresh and flavorful as I think it should, and the bean sprouts should have been fresher, too.  It's fine - the pho as a whole makes for a great meal - but I'm convinced there's better out there, even if "better" is all the way down in San Jose.  So I'd definitely encourage others to visit this spot, and I plan to return in due course, but not until I figure out whether I can do better  for pho tai in SF.
author: B L.

description: Okay this Kevin's Noodle House is much much better than the one in Daly CIty. For me small pho with rare beef on the side and for my husband large with the works. So great on a cold day! Love it!
author: Michelle Y.

description: Everything I order from here is delicious and inexpensive! My bf and I go here ocassionally and it's wonderful the service and the food and it's never too loud. A few times we've had almost no one around us so it was nice to be in a quiet atmosphere. Definetely recommend this restaurant whether it be this location or their other locations
author: George C.

description: Pho is just ok. Maybe I'm spoiled from having just come back from Vietnam...
author: Kiri H.

description: This was one of the places where I had Pho for the first time before. I was in the neighborhood and it was cold.So my boyfriend and I decided to drive there. HUGEEEEE MISTAKE! My bf was craving chicken noodle soup and I wanted beef stew so we order it. The first thing I was suspicious about was that they brought the soups in 3 minutes whooaa! First off all i could tell the chicken soup was water,msg, and nasty chicken it was SEE Through+my bf did not like that it didn't have the think noodles. My stew was horrible. We took it to go only the noodles and pay. After that we RAN to TURTLE TOWER NOW THATS PHO.
author: Julia D.

description: Haven't been there for 6 months. went there 2 weeks ago and noticed they drop the price about a dollar and the restaurant was packed. It's good to see a nice restaurant doing well. Pho is good if you don't mind the msg. Workers are cool.
author: uncle m.

description: This place is alright.  Pho places are very difficult for me to rate, as I usually eat the rice/meat/hoisin sauce combo meals, as my ability to use chopsticks is very poor. However, I did eat pho at this place and it was quite decent.  Located near 19th Avenue and Irving, it's fairly easy to get to, but parking can get difficult on most days & nights.
author: Rob L.

description: I finally tried something new and had the bun thit nuong or rice noodles with BBQ.  Everything tasted really fatty.  The noodles were a little oily and the meat had lots of fat.  The nuoc mam wasn't really spot on.  Wish they used more lime.  Overall it was okay, but I expected more.  For a pho place, it's common for them to specialize in rice and noodle plates, too.  Service was super fast though.  If I do come back, I think I'll just stick with the pho.
author: Anne N.

description: This place is really good when you get that pho craving! They stay consistent when it comes to the broth and spring rolls. They're fast and usually have an open seat for you right away. I'm a regular customer and will continue to be!
author: Charlene F.

description:
I eat here about 3 times a week.  Sometimes 2 times in one day.  It's like home-cooking and I ain't even Vietnamese.  If you ask for a glass of water, they'll never remember to bring it just like your very own senile grandparents would.

Kevin's is the best pho in the city.  Hands down.  I used to be blinded by PPQ across the street, but now I see the light.  Don't settle for inferior noodles.

I recommend the #2 extra large. 

 What sets Kevin's apart is the noodle quality, broth quality, and beef ball quality.  No other shop can compare in these three categories.

The legend is growing, so expect a wait on some nights.  Don't worry too much though, because they serve up their dishes extremely fast.  You'll be seated before you can run down the street and get a tapioca milk tea from Wonderful Foods.
author: Brandon C.

description:
Perfect Pho and Spring Rolls
This is one of my favorite places in the city

P.S. In the battle between Pho Hoa Hiep and Pho Phu Quoc right accross the street, Pho Hoa Hiep prevails (hands down).
author: Bobby T.

description:
Tasty Pho. Fast service and decenty priced. The only down fall is the service, but who really  cares if youre in for some damn good pho. 

definitely try it sometime.
author: Alyssa A.

description:
My critique should not be entirely accepted. I have only experienced a bowl of Pho and no other dish.

Two and a half stars for their Pho, but four stars for their effort and hard-at-work performance, for a 14 year old should never have to take my order. 

I can make better Pho than this place. If there weren't 25 guests over at the house partying for New Year's Eve, I would have cooked instead. As a Vietnamese native from San Jose, I know good Pho and where to find it.

If a trip back home to San Jose isn't likely, I may come back here to sample other dishes.
author: Thao T.

description:
Pho Hoa Hiep is the best place on earth. I order either the #13 medium or large, or the #17 medium or large.  I love how the food comes so fast so I can get in and out of there very fast. The service is good and the prices are even better. 
If i had enough money i would eat here everyday =]
author: Alicja D.

description:
Definitely a strong pho place to eat. Food is always lightening fast and always pretty solid portions. Drinks are pretty standard. I would say the thing that keeps me coming back is the broth that is used to make the pho. YUMMMMMMMM. 

However, four stars because parking is sometimes tough and you need to ask like 5 times for water.
author: Rich H.

description:
seafood egg noodle.
eh.
author: Henry H.

description: Great pho! Best Vietnamese restaurant in the Outer Sunset.
author: Cindy C.

description: Tasty pho always satisfied parking always works out price is so good service rocks when I want pho I always what to get it here.
author: Brent D.

description: Good Pho.  Price is right.  I found the Pho at Daly City location to be a little more flavorful.
author: Mickey D.

description: Kevin's is pretty amazing on a cold day. Their pho is always really good and the meat from their rice plates is just amazing. I'm not a fan of their chicken pho. I like the crab in their seafood dish pho and I also like the beef pho. I love the thin rice noodles. The pho is always served hot and the place is about the same price as Subway and it fills you up more. The Vietnamese coffee is great, even for someone like me who doesn't like coffee. The boba is really good too, the lychee is my favorite and it doesn't disappoint. Just don't get it if you're freezing. Try and go before 7 because then it gets crowded and you'll have to wait until someone's done for a table.
author: Robin J.

description: Wanted pho and the places we usually go to were closed, so we picked out this one out to try. The prices are pretty decent and although it wasn't the best pho we've had, they do load you up on meat when you order. Usually I'll have a big ol' bowl of noodles and a few slices of beef or whatever meat that comes with it. Love the fresh bean sprouts and basil that comes with it. Their rice plates are pretty good as well. Quick service and food was good... I need to remember this place as a back-up.
author: Anne T.

description:
I love this place, my wife and I try to get here as often as we can.

The Beef Stew is my number one favorite here.

Fast service and great tasting food, nothing more need to say about this place.
author: Masa M.

description: I love this place. Whenever I want to go eat Pho, this is the place I always go to. I can never compare other Pho places because this is the place I am use to. The other places has taste that I am just not use to. It is different.
author: Joanna Y.

description: Cheap $5 bowls of pho but the broth was oily, meat chewy, and bean sprouts not fresh.  Beefier broth than PPQ across the street, so if I had to choose, I'd pick PHH.
author: Mimi L.

description:
Another one of my regular spots I head to when I do not want to spend a crap load of money.

I seldom order their Pho, but I have it and it is pretty decent, I once drank all the soup that came with it and it was very good, albeit a little bit salty. 

The Rice plates are what I normally order, rice with pork chop, rice with Egg all have distinctive tastes and are prepared well. When I order the plate with the chicken it becomes a hands on dish because i end up using my hands to eat it. The also make a mean eggroll and less greasy and a lot more flavorful than some dim sum places that I have been to. 

The Chicken soup that comes with most dishes is really good as well, it has some sort of leaf and onion at the bottom and when you finish drinking the soup, the onion is nicely cooked. A little bit salty as well. 

One of the waiters is kindly old man that walk around and takes your orders fast.

The food comes amazingly fast. 

One main gripe is that parking can be annoying as hell because this place is so close to 19th avenue and to other shopping areas. I have also been stuck when the Wah Lian or Sheng Kee truck decides it is time to deliver and blocks like 2- 5 cars from moving because either the truck is so big or they are just blocking.
author: Christopher C.

description:
This place gets 3 stars because while I feel like their pho is tasty and addicting...the health department gave them a 62 and so they lose 2 stars for their score.. I've gone to this place for about 8 years and the taste of their number 17 has almost always consistently been the same with a few exceptions of the broth not being warm enough to cook the noodles through.

Lately though, their broth has been less flavorful, plus I found out how dirty it really is. So, yes, one day I will come back. Just, not yet. The pho is good, the customer service is minimal, they take your order, bring your food, then your check, nothing impressive but it's the food you come for here.
author: Tiff L.

description:
Pho Huynh Hiep - Kevin's Noodle House is a busy place. Yet, no matter how busy, a food order can be ready in minutes and at a very reasonable price. 

The flavors and freshness is amazing. No wonder the place is always busy. Meter parking is not easy to find as that block of Irving Street near 19th Ave is always heavy with traffic.
author: Jonathan F.

description: I LOVE Kevin's Noodle House!!! they have the best pho in sf and my fave restaurant of all time!!! I use to come there at least once a week but I had to save money so I stopped going but now i am back for once a week! haha. last week I went there twice in one day! for lunch and for dinner! ordered the same thing. number 3 :] NEVER GETS OLD!! hehe.
author: Melissa G.

description: I couldn't find a good place for Pho in the city until I came here a couple weeks ago on a rainy day!  If you've never had Pho then this is the place to try.  i had the one with filet and flank steak and the small was definitely big enogh for lunch!  Plus it's so super cheap!  I'm a HUGE fan!!!
author: Carly P.

description: Always come here when I'm in the mood for Pho.  The prices are cheap and the food comes out super fast. The broth is very flavorful compared to other places I've tried. The combo rice plates are also good if you aren't in the mood for noodles.
author: anthony j.

description: My buddy Alex turned me on to this place.  It was nice to get back there after having lived in SF for a year.  He swears by it over every other place in the City, which I feel is a bit over the top.  However, out of the many places I have been, it has to be a top 5 pick for pho in the City.  It is an awesome spot that is frequently packed with the youth of the Sunset.  No nonsense, no frills, just cheap vietnamese in a low key setting.  I need to try different dishes when I go to Vietnamese places since all I get is pho and fried egg rolls.
author: Cole M.

description: This is the ONLY place I would EVER get pho. It's amazing! I love that they have 3 sizes to choose from, it's super cheap, and while the service isn't phenomenal, you never have to wait for anything, they expect you to just flag them down.  Also, they are really really REALLY fast, from the time I order to the time my food arrives is never more than 5 minutes, (altho I've never gotten a rice or bbq dish here before). I Love Kevin's!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I only go here to eat Vietnamese food if I can help it. (And don't go to the one in Daly city, it's not the same!!!)

Right when you walk in you are greeted and seated with smiling faces. They bring out a pot of tea for you right away. Once you order, the food comes out very quickly.

The pho is always piping piping hot! The kid's size is more than enough for me; very good portion! The fresh spring rolls are always a must when we go here! Great way to start off and the rolls come out within 2-5 minutes of ordering.

The rice plates are tasty as well! I  recommend the grilled chicken and fried shrimp cake rice plate. Very very good!

The pearl drinks are DELICIOUS. Even if they are the powder kind, they are so good. I like the mango shake.

This place has affordable prices for wonderful authentic Vietnamese food and you can't beat the service at this particular location.
author: upper d.

description:
Almost decent #1 pho.  It's like they fall short in every way and at the end of your meal you wish you ordered the medium bowl.  I do like their rice dishes and if PPQ across the street is busy, I'll come here for some rice, shrimp cake, egg cake, and grilled meat.

The eaters here are more hard-core than the PPQ crowd.

Pho Hoa Hiep gets two stars (from a base of three) because I'll come here only if PPQ is busy, and I don't order the pho.
author: Amanibhavam K.

description:
Worse Viet Place i have been tooo!!!
It smelled bad.. their fridge melted my cake.... slow service.... the store is not very welcoming... i have nothing else to say about this place

-x3 shells
author: Lily X.

description: I used to come here to eat Pho but than I realized it was better across the street.  Personally I think that the only thing that is worth it on the menu is probably the Pho.  The rice dishes in my opinion are not good at all and neither are any of the Vermicelli dishes.  The Pho is good but from my experience depending on when you go to eat you will get a better blend of soup.  Lastly the appetizers are pretty good especially the shrimp cake. If you want alright Pho and good appetizers go to this place if you want a rice or Vermicelli dish don't come here go across the street to PPQ
author: mea f.

description: Ill admit That I was horrified at the idea of eating tendon and tripe soup but my friend assured me this place had something for everyone and he was right. I love the very humble and simple thin beef pho, its is beyond delicious. A little Asian pepper sauce only enhances the amazing broth. I eat here a few times a week, you'll love it!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
My faves:

1. Shrimpcakes
2. BBG Chicken over rice
3. Chicken noodle soup

YUM..YUM!!!!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Ah. To put it simply, I just love this place. Atmosphere here is quite refreshing. Shaved ice machine, skylights. So I just recently came here with my friends for food. I ordered the shredded pork and grilled pork chop rice, because I wasn't in a mood for pho. It came and it was delicious. The shredded pork wasn't what I expected but it sure it taste good. The lady back there always making drinks was cool. It was fun sitting there and watching her juggle between making drinks. They sure do need a second blender! Haha. Good stuff. Good stuff. 

P.S. It always seems like there's a line for the bathroom.
author: Danielle Y.

description:
The only positive thing to this place is the pricing. 

I had the fried rolls and the number 17 (noodle soup w rare steak). 

The rolls tasted like poorly made egg rolls. The amount of pork was infimitesimable. The fish sauce was nearly water and hadn't the slightest sign of spicy in it. You could only order 4 at a time which isn't uncommon, but normally you get with that several lettuce leaves, some noodles and cucumber julienned. Instead it came with a quarter leaf of lettuce and a couple slices of cucumber. The price was decent for 4 rolls at 5.25.

The soup was also 5.25 (for the small). The noodles were good and the broth was also good. It was served with basil that had the largest leaves id ever seen with basil. The soup would have been pretty good except the meat ruined it. The rare beef, which I always order on the side so that it doesn't get overcooked, was twice as thick as it should have been.

Keep looking, across the street is much better pho. 

Come here if you have a hankering for pho and can't spend more than 6 bucks.
author: H B.

description: the first time I ate here, I was in pho heaven... It was so tasty..I had the beef pho and it encompassed precisely how Pho should taste. I am not vietnamese actually far from that, I am Argentinian... but I have a pho addiction..I eat it more often then anyone probably should. Anyway so it was good the first time so I decided to go back.. and well my experience was interesting.. I had to use the rest room so I attempted at doing so but apparently the cleaning lady wasw in there and coincidentally didnt hear me knocking loudly but heard the waiter who I had to grab in order to try to get into this mysterious bathroom.. by the time I got to my table my pho was already there and getting kinda cold...so I went in for the kill and it was good but a little bettr the first time..
author: Mariangeles C.

description:
Really  fast, really cheap, huge portions, and yummy tapioca drinks. What more could you ask for?  

Perfect for eating out with friends when everybody's broke.
author: Joe S.

description:
The Good:
The #1 - Pretty much the only thing I order cuz it's so good.  Broth is nice and salty, which transfers nicely to the noodles.  Sometimes the texture of the noodles could be softer, but sometimes it's just right.  You can ask for the rare beef on the side if you want it cooked in the soup to your liking.
Price - great prices, comparable to any cheap eats

The Decent:
Service - They are fast.  Not so friendly, but it doesn't bother me as long as I get my food quick.

The Bad:
?
author: Derk C.

description: Their pho is bigger than the place across the street. Beef stew is good always go here because of the noodles. Tasty too
author: Darren C.

description: Yummy! I ordered the pho with all of the seafood, medium size. Usually, I can barely finish a small anywhere but I almost finished this one cuz it was so yummy! Anyway, came here after Outside Lands 09 - Day 3 which was freezing so this was an awesome choice. It was also a place that our friend recommended which means something seeing that there are so many choices in the area. Had to wait for a few minutes for a table but one we sat down, we got our food pretty fast. Prices were good too.
author: Janice F.

description: Just moved to the city and I was craving for some pho. I went to 3 other Pho locations around the city and boy was i disappointed. However, this has solid soup and decent amount of pho. My favorite pho place in SF at the moment.
author: Tina T.

description: Picked up pho from here by accident, I usually order from PPQ across the street but they were closed so I ordered from this place. The place was empty when I got there and they had my togo order ready, when I got home I mixed my ingredients like a mad scientist and went to town on my bowl. Honestly this was nothing special, the broth was bland and the noodles tasted like cup-o-noodle, maybe I caught an off day or something, but im sticking with my PPQ.
author: Sergey A.

description: If you're in a hurry, this is the place. I can order and get my food in under 2 minutes and they never mess up my order, I like my raw beef on the side. When you order the large bowl, you get the large bowl, unlike alot of places, they just give you a bigger bowl with the same amount as the regular order. Have never tried anything else but the Pho, even if it's the only thing that's good, that's just fine with me.
author: Michael C.

description: I ate here last night, the restaurant was packed, but the service was still good.  I got the shrimp and chicken bun, number 55 I think.  It was very good and it tasted fresh.  They were kind of skimpy on the portion though, which isn't usual for this type of place, which usually gives you too much food.  Overall, it was pleasant.
author: Rachelle P.

description: Besides speed in bringing the food, there is nothing special about Kevin's Noodle House.  I ordered #22B large, chicken and shrimp pho.  I noticed right away that the soup seemed to be missing a key ingredient that I'm used to.  Perhaps MSG?  Lol...no it just wasn't as tasty.  Also the chicken had that "a day too old" taste--clearly it wasn't super fresh.  Furthermore, although the shrimp were tasty and big, I thought they could have given more than three shrimp!  With all the choices on Irving it'll take some more quality to win me over.
author: Christopher W.

description: what's the perfect remedy after a long, night out or a cold, gloomy day? well, pho of course! i've only had their pho and imperial rolls which are both good.. but not great (now, i prefer ppq across the st.. whenever that place is too busy and i dont want to wait then this place is a good runner up). the food comes out quick and the pho is flavorful but if you want some water in addition to your tea you have to ask several times for them to remember to bring it over.. other than that small detail this place is a good pho place to check out.. so make sure you do!
author: Raquel T.

description: this the place if you looking for pho in san francisco... always order me a no.1 or no.32... for some reason i like this one over the one in daly city... love the meat and noodle, always full... soup is the main ingredient make the pho taste good....
author: JessePanda C.

description:
*drools*  that's all I gotta say!!!  

food is fantastic..cheap, good, FAST and extremely filling....

My friend Jorge and I go there at least once a week - its our hang out place whenever he comes to the neighborhood, not to mention the two really adorable and cute guys who are the waiters most of the time (I think they're relatives if not brothers).  I get the TAI (rice noodles with thinly sliced steak) and my friend gets rice noodles with chicken - he forgot the name but it's the first one on the chicken menu...and i must say that ti's always a pleasure to go there.  So if you're ever in the neighborhood, do try Kevin's Noodle house. it's really good - i sometimes leave a note on their credit card receipts telling them the food is good.  Oh by the way, unlike many Phos, this place does NOT smell bad...
author: Me V.

description: the food here is not too bad, the food comes by pretty quickly after you place the order. it's funny because there is always one thing that makes kevins stand out for me, and it's the pushy little asian man that takes your orders... theres one at the irving location and one at the daly city location. but other than that, the food not too bad.. the smoothies are decent. i'd go there if i had a craving for some pho and want to get rush to order by that old guy =)
author: Jeff C.

description: After going back to Kevin's Noodle House for the second time, I really have to take away 2 more stars. I asked for the chicken and shrimp pho. The broth was fine, so were the noodles, but the shrimp was borderline unedeble. They tasted so fishy if you closed your eyes, you could not tell it was shrimp besides the texture. And the chicken- oh God! Good chicken is mellow, not flavorless, but mellow. What they gave me was the most gamy tasting chicken I have ever had. When you ask for chicken, they give you chicken- not all meat either. The intensity of the gamminess was not like anything I have ever had. I have been to my fair share of Asian restaurants and have had some gamy chicken, but this literally lingered in my mouth 10 minutes after I ate it.
author: David D.

description: Hands down, best pho I've ever had.  Never ordered anything else.  Theres something about this place.  We joke that the must put crack in it.
author: Maureen K.

description:
pho.....ck it, ill review this place. i used to come here alot as a kid. whats better than a couple of reds, and a bowl of pho after a long day of cutting class? smoking some weed right before, but i digress. 

pho hoa hiep is one of the better pho joints in the city. most other places use stock, generic, ehhh, noodles. im not sure if they are in house or what, but the noodles here are different. they have a bit of bite to them. slightly chewy is the best explanation... al dente. the chicken broth noodles are pretty damn good also. not your typical out of the can shit, but rather a clean, smooth chicken broth, made in house. did i mention i like the noodles here. some damn good noodles.

i like the option of different sizes. i like the variety of phos, chicken broth noodles you can get. the rice plates aint too shabby niether. \

you worried about it being clean? what the pho man, do what the natives do. always wipe the utensils. shit, my moms, everytime wes go to a pho shop, she wipes down the table with some hot tea and napkins.
author: Euge L.

description:
So we were suppose to go to this French restaurant in the city for New Year's eve, but we ended up here instead. My hubbie was under the weather and I also wasn't feeling good. I suggested cancelling our dinner plans and go for some hot pho to kill all the virus that was inhabiting our bodies. I Yelped of course and found several places on Irving. What the heck, lets just drive there and park. That is what we did. No problem finding parking. Went into Tuttimelon and asked the lady there what she recommended in Pho places here. She said the PPQ down the street. So we went all the way down the street and saw the restaurant. Long story short, since we were on the right side of the street and PPQ was across the street, we decided to go to Kevin's Pho  directly in front of us. Why waste more energy to cross?
We were seated immediately. I ordered the pork chop, egg roll, 2 fried chicken wings, over rice. My hubbie had the combo small noodle. Everything was very good. I finished mine and well he couldn't finish his to my surprise. Definitely be back again. $15 for both of us. Not bad for New Year's Eve!
author: Mauling W.

description:
sad to say, i never EVER thought i would EVER have to eat pho alone.. but today, i have... like a loner and a half.

okee.. make sure to chk out my pastry review after this one...

can i say "holy cow! it was fuh reezing tooooooday!" came in here right after my interview at ucsf medical center (ooh, i hope i get the j-o-b!)this morning... u kno how it is, u cold? u want something soupy... it's not that difficult to be a 5 stars in my book ... 

loses .5 stars because the bathroom was quite nastay... i don't expect some ritz carlton or anythin but ack... got some graffiti going on there and man, it stinks. sure, all toilets stink but ack. sharing a bathroom with the opposite sex, ick!

loses another .5 stars because they were so cheap on their MEDIUM SIZE NOODLES. i swear, i took 3 bites and i was DONE with my pho... =( either i was super hungry or they were being so cheap

loses another star because i ordered me egg rolls & pho tai = $10.41.
it's the egg rolls that really got me.. is it just today or is it normally like this? i haven't seen any egg rolls to be the point of being soo oily... peek fotos ... and they lack all the veggies too.. where's the plush lettuce to wrap your eggs rolls in? aww man, it makes me miss LA's pho...=(

but i have to give it kudos how they have so many diff sizes... if you're really not that hungry, you can get a kiddie size for only $3 and it's not restricted to kids...

$4.95 regular
$5.25 medium
$6.25 extra large and man, was that HUGE!!! 

plenty of meter throughout.
author: Jennifer S.

description: I love this place...simple and delicious. The price is right too! Their vermicelli is perfect and I love how quick they are!
author: Tricia M.

description: I came here today around 5:30pm and found mulitiple parking spots right in front. Me and my friend ordered the crunchy egg rolls and the #1. The egg rolls werent very tasty and they were VERY greasy, wasnt that good to me. The soup we ordered was delicious, they gave us plenty of beansprouts and mint leaves. It was the best meal of all. Not bad for a first time, I like to eat the crunchy egg rolls from the other pho restaurant across the street. Much tastier than this one.
author: Claudia M.

description: eh.. went back here while I wasn't sick and didn't realize all the weird stuff going on around me.  Umm this place is pretty dirty, haha and I guess I didn't realize that when I reviewed this place since I was intoxicated off of NYQUIL.  So my bad peeps.  Pretty dirty here. The one in daly city might be 10% cleaner.
author: Jen A.

description:
Just got done eating here and I am feeling the good pho feeling... no MSG hangover like many SF joints give me.  If you are looking for good pho and can't make the trip to San Jose (East Side represent!), skip the phake pho places around town and come here.  It is the closest thing to decent San Jose-style pho you are going to find in the city.  They understand the secret that other SF places do not seem to grasp = GOOD BROTH.  Despite the heavier than usual layer of oil at the top, this broth still comes out tasting light and flavorful with just the right amount of spice and meatiness.  Service is super quick and efficient and the noodles are of a good texture and suitable quantity, plentiful and not stuck together in a clump at the bottom, but flowing freely about in your bowl with some friendly hunks of green onion thrown in for good measure.  Minor oversight: the basil was wilty and served sopping wet, in need of a quick shaking off before being thrown onto the herb plate.  Other than that, nothing really to complain about here... pretty standard issue stuff with above average broth.  The Vietnamese iced cofee is STRONG and delicious.

It is indeed a wiser decision to come here for pho tai rather than PPQ across the street, though no one can outdo PPQ for their #8 curry chicken vermicelli soup...

3.75 Brothtastic hot cocks (rounded up to 4 for SF-curved ratings)
author: Molasses C.

description: REALLY good pho. I LOVE pho and have tried most places in San Francisco. This is one of the best pho places in the city if you like your broth really flavorful and not too salty/meaty. Their Large pho is HUGE!! So order a medium unless you are prepared to walk out with a pregnant belly.
author: Janie Y.

description: 3.5 stars.  This was my 1st decent bowl in the city after a slew of bad recommendations, mainly from people who pronounce pho as "foe".  wrong.  the broth was hearty enough, though just a tad on the sweet side.  the noodles were perfect as was the amount of beef.  the summer rolls and water came well after i'd dug into my bowl, that part of the experience was inexplicable but until i find something better this spot's the junks.  see you there on hangover days!
author: beltrand a.

description: I give this place 4 stars because the food is consistent in taste whether its the pho or the rice plates. ANd it comes out quick.  The pho soup is nice and hot so it cooks your bean sprouts and remains warm. They dont get 5 stars because sometimes i feel rushed when i bring a new person to eat with me, and they havent seen the menu before and the old dood tries to take the order. I understand that they need to have quick turnover but thats the only thing that makes it unpleasant here. But all in all I will always go here if im in the neighborhood.
author: DOM d.

description: i used to love this place. been going there my whole life, literally.. since my brothers were born ! thats about... 8-9 years ? its either im getting pickier, or this place is really going downhill. I always order number 16 or 42 ! 16=beef noodle soup+steak+tripe. YUM! and 42=pork chop+shrimp cake over rice with a salad and soup on the side only if you eat it there. and any of the chicken noodle soup and egg noodles are darn good. The people there also remember me well. Ive stopped going about a year ago, when i found something "raw" in my noodle soup. I KNOW sounds typical when all the meat they give is supposed to be raw.. but no... this was raw.. after i finished my noodles.. it looked like some kind of organ that was still bloody ! it was under alll that soup... i found it all bloody after i finished my noodles&was drinking my soup... GROSSSSSSS !! :[
author: Wendy X.

description: The owners here have somehow gotten the art of making pho down to an exact science because (1) it's always good and (2) it's always consistent (same flavors, balance of soup to noodles, etc.). I'm a fan of the pho and mi bo kho, but lately I've been ordering the combo rice plate #41 because the fried chicken is amazing! Oddly, you can only order it in the combo or as a side dish, but I could easily polish off a plate of nothing but the fried chicken and rice. The imperial roll and grilled pork served with the chicken becomes merely a side dish.
author: Sara Y.

description: This is the #1 spot where I like to get pho. Not rice plates or vermicelli bowls, but just PHO! it's quick and cheap...seriously, I usually get my pho in less than 5 min. I'm in and out within 30min. I always get the beef ball, tripe and rare steak on the side. I havent eaten much of their rice dishes, but if I were to do that, I'd opt for Yummy Yummy. I've been comming here for 10 years now, the decor has changed for the better....the staff is still very efficient.....I just wished they had music sometimes.
author: annie w.

description: I went here with my lil urban pinay friend who could never remember what it was called so she always called it Pho Hip Hop, I guess that works. This is a reliable spot for reasonably priced and a non-westernized menu that isn't afraid of tripe or tendon, for goodness sakes peoples, it's cow parts, relax.
author: Amber L.

description:
#29 small thanks.
i came here 3 times last week. i think im pho'ed out for now. 
they take credit card which is the main reason i come here.

i used to be a ppq-er, but they've raised their prices and the cashier people there are snobby.

this place is the same everytime, the old man comes and takes your order. the old lady comes with your tea. if you ask for water they'll never bring it. the young guy with the white t shirt brings you your bill. 

i always feel like my noodles are really short are choppy like someone bit them already and they are reused, but im sure im just insane (i hope).

anyways i love pph now.
author: just k.

description: I have been here several times and have only ever ordered #54, it is the vermicelli with BBQ pork, shrimp, and carrots.  It is SO good, I don't know what the sauce is, but it just makes the whole thing awesome.
author: Kristin M.

description: One of the best pho in town.  I order this every time I go there.  It's all about the broth..it's perfect!!  It's alway fresh and delicious.
author: hello k.

description: We looked on Yelp for a local Vietnamese restaurant and found this. It was exceptional. The food was delicious, and came out in unbeliviable time. The waiters were attentive, PLUS the bathroom was clean! My dad's mouth was numb from the dentist, and the phó was simply perfect. And the bill was even under $40.00, for a group of FIVE! I have no more to add.
author: Rafael S.

description: haven't went here in a long time but when i came with my friends their dishes was ok. mines on the other hand wasn't so great. if i remember correctly i ordered a $4 or 5 the beef was really chewy and hard to bite apart. ended up not eating all my meat portion but eat all my noodles and i was hungry too, so disappointed.
author: David M.

description: I think this place is really good... I'm not a Vietnamese food expert, but I think you get the most bang out of your buck here than out of all the pho places I've ever been to.  They serve HUGE bowls of soup for around $6.  The beef is really good but so is the chicken soup.  The chicken is a little chewy but it doesnt really bother me that much.  They also got some good drinks made from fresh fruit there.  They also serve everything really quickly.  Plus.. they let me place a to go order the other night after their closing hours.
author: Ray S.

description:
When you have a love for something, and you've tasted how good it CAN be, it becomes the standard.  And everything else will be compared and judged according to it.  That's how I am with Pho.  Pho is definitely a meal that I crave consistently and recurrently.  And so far, I haven't found any Pho broth that satisfies me as completely as Tay Giang's.

On a cold and rainy evening, my husband and I decided to try a new Pho restaurant.  Based on the Yelp reviews, we decided to venture our palate at Kevin's Noodle House, with much anticipation.  The place was clean, bright and spacious.  And the service was fast as many mentioned.  As usual, we ordered our Vietnamese egg rolls to start off the meal, followed by a Pork rice plate for my husband and a Beef Pho for me.  
I will admit that this place delivers a good tasting Pho broth.  In fact, it probably features second on my list of "Pho".  The portion was generous for the price.  If I were to rate the Pho alone, I will probably give this place a "4 stars".  However, where it lost a star was on the Egg rolls, and the quality of the ingredients as presented on the appetizer and the rice plate.  The rolls didn't taste authentic Vietnamese at all- more like "Fast food style egg rolls" with meager bits of carrots, cucumbers for garnish.  My husband's rice plate tasted good, but again it looked "Fast foodish."  

That is why Tay Giang's still stands strong on my list of favorite Pho restaurant in the city.  Certainly the items on the menu may cost one to two dollars more, but the taste and authenticity are worth it.
author: Nadine M.

description:
surprised the food was actually ok
went a year ago and did not like the place
but went again a few weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised
had the beef vermicelli with the spring rolls. i like the thinner noodles and they used the fat ones but whatever
i like the meat lean and it was
tried some of my bf's beef pho it was pretty good
we go here because it's within walking distance 
and it's cheaper than the place across the street, where ppl don't really speak or understand english. also seems cleaner and much more spacious.
author: Candy Y.

description:
PHO THE AVERAGE

This place is seriously hella busy. The location is ridiculous, but worth it for the pho. Great remedy for hang overs! Their broth is flavorful and portions are usually generous, but not consistent so be smart and just get a medium/large. I usually order the raw thin sliced beef and tripe. I get extra meatballs added in! 
Their bun thit nuong is average. Nothing special about it. Definitely doesn't have a wow factor for me because the flavors are really ordinary in the marination of meat. Its not the best here, but its a good alternative if you're looking for a healthy dish. Theres a lot of veggies! =) Its pretty much a vermacelli noodles on top of a salad topped of with bbq shrimp and bbq pork. Ok, it was a little exaggerated with the salad thing but there are quite a bit of veggies!

As for service, its typical asian service. "What yooh want?" Make sure you ask for water with your order, otherwise it might take awhile before you can waive someone down. Although you don't get attentative service as American restaurants, your food comes out pretty fast. So no worries if you're hungry.

Downside: Drinks. They need a lot of work on their drinks. Their shakes aren't that great. I ordered an avacado shake once and it came out really powdery(Rating: below avg). The 3 other drink orders at our tables came out the same. I also have had their fresh young coconut, which contains more ice than juice or coconut meat(Rating:barely avg). I also have had their fresh lemonade. No restaurant can can ever mess up a lemonade. This lemonade tastes home made, so nothing out of the ordinary (Rating: average). Their plum salted lemonade is ok(Rating: below average).


Would I return: Yes
author: Food Critic C.

description: I'm no pho connoisseur but Kevin's turns out some tastiness... Cheap, fast, delicious, and Buckethead named an album after this place so you know it's gotta be pretty good: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin's_Noodle_House
author: Brian H.

description: I go there with three sorority sisters all the time!!! love eating their rice plate with pork chop!! and it comes with soup... last time they charge us less.. three people and it costs us eight bucks... we are honest .. so we told them that they made an mistake.... man! we could juss spend eight bucks for dinner!!
author: Lily T.

description: I just ate there today and I think they are now going by Pho Huynh Hiep #2 or something like that.  In any case, I definitely prefer this place to PPQ across the street.  It seems roomier and they make a solid #1 (a.k.a the really big bowl with everything in it).  I'm pretty basic when it comes to my pho likings, so I almost always get the #1.  I do also like their spring rolls.  Delicious.
author: Kenton W.

description: Came here 12/1/09, their pineapple tapioca drink made my throat itch because it was most likely expired. Never getting those drinks here again.
author: Keit K.

description: I really like this restaurant for a variety of reasons.  The food is always good, the prices are low and the service is outstanding.  I've tried most of the pho dishes on the menu, and I've enjoyed them all.  There are some really nice combinations combining four meats with your choice of rice noodles or egg noodles.  The broth is usually clear and tasty with no hint of MSG, and the ingredients are fresh.  I prefer the thin egg noodles because no matter how long I let them sit in the broth, the noodles stay fairly firm and chewy.  I like the fact that most of the pho dishes come in three sizes (small, medium, x-large) because sometimes a medium bowl just isn't enough.  The chicken meat on some of the combinations is sometimes a bit tough to chew, but that's probably the ONLY negative thing I can think of to say about this restaurant.  I like the beef stew and any of the combinations with shrimp, fish cake and ground pork.   Your food arrives no more than five minutes after you've order; it's piping hot and it's good!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
best pho in the outer sunset for sure.
the smoothy drinks get 4 stars!
try avocado with tapioca pearls.
awesome.
author: william m.

description: So far, P.H.H. is leading the pack in phofest 2005. Bonuses include nice staff (a rarity at low end restaurants) and an excellent #26. I sampled the classic #1 pho with white(rice) noodles and all things cow, however, but I'm glad I went with #26, yellow (egg)noodles, shrimp, ground pork, pork, chicken, and fish cake. Ground pork is a great addition to the soup, the broth was flavorful and not msg-laden, noodles not too mushy, and the meats were of decent quality. I would stick to the yellow noodles or other dishes here, b/c the classic pho broth was a little heavy on star anise or some other flavor for my tastes. The fresh oj was also served in a slushy-like form with crushed ice and a bubble tea straw.  Now if they could just stay open later and serve the oj sans ice...however, a very solid contender who will remain in my rotation.
author: Candice L.

description:
I love you Pho. My bestfriend in the world. I can never get enough of you. I can to see you day in and day out. You're my third boyfriend next to my real boyfriend and trader joes. 
---
My mom was the first person to take me to this place! WHY! because she used to work next door @ Lam's Dentist..blah blah blah. 2. the owners son I think is my cousins friend. :D 3. my boyfriend loves pho. 4. I like pho on cold days when I'm shaking cold. I eat here every month, theres not one month we I haven't. I either get it to-go to eat in class or there with my lovely kind boyfriend. I keep forgetting to yelp this place. This is the place to run into old friends, and old buddies of yours that like pho. Or the reunion of old friends. Or the meeting of hot friends. :] Don't eat there on a date if you're cheating on your boyfriend, you'll most def be seen. All the money I earn from work comes towards them and forever. It fulls my tummy like the fatlard I am. yes yes yes, all day everyday I'ma fatlard and I'm proud of it son! :D
author: Carolyn Y.

description: My friends and i use to frequent this place at least twice a week!  That was 5 years ago.  We had some issues with cleanliness and flies.  I remember one of the waiters have this black fingernail that always dip into the broth when he serves it to you.. we had this rule of turning our heads when the pho is being served so we don't see it.  they always seem to have sewer problems right outside their restaurants too.  that being said.. we enjoyed it while it lasted but was too grossed out in the end.  we end up going to ppq across the street..
author: Brendan A.

description: Pho is good but the broth was better in Daly City. I'm not much of a pho person so I'll typically order their BBQ Chicken or BBQ Pork Chop. Their imperial rolls are on the greasy side.
author: Armstrong B.

description: Had lunch here sunday.  My sister prefers the broth here and we were able to live without our raw beef from PPQ across the street.  4 phos and an ice coffee for $28..not bad at all.  I love the fact that they have a kids menu here.  Sometimes I just really don't feel like sharing with my son.  I ordered the #3 with clear noodles.  It must have been a while since I had clear noodles....I ate the whole time.  I had to minus one star because I wanted something with tofu and veggies but they didn't have anything close to that on their menu.  Otherwise tasty broth and clear noodles.  Love it.
author: Allison T.

description:
oh kevin, i don't know who you are, but boy do i give you a lot of business.

my main go-to pho place. i love the simple pho menu. they have specials but they also have the plain with many options. i like the plain. with different meats and tendons and tripes. you pick. 

nice and big inside. you have a lot of breathing room, not cramped like most sunset restaurants. the thai bubble tea had too much ice. i dont like sucking up shave ice. ew. crunch crunch.

fried spring rolls are yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmy. yup that good. 
get it get it. my friend gets vermicelli all the time. i never did however. but they must be good since she gets it all the time. also had the boneless pork rice plate for takeout. that is good too. maybe a bit too much money though. 

i'm going to try not going here so much, and try others. but still good no matter what.
author: Liz R.

description: i had the beef stew with hofun noodles. HUGE bowl for $4.95. it was everything i wanted: hot, beefy and soupy. i can't imagine ordering anything bigger, but it comes in two larger sizes and i think they have a separate menu for kids or people with tiny tummies. spring rolls are good, too, but i've never really had a bad one. it's cheap, tasty, popular and CLEAN  which is more than i can say for a lot of nearby eateries.
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: This is actually the #2 of the Pho Hoa Hiep restaurants. #1 in the booneys of Oakland is the best still. Fast, friendly service and the Pho always tastes like .. ehh. p h o. .. The staff is nice to talk to and a fun bunch..
author: Wilson L.

description:
I guess I'm spoiled by the Pho in SJ and the TL.  I even like PPQ better than this place.

I had the #2 and could not identify most of the ingredients.

I ordered my kids the chicken with egg noodles.  I found pork in it.

This was my 2nd time--they accommodate groups much easier than PPQ.

On another occasion, I thought I had some reaction to MSG.  With that in mind, I really didn't want to finish the broth hoping to avoid any side effects.
author: benwa h.

description: Good pho.  I like how this place gives you size options for the pho (which means you have a choice in how much you can spend too), in cases when I just want a small bowl and not some ginormous XL one that is customary in other places (e.g. Yummy Yummy).  The rice plates are delicious... try the one with the shrimp cake and barbecue chicken... mmmm.  This place also has lower prices in contrast to Y2, which is a great plus
author: Grace M.

description:
i used to go here quite a bit when i lived in the outer sunset back in the day...
the old man is mellow and friendly...
their noodles are tasty 
mmmm vermicelli noodles with bbq pork and shrimp :D
author: charlotte s.

description: Amazingly enough, I've only eaten here for the first time the other day. I've always eaten Pho from across the street at PPQ. The soup had plenty of flavor. It had a more onion taste to it but it's not bad at all. When you order a medium bowl it looks like a large, so you can imagine what the large looks like. The only thing that bothered me was that they skimped out on the basil and sprouts but they gave us more after we asked.
author: Bert T.

description: Fairly standard Pho but minus points because PPQ across the street is the better choice. The broth was ok but nothing special, which is not good enough in a city with so many pho places. Other locations of this chain seem to have better pho as well.
author: Sven S.

description: Learning to love pho for breakfast has been an easy lesson to swallow (http://instantrimshot.com) thanks to Pho Huynh Hiep 2 - Kevin's Noodle House. I usually order a small bowl of pho with thin slices of steak (#17 - Pho Tai), which I have delivered "on the side" so that I can place the slices of meat into the hot broth to better cook them to my specifications. The waitstaff are very accommodating of this request. Also, it was here that I first tried Vietnamese iced coffee w/ condensed milk (#57 - Cafe Sua Da), which has recently replaced the white mocha as my favorite coffee beverage. But be warned that this magical elixir will only inspire intense pleasure in the taste buds of those seeking a simultaneously very rich and sweet brew. For all of these reasons and generally attentive service, I highly recommend Pho Huynh Hiep 2 - Kevin's Noodle House.
author: Ben D.

description:
important: NO VEGETARIAN OPTIONS.

aside from that, pho was good, although i wish the meatless (well aside from the chicken broth) pho came with vegetables or...just anything in addition to the noodles. 

we came a little after lunch, it wasn't too busy. the service was very attentive...there was the oddest smell in the restaurant though, only when i had gotten my fill of sriracha doused pho did it go away...
author: Rebecca M.

description: Kevin's hooks it up for cheap. I can mosey in and get a small chicken pho and still have leftovers for tomorrow for about $5. So tasty, close to my house and cheap. What more can a girl ask for? Oh, right. They have AWESOME boba!
author: Stephanie W.

description: So this restaurant has another location in Daly City. We go to both often. I like the one in Irving St. for being clean. But is hard to get a parking in weekend. So, we go to the Daly City one, which is always pack in the weekend. But the turn around time and get you seated is amazing fast. I will vote for the best management system. Fish cake and their must variety smoothie is MUST.
author: Nancy T.

description: I have been coming here since I was in high school, and despite having tried many other places, this is my fallback for when I have a craving for pho.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Delicious. Really good pho. The shredded beef was good too. Clean. Decent service.
author: Amanda R.

description: Got a meat vermicelli dish (don't remember if I got beef or pork) and a iced vietnamese coffee and it was pretty damn good. The meat quality was average to slightly better than average. The overall dish, soup, coffee, etc. were all better than average. Of note, my meal was pretty big, made me very full, and was relatively inexpensive. This is certainly a low-key but legit Vietnamese joint that I'd recommend.
author: A I.

description:
pho on a nice rainy cold day is the best.  this place being the one of my favorite place in the city is a plus also.

when ever the family is in the city, this will be their kick it spot for food.   before/after doctors appts, airport pickups, or class, this is were they go. 

and i always get pho tai sach, but can you say msg.  i always leave feeling tired=/ cheap and good
author: Hong T.

description: Hands down, the best pho joint in the city.  Affectionately known as  "Hip-Hops", I eat here AT LEAST once a week.  Not into beef broth?  The chicken broth noodle dishes are also really good.  I swear, the soups have healing powers.  Also go for the shrimp cakes, fresh spring rolls, fried chicken, and the honeydew tapioca drinks.  Clean, well lit, spacious, fast and friendly service.  What more could you want from a Vietnamese restaurant?
author: Tommy O.

description: The pho here is consistently good. Just please please PLEASE do not stick your thumb in my soup when placing it on my table. And if you must, please cut that dark nail because I don't know what lurks underneath. I know that the bowls of pho are heavy and business is bangin', but maybe try carrying out 2 bowls at a time instead of 3 + condiments?
author: Nancie T.

description: Sunset District, San Francisco in July...it doesn't get colder or foggier than that.  After a hard day's work on the sunny Peninsula, coming back to the chilly SF feels good, especially when one craves a nice hot bowl of pho.  And this place has the best pho in town.  Ask for cilantro with your basil, lime and jalapenos...After your pho, walk out into the swirling fog, your belly full and your breath coming out warm and herb scented, and thank God you live in SF, where you don't have one restaurant in town that serves "Asian" food.
author: A S.

description: This is my favorite pho place, I love the flavor of the broth. I did not taste any MSG. Most importantly, the service is quick and efficient. No BS process - just sit, order, eat, pay, then leave!
author: Wine L.

description: I come to this location rarely because parking on irving sucks ass especially with all those damn meters! Anyway the pho and rice plates are good and the service is fast too..yay! I LOVE PHO!
author: Heather C.

description:
What the Pho!!! 
love the broth consistency of the broth is good, fast service, and cheap what else can you ask for
author: otter e.

description: Came back here recently, and in retrospect I don't think this place is THAT amazing.  The pho wasn't as delicious as I remembered it to be- I think I was just extremely overjoyed at finding a decent pho place in the city.
author: Jennie L.

description: Dude, you want some PHO?!  Yum Yum Yum!  Gobble Gobble Gobble!  I love Pho and this family run business has it down!  The food is great and fast.  The service is decent, but what do you expect with one guy taking care of the whole restaurant.  He's a badass mofo!  I love coming here.  Doooo maaaa!  Yall Vietnamese people know what that means!  But not you Yelp regulators!  puuuuhahaha!  *evil grin*
author: Manton R.

description: I like this place a lot! It's a very typical vietnamese pho place- big on the portions, and good on the wallet. The pho always comes out piping hot and fresh, and the quality of the meat is always great. The bun vermicilli is delicious, with perfectly grilled meat and crisp veggies to top. I usually get it with beef and an order of the the egg rolls (pretty standard). You can always expect this place to be under $10 a person, or under $15 a person with appetizer.
author: Carmen L.

description: standard vietnamese noodle restaurant, but the good thing about this place is that their waiter/waitresses can speak english.  That's awesome and they are actually nicer than any other pho places.  Love 'em!!!
author: Albert W.

description: This is probably the best pho place I've ever been to. Also coincidencely whenever I go here, it's always a good day for me. Me and my best friends always come here to hang and eat and theres also a Walgreens near by so you can buy whatever you need for school or if you're just craving for candy it's kinda just a couple steps away. I don't really choose anything else but the special but the special is hellllla good! Eggrolls are pretty good too but eggrolls are not my thing. Tapioca drinks and other beverages is always fresh made and delicious(: Maybe you'll see some of your friends eating there too cause I know I always see some people I know eating there!
author: Didi L.

description: Love the Pho here. I think it's the best in the city!  If my friend hadn't introduced me to the Pho restaurant  in Sunnyvale, I'd give Pho Hao Hiep 5 stars.  Anyway, I usually order the steak flank and beef balls with beef noodle soup.  Their rice dishes are very good as well.
author: Lily T.

description: I love this place. The service is super fast. The food is great. Sometimes I have a bit of a problem because of how packed it can get, but otherwise a 5-stars-worth restaurant all around.
author: Henry P.

description: I can't say a lot about it, I haven't been to this place in a few months. It's not that I don't like their food, it's very good. I'm just not fond of Irving, since it's a mind boggling place. Anyway, their waiters are nice. There's an old man who always talks to my Cantonese friends, I don't know what exactly they're yaking but they seem to lead interesting conversations. The pho is tasty, but not the best. It's an odd joint, very clean, very well lit, but.. just strange. It's not a cozy, nice restaurant you'd take your friends to in order to spend a nice evening over food and a conversation. It reminds me of a Vietnamese version of McDonald's, judging by the place's pace.
author: Roger W.

description: I got a small #9 pho....brisket, steak, etc... yum!! This is my new favorite pho place in sf, and it's SUPER fast! Theres not much more to say... you just gotta try it. And yeah, it is funny how everyone has their own little ritual about how they prepare and eat their pho....my favorite thing to add is the lime and basil...
author: Kelley N.

description:
Do yourself a favor and go to Loi's restaurant across the street and two blocks down. The food there is far better. 

If nothing else the clientele is a dead give away. It seems like the average age of a customer at Pho Hoa Hiep is about 20, and many of the late night diners look to be in their early teens. 

but in all fairness the restaurant is fairy clean and well lit. There is ample space between tables, very user friendly for the disabled. (And the food is cheap)
author: neal j.
