description: Thank you for curing my weekly hangovers.  Its nice to roll out of bed post drunk at 2pm and walk 2 blocks down the street.  Even though I hate pho I always find some kind of dirty meat to eat.  The damn manatee keeps rubbing my boobs right now.  Manatees are annoying.
author: Fatty A.

description: I come here every so often but I always enjoy the pho and vermicelli I get there.  The food is delicious and the service is fast, which is a plus!  Great for a cold evening in SF.  I just wish it was a little quieter there.  otherwise, great!
author: Agnes L.

description: Standard pho place - soup base is pretty good.  This is one of the few places that serves my fav combo of rare steak and well-done brisket, but the beef was a tad on the chewy side (even the brisket, which should be more tender).
author: Ana L.

description: I got the some chicken pho and it was alright. Nothing spectacular. Got some friend rolls too. Seemed too pre-made if that makes sense. Got a seafood pho to go and that was pretty good. But 2 stars means "meh, I've experienced better" and I have at Pho Clement, Pho Garden, and Yummy Yummy. Sorry Kevin. Play some music too. They place is too quiet and awkward.
author: S D.

description: This is my pho place for now.  It's the closest, tastiest place to my house in the other side of the GGP.  The soup is very flavorful and perfect.  I usually get the large #1 pho and the amount is very satisfying for only $7.  Their fried chicken wings is alright, same with egg rolls.  but i never really try the other things but i do see people enjoy the combo meals like porkchop and fried chicken wing or something.
author: Vincent K.

description: I would rate this place higher if they were more generous on their meat. But I must say, that their soup base is pretty darn good and tasty. I'll try more appetizers and drinks and review again. But I have been here many, many times for the Pho.
author: Elaine H.

description: This place is always the default go to place if PPQ is too crowded or closed. I like eating here because of the convenient location and the decent quality of the food.
author: Jj H.

description: I used to come here a lot because the service is quick and the food is good but now that I'm on the richmond side, I would go to their location on Clement/4th but they've changed into another pho restaurant.
author: kristin e.

description: I've always preferred PPQ over this but when the wait is too long and I'm starving, I gotta settle for this one. I mean, it's not bad but the vermicelli just doesn't do it for me like how PPQ does it. The Pho is decent and the prices are OK. I do get my food fast, and I mean fast.
author: Juliane N.

description: Good, solid pho.  It is right down the street in my new hood.  I have gotten pho here several times and it has been excellent.  Good ingredients and a great broth.  The people who run the place are incredibly nice and friendly.  This place is definitley one of my new staples.
author: Kate B.

description: Good food, but I like PPQ across the street better. Something about the Pho over there that's just delicious. I don 't like the atmosphere as much either. But, all in all, a bowl of noodle soup.
author: Scott M.

description:
this is my choice for vietnamese when i'm craving it and i'm always craving vietnamese.

the size of the bowls have changed over the years. yes, they got smaller and pricier. but i can't hate them for it. it's this ridiculous thing they call cost of living here in san francisco that's inflated things. anyway...

i always, almost always get the pho with rare steak, on the side please, with tripe. on a good day i can finish a medium. any other day, a regular bowl is just the right amount. but i always, always, always get the rare steak on the side squeeze a bit of lemon juice on it and cook it in the soup when i'm ready for a slice. and for the soup itself, i always add a handful of bean sprouts, basil leaves (to eat with the rare steak) and chile peppers. the peppers just add a bit more flavoring to the soup. unlike people who actually pour the hot sauce and oyster sauce into their soup, i like to dip. my sauce consists of 2 parts hot sauce to 1 part oyster sauce.

paired together with a 3 color drink and you got urself a wholesome meal.
author: Mei N.

description:
Terrible restaurant with mediocre NON-tradition Pho.  To PEOPLE WHO DON'T COOK or EVER grew up Eating PHO & OTHER Vietnamese dishes: Please DO NOT spend your hard earned dollars on this terrible excuse for a Vietnamese noodle house.

For starters, I came here on a QUIET night.  The staff was completely slow and Forgetful! There was a total of only 6 tables in the restaurants (wasn't even late night).  They mixed up our order and forgot water & vegetable condiments.

Secondly, There "Summer rolls", the ones with the shrimp wrapped in rice paper was completely a rip-off and overpriced for what you are getting! It was the NASTIEST I've ever eaten in my life.  They mislead me as the consumer and I should have demanded my money back!

All they put in it was: Shrimp, lettuce, rice vermicelli noodles, and a few semi/spoiled bean sprouts! That's it!!! According to the menu (and from personal experience making it at home), it's suppose have: pork, lemon basil, mint, & green onions! NONE of these were present! All that was included was CHEAP ingredients that pretty much only costs $4 dollars buying at the store and then making them at home, however, in return you're able to make 25-30 rolls instead!


The thing that makes me the angriest the most was the Beef Pho! Never have I ever been to a Viet restaurant that was SO CHEAP and STINGY!!! DON'T even consider it as PHO!!! ALL IT WAS: FLAT RICE NOODLES WITH SOME RANDOM BEEF CUTS TYPICALLY FOUND IN PHO AND WITH BOILED HOT WATER OVER IT! THAT IT!!! Oh and here's the PLUS side, instead of giving you a lot of noodles, they decided to "save" by slicing up more BEEF TRIPE than anything else for the dish.  Instead of picking up layers and layers of noodles, you're actually picking up "lots of thin layers of tripe MADE TO LOOK" like the noodles! Isn't that great? I'm an "adventurous eater" but come on! Why did they have to go so far and rip people off, even with the noodles? The noodles ONLY cost anywhere from .50 cents-.95 cents a pack (probably even cheaper).

That's right! even with all of the condiments on the table it still tasted bland and nasty.  As a cook, if you don't have the base of a dish started, all hope is lost for the entire dish! In other words, if you are so lazy to even "make" the beef broth for the dish, there's no point trying to "pass" off the dish as authentic, but of course this place did! 

NEED I say more? I really hate putting down Asian restaurants, but I swear! The Chinese, Thai, & Vietnamese restaurants in THIS town really play to their roles as the stereotypical STINGY, CHEAP, & DIRTY Asian establishments as they are!

Unlike the "average" resrauntraur, I been cooking ALL of my life and I rarely eat out, PLUS worked in restaurants when I was younger, I know what I'm talking about!

If I could give this place a ZERO STAR, I would! Please save your money and go else where folks!
author: NeverFoodFull F.

description: The service is usually not bad, the pho is alright. During the peak hours it's usually really busy and you end up being in a tight spot. If you eat here you are bound to see someone you know or know of. It's quite well-known.
author: Rebecca T.

description: This is my favorite place for pho--the service is good (I love the older guy who takes the orders) and the food is delish!  They have a gazillion combinations (which I think is a good sign of a real pho place) and the soup just hits the spot.  My dad says the best pho is in  the Tenderloin, but since that's not the most convenient location for me, it's been a long time since I've been there.  Anyway, I have no real gripes with this place--it's good comfort food, 'specially on those cold days.  I s'pose I  wish they were open later...oh, and I don't know what the big deal is about PPQ across the street.  I like this place better (at least for pho).
author: Joyce L.

description:
$5 gets you quite far at pho hoa hiep! heard of the place through word of mouth, and it's a good place to hit up when you dont know what you want to eat. stick to the regular sized bowls, unless you are crazy hungry. the rice plates look quite tasty, so if you dont feel like having soup, pick one and try it out. the menu is very extensive - so there should be something there that will tickle your fancy. this is the first pho place that takes card and doesnt require a minimum amount. how cool is that!?


i didnt give it 5 stars because the service lacked....lacked..service! had to flag down someone for water and sat for 10 min to order.
author: marlene m.

description: Well I had pho for the first time here a few days ago, so I can't really comment on the quality compared to other pho other than it was damn tasty.  One thing I do want to comment on is that, as of 11/06 the restaurant seemed to be quite clean and there were certainly no flies(shudder).  It was everything I had expected it to be after much pho research.  ;)
author: Vince G.

description: This isn't the best pho ever. But what gives this place some credit is that the food comes out practically right after you order it. No, it isn't some left overs. It's all made by order! But for the most part, it's your standard pho restaurant in San Francisco. Cheap eats!
author: Andrew W.

description:
mmm always my favorite restaurant for vietnamese.. i will go out of my way to get viet food here.. seriously 20 min drive? no problem haha.. 

i LOVE the vermicelli bowls and the rice plates (especially number 44).. and with their thai ice tea.. mmmMmm.. yummy
author: JUDY L.

description: Coming here is like going to a mcdonalds, It's not all that great, but it will have to do. I do enjoy it. but sometimes the pho noodles just feel like they havent even been cooked enough cause it tastes a bit how do you say..powdery? pasty? The service is extremely fast though, but dont get me wrong if you ask for a glass of ice water, it might not even get there until you're done with your food already. You can be in and out of this place probably like 30 minutes-40 tops..if you're there to chat then i guess 50 minutes..
author: Terry S.

description: Can't beat it!  This restaurant has the BEST pho!!!!  The price is reasonable and the soup is oh-so-good!  I usually order my Pho Tai w/meat on the side.  Give it a try and I'll bet that you can fall in love with it!
author: Karina L.

description: food here taste great and full of flavor, but after wards you feel the reckoning. They add too much msg, feel like sh*t after 15mins of eating.
author: Robin L.

description: This is the place to be at for LUNCH! Not sure about dinner, but I've had their rice plate once and it was alright...it's just your average dinner plate with 2 scoops or rice, a small salad on the side, and your pieces of meat. I go there for item 16 Medium. It has the least greasiest broth and their Pho noodles is just cooked right. Their service is always TOP SPEED and ingredients are fairly fresh, so this place is all around better than others. The walls seem a little too white for me, but that's just how it is...at least their tables and chairs have been updated making the place feel a little bit more cozy and not so stark like before.
author: LovesToEat S.

description: Just got back from our 3 millionth visit to Kevin's and figured I should write a review.  This place is great.  So much good food so fast, and so consistent.  The same family is running this place every time we go in and they're good at what they do.  Tried about a million pho places in the city and this is our favorite.
author: Patrik D.

description:
Good food and the place is clean.

O.k. here is what I've learned:

If you're picking up food to go with your friend be aware that ordering over the phone is tricky because if the lady doesn't understand you she'll just tell you that it's not available haha. 
We wanted charbroiled pork which she "didn't have" so she said she'd give us "bbq" pork which ended up to be... DUCK?


edit: this is going to be funny. I got this place confused with a restaurant across the street and it just so happened that the order that I'd picked up was identical: two dishes and a side of egg rolls except that the meat was different. That explains it all.

woops

this place is still good though
author: John B.

description: This place may have the best pho in San Francisco.  The broth is usually flavorful, though the flavor can be inconsistent.  If it's hot outside and you're not in the mood for a hot bowl of pho, their pork chops are excellent.  Also tasty is their three-bean drink.
author: Peter C.

description: This is probably the best Pho place in Sunset. Yes it is better than PPQ which is right across the street. Note that I only gave this 3 stars. The noodle is a little mushy, the soup is a little bit over spiced. But overall it is still good.
author: Dao C.

description: I had the Pho Tai. Tai is supposed to be thinly sliced rare beef. The beef I had was no where near thin and was overcooked and tough.
author: Erica B.

description: The food is good for its price, but the people who works there tend to rush you and want you in and out ASAP. I only go here when I'm craving for pho and not really looking to stay long with friends to socialize. The food comes about 5 minutes or less after you order, but the drinks takes FOREVER to come. One time my friend ordered a drink and it did not come until we were about to leave. Horrible service... but again, for its price, it is fairly reasonable.
author: Edgar G.

description: I meandered over to this pho place on a Thursday afternoon, as the one across the street seemed too busy (and probably for good reason).  I ordered a medium sized #34.  Frankly, the amount of meat and noodles could have qualified for the small size, it just had a larger bowl.  And the cuts of meat were clearly not first-rate, not second-rate, and barely third-rate.  I definitely gotta try the other pho place across the street someday.  The broth was ok.
author: Gerald C.

description: Okay, so whenever my friends and I want pho, we come here. The place is really spacious and the staff are polite, which is good. The pho is always delicious, and after I'm finished I'm always really full. The food here is generally very affordable and it's a great place to eat in groups!
author: M J.

description: This is my favorite vietnamese noodle!!! Every dish comes in hot! The noodle is great, I love everything there. Nobody else can beat this place! They recently remodeled the place, looks much better now.
author: The Black Cat C.

description: The fried rolls were too skinny and they didn't give you enough lettuce to wrap around all the rolls.  The bun wasn't very fresh - the lettuce had brown edges and the pho wasn't that flavorful.  Also, the 3 color drink was way too sweet.  I won't be back.
author: Joann C.

description: Great Soup!  and the rice dishes are wonderful... it's nothing too fancy and all just good 'ole Pho!!!  and they do get busy but don't fret it goes by quick and you'll get a table pretty quickly.  I recommend their fried fish cakes yumm.... =)   btw... pho is wonderful after a crazy wild nite of heavy drinkin' nothing like a soothing bowl of soup the next day =) woohooo
author: Ryan M.

description: I've been coming to this place once a week for the past four years! Do the math, 7 dollars a week x 52 weeks = 364 bucks x 4 years = $1,456 (give and take) and that's how much I've spent here which means this place is absolutely delicious! I don't go to another other place in the city or San Jose for pho but this one! The pho comes out within 5 minutes and it tastes so good for those foggy cold San Francisco evenings! The soup base is perfect and the prices are pretty reasonable. It's about 7 dollars for a medium size bowl that fills you right up! It is usually filled with high school kids on Friday and weekend nights so there is at least a 5 minute wait but normally, there isn't a wait at all. The service isn't perfect but it's better than others. I just hope this restaurant will be around for a while!
author: Vikki K.

description: I only came here once but I didn't really like the food so I never came back. I ordered the one of the PHOs, don't remember which one, but it wasn't that good. The soup lacked flavor and it wasn't really cheap either. I had PHOs that are far better and cost less, so there wasn't really any reason I would go back for it. Maybe I should have ordered some bbq meat instead like my friends did, because it looked way better than what I had.
author: Audrey M.

description: I have a hard time deciding between this place and Pho Phu Quoc across the street but both are busy all the time so i choose whatever is less busy and which one i can get a seat faster, but this place is also bomb, the only reason why i give a 4 and not a 5 is because of the quantity of the food its much better across the street but i have to say the quality of the food is very good and the service although busy is surprisingly fast.
author: Genesis K.

description: Does this place really deserve 5 stars?  It's not exactly service with a smile, but the food arrives promptly and they always get the order right. Quality of ingredients is fine so long as you don't look too closely. But what really does it for me, like all the other places I can't tear myself away from, is the simple fact that I've been eating here for such a long time. It's like a critical period where the development of taste occurs, for me some time in highschool, where anything I eat during that period ends up being my taste for life. And since I started eating here during that critical period I've just always been a fan of this place.
author: Alan L.

description:
I used to love this place. It was the best vietnamese pho restaurant around. However, recently I find myself enjoying this restaurant less and less. The food is still pretty good and the service is fine, but the meat seems dry and the noodles are not as good as they used to be. 

Conclusion: Still a great place to go for pho, but I have to give them a 3 because I had much higher expectations.
author: Michael H.

description: This place is great!  Classic, authentic pho.  Just what I need to hit the spot.  I love the spring rolls and the beef pho.  The thai iced tea is definitely thirst quenching.  It is not for the faint of heart, the thai iced tea is strong and delicious!  If you want a short wait time, this is the place to go to.
author: Lulu S.

description: This place has some good rice plates and their fresh spring rolls are good. Not bad for a Vietnamese restaurant located in the sunset.
author: Maile W.

description: Not bad for a pho place in San Francisco. Their broth is 8/10 for their pho. I usually get their chicken noodle soup which is really quite tasty. Its a very cheap place to go and it gets the job done when you are hungry.
author: Prescott T.

description:
Had the vermicelli with beef and shrimp ($7.50)
Yummy, pretty filling, and inexpensive. Pretty crowded on a friday afternoon, and service was top notch. Food came quickly.
author: Jason T.

description: What can I say? This place was cheap and delicious! I ordered the Beef Stew, and it was great! Too bad this place was a little dirty and sticky...but what Asian restaurant isn't? The service was fast...a little too fast. Before my friend and I even opened the menu, we had 2 waiters come and take our order. The food came within 2 minutes of our order, which makes me wonder how fresh the food really is...All in all, not a bad place to satisfy your fix for some Vietnamese food!
author: Bub B.

description:
I really like this place and is rarely disappointed. I usually get the #1, pho with everything in a middle bowl. The pho arrives at your table minutes after ordering so waiting is never an issue. It smells delicious and taste great. The price is reasonable and I always leave full. I also ordered the spring rolls which are good but nothing special. The need to be bigger please, if you're reading it. 

The service, first I was taken back by the lack of service then it just grew on me. They take your order and give you your food. simple as that. They don't come around making small talk which is good i guess because I'm enjoying my food. I always ask for water but 4/5 times they forget. Be happy the like the food and speed or else wouldn't come back. The family who runs the place has a strong work ethic so I come back to support. 

Great place to take first time pho eaters or to cure a hangover =)
author: Caroll V.

description: Somehow my old review of this place ended up under "Pho Clement" (never been there). Anyway, this place has tasty pho. The only thing about their pho that I don't like is the beef balls - a bit peppery and too much filler. But that broth is damn good.
author: Scott M.

description: Cheap, quick, and good. I came here with a party of six people and were promptly seated with no problems. I ordered the standard sort of Pho noodles with beef. It was very good and quickly made. Their tapioca drinks are also not bad! I come here every now and then with friends when I'm looking for a cheap no frills place to eat.
author: Steven S.

description: Of course, the service sucks.  But then again, it's an Asian restaurant so I don't let that deter me.  The food doesn't deserve any compliments either.  The pho is average to below average.  Okay for locals who want a quick meal and doesn't want to drive far.
author: Emma T.

description:
just wish they could stay open longer and be in the mission.
lemon soda!
author: Kimby T.

description: We stumbled upon this place and after a quick Yelp-check decided to try it out. I was really excited to finally have my first bowl of pho in SF as I was going through Vietnamese food withdrawals. There is one test that helps you determine if a pho place is good - upon entering a restaurant you should be overwhelmed by the aroma of pho. Not so here. That was the first red flag, but we decided to give it a go. It was just.... mediocre. No aroma, tough meat, bland broth. Just a terribly underwhelming bowl of pho.
author: Jo T.

description: Not unlike its neighbor across the way, PPQ , the eats are great and worth a strike from a bike ride of the Hayes. I first went here with some friends after this year's Bay to Breakers and was taken aback by how good my Pho' was. The price is so minimal compared to what a small bowl of Pho' gets you. It may have been the cold walk as we neared the Sunset of the B to B and the hunger we worked up. Or it could have been waiting for a table while watching the people all dressed up or not dressed up at all and trying to get a way back to where they came from dress or not dress how they were, and glad to not be in thier shoes or, even in shoes, that made the meal so good. I don't know. I will go here before PPQ.  Service was better, food, the same. BUT, when I asked for a water, I got one.
author: Lou Z.

description: The pho was edible...ok, but I have had much better and fresher tasting pho. The broth was salty, and their portions were small and pricier compared to other Pho joints. The other disappointment was the service. It was lacking. My husband sat and waited at our table while I ran our baby into the bathroom to change his diaper. Thinking we would be ready to order when we returned, I noticed the menus had not been brought to our table. We all sat for a while, so I finally decided to ask for menus so we can order. When it came time to pay, again there was no one. I also wanted to add that my husband and I are a biracial couple, and felt a bit of descrimination by the employers working there. I couldn't help but noticed the quick and FRIENDLY service others were getting once they step through the door. For what ever reason, the service was not good. I am one to want to support my fellow Vietnamese people's restaurants but NOT this one. Based on quality of food and poor service, I will not be spending anymore of my money here. If you want better Pho, Vietnamese food, go elsewhere.
author: V S.

description: Standard issue Pho and  I agree with Andrew S about PPQ across the street being a better choice. They have some interesting other dishes here, but everything I ordered was fairly greasy. The staff I've experienced were slightly unintelligible, but they never got my order wrong so who cares.
author: Tom S.

description: This is my favorite place to go for Pho.  It is cheap, delicious and the service is super fast and efficient.
author: Toni C.

description: There aren't a lot of good Viet restaurant in SF. This place makes OK Pho and the price is very reasonable. Service is fast!
author: Joe C.

description:
if i could give something negative stars this would be one of them.  my wife & i have eaten the pho here & we vowed never to eat here again.  the broth was horrible & not to my liking.  the meal was full of msg.  my wife & i left there with a horrible head ache & stomach ache.  some of the worst pho i have ever eaten.  

i have had better vietnamese food elsewhere in the city & out of a pack of instant pho noodles without the massive side effects of too too much msg.  definitely, not a great dining experience or after experience.

the layout of the restaurant  is ok & service is nothing special. the parking is horrible at best in this area any time of day or night.
author: larry s.

description: One of my favorite places to eat pho, that's all I've got to say. I've probably been here at least 20+ times all my years in high school.
author: Jessica R.

description: Food here is good/fast/cheap.  During winter time it's always nice to stop by and grab a bowl of pho noodle soup!
author: JenJen W.

description: This place has really bad service and the food is really bad. 4 of us went in and we got a little old lady to serve us. I don't have anything against people who don't speak English, but I don't think it's appropriate to put someone in the front end when they don't understand something as simple as "water". Four people ordered pho, but they only gave us one small plate of sprouts and basil. cheap much? Food isn't as good as the place in Westlake.
author: Tanya N.

description: Okay, I admit it. I am a pho addict. I come here once or twice a week to get my fix. Awesome pho!!
author: Mike B.

description: It is foggy and you need a warm and delicious Pho.  They have the best avocado shake in the city, also. Their prices are great and the service is always nice.
author: M J.

description: I went there because I read the review as 4 stars.  I think I am a bit disappointed afterward.  The taste is okay, as somewhere in between 3-4 stars.   Price is all right.   The thing is that serving size is a bit too small.  I looked over #1 as x-large on menu, and only priced at around $7. I was like, great.  However, it came out in a sort of regular bowl.  It has a lot of soup, but not much noddle.  For people who go to Vietnamese restaurants regularly, usually x-large has a lot of serving in very large bowl.  Not in this restaurant.   My wife, who doesn't eat that much, order #6 regular, and still got hungry afterward.  We ended up going to a yogurt nearby after that.
author: Alex D.

description: I'm not sure what the hype is about this place.  Maybe I ordered the wrong thing...but how can I go wrong with XL #1?  Soup was decent, noodles were too soggy, and the rare beef were too thick and chewy...I couldn't even swallow!  I prefer PPQ across the street.  Sorry folks.  :(
author: Peter G.

description:
I'm new to Yelp but not to "Kevin's Noodle House".  Probably been here >50 times in the last 4 years.    This is our favorite weekend early am stop, either on the way or on the way back from our weekend hang out in Sausalito.  They will open as early as 9AM.  
Today my husband and I were there before 9am and the Open Light was on.  
We splurged to share the FRIED Viet egg rolls, and both got a Pho, Gai Chin, small and medium. 
The service is predictable, same eldery gents point to a table, with a slight grimace, but are there quickly to take your order as they replenish the Sriracha  (red hot sauce) and Plum sauce on each table.  The place got an upgrade about a year ago.  The prices are Very reasonable.  Our bill was $20 incl. tip.  No Cafe Sua Da today but it's always good.
Sometimes my husband and son get the pork/fried egg rice plates, which they delicious.
Knowing good authenic Viet cuisine here in the Bay Area; I laugh when I see the menus/prices for Slanted Door in SF, Tamarine, in Palo Alto...andy other Viet fusion places.  They're fine when folks are afraid of the real thing, or want to enjoy a nice business meal.  

BTW, there's a Great Dim Sum Bakery, across the street, two blocks down (away from 19th ave).  They speak limited English, but the dim sum, egg custards are incredible. We usually get a tray of goodies to share with our friends for less than $10.  Picked up 6-7 potstickers, and 4 egg custards and a sesame ball for snacks today.  total cost less than $10.   I'll find the name next time.
author: Nancy N.

description: Ehh the broth just isn't that good anymore....or maybe the last 2 times I came just happened to be bad days? The service is still friendly at least.
author: Mike A.

description: I eat at this place about twice a week and I personally love this place. I'm not vietnamese so i'm no expert but it is the best pho i've ever tasted. I've been to PPQ and Lam's on 23rd but this place is alot better. I even went down to San Jose to try "real" pho and i'd still rank this place better. My personal favorite is #10 regular size. The price is pretty good too. And if you want a rice plate, i would suggest #41 which comes with fried chicken wings, pork and eggrolls for only $7
author: Kevin T.

description: Consistency is a big issue when eating out.  Kevin's is consistently good.  I've been there plenty of times, and I don't have to worry about who is cooking and whether or not the soup will be good.  Plus they take cards.  And the same exact people are always working.
author: cheddar b.

description:
Out of all the pho places I've been to, I've fallen in love with this one.. I only have eyes for this one now. There used to be a guy that worked there that would not only bring out your food in 2 minutes flat, but he would know who ordered what.. I don't know what happened to him.. The old guy that takes the orders is real cool tho.. 
But, what is up with the plastic chopsticks??? I freakin' hate those things!!!!
author: Mari K.

description:
Horrible attitude from the female boss.  It seems as if she looks and judges you by the way you dress before she determines if you're worth her time.  

The last couple of times I was there, the pho noodles weren't fresh.  They probably tried to cut costs and used the dried ones.  And, compared to when they first open, the portion is much smaller now.   I would much rather go to the PPQ or some other ones on Clement.

Note:  I enjoy Yelp, but I also feel that it's widely abused by many - ranting and bitc**** just so they can feel implortant.  I normally don't give any places a 1 star unless I went back more than once.
author: Gina R.

description: Don't be phased by the smell of the place when you walk in for the first time. The soup here is great. I always order a #17 small. It has no MSG yet i find myself wanting it at least once a week. great on a college kids wallet. $4 for a meal? can you beat that in the city??
author: Rich V.

description: I love this place, I used to live right up the street and had never tried pho before, I went here tried their pho with sliced beef and it was amazing. I still can't find any in the city to match it. The food comes out really quick, its a good price, and tastes delicious. What more could you ask for?
author: Zachary L.

description:
When it comes to pho, I have very high expectations.  It's hard to eat good pho without driving 50 miles to San Jose.  But luckily I found this place which I go to least once a week.  I've been coming her for about 7 years now and I just can't find myself getting sick of it!! The service is good and the food comes fast.

I have to agree about the fingernails in the soup thing though.. hehehe.  I think that's their secret recipe.  It adds a little extra something to the soup.  Hehe I'm just kidding!! Don't take me seriously. Jokkkking. =)
author: Angela L.

description: OK.  It's mostly a noodle shop, but it's a really, really good noodle shop.  Big open area and speedy service.  After 5 minutes you get a huge bowl of nicely-flavored broth and lots of noodles.  But what is best is that they give you an extra large platter of fresh veggies and other add-ins that takes it over the top.  I can't comment on other dishes:  this is all I order.
author: JA F.

description:
i recently was inducted into the national honors society for psychology.  if you know me, you know that is a HUGE accomplishment.  
so after the ceremony, the old man said i could go anywhere i wanted for a celebration dinner.  and i chose kevin's noodle house.  all week i was dreaming of the nectar that is broth from the pho they have.  i was so excited for the tender brisket and flank steak (even if it is cheap and gross meat) mixed with perfect slippery noodles and crisp bean sprouts.  i could eat their pho every day for the rest of my life.  it is that amazing.
so was it as great as always for my celebration dinner?  i don't know because the old man made us go to the underdog across the street to watch the end of the warriors game and we got to kevin's 10 minutes after they closed.  after shedding a few tears and stomping my feet, we went across the street and got non-kevin pho.  and it made me sick.  so the old man still owes me some celebration pho.

i love you kevin's noodle house.
author: Katie H.

description: Mmm, best pho in the city! And I'm a pho addict. The thinly sliced steak pho is the best.
author: Molly H.

description: PPH2 translated to English must mean MSG X 2.  The pho soup is cloudy and nasty. The soup base must be some cheap packaged sh't they add hot water too.  Also a bunch of hoodlums there all the time.  I'm not sure if you are more likely to get shot or sick.
author: Edmund W.

description: This has always been one of my favorite places. Especially the chicken noodle soup with ho fun. The soup base does have a nice taste to it and isn't bland like other places. The beef broth is always good here, but the rice plates are pretty oily and mediocre. But don't confuse all Pho Huynh Hiep as the same, the Irving one is far superior to the Daly City one. Try their Thai ice tea, its one of the strongest I've ever tasted!
author: Alan L.

description: this is what anyone with half a brain would expect from a pho restaurant. lets set standards, and lets meet them. the price is right, the flavors are right, and the service is right. i dont know the exact price, but i know it's sub-$7. and the flavors going on here is spot on. it all comes together legitimately. the noodles have texture, the beef is tender, and the broth is full of flavor. and the service is just right too. you get a quiet old man who seats who quick, hovers over you until you're ready to order (under 90 seconds.) and leaves you alone (to enjoy your meal) until its time for the check. wam bam thank you ma'am.
author: geoffrey l.

description: my only favorite Vietnamese restaurant for pho, they have the the best tasted broth and the best textured noodle. i can not find anywhere else is better in the neighorhood.  ice coffee, fresh spring rolls, fried chicken wings are the must order.
author: Bei K.

description: The shrimp cake is good - really fresh. And I usually don't like fish/shrimp cake. The pork chops are thin. The place is immaculate - the owners are OCD. The sauces are all clean - nothing sticky. Bathroom is clean. The milk iced tea with tapioca was different. They refrigerate the pearls in separate cups so they are a little too chewy and dry.
author: P B.

description: good pho,but not spicy enough for my liking and they don't hook you up with the chili sauce if you get things take out wise. also i think they didn't correctly do my order bc there were extra beef parts i didnt like or want that they gave to me.in general though pretty tasty,good price, and their milk tea/boba balls are two thumbs up!
author: Lauren V.

description: another hot spot in the avenues...stumbled across here after a long day of drinkin from the giants game...i swear pho is the cure for everything~had the egg roll action & seafood combo/egg noodles @ this joint....service is prompt/excellent....theyre always lookin to fill seats & avoid for peeps like me & others to wait in line
author: elmer d.

description: Better than average pho. Good prices. Quick service. Clean.
author: Retired B.

description: I went to this place twice and loved it. Since I lived in Oakland, I normally go to Pho Huynh Hiep #1 instead of Pho Huynh Hiep #2. Price is decent , the noodle is stringy(not sure if that is the appropriate term for it) and the soup is very  flavorful. I tried a lot of different pho places and the only two I really would recommend is this one and Pho Saigon. Pho Saigon have the best shakes. There is not a lot of  Pho Saigon in the bay area.  If you happen to see one, definitely go in and give it a try. You will not be disappointed.Make sure you order their shakes as well.
author: tina l.

description: I used to be a regular here, and preferred PHH over PPQ across the street. Until one day, when I was 3/4 done with my "#6- Small", I found a used bandage floating in my soup!! USED with a splotch of beef broth-diluted blood on the pad! When I complained to the old man waiter, he looked at my soup and had a good chuckle over it, pointing at the bowl to another waiter. They did not refund my bowl, instead, they replaced it with a bandage-free one. Good News: My doctor affirms that I'm disease-free!
author: Gloria C.

description: This is my all time favorite pho restaurant in sf by far. I eat here at least once a week, if not, once every two weeks to curb my craving for pho. In my opinion this places beats PPQ (across the street). Only by a hair. If curious, see their review.  The spring rolls here are AWESOME!!! I don't like my rolls with too much noodles where it's hard to fit in your mouth, so these were the perfect size, the rice wrap is fresh and soft. The peanut sauce is wonderful! Not too thick or watered down. The perfect blend of peanut butter, cococut milk and hosin sauce. I love it.. I could eat it just by itself.. hehe.. Anyways, on to the pho.. I always order #17. The soup alone is the bomb. The broth is flavorful with the taste of beef and star anise. I love it. The noodles were not too soft or mushy, more chevy.. it came with sliced rare beef and the meat was still pink, but starts to cook in the hot soup. SO good and comforting. My other favorite on their menu is the cold vemellicelli noodles with shrimp and pork. Oh so good on a warm summer day.. It's basically a huge salad bowl with lettuce, cucumber, carrots, bean sprouts and a bed of dry rice noodles. You could have any type of meat on top. I highly recommend the bbq shrimp and pork.  The dressing is the famous fish sauce. They put it on the side, so you can add as much or little to your taste. There's so much more that's great on the menu, but these are my favorites.
author: Denise L.

description: I go to the Daly City location more often but this location is nice too. It's more spacious than the Daly City location and seems just a bit cleaner. Pho portions here are HUGE and cheap. I ordered seafood pho and was really surprised that they gave me a decent amount of seafood and it wasn't all imitation crab and fish balls. There were actually big pieces of shrimp and calimari swimming in my soup too! The staff is as friendly as you can find in a pho place; they're helpful but they're not there to be uber-nice, just to make sure that you get your food very quickly so they can turn your table over to the next set of customers... One thing that irked me was that our waitress told me it wasn't possible for her to charge my card minus the cash amount that my sister put down, which is a standard practice since my friends and I do it all the time. Don't tell me it's not possible when the fact is that you don't know how to do it! My sister saw that I was about to have a mini-fit and insisted that I just charge the whole bill, which was fine too but it was the principle of the matter...
author: Queenie C.

description: one of the staff reminds me of droopy the dog.  she looks so sleepy all the time... 8P
author: Ethan L.

description: not bad compared to the PPQ across the street.  larger portion of meat and better tasting soup.  also they have more appetizer choice and blended drink selection.
author: Gary T.

description: this place aint the best but they're fast with it. customer service is alright but this place is good for big groups which is good for me and my friends. besides that i still prefer PPQ better but its all good.  i cant complain though, their #1 is still good. their rice plates are lackin though with the meat! they give you small ass portions for $8, rip off.
author: Kenny L.

description: My go-to pho joint. Good pho, good service. Very cheap as well. I recommend highly for the pho, rice plates, and vermicelli. Take out is good as well.
author: Jason H.

description: Best I've had.  When I lived in the Sunset I was here at least once a week.  #1 and a hot Vietnamese coffee for 10 bucks - unbeatable.
author: Garett Y.

description: good ol reliable kevin's  - the cure for hangovers and cheap pho cravings
author: J J.

description: satisfactory pho in the sunset.  i prefer pho hoa in the tenderloin by far, but this is decent.  service was okay.  seemed fairly clean.  they feature harris ranch beef if i recall...
author: Yvette H.

description: better then that cheap place across the street. the food is good and it comes in pretty big portion for the price. always comes really fast. the short old guy who works there is very friendly and knows what's going on. #1 on the menu for pho is very good too. the rice plate is exceptional but i say the one next door can kick this one in the butt if only comparing to rice plates. the pho here is better tho. so always choose this one over that one across the street
author: Eric Y.

description:
reliable pho place, cheap and fast.

the soup is good, if you don't mind the msg. get the raw beef slice on the side, so you can dip in the soup  to the tenderness to your liking. the basil and sprout portion is to small. I like my soup with a lot of basils.
author: Yi S.

description: i always order #1 but recently i've been ordering #43 and i'm hooked to this place. the flavor is just right, it isn't perfect but it is delicious..
author: Patrick T.

description: Now, I grew up in San Jose, so even though I am not Vietnamese I would like to think that I know my way around a bowl of pho. That being said, this is a very decent place for me to get my noodle fix. The broth is rich and tasty and they load up those bowls with meat and noodles. I usually order pho tai nam, if i'm feeling adventurous I get the tai nam sach. The small is plenty, I think they just give you more broth in the larger bowl. They give you plenty of basil and sprouts and stuff. My only complaint is that my sprouts and basil are always presented sopping wet. I suppose that it's good to know that they wash the stuff but couldn't they put it through a salad spinner or something? Also parking really sucks on Irving so I often find myself debating whether I want to drive the extra distance to go to the one in Daly City or drive around the block 5 times looking for a meter. Circling the block usually wins
author: Melanie V.

description: this is another spot i tend to go to with bunch of my friends that ive known since who knows how long. yea it seriously depends on the friends im hanging out with. ill either go here or ppq. depending on them. im down with both. but this place does have a more wide selection of food and their bowls are huge. ive always like this place so i cant hate.
author: Tuan D.

description: kevin's beats PPQ, though PPQ is still a good restaurant. the broth at kevin's is far superior, however, and i might argue the best in the city. bbq pork is noteworthy as well.
author: Eddie G.

description: pho is good and the food comes out fast. good cheap food. decor..lack of it...but the food is good and cheap.
author: Linda L.

description: mmm. pho.  i have come here since i was a kid with my parents; every week before my dad passed - and its the only place my friends and i go to.  i'm sure there is such thing as better pho but of all the ones i've tried in the city... this is the place to go.  the one thing i've found is that i never know what the official name of this place is, they've probably changed it like 5 or 6 times, or so it seems.  i always get the #3 and fresh spring rolls.  occasionally i'll order the taro tapioca.  mmm.  the spring rolls have depreciated with less ingredients into a smaller roll but i still order them anyway.  all the easier to fit into my mouth and chow it down. haha.  the service is quick, they don't really check up on you unless you call them over, but hey, it's like asian fast food.  and it's CHEAP!
author: Stephanie C.

description: went last night craving pho, and it hit the spot.  great spot if youre stuck in the sunset, but i must admit i've had better pho at some of the pho hua chains throughout the bay area.  still, i would go back since it's much closer than getting myself to tu lan when i have cravings.
author: colin b.

description: This place was really good. I had the seafood pho, #28. The waiter couldn't quite understand my friend's order, which was for only beef balls, but he got it taken care of. It's affordable and I always leave really full. The atmosphere's nice and it's pretty to sit in and just enjoy with friends.
author: Peyton L.

description: Good Pho fo yo money.
author: Justin R.

description: they have good food and great service. they are very nice and will help and understand you when you have a problem with your order
author: Lu G.

description: pho? good. vermicelli? good. food delivers fast, but the service is slow. usually packs with people, but theres some time they're pretty spacey to dine in.
author: Valerie N.

description: by far the BEST pho in sf... the beef pho is awesome, there are about 50 kinds to choose, make sure you don't get the ones with tendon or tripe because thats just nasty. the noodle bowls are kick-ass too. and the chicken soup ain't so bad either.... really cheap and authentic -yum.
author: Kate G.

description: This is my regular Pho spot.  I've been coming here since forever and there are definitely no complaints.  Though sometimes they DO forget the beverage and needed to be reminded of but that's okay, I forgive them.  I love the way they make their Spring Rolls--it contains NO mint leaves, just the way I like it.  It especially tastes good with fish sauce (I don't like the peanut sauce).  The food comes out really fast and the prices are fair.
author: deeks ..

description: This might not be the best Vietnam restaurant in the city, but the Stew Beef Noodle can be the best noodle in the city. Love it.
author: Winnie P.

description: This place is incredible! I've been eating there for awhile now and loved it every time.  Great service, great food, and great atmosphere.  Better yet, sometime shortly after Chinese New Year they renovated the place with new art work, paint, flooring, and all new tables.  Best Pho in the city!!
author: Ryan C.

description:
i cant believe i just gave  them a star. i grew up going here. and their multiple locations. and i remmber why we stopped going. i was very malnourished after a long camping trip and wanted a fat bowl of hot pho. this place.... ugh...
 1. the soup was holographic. like... rainbow colors... is that msg or something else?
2. my cliantro and basil along w the bean sprouts and lime slice were old, warm, kinda black on the edges and the limes were hard dry dead limes.
3. no one speaks english and unfortunatley i dont speak viet.
i pointed to my dish and they made me the wrong one.
then they tried to charge me an extra 2.50 because they got my order wrong.
4. i asked for water before i ordered. i didnt even get it. at all.
5.THIS TAKES THE CAKE.
they ASKED WHEN I WOULD LEAVE!!!
i was only there for 15 mins. barely eating my lukewarm pho and a group of 20+ came in and they needed extra seats. really?
wow.
6. my friend ordered the BBQ shrimp over vermicelli.
it came with only two baby scrimps. and when we asked if thats how much that comes in the order (the shrimp dish was priced 8.95) they said yes. as if WE were crazy.
my friend asked if she could have like two more. and GASP/
they brought TWO MORE SCRIMPS.

good bye pho huynh hiep. i will not miss you.
author: karina m.

description: i have been eating here since i was little.my dad works near PHH and he always gets me some after work.they are very nice and the store is very clean.you get seated and served fast but we just leave.they take credit cards,which is a plus.i love eating #40(grilled chicken+rice), #55B(grilled chicken+vermicelli+eggrolls)i just love this place!!!
author: r g.
